title: Arrest Stops Falls Plunge
description: SPOKANE, Wash., July 7 (AP)  Terry Brauner, who attempted to go over the Spokane Falls last May, was ready for a second attempt today but couldn't get past police. Mr. Brauner, 25yearold, of Kettle Falls, was arrested even before attempting to hurtle 75 feet down the falls in three innertubes. He was charged with breaking a law  passed in reaction to his first attempt to shoot the falls  that bans swimming in the river.

title: U. S.Soviet Union Track Meet A cquires Carohna Spirit
description: DURHAM, N. C., July 7Mary Decker was not the only American heroine who emerged from the United StatesSoviet Union track and field carnival over the weekend.

title: Serious Infant Deformity Seen as Justifying Death
description: CHICAGO, July 7 (AP)A Roman Catholic theolologian says that infants should be allowed to die when they are so seriously deformed that there is no hope for their having human relationships.

title: Books of The Times
description: Watergate and the Nixon Administration. Whatever else these have done, they certainly have created a new interest in the practice of journalism. And a new interest, too, in journalists, who now may seem either heroes or villains, depending on your politics. Along with the interest, quite naturally has come endless writing on the subject. Some of it, like All the President's Men, by Carl Bernstein and Bob Woodward, and Timothy Crouse's The Boys on the Bus, has been excellent and important.

title: Improvement of Business Continued to Slow in June
description: The rate of improvement in business continued to slow down in June when the rate of rise in new orders, production, inventory and prices showed further drops, according to E. F. Andrews, chairman of the business survey committee of the National Association of Purchasing Management.

title: Consumer Notes
description: The Federal Trade Commission, in the initial phase of an inquiry into possible price fixing and other noncompetitive practices by the food industry, plans to scrutinize national operations in Jersey City, Atlanta, Denver, Detroit and Little Rock, Ark.

title: Blast Rips Apartment House
description: SKOKE, Ill., July 7 (AP)One man was severely burned and eight other persons were injured today when a broken gas line connection exploded in an 18unit apartment building here.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A leading environmental group in the Hamptons, on Long Island, warned that unless the population growth rate in the area was kept at 2 per cent annually, the character of the area would be unalterably changed and the region could run out of adequate water resources for its population.

title: Dolphins Divided On Strike
description: MIAMI, July 7 (AP)Picketing spread today to the camp of the Miami Dolphins, the Super Bowl champions, as part of the fivedayold National Football League Players Association strike. But the Dolphins camp appeared divided on the strike issue.

title: Red Smith
description: It was said that this was a dispute which nobody won. That isn't so. The players proved they could stand together as long as need be in spite of pressure from many directions. It was proved that for all their brave talk the owners would not hold out for a season, would not dare to foist off rookies on a clientele accustomed to something better, would not even sacrifice the revenue from one exhibition game. All this will be remembered four years from now when contract talks begin again.

title: Beyond the Facts
description: Ours is an age of facts, factual knowledge, chemical formulas, dollar balances, interest rates, per capita income, taxes. But we live in a world where, especially on a midsummer day; and especially beyond the city canyons, facts cannot begin to encompass life. The fact that mist rises doesn't tell the story of the mist rising from a lake or, river, like incense, in the coolness of a July dawn. The fact that birds make audible noises can't begin to describe the song of an oriole. You could fill a book with facts about the sun and sunlight, but the first glint of the newly risen sun on a lawn still wet with dew makes even the idea of such a book seem musty and forbidding.

title: Secretaries: A Little Irked But Generally They're Happy
description: A generation ago, the woman who had to earn a living didn't have much choice. If she wasn't enthralled by teaching or nursing, she learned stenography and typing and became a secretary.

title: Cabbies Restore Spirits Of Bilked Parisian Here
description: Martine Bianchi was the guest yesterday of 180 taxi drivers who wanted to show the 26yearold secretary from Paris that they were not all like the cabby who charged her $52 for a $10 ride.

title: West Germans Win Soccer Cup
description: MUNICH, West Germany, July 7West Germany repulsed a fierce attack to defeat the Netherlands today in the World Cup soccer final, 21, and become the champion in the world's most popular sport.

title: Millions Pour Bark Into Sweltering City After4Day Holiday
description: The return from the coluntry to the citya passage that is as much, psychological as geographicbegan late yesterday for millions of New Yorkers who jammed trains and wedged onto highways in an oftenpainful retreat from pleasure.

title: A Small Store in South Feels Big Pinch of Inflation
description: SCHLEY, N.C.,  It is not the financial part of inflation, the ballooning figures on the account books, that bothers Edward Underwood, one of the three Underwood men who operate a Shell station and general store in the pleasant countryside between Durham and Chapel Hill. The grating part is what the rising prices, the shortages and the situation in Washington are doing to the people who have come to the store for years.

title: BOY, PAST CUSTOMS HELD ON DRUG COUNT
description: A 17yearold boy who apparently cleared Customs at Kennedy International Airportll with more than six pounds of cocaine hidden tinder the false bottom of a suitcase was seized last night by the city police, a department spokesman said.

title: Hamptons Advised to Cut Population Growth to 2%
description: BRIDGEHAMPTON, L. L, July 7A leading environmental group here warned today that unless the populationgrowth rate in the Hamptons was kept to 2 per cent a year, the character of the area would be rapidly and unalterably changed.

title: ENGINEERS CORPS SEEKS JERSEY AID
description: The Army Corps of Engineers is seeking $29million in Federal, state and local funds to build jetties and pump sand to beaches from Hereford Inlet north of the Wildwoods to Cape May Canal on the Delaware Bay.

title: Judge's Doubts on U.S. Attorney's Prosecution of Roncallo Are Focus of Inquiry on Drugging of Aide
description: A Federal judge's recurring chastisement of the United States Attorney's office here on the grounds of faulty preparation and mishandling of the extortion case against Representative Angelo D. Roncallo last May has provided a focus for the threeway investigation into the drugging of Assistant United States Attorney Peter R. Schlam, the Government prosecutor in the case.

title: OvertheCounter Quotations
description: L's OTHER BONDS Supplementary OTC

title: NEWS INDEX
description: NEWS INDEX

title: Rebuff for Mr. Tanaka
description: Japan's voters have administered an unexpectedly sharp setback to Premier Kakuei Tanaka and the LiberalDemocratic Government in a record turnout for elections to the upper house of the Diet. This is the major significance of the voting even if final returns give the ruling party, in office for the last quartercentury, a slim majority in the 252seat House of Councilors.

title: W.F.L.s New Ball Is Leaving Players Goldfingered
description: James Bond; had his Goldfinger, and this week the World Football League will have its hands full with Goldfingers.

title: Tapes Permitted as Evidence in the DiLorenzo Trial,
description: State Supreme Court Justice John M. Murtagh ruled yesterday that taped conversations could be introduced by the prosecution as evidence in the, perjury trial of Civil Court Judge Ross J. DiLorenzo.

title: Busby Wins 11th Game As Royals Halt Red Sox
description: Steve Busby, who pitched a nohit game against Milwaukee last month, shut out the Boston Red Sox in Fenway Park last night to give Kansas City a 50 victory.

title: COSTELLO'S FRIEND HELD IN CONTEMPT
description: Harry Segal, whom the late gambler Frank Costello identified as his bookie, was convicted yesterday in State Supreme Court of criminal contempt in the first degree.

title: Events Today
description: Music Dance Cabaret

title: William Buckley Sues In Death of Mrs. Hunt
description: CHICAGO, July 8 (AP)William F. Buckley, the conservative columnist, filed suit in United States District Court today seeking damages for the death of Dorothy L. Hunt, the wife of the convicted Watergate conspirator, E. Howard Hunt J.

title: Echoes of History Heard In a Pillared Courtroom
description: WASHINGTON, July 8It seemed at times like a constitutional casebook come to life. Marbury v. Madison was not only cited but, for a moment, debated, What exactly had Chief Justice Marshall done in 1803 when he held that the Supreme Court was the ultimate interpreter of the Constitution? Had President Jefferson won or lost.

title: JAMES PHELAN
description: James Phelan, vice president and cashier of the National Bank of New Jersey, died Saturday in Clark, N. J., where he lived. He was 50 years old.

title: For Hospital's Chinese Patients, Journey to Health Starts With Ethnic Foods
description: For Hospital's Chinese Patients, Journey to Health Starts With Ethnic Foods hensive care, Dr. Young said. What they get is care for their symptoms. They see a doctor, get temporary relief, but no tests or treatment. In contrast, he added, the center gives treatment and tests at prices people can afford.

title: Bank of America in Deal
description: SAN FRANCISCO, July (Reuters)The Bank of America said today it had purchased a 30 per cent interest in the Commercial Bank of Malawi for $860,000. The Malawi institution operates 18 branches in Malawi and a branch in London, it said.

title: CLOSER CHINA TIES URGED BY JACKSON
description: WASHINGTON, July 8Senator Henry M. Jackson called today for greatly strengthened United States relations with China in the interest of world peace, saying the Chinese could be trusted more than the Russians as international partners.

title: Mrs. Peron Decrees a Workers Bonus
description: BUENOS AIRES, July 8President Isabel Martinez de; Perim, promising to follow her husband's policies without an: iota of change, announced today that all workers would get: a bonus of one month's pay to compensate for rising prices and a prohibition on strikes.

title: Leo Miller, ExEditor, Dies; Theatrical Publicity Man
description: NORWALK, Conn., July 8 Leo Miller, a former managing editor of The Bridgeport Sunday Herald and in recent years, the head of his own public relations concern, died today at Norwalk Hospital. He was 69 years old, and lived at 168 Bayberry Lane, Westport.

title: Amsterdam Chinese Food May Be the Best in Europe
description: AMSTERDAM  We had twice been told that the finest Chinese restaurant in Europe could he found in Amsterdam. The name of the gem is the Fong Lie, 80 P. C. Hoofstraat, only a stone's throw from the Rijksmuseum.

title: BROOKLYN KILLING IS 11TH IN 5 DAYS
description: Brooklyn's 11th homicide victim in the last five days was discovered yesterday by fire. men in a burning apartment in the Crown Heights section.

title: Commodity Price Index Up 2.2 From WeekAgo Level
description: The commodity spot market price index of foodstuff and industrial materials rose to 229.3 in the week ended July 2, from 227.1 a week earlier.

title: Trudeau Wins in Canada; Parliament Majority Seen
description: OTTAWA, Tuesday, July 9Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau and his Liberal party won overwhelmingly yesterday in the Canadian national elections.

title: Pietro Campilli, a Leader Of Christian Democrats, 82
description: ROME, July 8Pietro Campilli, a veteran leader of the Christian Democratic party and president of the National Christian Council of Economy and Labor, died today at his home. He was 82 years old.

title: Canadians Giving Trudeau A Majority in Parliament
description: OTTAWA, July 8Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau and his Liberal party were headed for an overwhelming victory in the Canadian national election today.

title: Jurors Hear Officers Describe Finding 27 Bodies Near Houston
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., July 8 A jury of six men and six women began hearing testimony today in the multiple murder trial of Elmer Wayne Henley Jr.

title: Exchange Seat at Low
description: A seat on the New York Stock Exchange was sold yesterday for $70,000, the lowest price for a Big Board seat since Feb. 27, 1958, when a seat sold for $69,000. Today's sale was $2,000 below the previous sale, on June 25. Current prices for a seat on the Exchange are $55,000 bid and $77,000 asked.

title: Radio
description: 610 A.M., WNCN. From Bohernia's Woods and Fields, Smetana; Trumpet Concerto, Albinoni; Five Variants of Dives and Lazarus, Vaughan Williams; Valse Brillante in A flat, Moszkowski; La Plus Que Lente, Debussy; Theme with Variations, Paderewski; Impromptu Caprice, Pierne; Trio No. 7 in B flat, Beethoven; Prelude to Act I of Lohengrin, Wagner; Etude in B flat Minor, Szymanowski; The Art of Ornamentation and Embellishment in the Renaissance, Various.

title: Market Place: I.B.M. Tumbles Below 200 Level
description: It happened again yesterday. For the second time in four years, International Business Machines dropped to below 200.

title: Le Club, Restaurant of Jet Set, Cited for Health Code Violations
description: Le Club, the East Side discothequerestaurant catering to international society, was cited yesterday by the city's Health Department for violating the Health Code.

title: Voices From the Past Help WNYC Mark 50th Year
description: On July 8, 1924, the deadlocked Democratic National Convention meeting at the old Madison Square Garden on Madison Square held its 88th through 100th ballots on the way to nominating John W. Davis for the Presidency and a swift trip to political oblivion.

title: HIGH COURT HEARS 3 HOURS OF DEBATE IN NIXON CASES AND RESERVES ITS DECISION
description: WASHINGTON, July 8The grim battle between President Nixon and Leon Jaworski, the special prosecutor, over access to possible evidence of the Watergate criminal conspiracy went into its last round today, in the Supreme Court.

title: Herrmann Will Shun Picket Line
description: Don Herrmann, who made it the hard way in professional football, will not join the picket line of established players at the New York Giants training camp in Fairfield, Conn., this morning.

title: Treasury Bill Rates Rise in Weekly Sale
description: WASHINGTON, July 8 The rates of Treasury bills rose today as the Government borrowed a total of $4,5billion at its weekly sale of shortterm securities. The average rate on threemonth bills was the highest since June 17.

title: Fertilizer Group Continued
description: WASHINGTON, July 8 (UPI) Faced by short United States fertilizer supplies, the White House announced today it was extending the life of the Interagency Task Force on fertilizer beyond June 30. Kenneth Rush, presidential economic counselor, said in a statement that Dr. Kenneth Fedor will continue to head the Interagency group that was originally created under the Cost of Living Council. The Cost of Living Council was disbanded June 30.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Israeli naval commandos raided three ports on the coast of southern Lebanon and sunk 30 fishing boats in an effort to thwart further Arab terrorist attacks against Israel from the sea, the Israeli Army said. An Arab raid on the Israeli resort town of Nahariya last month is believed to have been made by sea from southern Lebanon, and an Israeli Army spokesman in Tel Aviv said there had been indications of further such raids. [1:1.]

title: Greek Foreign Minister Quits in Apparent Dispute
description: ATHENS, July 8 (AP)The Greek Government announced today that Foreign Minister Spyridon Tetenes had resigned.

title: FATE OF PRISONERS AN ISSUE IN BRAZIL
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, July 8Reports that 16 political prisoners have disappeared in the last 10 months have impelled Roman Catholic leaders, the Brazilian Bar Association and opposition politicians to protest to the Government.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: Article 1  No Title

title: EARNINGS OF TOYOTA PLUNGED FOR HALF
description: TOKYO, July 8 (AP)  The Toyota Motor Company's net profit plunged 73 per cent in the halfyear ended May 31 to $33.5million from $126.9million a year earlier, the Japanese auto maker said today.

title: Rush Sought Labor Restraint
description: WASHINGTON, July 8Kenneth Rush, President Nixon's economic counselor, disclosed today that he met recently with business and a few labor groups to urge restraint in private price and wage decisions but added that he had no plan for a new, organized system of jawboning.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: Only the New York Philharmonic will have Boulez. Bernstein. Barenboim Boehm, Conlon, Glullin, Haitink, and Lelnsdorf Subscribe now and be sure to hear them Call 7999597 nowAdvt.

title: Logs: Healthy Kind Of Chic
description: For a decade now, modern in furniture has been another way of referring to all those designs in steel and glass and in glossy plastics. Now there may he some competitionfurniture of planks, logs and tree trunks that could well become known as the logging camp look.

title: DrugCompany Opposition Cited By Wolffin Fight Against Oplum
description: Representative Lester L. Wolff, a leading opponent of the resumption of opiumpoppy growing in Turkey, said yesterday that drug company representatives had tried to persuade him to drop his opposition because people would be in pain.

title: Newport Jazz
description: The longest and most successful (in financial terms) Newport Jazz Festival in the 21year history of the series came to an end yesterday with a free midday concert at the Lincoln Center Fountain Plaza by Kid Thomas's Preservation Hall Jazz Band.

title: Power Project Is Set for Northeast Utilities
description: MONTAGUE, Mass., July 8 (AP)  Work on a proposed $1.5billion nuclear power project of Northeast Utilities may get under way next spring, now that the Atomic Energy Commission has completed its preliminary review of the plan.

title: COURT SAYS NIXON EXCEEDED POWER ON IMPORT SURTAX
description: In a decision that could lead to the refund of $500million to importers, the United States Customs Court ruled here yesterday that President Nixon had exceeded his authority in 1971 when he imposed a 10 per cent surcharge on all dutiable imports.

title: ENVOY TO TURKEY CONSULTS IN U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, July 8(Reuters)The Ambassador to Turkey, William B. Macomber Jr., started consultations at the State Department today after being recalled from Turkey in a dispute over opium poppy cultivation.

title: Sets Win by 2827; Miss Wade Beaten
description: DETROIT, July 8The New York Sets won the key mixed doubles event tonight and defeated the Detroit 27, in World Team Tennis.

title: LILCO Hit by Blackouts
description: Scattered power outages hit Long Island Lighting Company service areas in southwestern Nassau County and eastern Queens last night. Power was interrupted for an hour in Far Rockaway, knocking out lights in the 100th precinct station, which operated without incident with emergency units. Full power was restored at 12:15 A.M. today.

title: ISRAELIS ATTACK 3 LEBANESE PORTS, SINKING 30 BOATS
description: TEL AVIV, Tuesday, July 9Israeli naval commandos raided three ports on the coast of southern Lebanon last night and sank 30 fishing boats, the army reported here.

title: Burns Gains 2Shot Lead In Ike Golf
description: EAST WILLISTON, L.I., July 8George Burns was a member of the Wheatley Hills Golf Club from 1969 through 1973. The big 24yearold blond is also one of the best amateur golfers in the nation. This combination proved too much for the other 154 golfers in the first round of the 22d annual Ike amateur tournament today.

title: Verde Isles Economy Feels Winds of Sahara
description: MINDELO, Cape Verde Islands, July 5When people here give you their mailing address, they add such phrases as better mark it via Lisbon when you send it from abroad. They are sensitive to the fact that no outsider seems to know where the Cape Verde Islands are, whom they belong to or anything else about them.

title: A Needed Debate
description: Senator Henry Jackson is home from China, and is quoted by United Press International as favorably comparing detente with that country to the detente with the Soviet Union. The Chinese keep their word, he said; but the Russians had broken treaties and agreements and the real issue with [them] is and contiunes to be whether they will adhere to agreements.

title: Operating Earnings of the Mellon Bank Are Up
description: The Mellon National Corporation, the holding company that owns the Mellon Bank, the largest bank in Pennsylvania and 13th largest in the nation, reported yesterday increased operating earnings for the second quarter and first half of this year.

title: Above the Law?
description: The arguments on behalf of President Nixon before the United States Supreme Court yesterday constitute an audacious effort to place the person of the President outside and above the legal processes of the land, however much the lawyers try to blur the point. No measure of public weariness with the perplexing twists in the knot of Watergate can obscure the extraordinary presumption underlying the claims now issuing from the White House.

title: PRICES ARE RAISED BY BRITISH LEYLAND
description: British Leyland Motors, Inc., announced yesterday that it had raised prices on five of its models sold in the United States by a range of $50 to $100 each.

title: Perry's Streak Ended at 15 by A's
description: OAKLAND. Calif., July (AP)Gaylord Perry's string of consecutive pitching victories came to an end at 15 tonight, one short of the American League record, when Claude Washington,: an Oakland rookie, singled home the winning run from third base with two out in the 10th inning to giv? the A's a 43 victory over the Cleve land Indians.

title: Solar Storm Extends Time To View Northern Lights
description: BOULDER, Colo., July 8 (UPI)  Scientists say further solar disturbances during the next two days will continue to allow people in the northern United States to Niew the northern lights, a shimmering, multicolored spectacle usually reserved for Polar dwellers.

title: News Summary and Index
description: The Major Events of the Day International National Metropolitan The Other News Quotations of the Day

title: Rangers Are Routed; Mason Hits 4 Doubles
description: ARLINGTON, Tex., July 8 In this Lone Star State where Texans often are ribbed about their exaggerations, the New York Yankees tonight ended a fourgame series with the Rangers with a collection of remarkable statistics.

title: Democratic Telethon Yields $4Million Net
description: WASHINGTON, July 8 (UPI)  The Democratic national chairman, Robert S. Strauss, said today that the party's 1974 fundraising telethon last month produced $7million in pledges, of which the party expected to collect 86.3million.

title: Andreas Aid to Humphrey Taken for Study by Judge
description: MINNEAPOLIS, July 8 (AP) A Federal judge took for study today a Government case against a Minneapolis financier after a defense attorney said $100,000 loan in the 1968 Presidential campaign of Senator Hubert H. Humphrey was not morally or ethically wrong.

title: High Court Throws Out State Flag Law
description: The United States Supreme Court, with two Justices dissenting, affirmed yesterday that New York State could not ban the display of words or symbols overimposed on the American flag. The High Court upheld a lowercourt ruling that had upset the law.

title: Lon Nol Proposes Talks With Cambodian Rebels
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Tuesday, July 9 (Agence FrancePresse)President Lon Nol today proposed peace negotiations with the Communistled Cambodian rebels without prerequisite or condition.

title: ExAgent, in Book, Is Said to Assert That C.I.A. Aided in the Killing of Some Employes
description: WASHINGTON, July 8A former undercover agent for the Central Intelligence Agency in Latin America has written what his associates describe as a major expose of the agency's LatinAmerican activities in the 1960's, including an assertion that the agency participated in the murder of some of its employes.

title: Ethiopia Reports the Surrender Of 13 on Military's Wanted List
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, July 8 (AP)Ethiopia's military said that 13 political conservatives and suspected embezzlers gave up and were arrested today in response to an order to sufrender or be hunted down as outlaws.

title: Stage: LondonNew York
description: LONDON  The links between Broadway and the West End are very strong. Why, in London, those breakthrough shows, Oh! Calcutta!, Hair and God spell, to say nothing of Jesus Christ, Superstar, are still running. And in the Royal outskirts of Windsor you can catch Elaine Stritch in the first British production of Neil Simon's The Gingerbread Lady.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Several church groups, protesting a revision of the state's sanitary code that requires the city's Department of Health to supervise their summer daycamp programs, said that they could not comply with the licensing requirements and would fight for exemption from the revised code.

title: Foreign Exchange
description: Money

title: TRIAL OPENS IN SUIT ON PRISONER SHIFT
description: TRENTON, July 8 (UPI)The United States District Court began today to consider the claims of four Rahway Prison inmate leaders who said they had been transferred illegally to Trenton State Prison.

title: TickCarried Fever Reported Growing In Jersey and L.1.
description: At least 26 documented cases of Rocky Mountain spotted fever have been reported in New York and New Jersey so at this year as a result of a substantial increase in the tick population, a survey disclosed yesterday.

title: 13 at Prison Farm In Nashville Seize A Bus and Escape
description: NASHVILLE, July 8 (AP)Thirteen inmates at the Tennessee State Prison commandeered a prison bus today and fled into the streets of West Nashville amid a hail of shotgun fire.

title: St. Petersburg Times: Both Successful and Independent
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla.  All year, but mostly in the cold months, down they come, the tourists, mainly from the cities and the small towns of the Middle West, to get the sun. Part of the bargain is a daily, enraging, sometimes frustrating, dose of independent journalism with tough liberal editorials known as The St. Petersburg Times.

title: HIGH COURT RULES AGAINST A MARINF
description: WASHINGTON, July 8 (AP)The Supreme Court upheld to day the conviction of a marine who prepared a statement critical of United States involvement in Vietnam.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: LEXINGTON, Xy., July 8 (AP)The 29 states that allow partmutuei netting on horse races reaped a record $533.3million last year in racing taxes, an increase $25million from the 1971 record.

title: Two Get Life Sentences For 9 California Killings
description: STOCKTON, Calif., July 8 (UPI)A judge today sentenced two young drifters, including a former resident of The Bronx, to life imprisonment for nine California killings.

title: Palomar Mortgage Trust Will Omit Dividends
description: Palomar Mortgage Investors, a real estate investment trust based in San Diego, reported yesterday that it does not exIpect to pay dividends for the rest of the fiscal year ending November 30 and does not anticipate the granting of any new loans for the rest of the year.

title: SMITH REQUESTED FRANKLIN SUITORS
description: WASHINGTON, July 8  At the height of concern about the financially troubled Franklin National Bank a month ago, the Controller of the Currency, James E. Smith, asked the member banks of the New York Clearing House Association to submit proposals for a possible merger or acquisition of Franklin.

title: KODAK WILL GIVE NEW FILM DATA
description: The Eastman Kodak Company agreed yesterday to provide its competitors with advance notice of new film developments it achieves, when those developments cannot be utilized by existing photographic equipment.

title: Agnew, His Wife Ill, Got Special U.S. Aid On Trip to Mideast
description: WASHINGTON, July 8Former Vice President Spiro T. Agnew was accorded special treatment during his recent trip to the Middle East when his wife became seriously ill in the United States, State Department officials acknowledged tonight.

title: Outmoded Fire Law Blamed In Fatal Port Chester Blaze
description: PORT CHESTER, N. Y., July 8 Assemblyman Antonio G. Olivieri, Democratic aspirant for Lieutenant Governor, stood) in front of the charred remains of Gulliver's night spot today and charged that the stale had a weak and outmoded fireprevention law that was to blame for the fire that took 2,1 lives here June 30.

title: Wood, Field & Stream
description: A man may spend $10,000 on a sport fishing boat and another thousand or two on rods and reels, lines and lures, but no matter how sophisticated his equipment the ultimate link between him and his prey is the inexpensive and muchneglected hook.

title: NATIONS TO HELP TROUBLED BANKS
description: BASEL, Switzerland, July 8 Central bankers from the world's leading industrialized nations agreed in principle today to provide emergency assistance to financially troubled banks wherever necessary to avert a crisis of confidence in the international banking system.

title: NATIONS TO HELP TROUBLED BANKS
description: BASEL, Switzerland, July Central bankers from the world's leading industrialized nations agreed in principle today to provide emergency assistance to financially troubled banks wherever necessary to avert a crisis of confidence in the international banking system.

title: FOREIGN SECURITIES
description: AUTHORITY BONDS

title: Brooklyn Woman Is Slain; Daughter, 18, Is Stabbed
description: A 42yearold Brooklyn woman was killed and her 18yearold daughter was seriously wounded when they were stabbed by a man whom the police described yesterday as a 60yearold friend of the mother.

title: Burns Gains 2Shot Lead In Ike Golf
description: EAST WILLISTON, L.I., July 8George Burns was member of the Wheatley Hills Golf Club from 1969 through 1973. The big 24yearold blond is also one of the best amateur golfers in the nation. This combination proved too much for the other 154 golfers in the first round of the 22d annual Ike amateur tournament today.

title: Contract Awards
description: The Pratt & Whitney Aircraft division of the United Corporation has received a $102.4million addition to an Air Force jetengine contract for the F15 and YF16 aircraft flight test programs. The award went to Pratt & Whitney's Florida research and development center.

title: A Strong New Front Lends Bright Touch To Weather Report
description: Weather Report, the progressive pop  jazz quintet, has undergone some personnel changes and did not appear at this year's Newport Jazz Festival, as it had the previous two summers. But that did not prevent the group from playing here during Newport time, before packed erithusiastic crowds at the Bottom Line on Sunday night and last night.

title: Papp, After Dull Year, Is Optimistic
description: In a reflective mood recently, Joseph Papp, the producer of the ubiquitous New York Shakespeare Festival, looked forward to his next season with optimism, at the same time that he looked hack on his last season with rue.wanted to do it. He said that the resolution wasn't satisfying to Ron Milner's What the WineSellers Buy.Bill Gunn's Black Picture Show, but it was withdrawn from the schedule because Mr. Papp felt that it was not ready. It will now be done at the Public, first in workshop.

title: Churches Will Seek Exemptions From Revised DayCamp Rules
description: Several church groups, protesting last January's revision of the state's sanitary code that requires the city's Department of Health to supervise their summer daycamp programs, said that they could not comply with the licensing requirements and would fight for exemption from the revised code.

title: P.S.C. AUTHORIZES STUDY OF CON ED
description: By ALFONSO A. NARVAEZ.

title: 30 Injured in HeadOn Collision Of 2 ErieLackawana Trains,
description: BELLEVILLE, July 8At least 30 people were injured tonight, none seriously, when two ErieLackawanna commuter trains collided headon in Branch Brook Park here.

title: Brazil: Cost of Growth
description: BRASILIAIs the practice of political repressioncensorship, arbitrary arrest, police and army persecutionessential for Brazil's 10 per cent growth rate?

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: WHEAT FUTURES UP DAILY LIMIT
description: Prices of wheat, corn and soybeans jumped the daily permissible limits yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade. The rise was attributed to a crop report issued over the weekend by Conrad Leslie, a private crop forecaster.

title: Decline in Quality of Production Plagues Publishing
description: After Paulette Cooper's father and mother died at Auschwitz, she was adopted by an American couple and She grew up to be a freelance writer. And so when her hook The Medical Detectives was published by the David McKay Company last year, she dedicated it to her natural parents, noting where they had died.

title: PANEL ON SEX BIAS EVOKES CRITICISM
description: A traveling panel of Federal officials seeking comment on proposed regulations to combat sex discrimination in federally financed schools drew criticism from representatives of women's groups at a forum here yesterday.

title: Lyman C. Craig, Chemist, Dies; Refined Purification of Drugs
description: Dr. Lyman C. Craig, Rockefeller University chemistry prolessor whose research revolutionized techniques for purifyjog drugs, penicillins, proteins and hormones, died Sunday at his home in Glen Rock, N. J. His age was 68.

title: The France Will Make Her Final Run by Fall
description: PARIS, July 8The French Line announced in Le Havre today that the liner France would be laid up no later than this fall.

title: ISIDORE A.SCHWARTZ OF THE NEW SCHOOL
description: Dr. Isidore A. Schwartz, professor of Romance languages at the New School and former chairman of the language department of Tilden High School, died yesterday on a visit to Fort. Collins, Colo. He was 82 years old and lived at 8 Highland Court, Far Rockaway, Queens.

title: Spotlight on Latin Music: Bands and Audience, Too
description: Latin music moved into the Newport Jazz Festival spotlight for the first time on Sunday evening when two concerts were given at Carnegie Hall by four Latin bands.

title: Shipiping/Mails
description: All HoursGIven In DayINN SoVines Time

title: Ehrlichnuin Denies Guilt; Kissinger Told to Testify
description: WASHINGTON, July 8John p. Ehrlichman took the stand in his own defense today and denied that he authorized the 1971 breakin at the office of Dr. Daniel Ellsberg's former psychiatrist.

title: Action on Legal Services
description: As the Senate returns to work, it can tune up for its tough summer schedule by approving with dispatch the legal services bill, which is as ripe for final action as any measure could be. This legislation would create corporation to house legal services activities and insure the continuation of that program.

title: PERCY KWOK DEAD; A MASONIC LEADER
description: Percy Kwok, a retired exporter and importer and a leader in Masonic activities here, died yesterday at the ColumbiaPresbyterian Medical Center. He was 77 years old and lived in Dobbs Ferry, N. Y.

title: Mediator Enters NursingHome Dispute
description: More To Be Relocated Face Seniority Loss

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A Yugoslav citizen, found not guilty by virtue of insanity last year in the 1961 murders of five of his relatives, was captured yesterday outside the Pilgrim State Hospital from which he had escaped over the weekend. The fugitive, Mate Ivanov, 51 years old, surrendered without a struggle but did not explain why he was returning to the hospital, which recently initiated an opendoor policy that allows patients to enter and leave voluntarily during the day.

title: High Court Throws Out State Flag Law
description: The United States Supreme Court, with two Justices dissenting, affirmed yesterday that Nevi York State could not ban the display of words or symbols overimposed on the American flag. The High Court upheld a lowercourt ruling that had upset the law.

title: Highs and Lows
description: New York Stock Exchange

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary aid Index, Page 39

title: Lancey Smith Wins West Golf Medal
description: INDIANAPOLIS, July 8 (AP)  Lancey Smith of Snyder, N. Y., won medalist honors today with a twounderpar 70 in the 74th Women's Western Golf Association amateur championship.

title: 25 Hurtas Ceiling Falls
description: SOUTH BURLINGTON, Vt., July, 8 (AP)Part of a dining room ceiling collapsed today at the Ramada Inn, injuring about 25 persons, the authorities said. The cause of the collapse was not determined.

title: Newport Jazz
description: The longest and most successful (in financial terms) Newport Jazz Festival in the 21year history of the series came to an end yesterday with a free midday concert at the Lincoln Center Fountain Plaza by Kid Thomas's Preservation Hall Jazz Band.

title: Aqueduct Race Charts
description: Aqueduct Jockeys Tonight's Entries at Roosevelt Roosevelt Results

title: Food Costs for Family of Four Up 50c a Week on U.S. Menus
description: WASHINGTON, July 8 (AP) Higher retail food prices in May meant that a family of four spent about 50 cents a week more to eat during that month then during April, new Government figures showed today.

title: 96 Women to Play In U.S. Open Tennis
description: With Wimbledon a matter of history and America's sweethearts, Jimmy Connors and Chris Evert, basking in glory as champions, Billy Talbert is rolling up his elegant sleeves and vowing to make Forest Hills just as spectacular. His first move was to increase the women's field at the United States Open, of which he is director, to 96 from last year's 72. The men's field remains at 128.

title: A New Peron Bonus
description: President Isabel Martinez de Peron of Argentina, on her first full working day, pledged to follow the policies of her husband, the late Juan Domingo Peron, without an iota of change. She then announced that the nation's workers would be paid a bonus amounting to a month's wages. Details, Page 9.

title: Liberty Lobby Series on Mutual Is Scored by A.D.L.
description: The AntiDefamation League: of B'nai B'rith has charged that, a syndicated radio series being distributed by the Mutual Broadcasting System has antiSemitic overtones and promotes literature that is blatantly antiSemitic.

title: U.S. COURT SCORES LAWYER'S ETHICS
description: NEWARK, July 8 (AP)A Federal court here today began considering stiffening disciplinary action against a Newark lawyer who had been found guilty by the State Supreme Court of unethical conduct.

title: U.S. Food Exports Climb To Saudi Arabia and Iran
description: WASHINGTON, July 8The Agriculture Department reported today that United States food exports to Saudi Arabia and Iran are rising briskly as higher petroleum prices and revenues are realized by the two largest Persian Gulf oilproducing countries.

title: MRS. JAMES PARSONS SR.
description: Mrs. Adelaide Douglas Smyth Parsons, widow of James Graham Parsons Sr., an investment banker, and mother of James Graham Parsons, retired Ambassador to Sweden and Laos, and former Assistant Secretary of State and deputy chairman of the United States delegation to the Strategic Arms Limitation Talks, died Saturday at her home, 570 Park Avenue. Her age was 95.

title: Listing of Prices for Transactions in Commodity Futures
description: NEW YORK COTTON EXCHANGE Open Interest

title: Missionary's Wife Released By Philippine Authorities
description: MANILA, July 8 (AP)Mrs. Paul F. Wilson, who was detained 12 days ago with her husband, a missionary, has been released by the Philippine martial law Government, church sources said today.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: July 9, 1974

title: For Hospital's Chinese Patients, Journey to Health Starts With Ethnic Foods
description: Hensive care, Dr. Young said. What they get is care for their symptoms. They see a doctor, get temporary relief, but no tests or treatment. In contrast, he added, the center gives treatment and tests at prices people can afford.

title: Gulf & Western Extends Brown and Garden Offer
description: Gulf and Western Industries, Inc., announced yesterday that it has extended its cash tender offer for shares of common stock of the Brown Company and the Madison Square Garden Corporation until 5 P.M. July 31, unless further extended or terminated earlier.

title: Dave Anderson
description: For six months America has waited patiently, or perhaps uncaringly, to learn the identity of Dandy Don's successor as the third intruder into its life on Monday nights during the National Football League season, there is one. If there is a season, that is, not if there a successor. Because yesterday the successor swaggered into the paneled Hunt Room of the 21 Club in a blackbraided tuxedo with a jade medallion hanging below the lace collar of his formal white turtleneck. Fred Williamson, now a motionpicture actor, once cornerback known as The Hammer until the Green Bay Packers left him for dead in Super Bowl I, was overdressed but not overmatched. He moved easily among mounted deer heads, elegant beer steins, curious newsmen and American Broadcasting Company types. With him, in their yellow abc blazers, were Howard Cosell and Frank Gifford, who have turned the title of The Hammer's latest movie, Three the Hard Way, into the subtitle of his future shock in the Monday Night television booth. Soon the three sat in front of an abc banner with Roone Arledge, president ABC Sports, and looked into ABC cameras. The other Sports of The Times

title: Rumania Credit Approved
description: WASHINGTON, July 8 (UPI) The United States has approved a $36million threeyear credit to Rumania for the.purchase of American cotton and livstock feed grains, the Agriculture department announced today. The credit was granted under a program operated by the department's Commodity Credit Corporation.

title: Montgomery Ward Studies Dropping Some LongDelivery Items
description: Montgomery Ward of Chicago, the major subsidiary of Marcor, Inc. and third largest of the nation's catalogue chains, has begun a study of those products that take the longest time to deliver and have shown the highest rise in price, with the aim of dropping some or all of them from Ward's order list.

title: New York Stock Exchange Bond Trading
description: New York Stock Exchange Bond Trading

title: Company Reports
description: Company Reports

title: Cabaret: Manhattan Follies at Plaza
description: What's this? A bevy of female impersonators at the elegantly sedate old Persian Room of the Plaza?

title: S. E. C. CENSURES ARTHUR ANDERSEN
description: WASHINGTON, July 8The Securities and Exchange Commission censured the accounting firm of Arthur Andersen & Co. today for failure to make full disclosure of its financial relations with the Whittaker Corporation, a manufacturing conglomerate.

title: DOLLAR IS MIXED ON WORLD MARKETS
description: BRUSSELS, July 8 (UPI)The dollar moved within a narrow margin on world money markets today. Gold rallied strongly from last week's fivemonth low.

title: Prosecution Rests In 2d Brasco Trial On Payoff Charges
description: The prosecution rested its case yesterday in the second trial of Representative Frank J. Brasco on a charge that he conspired to obtain illegal payoffs to help a Mafiacontrolled truck company.

title: A Study of Dutchess County Jail Finds OverAll Filth and a Lack of Discipline
description: A confidential state report on the Dutchess County Jail described discipline there as nonexistent and asserted that, as of last March, if any did exist, the inmates were enforcing it. But state officials contended yesterday that there had been a vast improvement since.

title: Highway Turnabout
description: Governor Wilson's decision to suspend planning enlarge the Long Island, Expressway in Queens indicates a most welcome shift in priorities in Albany.

title: Chess: Korchnoi Works Himself Into A Fit of Silence for the Match
description: Viktor Korchnoi currently refuses to speak to Anatoly Karpov whom he will face in the final world championship candidates match, which begins Sept. 1 in Moscow.

title: AllStars Contest Faces Cancellation
description: EVANSTON, III., July 8 (AP)The executive director of Chicago Tribune Charities said tonight that the strikeplagued College AllStar football game would be canceled unless an arrangement is worked out within 48 hours to allow it to be played without interference.

title: S.E.C. Says Pennsylvania Life Joined Equity Funding in Plan
description: LOS ANGELES, July 8The Securities and Exchange Commission obtained today an injunction against the Pennsylvania Life Company and five of its officers based on S.E.C. allegations that the defendants had participated with the Equity Funding Corporation of America to fraudulently enhance the financial condition of both companies.

title: 9 U.S. Astronauts Praise Russian Crew
description: MOSCOW, July 8A crew of American astronauts now training at the space center outside Moscow today sent a telegram of congratulations to the two Soviet astronauts aboard the Salyut 3 orbital station.

title: A New Peron Bonus
description: President Isabel Martinez de Peron of Argentina, on her first full working day, pledged to follow the policies of her husband, the late Juan Domingo PerOn, without an iota of change. She then announced that the nation's workers would be paid a bonus amounting to a month's wages. Details, Page 9.

title: Mr. Wallace Again
description: WASHINGTON, July 8Every discussion on the future of the Democratic party goes back to the putative candidacy of Gov. George C, Wallace.

title: Secrecy May Curb Strategic Arms Debate
description: LONDON, July 8The shape and the problems of the developing American debate on nuclear arms agreements with the Soviet Union have begun to emerge as Secretary of State Kissinger tours Western Europe presenting his version of what happened at the Moscow summit meeting. As they listen, many European diplomats candidly admit that the subject is just too technical for them to absorb, a difficulty Americans are bound to share. News Analysis

title: United States Government and Agency Bonds
description: United States Government and Agency Bonds

title: City Hall Lends Ear to Those Tangled in Red Tape
description: I had spoken to nine people before I spoke with you, and you shine out like a beacon light, wrote a New Yorker to the Mayor's Action Center in the basement of City Hall.

title: CITY LOSES APPEAL ON TAP OF AQUEDUCT
description: The State Supreme Court's Appellate Division yesterday upheld the right of the Village of Cornwall to tap into New York City's Catskill aqueduct, as a substitute source of drinking water.

title: Summit Talk Foundered Over MIRV's
description: WASHINGTON, July 8President Nixon proposed in Moscow last week that the United States and the Soviet Union limit the number of their missiles with multiple nuclear warheads and then phase out some of their landbased missiles with single warheads, according to Government sources.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Giscard and Schmidt Seek Common Policy Ground
description: BONN, July 8President Valery Giscard d'Estaing and nearly half of the French Cabinet arrived at a 17th century castle near here today for talks with Chancellor Helmut Schmidt, aimed at reviving European economic and political cooperation.

title: Jersey Senate Vote Skirts Income Tax Commitment By WALTER H. WAGGONER
description: TRENTON, July 8The State Senate approved by a narrow margin tonight a bill defining the state's role in assuring a thorough and efficient education for New Jersey's pupils but without reference to new taxation that would be required to finance the necessary, state aid.

title: Bangladesh: Orphan in World With No Foster Parents
description: DACCA, Bangladesh, July 2  Chunnu; 2 years old, is leaving for Sweden shortly to join his foster parents.

title: Bargain Housing Urged In Coney Revitalizing Plan
description: An eightpart program for revitalizing Brooklyn's deteriorating Coney Island section, including apartments at bargain prices to attract middleincome families, was recommended yesterday by a courtappointed special master, who sees the plan as a model for neighborhood racial integration throughout the city.

title: W. Germans Hope AceWon't Quit
description: FRANKFURT, West Germany, July 8 (AP)West German soccer fans were stunned today by reports that 28yearold Gerd Mueller was quitting the World Cup championship team.

title: LANDLORDS FOILED ON CANCELING PACTS
description: A, vote by a major group of apartmenthouse landlords to cancel their contract with Local 32B of the Building Service Employes International, was declared invalid yesterday by a unionlandlord arbitrator.

title: Ehrlichman Denies Guilt; Kissinger Told to Testify
description: WASHINGTON, July 8John D. Ehrlichman took the stand in his own defense today and denied that he authorized the 1971 breakin at the office of Dr. Daniel Ellsberg's former psychiatrist.

title: KISSINGER MEETS BRITISH LEADERS.
description: LONDON, July 8 (AP)Secretary of State Kissinger and British leaders agreed today that financial and energy problems could lead to a world economic slump of huge proportions, but they could not decide what to do about it, informed sources said.

title: Business Briefs
description: LONDON, July 8The British Government is expected to announce this week plans for a partial nationalization of offshore oil. The announcement, which may come on Wednesday, would be a fulfillment of the governing Labor party's campaign pledge to insure that Britain obtained a fair share', of the profits from exploitation of North Sea oil.

title: MASSAGE PARLOR LOSES LEASE HERE
description: Heated reaction in the Times Square area to a storefront massage or rap parlor resulted yesterday in the revocation of the lease by the building's management.

title: $533.3Million Sets Racing Tax Mark
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., July 8 (AP)The 29 states that allow parimutuel betting on horse races reaped a record $533.3million last year in racing taxes, an increase of $25million from the 1971 record.

title: Mounting Disagreements in Lisbon Over Reforms Point to a Cabinet ShakeUp
description: LISBON, July 8  Strains within Portugal's coalition Government and tension in the military increased sharply over the weekend, and now a Cabinet shakeup appears in the offing.

title: People and Business
description: James H. Higgins has been elected chairman and chief executive officer of the Mellon National Corporation, the holding company for the Mellon Bank of Pittsburgh. The 58yearold Mr. Higgins, who began his banking career with the Bank of Manhattan Company in New York, succeeds John A. Meyer who is retiring, at the mandatory age of 65, effective Aug. 1.

title: Television
ISRAELIS ATTACK 3 LEBANESE PORTS, SINKING 30 BOATS
description: TEL AVIV, Tuesday, July 9Israeli naval commandos raided three ports on the coast of southern Lebanon last night and sank 30 fishing boats, the army reported here.

title: 200YearOld Sycamore Will Yield to Intersection
description: RIVER EDGE, July 8A giant sycamore tree that has been slowly succumbing to the pressures of progress during the late portion of its 200year life will fall beneath the power saws within the next two weeks.

title: Thomson Absorbing W.E. Hutton Offices
description: In what must be the quietest maneuver in Wall Street's current flurry of consolidations, Thomson & McKinnon Auchincloss Kohlmeyer, Inc., took control of at least 10 offices of W. E. Hutton & Co. yesterday and will absorb up to 20 more in the next week to 10 days.

title: 6,000 at 2d Jam Session Turn Out for Diana Ross
description: The Newport Jazz Festival's idea of building the second of its two midnight jam sessions, held early Monday morning at Radio City Music Hall, around a singer, Diana Ross, seemed to be a contradiction in terms. For one thing, Miss Ross, a former member of the Supremes, is not known as a jazz singer. Beyond that, even the most adept of jazz singers is usually only a peripheral element in a jam session, one human voice among several instrumental voices.

title: Bridge.
description: The news that the New York City Board of Health voted to have smokers segregated in certain public gatherings may have alarmed some bridgeplaying smokers. However, the ban will not apply to functions at which the organizers rather than the owners of the buildings control the seating arrangements.

title: AllStar Game Voting
description: NATIONAL LEAGUE

title: Tanaka's Party Clings to Election Lead, but Its Majority Is Cut
description: TOKYO, Tuesday, July 9In very close voting, Premier Kakuei Tanaka's LiberalDemocratic party appeared to have kept control of the upper house of Parliament in Sunday's election, incomplete returns showed today, but its majority will be sharply reduced.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: CONCERTS Some offbeat free music this afternoon'and evening for people in midtown and people in Washington Heights. From 12:15 to 1:30 P.M., the Great Swamp Jazz Band will begin a series of free lunchtime concerts at the Grace Plaza, Avenue of the Americas and 43rd Street, Dixieland and swing mostly. And this evening, senior citizens especially will be able to enjoy a special concert at Fort Tryon Cultural Center, at Broadway and Dyckman Street by the South Bronx Community Action Theater's Young Guitarists, beginning at 7 P.M. On Thursday, there will be another concert, by the Mariachis Los Soles, at the nearby Bethune Houses Cultural Center, 156th Street and Amsterdam Avenue.

title: DR. HOWELL LAIR, 89, MISSIONARY IN CHINA
description: The Rev. Dr. Howell P. Lair, a Presbyterian missionary educator in Tsinan in China's Shantung province from 1913 to his eviction in 1950, died Saturday in Duarte, Calif., where he had headed a church retirement home. He was 89 years old.

title: GEORGE E. MOONAN
description: George E. Moonan, a consulting engineer, died Sunday of cancer in Lawrence Hospital, Bronxville, N.Y. He was 59 years old and lived at 254 Manhattan Avenue, Crestwood, N.Y.

title: Nyquist Upholds Anker On Canarsie Principal
description: The State Education Commissioner, Ewald B. Nyquist, has rejected an appeal by East Flatbush parents, who opposed the affirmation by Chancellor Irving Anker of Norman Desser as principal of Public School 208 in Brooklyn.

title: Mock Impeachment Bill Voted by Upsala Class
description: EAST ORANGE, July 8 (UPI)Seven students at Upsala College's The Presidency in Crisis class voted today for a mock bill of impeachment.

title: New Nuclear Blast by French Reported in the South Pacific
description: CANBERRA, Australia, July 8 (UPI)The Prime Ministers of Australia and New Zealand said today that France had set off another atmospheric nuclear explosion in the Pacific.

title: 3 Policemen Are Cleared In Rochester Man's Death
description: ROCHESTER, July 8 (UPI)Three Rochester policemen were cleared of wrongdoing today by a Monroe County grand jury in the shooting death of a Rochester man last month.

title: A Disarray in Credit Markets Proves Failure Factor
description: Columbia Gas Systems, Inc., one of the nation's top utilities, was unable yesterday to raise $50million on an issue of preferred stock because of the general disarray in the money markets. Soon afterward, the Honeywell Finance Company announced it would not bring its proposed of fering of $75million of debentures to market this Thursday, citing, unfavorable market conditions.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Letters to the Editor

title: Katharine Cornell's Estate Valued at Over $500,000
description: Katharine Cornell, the actress, left an estate estimated at $500,000 to $1million, it was disclosed in Manhattan Surrogate's Court yesterday, where her will was filed for probate.

title: Advertising: Rest of the Year
description: With half the year behind them, top ad agency executives are sighing and saying something like: Well, that wasn't as bad as we thought it would be back in those cold December days. But what about the rest of the year?

title: JAMES A. DORIS
description: James A. Doris, executive secretary of the St. Patrick's. Day Parade Committee and the Clan Na Gael, who was a leader, in AmericanIrish activities died (Saturday in St. Vincent's HosHe was 75 years old and. lived in Stuyvesant Town.

title: Navy Plans to Scrap 291 in Mothball Fleet
description: WASHINGTON, July 8 (AP) The Navy is scrapping nearly 300 old aircraft carriers, cruisers and other ships in the first major reduction of its mothball fleet since World War II.

title: Weather Reports and Forecast
description: Except for possible showers and thunderstorms over northern New England, mostly sunny skies will cover the rest of the Northeast today. Hot weather will continue from the North and Middle Atlantic States to the Northern and Central Plains States. Thundershowers will linger over Florida, Georgia and Alabama, while isolated showers will occur in southern New Mexico. Showers and thundershowers are forecast from the northern Rockies to the coast of the Pacific Northwest. Clouds will cover the northern plateau region with showers expected over northern Utah. It will be slightly cooler west of the Rockies. Sunny weather is forecast elsewhere.

title: Nixon and Ford Discuss Summit and the Economy
description: WASHINGTON, July 8 (AP) President Nixon met for more than an hour today with Vice President Ford to report on the Soviet Summit talks and to discuss unspecified domestic issups, a spokesman said.

title: Alcoa Planning Expansion Of North Carolina Smelter
description: The Aluminum Company of America said yesterday it planned a multimilliondollar expansion of its aluminum smelter at Badin, N. C. The expansion would increase the plant's rated capacity by about 50 per cent, which would mean a 60,000toayear addition, through a third potline and supporting facilities.

title: Kim. Holiday Designated
description: BOSTON, July 8 (AP)Gov. Francis W. Sargent signed today a bill designating Jan. 15, the birthday of the late Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., as state holiday.

title: 24 NASSAU JUDGES DUE FOR 40% RAISE
description: MINEOLA, L.I., July 8Nassau County's 24 District Court judges are expected to get their fourth salary increase in two years after a public hearing today.

title: GOODRICH TO BUILD NEW POLYVINYL UNIT
description: The B. F. Goodrich Chemical Company, a unit of the B. F. Goodrich Company, disclosed yesterday that it was building a pulyvinyl chloride plant at its chemical complex in Louisville, Ky.

title: Books of The Times An Atom Bomb in Every Home
description: THE CURVE OF BINDING ENERGY. By John McPhee. 231 pages. Farrar, Straus & Giroux, $7,95,

title: Stage:LondonNew York
description: LONDON  The links between Broadway and the West End are very strong. Why, in London, those breakthrough shows, Oh! Calcutta!, Hair and God, spell, to say nothing of Jesus Christ, Superstar, are still ruming And in the Royal outskirts of Windsor you can catch Elaine Stritch in the first British production of Neil Simon's The Gingerbread Lady.

title: GEORGE TASSO
description: George Task), a retired linotype operator formerly with The New York Herald Tribune, World Journal Tribune and The New York Times, died Friday in Gulf Harbor, New Port Richey, Fla. His widow and a brother survive.

title: 30 Injured in HeadOn Collision Of 2 ErieLackawanna Trains
description: BELLEVILLE, N.J., July 8At least 30 people were injured tonight, none seriously, when two ErieLackawanna commuter trains collided headon in Branch Brook Park here.

title: Bhutto Bids U.S. Supply More Arms
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, July 8Prime Minister Zulfikar Ali Bhutto said today that the United States had an obligation to resume the shipment of arms to Pakistan.

title: Summit Talk Foundered Over MIRV's
description: WASHINGTON, July 8President Nixon proposed in Moscow last week that the United States and the Soviet Union limit the number of their missiles with multiple nuclear warheads and then phase out some of their landbased missiles with single warheads, according to Government sources.

title: LIGHTER PENALTY ONCOCAINE FOUGHT
description: NEWARK, July 8 (AP)Calling cocaine a danger to, society, Justice Department lawyers asked a Federal judge today to reject a constitutional challenge aimed at taking cocaine off the list of narcotic, substances.

title: Notes on People
description: Rudolf Kirchschlager took office as President of Austria yesterday with an offer to serve as a neutral mediator between East and West, between North and South, for peace and human rights.

title: Compensation Is Upheld In Good Samaritan Death
description: A referee of the State Workmen's Compensation Board yesterday ordered an insurance company to pay death benefits to the family of a good citizen who was shot to death as he pursued a berserk gunman.

title: Candor and a Low Profile Have Characterized Kelley's First Year as F.B.I. Director
description: WASHINGTON, July 8The Federal Bureau of Investigation has not produced many headlines since Clarence M. Kelley took over as its director a year ago tomorrow. There have been no determinedly innovative edicts like those L. Patrick Gray 3d issued approving women agents, colored shirts and longer hair, no bold investigative strokes like William D. Ruckelsliaus's foray into the White House to recover missing wiretapping records.

title: Sports Today
description: Mets vs. San Diego Padres, at Shea Stadium, Roosevelt Avenue and 120th Street, Flushing Meadow, Queens, 8:05 (Television  Channel 9, 8 P.M,) (Radio  WHIN, 8 P.M.)

title: PANEL ON SEX BIAS EVOKES CRITICISM
description: A traveling panel of Federal officials seeking comment on proposed regulations to combat sex discrimination in federally financed schools drew criticism from representatives of women's groups at a forum here yesterday.

title: NIXON SAID TO SEEK NEW WELFARE PLAN
description: WASHINGTON, July 8 (AP) The Secretary of Health, Edu cation and Welfare, Caspar W. Weinberger, said today that President Nixon was pushing for an Administration program to replace the wide number of welfare programs to which the nation is now committed.

title: Veterinarian Thrives as Trainer
description: Doc Schmitt has been quietly making his presence known at Aqueduct, where lie has been compiling a good record with horses that are hardly of the expensive variety. Ye s te rday he saddled two horses, and both of them won. Those two triwnphs extended a streak that started last week, and which now stands at four.

title: Steel Production Fell 0.8% in Week To 2,780,000 Tons
description: Production of steel for the week ended Saturday hit another low for the present year, the American Iron and Steel Institute reported yesterday.

title: Compensation Award Is Upheld In Death of Good Samaritan
description: A referee of the State Workmen's Compensation Board yesterday ordered an insurance company to pay death benefits to the family of a good citizen who was shot to death as he pursued a berserk gunman.

title: Bond Hearing Scheduled
description: ST. PAUL, July 8 (AP) United States District Judge Fred Nichol scheduled today a hearing for Friday on the Government's request that the $42,000 bond of Russell Means, a defendent in the, Wounded Knee trial, be revoked. Mr. Means and Dennis Bank's, American. Indian Movement leaders, are on trial on 10 felony charges in connection with the armed occupation of Wounded Knee, S.D., last year.

title: Environmental Protection Unit To Establish Land Use Division
description: FARGO, N. D., July 8 The Environmental Protection Agency will soon establish a new divisiinto deal with land use problems, tife agency's ada ministrator, Rusell E. Train, said today.

title: A Few Boos and Let's Go, Leon in the Patient Crowd
description: WASHINGTON, July 8There is a feeling of order and dignity in the marble halls of the United States Supreme Court building, and it seemed to spill over today onto the marble plaza outside where the crowd waited.

title: Delay Possible for Citicorp's Offering
description: Uncertainty arose yesterday over the timing of a proposed offering by Citicorp of $850million in a controversial and novel type of security.

title: People in Sports Ahurnada Will Fight Oquendo Here July 29
description: Jorge Ahumada, who fought a draw with Bob Foster, the lightheavyweight boxing champion at Albuquerque, N.M., on June 17, will return to the ring on July 29. The 28yearold Argentine will fight Angel Oquendo, a native of Puerto Rico who lives in the Bronx, at Madison Square Garden's main arena.

title: Deaths
description: ALBENRoslyn. Loving aunt of Joan Mills, Audrey Leif, Lenore Sinert and Wynn Alby, dear cousin and great aunt. Services today 1 P.M. Westminster Chapels Coney Island Ave. at Ave. It, Brooklyn.

description: Article 2  No Title

title: Venezuela Plans Refinery
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, July 8 (AP)The Venezuelan Government is planning to construct a $3.9million oil refinery in the oilrich western state of Zulia to process approximately 300,000 barrels of oil daily, the Mines Ministry's r.ews letter ireported today.

title: Study Finds IcelanderIrish Blood Link
description: REYKJAVIK, Iceland, 8 Despite the classic image of the Icelander with flaxen hair, high cheekbones and blue eyes, it appears that at least in some respects the inhabitants of this island country arc more Irish than Nordic.

title: Today's Entries at Monmouth
description: Today's Entries at Monmouth

title: Follower of Chenault Says PresentDay Events Are All Explained in the Bible
description: DAYTON, Ohio, July 6Everything is predetermined. There's nothing you can do about it. It was all written 2,000 years ago.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: LAKEWOOD, July 8  New Jersey has 130 miles coastline, more than 800 lakes and ponds, thousands swimming pools and approximately 3million people who can't swim. It also has Mrs. Delores Kraft, aquatics director for the Ocean County Young Men's Christian Association, who has taught approximately 8,000 people how to swim during the last eight years, many of them babies.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Officials at Newark International Airport welcomed its first international flight, a charter flight from Frankfurt, West Germany, yesterday afternoon. The plane, which was carrying 169 German tourists to Los Angeles, stopped in Newark for nearly two hours while the group cleared the new United States Customs and Immigration inspection facilities at the airport's old North Terminal.

title: MILTON J. WEITZMAN
description: Milton J. Weitzman, vice president for engineering of the Leviton Manufacturing Company, maker of electrical switches and lampholders, died Sunday near the Bayside (Queens) Marina. He was 50 years old and lived at 2808 215th Street, Bayside.

title: Excerpts From Oral Arguments by jaworski and St. Clair Before Supreme Court
description: WASHINGTON. July 8 Following are excerpts from the oral argument before the Supreme Court by Leon Jaworski, Watergate special prosecutor, James D. St. Clair, President Nixon's counsel, and Philip A. Lacovara, assistant special prosecutor, in the cases of United States of America v. Richard M. Nixon et at and Richard M. Nixon v. United States of America. The unofficial stenographic transcript did not identify the Justices asking questions. Their names have been provided, wherever possible, from news reporters' notes. Where there is uncertainty, the names have been omitted.

title: West African Days
description: It's been ten years now since Bloomington and Terre Haute and the long flight to West Africa. It's hard to believe. It seems as if just the other day I was 22 and going to a place that had always attracted me but never expected to reach. I think that was why I joined the Peace Corps.

title: SKELETON IN MEXICO BELIEVED U.S. AIDE'S
description: HERMOSILLO, Mexico, July 8(UPI)  Mexican authorities said tonight that they had found the badly decomposed body of a United States vice consul, John Patterson, who was kidnaped in March.

title: Southern Cross Wins Practice Run
description: NEWPORT, R.I., July 8 (AP) Southern Cross finished two boat lengths ahead of Gretel II today in an abbreviated practice race between the two Australian yachts seeking to bid for the America's Cup.

title: Gary Player Picks Black Caddie for British Open
description: LYTHAM ST. ANNE'S, England, July 8 (AP)Gary Player, the golfing star from South Africa, has shown up at the British Open with a black caddie from the United States.

title: Amex Stocks Slump to a 4Year Low
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange fell yesterday to their lowest point in four years in increased trading. Prices also fell in the overthecounter market on heavier volume.

title: High Tides Around New York
description: High Tides Around New York

title: COURT SAYS NIXON EXCEEDED POWER ON IMPORT SURTAX
description: In a decision that could lead to the refund of $500million to importers, the United States Customs Court ruled here yesterday that President Nixon had exceeded his authority in 1971 when he imposed a 10 per cent surcharge on all dutiable imports.

title: 2 Die in Car in Flash Flood
description: ALBUQUERQUE, N. M., July 8 (AP)Two women died Yesterday when their car was Caught by a flash flood in a mountainous area about 25 miles from here. The victims were Teresa Chavez, 24 years old, and Martha Chavez, 33, both of Torreon, N. M.

title: Witness Fails to Refute A Charge Against Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, July 8 Frederick C. LaRue, summoned today before the House Judiciary Committee at the request of the White House, apparently did not refute an important element in the charge that President Nixon approved or tolerated the payment of alleged hush money to a convicted Watergate burglar.

title: Confused About Pantyhose Sizes? Relief May Be Near
description: Nude and naughty, mercifully opaque, fanny flattener, stomach controller, Red, yellow, blue, brown, The variety in pantyhose is bountiful but, please, miss, what size do I wear?

title: EUROPEANS FACE SURPLUS OF BEEF
description: BRUSSELS, July 8The European Economic Community, which only a year ago was scouring the world's markets for meat supplies, is now suffering through the worst beef glut in its history.

title: G.M. to Resume Production At MotorHome Facilities
description: PONTIAC, Mich., July (UPI)  The GMC Truck and Coach division of the General Motors Corporation resumed limited production today at its motorhome facilities. They had been closed since early March because of the slump in sale of motor homes.

title: DowJones Average Down 21.20 on Rise in Interest Costs
description: Stock prices plummeted yesterday to their lowest levels since 1970, carried by a tide of rising interest rates.

title: Voices From the Past Help WNYC Mark 50th Year
description: On July 8, 1924, the deadlocked Democratic National Convention meeting at the old Madison Square Garden on Madison Square held its 88th through 100th ballots on the way to nominating John W. Davis for the Presidency and a swift trip to political oblivion.

title: IIHunger in the World
description: Impending or even possible world calamities are hard to visualize in good times and almost impossible to cope with in bad. Yet, as Americans reel under the impact doubledigit inflation and stumble benumbed through the Watergate fog, they are beginning to be confronted with the specter of a global food shortage that could rival a massive war in ghastly impact.
