The 28yearold Argentine will fight Angel Oquendo, a native of Puerto Rico who lives in the Bronx, at Madison Square Garden's main arena.

title: Parker, Mets Top Padres, 21; Yankees Win, 125, on 19 Hits
description: Although Harry Parker tied a club record for walks with nine and continued a dubious string of having pitched no complete games in his four years in the major leagues, he did get the victory last night as the Mets defeated the San Diego Padres, 2.1, at Shea Sttadium.

title: WHEAT AND CORN DECLINE SHARPLY
description: In trading that one analyst called a fast track, wheat and corn futures dropped sharply yesterday, only a day after their upthelimit gains on the Chicago Board of Trade.

title: Deaths
description: ALBERTRose, devoted mother of Harriett Steam, Daniel and Marlin, dear sister of Jean Lestner and Emanuel Albert, adored grandmother and greatgrandmother. Services Thursday, 12 noon, at Gutterman's, 2239 Church Ave. (near Flatbush).

title: Safeway's Net Is Up 30%
description: Safeway Stores, Inc., one of the nation's largest food chains, continued its upward profit trend of the first quarter with an increase of 30.6 per cent in earnings in the second quarter. This brought the company's halfyear net up by 32.7 per cent.

title: U.S ARMS SALES DOUBLED IN 7374 REACHS815BILLION
description: WASHINGTON, July 9The United States sold some $8.5billion in arms for the fiscal year that ended last month, almost double the arms sales for the previous fiscal year and almost $2billion more than all the arms sold or given away by all nations in 1971, according to official Pentagon estimates.

title: Court Rules State Didn't Pay Enough For 180 Roadbed.
description: TRENTON, July 9 (AP)The State Supreme Court ruled today that the state must adequately compensate municipalities when it takes over public property for its own use.

title: Again Prime Minister, With Helm Firmly in Hand Pierre Elliott Trudeau
description: OTTAWA, July 9  Late last year, as Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau and a television interviewer looked forward to the Canadian national election, Mr. Trudeau said that although he had tried to speak the language of reason in the past, he might he more impassioned and a little less rational in the future.

title: White House Aide Criticizes A.T.&T.
description: WASHINGTON, July 9The Nixon Administration criticized the American Telephone and Telegraph Company today for using its power to persuade the Government to extend its monopoly in communications.

title: No. 3 Post for Rich Trot Helps Make Delmonica Hanover Pick
description: Asparagus tips were on the menu, but the most inescapable tip, at the United Nations yesterday was a horse named Delmonica Hanover.

title: HAROLD H. SHAPIRO
description: Harold H. Shapiro, who had been a reporter on The Long Island Press and earlier with The Long Island StarJournal for the last 18 years, died, apparently of a heart attack, yesterday in Booth Memorial Hospital, Flushing, Queens. He was 49 years old and lived at 14343 41st Avenue, Flushing.

title: Listing of Prices of Commodity Futures
description: Listing of Prices of Commodity Futures

title: Box Scores of Yesterday's Maj or League Games and Standings
description: Box Scores of Yesterday's Maj or League Games and Standings

title: People in Sports
description: Keith Wilkes has come out from the shadow of Bill Walton, his former teammate at the University of California, Los Angeles, to sign a multiyear agreement with the Golden State Warriors of the National Basketball Association. The Warriors, who had made the 6foot7inch allAmerica forward their top college draft choice this year, signed him yesterday.

title: MRS. ALBERT FRISCH
description: Mrs. Rebe Brager Frisch, an administrative assistant in the Queens College education department, died Sunday at Long Island Jewish Hospital, New Hyde Park. She was 60 years old and lived at 11270 72d Drive, Forest Hills, Queens.

title: CABINET IN LISBON FALLS AS 5 RESIGN
description: LISBON, July 9 Portugal's first effort at civilian government since the revolution in April collapsed tonight with the resignation of Premier Adelino da Palma Carlos and four of his middleoftheroad ministers.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I wonder if all the testimony and hearings that are leading up to the great debate over the question of President Nixon's high crimes and misdemeanors will in the long run serve the best interests of the country.

title: Tiant, a Red Sox Bargain, Wins No. 12
description: Luis Tiant, who came to the Boston Red Sox as a free agent in May of 1971, has turned out to be one of Boston's best bargains.

title: 1,100 Race Miles Slated at Watkins Glen
description: Mario Andretti, who has been having trouble finishing races this season, will start three this weekend. Johnny Rutherford, who said after winning the Indianapolis 500 this year that he would like to try road racing, will start two. And George Follmer and Jackie Oliver, the feuding teammates on Shadow's undefeated CanAm team, will have to stop fighting each other and pay attention to the opposition.

title: Sir Harry Brittain Dead at 100, Encouraged AngloU.S. Amity
description: LONDON, July 9Sir Harry Brittain, known for his lifelong service to AngloAmerican friendship, died at his home this evening. He was 100 years old.

title: Rangers to Drill in Long Beach
description: LONG BEACH, LI., July 9 (UPI)The New York Rangers and the City of Long Beach today signed agreement under which the Long Island community will provide practice facilities for the National Hockey League club. The Rangers general manager, Emile Francis, and City Manager Richard J. Bowen signed the agreement front of the old city skate house on Magnolia Boulevard, which is being transformed into a locker room adjoining the new Nassau County Arena. Eighteen Rangers live Long Beach.

title: Barr Asks U.S. Support for Exemption to Allow Potential Acquisitions
description: WASHINGTON, July 9  Joseph W. Barr, the new chairman of the Franklin National Corporation, the parent company of the troubled Franklin National Bank, was in the Capital today seeking Administration and Congressional support for legislation that would permit an outofstate bank to merge with Franklin.

title: Rep. Heckler Running Again
description: WELLESLEY, Mass., July 9, (UPI)Representative Margaret M. Heckler, Republican of Massachusetts, announced yesterday that she was seeking reelection in her 10th Congressional District. She is being challenged by Barry F. Monahan, Democrat of Fall River, who resigned as Police Commissioner there to run.

title: Aficionados of Innovative Jazz Get Their Fill at Studio Rivbea
description: While throngs filled the concerts of the Newport Jazz Festival over the last week hundreds of other jazz lovers crowded into Studio Rivbea in the East Village to hear some of the country's most innovative and exciting musicians play their best.

title: Meets With Aides on How to Use Freer Hand Given in Triumph at Polls
description: OTTAWA, July 9  Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau met privately with some of his advisers today to begin deciding how to use the sweeping new power that the Canadian voters gave him in yesterday's parliamentary election.

title: Struck Pie Plant Closed
description: POTTSTOWN, Pa., July 9 (AP)  Mrs. Smith's Pie Company was closed today following disturbance by striking union employes and the arrest of three pickets, according to Montgomery County officials.

title: Crusaders Get New Home
description: CLEVELAND, July 9 (UPI) The Cleveland Crusaders of the World Hockey Association will open their 197475 home schedule on Oct. 27 against the Toronto Toros at the Coliseum, now under construction in Richfield Township. The contest will be the first sporting event in the $20million sportsentertainment facility.

title: Reforms in France
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.  During his presidency, Georges Pompidou pursued a constant strategy on behalf of definite policy. The policy was to promote France's industrial development, under the guidance and with the help of the state, while softening the resulting social change with subsidies and tax advantages for the groups most hurt by it: peasants, small shopkeepers, independent workers.

title: WEDNESDAY JULY 10, 1974 News Summary and Index
description: The United States sold more than $8.5billion in arms in the fiscal year 197374, almost double the sales of 197273, according to official Pentagon estimates. This surge, many officials say, has been at least as much for economic reasons as to meet defense and diplomatic requirements. The bulk of the sales has been to the Middle East and the Persian Gulf area. [1:5.]

title: 2 CONVICTS SUE OVER TRANSFERS
description: TRENTON, July 9Two inmates of Trenton State Prison today charged in Federal District Court here that the State Department of Institutions and Agencies violated their rights by abruptly transferring them from Rahway State Prison following a mass meeting there last April.

title: 4 Carefully Wrought Packages Pass EggDrop Test
description: SOUTH ORANGE, July 9 Fourteen chicken eggs were broken here on the campus of Seton Hall University this morning, but no omelet was served.

title: MRS. KOPELIOVITCH
description: Mrs. Marie Kopeliovitch, mother of Leonard Koppett, West Coast sports reporter for The New York Times, died Monday at her home in Palo Alto, Calif. She was 80 years old.

title: Plan for Douglaston Mall Is Dealt a Blow
description: The proposed construction of a shopping mall in a ravine area of Douglaston. Queens, came up against another roadblock yesterday with a ruling by the state placing the ravine under the protection of the 1973 Tidal Wetlands Act.

title: ATOM AID BACKED FOR THE MIDEAST
description: WASHINGTON, July 9Administration officials today defended the proposed sale of atomic power plants to Egypt and Israel on the ground that the two countries might obtain the nuclear assistance from other nations under less stringent safeguards.

title: Sludge Dredged. Up Nearer L.I. Beach
description: ATLANTIC BEACH, L. I., July 9 A marine scientist who was startled last December to find that sewage sludge dumped into the Atlantic Ocean had flowed to within half a mile of the beach here found the sludge today as close as quarter of a mile.

title: The Dance
description: Still another view of Apollo, George Balanchine's seminal neoclassic ballet of 1928, was provided on Monday night at the State Theater when American Ballet Theater presented a new cast headed by Daniel Levins and Kim Highton.

title: DIFFERENCES CITED IN PANEL VERSION OF 8 NIXON TAPES
description: WASHINGTON, July 9The House Judiciary Committee released today eight transcripts its staff had prepared of President Nixon's Watergate conver sations, and committee members of both parties said that the marked differences from the edited transcripts machi public by the White House could damage President Nixon's case in the impeachment inquiry.

title: BRITISH TO RELEASE SUSPECTS IN ULSTER
description: LONDON, July 9 (AP)The British Government announced today that it would permit the phased release of suspected guerrillas held without trial in Northern Ireland.

title: About New York
description: Exactly when it happened nobody knows, but there came a time in the life of the city when prostitution became more open than it had been betore and when the city's sensibilities about it changed, too. Prostitution is a mean operation, and it has been, with us forever; the difference now is that we more or less expect to see it around.

title: Sludge Dredged Up Nearer L.I. Beach
description: ATLANTIC BEACH, L. I., July 9  A marine scientist who was startled last December to find that sewage sludge dumped into the Atlantic Ocean had flowed to within half a mile of the beach here found the sludge today as close as quarter of a mile.

title: Herbert Loewenthal, 76, ExBankruptcy Judge, Dies
description: Herbert Loewenthal, retired bankruptcy judge in the Federal District Court for the Southern District of New York, died yesterday at Manhattan Veterans Hospital, First Avenue and 24th Street. He was 76 years old and lived at 888 Grand Concourse, the Bronx.

title: CITY SPURNS A BID FOR BONDS, CITING CRUSHING COSTS
description: Citing the unconscionable cost of borrowing and asserting that near panic exists in the money market, City Controller Harrison J. Goldin yesterday rejected the sole bid on a sale of city bonds.

title: Lottery Numbers
description: The winning New York daily lottery number yesterday was: 473993

title: Wedding Leave for InmateMurderer Delayed
description: LEESBURG, July 9  A prisoner under a murder sentence who was to be the first inmate in the state to be granted a leave of absence to get married learned today that he would have to wait while the State Department of Institutions and Agencies studied the legality of the leave.

title: TV: An Absorbing Puerto Rican Drama on WNBC
description: Something odd has happened to local television programing involving minorities. A couple of years ago, public television, specifically Channel 13, could claim a virtual monopoly in the area. But public TV is now caught between tight budgets and campaigns for subscriber donations. Black and Puerto Rican audiences, generally on the lower end of the economic scale, make notoriously poor subscribers. So Black Journal has been cut back severely. Soul! was reduced to an occasional special. And Realidades is no more.

title: PRES1DENTTOOPEN INFLATION TALKS
description: WASHINGTON, July 9President Nixon will meet with a group of leading businessmen and economists on Thursday to open what the White House said today would be a national dialogue on ways to curb inflation.

title: Naval Academy Expels 7 for Cheating
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., July 9Seven United States Naval Academy midshipmen have been expelled for cheating, and 13 have been placed on probation as the result of a scandal that began seven weeks ago with the leaking of questions on a final examination.

title: Books of The Times A Jewishness So Unfamiliar
description: OUR SOUTHERN LANDSMAN. By Harry Golden. 241 pages. G. P. Putnam's Sons. $7.95.

title: SPACE CREWS HAIL U.S.SOVIET FLIGHT
description: ZVEZDY GORODOK, U.S.S.R., July 9  The American astronauts of the joint ApolloSoyuz, mission, winding up three weeks of training with Soviet astronauts here, reported today that the crews were progressing well togetherand even working in each other's languagesince their first meeting a year ago. But the American astronauts, like their Soviet colleagues, stressed that more needed to be accomplished before their final rendezvous in space next July.

title: Cubs Harris Disabled
description: CHICAGO, July 9 (AP)Vic Harris, Chicago Cubs second baseman injured in Sunday's game against the Atlanta Braves, was placed on the 15day disabled list yesterday. Harris sustained sprained ligaments in his left knee when Darrell Evans of Atlanta slid into him.

title: MORRIS I. CHARLAP, COMPOSER, 45, DIES
description: Morris I. Charlap, the composer who wrote the music for. Mary Martin's television version of Barrie's Peter Pan in 1953, died Monday in Lenox Hill Hospital. He was 45 years old and lived at 4 East 62d Street.

title: Radio
description: 67 A.M., WNYCFM. Poet and Peasant Overture, Suppe; Concerto for Three Pianos, Mozart; Don Quixote Watching Over His Arms, Espla.

title: Highly Dangerous Balkan Smoke
description: PARISPresident Tito of Yugoslavia is now in Bucharest conferring with Nicolae Ceausescu, his Rumanian colleague, and althoughas neighbors, unorthodox Communists, and highly independentminded leadersthey are always interested in each other, this time they have more than usual to discuss. The main burden of their colloquy: What to do in a time of troubles?

title: Dupont Glore Has a Lean Time
description: DuPont Gore Forgan, Inc., the lingering shadow of H. Ross Perot's shortlived venture on Wall Street, is likely to button up and go away if it doesn't get some business soon, Morton H. Myerson, chairman and chief executive, said in an interview yesterday.

title: CITICORP DELAYS FLOATING ISSUE
description: An offering by Citicorp of $850million in a controversial and novel type of security, scheduled for sale today, has been postponed, banking sources said yesterday.

title: HUSKY TO OPERATE THE HOMESTAKE CO.
description: CODY, Wyo., July 9 (AP)Husky Oil, Ltd., has been appointed by a Federal court to operate the California properties of the troubled HomeStake Production Company, Husky's president, James E. Nielson, announced today.

title: Why Not Make Up Your Own Game?
description: Children who enjoy such games as Monopoly and tiddlywinks, but wish they could devise their own board games too, will have their chance soon.

title: HAROLD O. BURDICK
description: ALFRED, N. Y., July 9 (AP)Harold Ormond Burdick, whose hormone research played an important role in birth control for humans, and who was retired chairman of the biology department at Alfred University died last night at his home. He was 77 years old.

title: Veterans Demand to See Nixon; 4 Arrested at Capital Monument
description: WASHINGTON, July 9 (AP) Protesters seeking a meeting with President Nixon to discuss veterans affairs locked themselves in a White House rest room and the Washington Monument today.

title: Pakistani Border Area Relives Violent History
description: PESHAWAR, Pakistan, July 4The authorities in this provincial capital declare that its security is completely normal and that everything is under control despite the series of bomb explosions set off in the last few months.

title: Notes on People
description: A Federal judge yesterday refused to suspend the threeyear sentence of Judge Otto Kerner, a former Governor on Illinois, and Theodore Isaacs, his former revenue director, for bribery, mail fraud and incometax evasion.

title: Franco, 81, Is Hospitalized for Treatment of Phlebitis
description: MADRID, July 9The Spanish Government announced today that Generalissimo Francisco Franco had been hospitalized for treatment of phlebitis in his right leg.

title: Racial Balance Ordered
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 9 (AP)  The Pennsylvania Human Relations Commission ordered today the desegregation of elementary schools in the Norristown area by the opening of school in the fall of 19Th.

title: The Justices Comments: Few Clues
description: WASHINGTON, July 9 Every lawyer or reporter exposed to the Supreme Court for the first time gets the same sage counsel: Anyone who tries to predict the outcome of a case by interpreting the Justices questions and comments from the bench does so at his Own peril set of questions indicating doubt about the basic White House position, then indicated sympathy with the President on another issue.

title: Body of U.S. Aide Is Believed Found In North Mexico
description: MEXICO CITY, July 9A mutilated body found in the desert near the northwestern city of Hermosillo has been tentatively identified as that of a United States vice consul, John S. Patterson, who disappeared, apparently kidnapped, in March.

title: PRESSURE GROWS IN MONEY MARKET
description: The already demoralized money market received some new blows yesterday. The supply of credit tightened, interest rates reached skyward and dealers were forced to operate well beyond the perimeters of their Credit experience. First, Marcis the market was shocked when New York City refused to pay a record 7.923 per cent to borrow $438million through a bond issue.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and index, Page 38

title: APPEAL NULLIFIES DETENTION LIMIT
description: An appeals court has overturned a Federal judge's order that was designed to release defendants from jail without bail unless they received speedy trials In State Supreme Court in Brooklyn.

title: Firm Lacks Business
description: The chairman of duPont Glore Forgan, Inc., which was H. Ross Perot's shortlived venture on Wall Street, may button up and go away if it doesn't get some business soon. Details on Page 54.

title: Eximbank to Use a Range Of Rates From 7 to 8%
description: WASHINGTON, July 9The ExportImport Bank will begin using a range of interest rates on its loans running from 7 to 8 per cent, its chairman, William J. Casey, announced today.

title: Mitchell, Parkinson Ask Supreme Court To Disqualify Sirica
description: WASHINGTON, July 9 (AP) Two defendants in the Watergate coverup trial asked, the Supreme Court today to disqualify United States District, Judge John J. Sirica from presiding.

title: Customs Cracks Down on Looted Art
description: Armed with new paper weapons and fired by increased public concern over the pillage of ancient sites throughout the world, the United States Customs Service is beginning an intensified crackdown on the smuggling of plundered art and artifacts into this country.

title: Team Tennis Not Virginia's Cup of Tea
description: UNIONDALE, L.I., July 9  Yes, Virginia, there is World Team Tennis. And yes, Virginia Wade, as the newest member of the New York Sets, the crowd is allowed to hoot, holler and yell as they did tonight when you dropped your Nassau Coliseum singles debut, 63, to Mrs. Nancy Gunter of the Cleveland Nets.

title: Nassau Bus Slowdown Ended
description: MINEOLA, L. I., July 9An agreement was reached today to end a work slowdown by Nassau County bus drivers that had forced 65,000 riders to find transportation alternatives since yesterday afternoon.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Committee on the peaceful uses of space10:30 A.M. and 3 P.M.

title: Dockers Here Win Guaranteed Salary Of $16,640 a Year
description: Labor and management in the port's, longshore industry reached agreement yesterday on a new threeyear contract, which includes a guaranteed annual income of $16,640 in, the pact's final year.

title: FOREIGN SECURITIES
description: AUTHORITY BONDS

title: FASHION TALK
description: Never mind about hemlines and other trendy matters. George Stavropoulos concentrates on clothes, especially evening clothes, of everlasting allure. Which means an emphasis on chiffon, with layers on layers for the skirt and a plethora of capelets, scarves and panels to wrap snugly or to float freely, setting up a constant commotion as the wearer moves.

title: PRESIDENT TOOPEN INFLATION TALKS
description: WASHINGTON, July 9President Nixon will meet with a group of leading businessmen and economists on Thursday to open what the White House said today would be a national dialogue on ways to curb inflation.

title: Grand Canyon Raid
description: The tiny tribe of Havasupai Indians has a reservation In a side canyon of Grand Canyon. The tribefewer than 300 persons live on this reservationprincipally makes a living by guiding tourists on muleback to see the spectacular waterfalls in its canyon.

title: A Second Injunction Is Issued As Baltimore Strikes Continue
description: BALTIMORE, July 9City garbage collectors continued wildcat strike today for the ninth day as a circuit court judge granted an injunction against workers in three other sections of their union who walked off the job in sympathy yesterday. Some 3,000 city workers are now on strike.

title: Dr. Arnold Zurcher Dies at 71; Led Sloan Foundation 23 Years
description: Dr. Arnold John Zurcher, professor emeritus of political science at New York University and executive director of the Sloan Foundation from 1945 to 1968, died yesterday, apparently of a heart attack. He was stricken while swimming in Long Island Sound off New Rochelle, N.Y.

title: Housing the City's Poor
description: The struggling parents of New York City's liberals lived in tenements at rents they could afford and were linked to a social and cultural neighborhood network. As they worked their way up, they had no fear of losing their homes to the government bulldozer.

title: Bridges Jam, Roads Buckle and Clothing Is Shed as Heat Soars
description: Drawbridges jammed, highways buckled and utilities fought to meet power demands as a hot, humid blanket of air smothered the entire East Coast with 90degree temperatures for the third straight day yesterday.

title: Lon Nol Easing His Terms For Talks With Insurgents
description: No Contact With Rebels Premier Discusses Offer Sihanouk Rejects Talks U.S. Welcomes Proposal

title: Earl Warren, 83, Who Led High Court In Time of Vast Social Change, Is Dead
description: WASHINGTON, July 9Earl Warren, who as Chief Justice of the United States presided over extraordinary constitutional change, died tonight at Georgetown University Hospital. He was 83 years old.

title: Market Place. In. Variables Many GL Cerro Bid
description: The offer by the GL Corporationa private investment companyto buy up to 1.5 million shares of the Cerro Corporation presents the Cerro holder with a classic dilemma in today's depressed stock market. That is, the shares have been much higher than the tender price of 19 in recent years, but this is well above what Cerro shares commanded before the tender was announced.

title: People and Business
description: Gov, Milton J. Shapp of Pennsylvania, in a statement issued in Harrisburg, Pa. yesterday, said that there was absolutely no danger of an immediate liquidation of the Penn Central Railroad as a result of a recent ruling by Judge John P. Fullam of the Federal District Court in Philadelphia that the Penn Central should not be reorganized under terms of the Regional Rail Reorganization Act of 1973.

title: Japan's Vote Continues Decline of Conservatives
description: TOKYO, July 9The setback suffered by the governing LiberalDemocratic party in Sunday's upper house election continues a trend of well over a decade in which the conservatives have steadily lost popularity but still hung on to their control of the Government.

title: Progress Is Reported in Sharing of Oil
description: BRUSSELS, July 9The 12member energy coordination group, made up of major oilconsuming nations, reported substantial progress during meetings in Brussels yesterday and today toward working out the details of an emergency oilsharing system.

title: GIBSONIS DELAYING TAXPLAN SUPPORT
description: NEWARK, July 9 Mayor Kenneth A. Gibson has asked for clarification of parts of Governor Byrne's taxreform program before he gives his longawaited public endorsement.

title: Italian Financier Said to Make Concessions for $100Million Loan
description: ROME, July 9Michele Sindona, the Italian financier, appears to have yielded decisionmaking power in his international empire of banks, holding companies and other interests as a price for obtaining a $100million loan.

title: PLAN TO REFORM JAIL IS SUBMITTED
description: A counsel appointed by a Federal District Court has submitted proposals for reform of the Dutchess County Jail that are aimed at restoring jailers control over prisoners and enhancing chances of rehabilitating the inmates.

title: State Broadens Program To Check Water Pollution
description: TRENTON, July 10The State Environmental Protection Commissioner today announced an expanded priority list of facilities to control water pollution in New Jersey that will more than double the number of sewagedisposal projects eligible for Federal financial aid during this fiscal year.

title: St. Clair Denies Knowing If Nixon Would Defy Court
description: WASHINGTON, July 9 President Nixon's chief defense lawyer, James D. St. Clair, said today that he did not know whether the President would obey a Supreme Court order to turn over subpoenaed White House tapes.

title: Poland Greets Cup Team
description: WARSAW, July 9 (UPI)Poland gave a hero's welcome today to her national soccer team, which finished in third place in the World Cup tourney. Thousands of fans waving the national flags lined the streets from the airport to the hotel, cheering the team bus as it passed.

title: U.S.toEurope Air Fares To Rise 5th Time This Year
description: International airlines tentatively approved yesterday the fifth ??? in United States??? fares of the year but cushioned effects on some travelers by voting a new early bird discount plan for those who buy tickets at least 60 days before a trip.

title: Sports Today
description: Mats vs. San Diego Padres, at Shea Stadium, Roosevelt Avenue and 126th Street, Flushing Meadow, Queens, 2:15 P.M. (Radio  WHN, 2:15 P.M.)

title: CITY SPURNS A BID FOR BONDS, CITING CRUSHING COSTS
description: Citing the unconscionable cost of borrowing and asserting that near panic exists in the money market, City Controller Harrison J. Goldin yesterday rejected the sole bid on a sale of city bonds.

title: Met Rally Fails in 54 Loss
description: After the New York Mets lost to San Diego, 5.4, before a crowd of 19,264 at Shea Stadium last night Yogi Berra had this to say:

description: Quotations aupplied throught NASDAQ as of 3:30 P.M. Quotes do not include retall markup, markdown or commlsslons. Volume represents shores that changed ownershipduring the day. title: CHENAULT INDICTEDIN MRS. KING SLAYING
description: ATLANTA, July 9 (AP)Fulton County grand jury indicted Marcus Wayne Chenault today on two counts of murder and one of aggravated assault in the June 30 shooting at Ebenezer  Baptist church in which Mrs. Martin Luther King Sr. was killed.

title: Aqueduct Race Charts
description: Roosevelt Raceway Results Aqueduct Entries Tonight's Entries at Roosevelt

title: Peacemaker Shot In Attempt to Halt Clash in Brooklyn
description: Next time I'll probably stop and think twice, Raul Cubero told a visitor yesterday as he sat in a wheelchair in the intensivecare unit of Brooklyn Hospital, where he is recuperating from a gunshot wound in the stomach. I guess you learn from experience.

title: J.P.Morgan & Co. Raises Profit 22
description: J. P. Morgan & Co. Inc., the holding company that owns the Morgan Guaranty Trust Company, the nation's fifthlargest bank, said yesterday that its net operating earnings for the second quarter rose 22 per cent from the equivalent period last year.

title: NATO Sharply Criticizes Dutch Plan to Cut Forces
description: LONDON, July 9The council of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization sharply criticized the Netherlands today for planning to cut its armed forces by 20,000 men. A communiqu said the move would weaken NATO and impose extra burdens on other member countries.

title: U.J.A., Federation Merge to Improve Campaign Efforts
description: New York City's two major Jewish philanthropic agencies have merged in an effort to increase the effectiveness of their fundraising.

title: How Does Family of 5 Manage on $16,600? It Gets Help and Pinches Pennies
description: Keeping up with the Joneses used to be a popular American obsession, but as inflation eats away at everyone's standard of living, the Joneses seem to be asking, How does anyone whose income is less than ours manage, when we can't manage on ours?

title: Rodino Says Nixon Inquiry Cannot Meet Its Deadline
description: WASHINGTON, July 9The House Judiciary Committee, plodding through apparently inconclusive questioning of witnesses at closed hearings, will be unable to meet its tentative deadline for completing the impeachment inquiry, the committee chairman said today.

title: JUSTICE THOMAS RYAN
description: BUFFALO, July 9 (AP)Justice Thomas J. Ryan of the State Supreme Court, presiding justice of the Eighth Judicial District, died today at his home. He was 55 years old.

title: U.S. MAY REOPEN CANADIAN ISSUES
description: WASHINGTON, July 9Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau's election victory was described here today as likely to raise Washington's expectations for resolution of some old issues between Canada and the United States.

title: Burns, on a 214, Takes Ike Golf; Bostwick Is 2d
description: EAST WILLISTON, LI., July 9  George Burns of Port Washington, L.I., has done gust about everything an amateur golfer can do in the New York metropolitan area. When he took the 22d annual Ike tournament by a twostroke margin at Wheatley Hills Golf Club today, he won his fifth major amateur tournament in the area.

title: 3 GET LIFE TERMS IN HANAFI DEATHS
description: WASHINGTON, July 9  A Superior Court judge today sentenced three Black Muslims to life sentences totaling a minimum of 140 years in prison for each man.

title: TORNADO DANGER SPURS FUNDS BID
description: Estimating that as many as 1,000 schoolchildren might have been killed if the severe tornado outbreak of April and 4 had struck Xenia, Ohio, during school hours, United States weather officials have requested extra spending this year on tornado warning systems.

title: Business Briefs
description: SANTO DOMINGO, Dominican Republic, July 9 (UPI)The Dominican Government's negotiations to obtain higher revenues from the Aluminum Company of America on its bauxite exports here have broken down, Government officials said today. They hinted that the Government could decide to follow neighboring Jamaica, which unilaterally increased her royalties 500 per cent. The country is also seeking alumina production facilities. Aluminum is made from alumina, which is made from bauxite.

title: Las Vegas Wary Of W.F.L. Games
description: Las Vegas bookmakers are taking a cautious approach to the new World Football League.

title: 10 Players Picket Jets Camp, Voice Complaints
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I., July 9The Jets welcomed their rookies into camp today, the coaches from their airconditioned rooms and the striking players from their sunstruck picket line.
