I., no one noticed anything amiss. It was a hot day and the six other children who had been in the pool were exhausted too.

title: Dirty Water Due in Brooklyn
description: Brooklyn Heights residents will be experiencing low water pressure and cloudy water for two to three days because of a crack in a 66inch water main that forced the shutdown of the entire main, the city's Environmental Protection Administration reported yesterday. A spokesman said: The water will be perfectly healthy and safe to drink, although it will be dirty.

title: Celanese Consent Decree
description: WASHINGTON, July 18The Celanese Corporation consented today to be enjoined from further violation of Federal securities laws after the Securities and Exchange Commission charged the company with selective disclosure of material nonpublic information concerning its operations.

title: Analyses of 7 Phone Tap Reports
description: WASHINGTON, July 18Following are the texts of seven analyses by the House Judiciary Committee of raw reports, prepared by the Federal Bureau of Investigation and sent to the White House, of telephone conversations of Government officials and newsmen that were intercepted between May, 1969, and February, 1971.

title: About the Yankees
description: Elliott Maddox, the center fielder, dropped out of the top 10 batters in the American League when he missed four games and most of the fifth after dislocating a finger. It wasn't his average that kept him out, but the number times at bat, which fell below the 200 minimum, Back the lineup Wednesday, he went 0 for 4 and dropped 318, but his 201 times at bat got him hack on the list, seventh place,... Bobby Murcer had hit safely in 13 his last 15 games before last night, with 23 hits in 62 times at bat and 17 runs hatted in. But he had not hit a homer at Shea.... Yankees praising (and keeping an eye on) hottest pitching prospect on their farm teams: Greg Diehl of New YorkPenn League, who is 50 with an earnedrun average of 0.21, including a perfect game. Wednesday night the 21yearold Delaware gradulatc hurled a threehit shutout for first place Oneonta. Diehl was a 22dround choice in the.June 5 draft.

title: Spinola Swears in the New Portuguese Cabinet
description: LISBON, Portugal July 18 (AP)President Antonio de Spinola swore in Portugal's new Cabinet today and called upon the Portuguese people to discipline themselves and to respect the new Government.

title: Hart Leads 4 Passers in Giant Camp
description: FAIRFIELD, Conn., July 18 If the players strike is not settled by next week, Coach Bill Arnsparger said today that rookies and free agents would dominate the New York Giants lineup for their exhibition opener Aug. 3 at Houston.

title: Kissinger Affidavit Cited White House Concern on Leaks of Sensitive Information
description: WASHINGTON, July 18Following is the text of an affidavit given by Secretary of State Kissinger on behalf of the President in the lawsuit growing out of the burglary of the office of Dr. Daniel Ellsberg's former psychiatrist.

title: MANHUNT UNDERWAY FOR MAKARIOS AIDES The following is a pooled dispatch from news agency correspondents in Cyprus.
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, July 18 (UPI)Greek Cypriote troops have launched a manhunt for principal supporters of the ousted President, Archbishop Makarios, since seizing control of the government.

title: Makarios Here to Ask for U.N. Action
description: Archbishop Makarios arrived here from London yesterday and said he wanted the United Nations to condemn the coup in Cypruswhich he called violation of the independence of Cyprus by the Greek Junta, and to ask that Greek officers be withdrawn from the island.

title: Commodity Price Index Up 11 From Week Ago Level
Life in'Totally Planned Town: Some Are at Peace Others Just Bored
description: IRVINE, Calif,More than a decade has now passed since it was proposed that a model city be built on the 83,000acre Irvine Ranch, the largest tract of undeveloped urban real estate in the country.

title: A Diver Is Trapped 50 Feet Under Water At Navy Yard Here
description: Police and Fire Department marine units continued trying last night to rescue a commercial diver who had been trapped since 2:30 P.M? in a pump room at least 50 feet underwater at the Brooklyn Navy Yard. The police said he had been trapped with only an hour's supply of oxygen in his tank.

title: Advertising: Checkout Changes
description: Before this year winds down you'll be noticing more and more product packages with small patches of black and white bars. No larger than postage stamps, they will be the first manifestation of a revolution that will be felt throughout marketing. But the first strong impact will be in the neighborhood supermarket.

title: 900 Contribute to Intrepid's Campaign
description: NEWPORT, R. I., July 18 United States participation in the America's Cup competitiOn since its beginning in 1851 has almost always been a venture of the New York Yacht Club's wealthy syndicates from the Eastern establishment. This year for the first time there is a populist yacht, Intrepid, from the West Coast whose 8750,000 in campaign costs have so far come from 900 different contributors, all of them enthusiastic fanS.

title: Kissinger and 3 Senators See Gain on Soviet Jews
description: WASHINGTON, July 18Secretary of State Kissinger and Senator Henry M. Jackson agreed today that they had made, progress toward a for, mula for expediting Jewish emigration from the Soviet Union and Congressional passage of trade benefits to Moscow.

title: ExPoliceman, 103, Dies
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., July 18John W. Frazer, who joined the New York City police department as a mounted patrolman in 1899, died yesterday in a nursing home here. He was 103 years old.

title: President's Attorney James Draper St. Clair
description: WASHINGTON, July 18I don't represent Mr. Nixon personally; I represent him in his capacity as President, James Draper St. Clair said in an interview two months after he became Man Mr. Nixon's attorney. in the This classical News lawyer's detachment parallels what has been a principal theme in his client's own defense; Mr. Nixon has said that he is fighting to preserve not himself but the Presidency. Mr. St. Clair has said he does not represent Mr. Nixon individually but rather the office of the Presidency. But he has made it clear that, as long as he is Mr. Nixon's counsel, he is committed to him entirely. I only reflect the President's he has said.

title: Off Course on Cyprus
description: Against the strong recommendations of experts in his own department and elsewhere, Secretary of State Kissinger has evidently set the United. States on a Cyprus course that carries maximum danger for everyone concernedincluding the United States.

title: Panel in Senate Warns Of Gasoline Shortage
description: WASHINGTON, July 18 (AP)Motorists may face a per cent gasoline shortage by winter unless they continue fuel conservation efforts, according to a report prepared for the Senate Interior Cominittee.

title: DrugInformer System Brings Only 1 Reward
description: Ten months ago, the State Division of Criminal Justice. Services set up a tollfree telephone number and offered a $1,000 reward to anyone who turned in a drug pusher.

title: Head of Precinct and 10 Shifted After Inquiry
description: The commanding officer, three lieutenants and seven sergeants have been transferred out of the 10th Precinct in Manhattan, following a Police Department investigation that found laxness, several incidents of cooping [sleeping on the job] and poor supervision, the department's public information office said last night.

title: Red Smith
description: As Knute Rockne told it when he coached football at Notre Dame, he had played soccer in Chicago as a youth and had come to respect this hardrunning game as a swift route to physical fitness. For the first few days of fall practice, he decided, he would have the athletes play soccer to work off the summer's flab.

title: Panel Raises Indian Budget
description: WASHINGTON, July 18 (UPI) The House Appropriations Committee increased the Interior Department's budget today by nearly $19million dollars, mostly for improved Indian health and education. The total budget for Interior and its related agencies, as approved by the committee, came to 83.1billion.

title: With Their Sand cleared Oil, Suffolk Beaches are Reopening.
description: The Coast Guard reported yesterday that all public and private beaches along a 27mile stretch of Suffolk County on Long Island Sound had been cleared of oil and were reopening for Swimming.

title: Peace at the Center
description: WASHINGTON, July 18Over the last few months not only President Nixon's supporters but his critics have expressed admiration for his endurance, and wondered how he was able to keep going in the face of the evidence against his Administration.

title: Film: NayakThe Hero
JOHN MEYER DIES; LED APPAREL FIRM;Women's Wear Leader Had Aided Jewish Appeal
description: John H. Meyer, founder of the women's apparel manufacturing concern John Meyer of Norwich, died Wednesday evening after a long illness. He was 50 years old and lived in Norwich, Conn.

title: Makarios Here to Ask for U.N. Action

description: WASHINGTON, July 18Documents released today by the House Judiciary Committee contradict President Nixon's declaration that ambassadorships have not been for sale in his Administration

title: Sanitationmen and Firemen Get Details of Labor Pact
description: As sanitationmen reported to their garages yesterday, shop stewards from their union gave briefings on the proposed labor contract that will bring their base pay to $16,500 by next July 1.

title: Turkey Extending Territorial Waters In Disputed Area
description: ANKARA, Turkey, July 18 (Reuters)Turkey today extended her territorial waters in the disputed Aegean Sea over a large area where Greece claims sovereignty.

title: GREECE, PRESSED, PLANS TO REPLACE CYPRUS OFFICERS
description: LONDON, July 18 Greece made a concession in the Cyprus crisis today by agreeing to replace the 650 Greek officers in the Cypriote National Guard,

title: Army Seizes Ethiopia's Second City
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, July 18 (AP)The Ethiopian Army has taken control of Asmara, the country's second largest city, and arrested the Mayor and the Governor of Eritrea Province, the Asmara radio reports.

title: STOCKS ON AMEX SHOW ADVANCE
Joan Phipps Scores in Debut
description: A 19yearold jockey captivated a good part of the crowd of 20,512 at Aqueduct yesterday. Joan Phipps, who had ridden to more than hundred victories in Canada, guided Dr. Leon Star's Chick n Lou to first place in a sixfurlong sprint, at a return of $24.20 for $2. Winning on a horse at 11.1 is gratifying, though not exceptionally unusual. But to Miss Phipps, the occasion was monumental, inasmuch as the race was her first in New York. This is the happiest moment of my life, said the 105pound rider, who will be 20 years old on Aug. 24.

title: Gainesville 8 Group Freed of Contempt As Ruling Is Upset
description: NEW ORLEANS, July 18 (AP)The United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit reversed yesterday the contempt of court conviction of seven persons in connection with the Gainesville eight trial.

title: 12% DROP SHOWN IN GROSS PRODUCT; INFLATION AT 8.8%
description: WASHINGTON, July 18The nation's total output of goods and services declined somewhat further in the second quarter but the rate of inflation diminished, Commerce Department figures indicated today.

title: Gen. Raymond Moses, 82; U.S. Aide With Montgomery
description: WOLFEBORO, N.H., July 17 (AP)Raymond G. Moses, a retired brigadier general who represented the United States on the staff of Field Marshal Bernard L. Montgomery in England in World War II, died Tuesday. He was 82 years old.

title: archy deplores a study of roaches
description: Don Marquis's archy, the literary cockroach who was too small to make covital letters on his typewriter, just passed through here. After he left, someone found the following letter about the Government's decision yesterday to spend $94,956 to investigate why the indoor cockroach was breeding less and why the outdoor cokroctch was moving inside:

title: Notes on People
description: Chaim Leib Pekeris, a specialist at the Weizmann Institute in Israel on the earth's vibrations during seismological disturbances, has been awarded this year's Vetlesen Prize. The award, known as the Nobel prize of the earth sciences, is worth $25,000.

title: Vision in Jersey
description: It is a sad commentary on the state of politics and social responsibility in New Jersey that the narrow victory in the State Assembly for Governor Byrne's income tax bill could be described by the Governor as an impressive demonstration of individual courage and vision.

title: WHEAT AND CORN CLIMB BY LIMIT
description: Hot dry weather over the Midwest growing areas and little prospect for rain acted to drive grain and soybean prices sharply higher yesterday. On the Chicago Board of Trade wheat, corn and soybeans jumped the daily permissible limits in futures trading.

title: Farm Bureau Head Says Baer's Visit Was Unannounced
description: TRENTON, July 18 (UPI)Commenting on an attack that left Assemblyman Byron M. Baer with a broken arm, the New Jersey Farm Bureau said today that farm visitors should conduct themselves in a manner which would not precipitate such actions.

title: IRVING LEMOV
description: Irving Lemov, a lawyer here 45 years and a founder of the Fusion party that backed Fiorello H. La Guardia for Mayor, died, of cancer yesterday at University Hospital. He was 73 years old and lived at 2143 77th Street, Jackson HeightS, Queens.

title: Prospects for Nearby Fishing
description: There are plenty of bluefish waiting to he captured along the coast from New Jersey to the waters off Rhode Island. The owner of Ruschmeyer's at. Montauk describes the quantities as being in the tons. Bottom fishing remains good in the Sandy Hook and Fire Island regions, but striped bass fishing is mostly spotty.

title: Toward Clearing Up Confusion Over Fragrances
description: A group of perfume experts gathered Wednesday to try to make life a little easier for consumers. They defined toilet water and cologne (toilet water is stronger). They discussed the confusion caused by the various names and strengths of both toilet waters and colognes. And; in the end, they agreed that nothing would ever replace the nose.

title: About New York
description: Harrison J. Goldin struck quietly this week, and Mayor Beame, who was suffering from bronchitis, anyway, fell suffering even more, Mr. Goldin, the Controller, had hit him in the pride, and this was the hardest thing of all. I know Abe, a friend said, and I know that this wounds his heart.

description: While representatives of about 600 of 856 office skyscrapers met yesterday's deadline for filing plans for dealing with fires, one major building owner charged that the law was unconstitutional and that it was making buildings more unsafe, with liability thrust upon operators.

title: City Lists Ousters in Medicaid Cases
description: The Health Department released yesterday the names of 32 physicians, dentists, podiatrists, chiropractors, pharmacists and optometrists it had suspended permanently from treating Medicaid patients because of abuses ranging from fraud to poor care. The list covers the period from 1971 to the present.

description: LONDON, July 18 (AP)Track and field officials gave preliminary approval today for athletes from mainland China to participate in the Asian Games.

Prospects for Nearby Fishing

The owner of Ruschmeyer's at Montauk describes the quantities as being in the tons. Bottom fishing remains good in the Sandy Hook and Fire Island regions, but striped bass fishing is mostly spotty.

title: WHITE PLAINS MAYOR RESIGNS FROM POST
description: WHITE PLAINS, July 18 (AP)Mayor Carl J. Delfino, ailing from a stroke, has resigned as mayor of this suburban city, paving the way for special mayoral election in November.

title: Podgorny Sees Cyprus Coup Backed by Some in NATO,
description: MOSCOW, July 18 (Reuters)President Nikolai V. Podgorny today lent his weight. to charges in the Soviet prest that some NATO circles had backed the coup in Cyprus on Monday.

title: Justice Agency to Get House Data on Immigration Corruption
description: WASHINGTON, July 18Representative William J. Randall, Democrat of Missouri, said today that the Government Operations subcommittee he heads had voted to turn over to the Justice Department all the evidence it had assembled on allegations of corruption in the Immigration and Naturalization Service.

title: Saigon Reports Its Positions Hit By Heavy Shelling
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Friday, July 19 (Reuters)Com munist gunners fired thousands of rounds of artillery and rocket fire into Government) positions in South Vietnam's northern and central provinces, while a ground attack penetrated at least one Government outpost in the Central Highlands yesterday, the Saigon command said today.

title: Rules Panel Moves to Televise Debate
description: WASHINGTON, July 18The House Rules Committee took the first step today toward opening the final sessions of the House Judiciary Committee's impeachment inquiry to live television and radio coverage.

title: Nixon Pledges Victory In a Call to 1,500 at Rally
description: WASHINGTON, July 18More than 1,500 of President. Nixon's most ardent supporters gave an enthusiastic demonstration of their confidence in him and his Administration tonight.

title: Addict Convicted of RapeS Is Facing 25 Years in Jail
description: A Bronx Supreme Court jury has convicted an admitted'heroin addict on rape, robbery and sodomy charges for having terrorized three women in a Hunts Point apartment.

title: 45 Brooklyn Prisoners Protest Presence of Guard
description: Fortyfive prisoners at the Brooklyn House of Detention for Men took part in a 15minute demonstration yesterday afternoon to protest the assignment of a correction officer to their eighthfloor cellblock. Earlier, theyhad circulated a petition calling forthe dismissal of the guard, whom they kranded as racist,

title: MAX GOODMAN
description: Max Goodman, a retired organizer for the Millinery Work. ers Union, died Wednesday in the DeWitt Nursing Home. He was 86 years old.

title: DR. JAMES S. EDLIN, TB EXPERT, WAS 85
description: Dr. James S. Edlin, a pioneer in the treatment of pulmonary tuberculosis, died Sunday at his home, 120 East Hartsdale Avenue, Hartsdale, N.Y. He was 85 years old.

title: CHARLES T. M'QUEENEY
description: NEW HAVEN, July 18 (AP)Charles T. McQueeney, retired managing editor of The New Haven Register, died yesterday at the YaleNew Haven Hospital. He was 64 years old and lived in North Haven.

title: Simon Says U.S.Set LongTerm Accord For Aid of Israel
description: TEL AVIV, July 18Secretary of the Treasury William E. Simon said today the United States and Israel planned to sign an ongoing longterm, economic assistance agreement in November.

title: Murchison Is Said to Link Nixon to Role in Donation
description: WASHINGTON, July 18 Clint W. Murchison Jr., the Dallas oilman, has told Watergate investigators that at President Nixon's personal suggestion he delivered $5,000 in cash to Mr. Nixon's secretary, Rose Mary Woods, as a campaign donation in 1968.

title: Bridge Spingold Upsets Start Early At Summer Nationals Here
description: The Spingold upsets began early this year at the American Contract Bridge League's summer nationals at the Americana Hotel here.

title: Supercontinent Jigsaw: Last Piece Is Reported
description: Drilling deep into the floor of the South Atlantic has revealed a former continental area that, like legendary Atlantis, has sunk some two miles beneath the sea.

title: LAWYER IN SEOUL HELD AFTER TRIAL
description: SEOUL, South Korea, July 18 A prominent South Korean lawyer who defended the na:. tion's leading poet and 10 students in political trials last week has been arrested, associates disclosed today.

title: OffDuly Officer Shot Slaying Holdup Man
description: A suspected holdup man was shot and killed last night by an offduty detective who was critically wounded in a shootout in a beauty shop in St. Albans section of Queens, the police reported.

title: Contract Awards
description: The Rockwell International Corporation B1 division received a $206.4million addition to a previously awarded Air Force contract for the B1 strategic bomber. The addition is because of schedule delays and technical changes in the company's research and development effort in connection with the bomber.

title: State to Sue on Harassment of Tenants
description: State Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz said yesterday that he would seek an injunction next Thursday to stop what he called continued harassment of tenants of the Brewster Hotel, at 21 West 86th Street.

title: Metal Concerns Gain
description: Two of the world's leading metal companiesthe Alumi. num Company of America and the International Nickel Company of Canadareported yes. terday new highs in sales and earnings for the first half and second quarter.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Tocks Island Fund Stripped From Bill

title: Seaboard and Burlington List Sharp Earnings Gains
description: Two of the biggest railroad holding companies, Burlington Northern, Inc., and Seaboard Coast Line Industries, reported sharply higher earnings yesterday for the second quarter.

title: Etchells22 Race Won By Piana
SUMMATION MADE IN BRASCO TRIAL
description: Corruption and credibility were the crucial issues in the summations yesterday by the defense and the prosecution at the trial of Representative Frank J. Brasco in Federal District Court here.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: July 19, 1974 SECURITY COUNCIL

title: Leonard W. Cronkhite Sr., An Early Rhodes Scholar
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., July 18 (AP)Leonard Wolsey Cronkhite Sr., one of the first American recipients of a Rhodes Scholarship, died Tuesday. He was 92 years old and lived here.

title: CAPITAL SPENDING REDUCED BY I. T.T
description: The International Telephone and Telegraph Company has reduced its 1974 capital spending plans by $106million, citing the unavailability of certain materials and the high cost of money.

title: Site of Ancient Merot Is Uncovered in Israel
description: JERUSALEM, July 18, (AP) American archaeologists near the noththern town of Safad have uncovered the Jewish city of Merot, which flourished in the first century, archaeological officials here announced today,

title: Amax Raises Base Prices For Its HighGrade Zinc
description: Amax, Inc., announced yesterday a 2centapound increase in its base price for special highgrade zinc, used mostly for die castings and in automobile parts. The new base is 39 cents f.o.b. the company's Sauget, Ill., plant.

title: Russiah Crew Ready to Return to Earth
description: MOSCOW, Rriday, July 19Two Soviet astronauts who havespent the last two weeks aboard the space station Salyut 3 tested their craft today for their return to earth, concluding a Soviet rehearsal for next year's docking of a Russian Soyuz with an American Apollo space vehicle.

title: SOVIET DISPUTES U.S. OVER BALTIC SAILOR
description: MOSCOW, July 18 (AP) Simas Kudirka, ruled a United States citizen by the State Department three years after his unsuccessful attempt to defect from a Soviet fishing trawler, is a Soviet citizen and subject to Soviet laws, a Foreign Ministry spokesman said today.

title: Emma B. Efurok, Pianist; Was Widow of Impresario
description: Emma Borlsovna Hurok, widow of Sol Hurok, the impresario who died March 5, died yesterday at her home, 91 Central Park West. She was about 80 years old.

title: Fishbach Wins on Clay
description: GREAT NECK, L.I.  Peter Fishbach of Great Neck, seeded fourth, beat Brian Anstey of South Africa, 6.2, 61, and gained the quarterfinals of the Nassau invitation claycourt tennis tournament today at the Great Neck Tennis Center. David Oberstein of Brightwaters, L.I., and Dr. Richard Raskind of New York also advanced to the quarterfinal round. Oberstein defeated Pete Bostwick of Locust Valley, L.I., 63, 75, and Raskind eliminated Doug Russell of Westhampton, L.I., 62, 64.

title: Ceremonial Cannon Hurts
description: MONTREAL, July 18 (AP)A ceremonial cannon went off prematurely at the Man and His World fair site last night, seriously injuring two Amencans, police officials said. The Americans were identified as Robert Therington, 50 years old, of Harrisburg, Pa., and Mildred Hill, 54, of Hammond, Ind.

title: Texts of 2 Memos From Strachan to Haldeman on the 1972 Election Campaign
description: WASHINGTON, July 18 Followim are the texts of two internal Whit House memorandums by Gordon Struchan to H. R. Haldeman concerninj the 1972 election campaign. They were released today as part of the evidence of campaign practices gathered by the House impeachment inquiry staff.

title: WEEKLY CAR OUTPUT UP BUT BELOW 73'S
description: DETROIT, July 18 (UM) United States auto production climbed 3,000 units this week deSpite strikes, vacations and changeovers but still was 27.5 per cent below output during the same week last year, the trade publication Automotive News said today.

title: PURCHASE OFFER FOR ESB PLANNED
description: The International Nickel Company of Canada, Ltd., anI nounced in Toronto yesterday that it planned to make a tender offer through a subsidiary: for all of the common stock: of ESB, Inc., for an estimated out, lay of $157 mil lion. International Nickel proposes tole pay $28 a share for the stock of ESB, a company with headquarters in Philadelphia that manufactures and sells electric batteries and reJated items.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: MONTCLAIR, July 18Daniel J. Gautieri is probably the worstpaid manager and coach ever to have directed teams to 1,000 victories.

title: A Background Paper on Leonard Boudin Prepared for White House by Hunt
description: WASHINGTON, July 18 Following are the texts of a memo and a background paper prepared in the White House on Leonard B. Boudin, the lawyer who defended Dr. Daniel Ellsberg. The material was prepared by E. Howard Hunt and transmitted by John D. Ehrlichman to Charles W. Colson.

title: SwimmingPool Buyers. Tell a Hearing of Fraud
description: MOUNT HOLLY, July 18Buyers of defective backyard swimming pools described at hearing today how they had been deceived by slick salesmen,

title: A Man Facing Drug Counts Plans to Enter Sheriff Race
description: NEW BRITAIN, Conn. July 18 (AP)  A 23yearold man with drug charges still pending against him announced today his intention to seek the Democratic nomination for sheriff in Hartford County.

title: MORGAN DICKERMAN 2D
description: WILSON, N.C., July 17 (AP) Morgan Paul Dickerman 2d, associate publisher and general manager of The Wilson Daily Times, died Tuesday night after a long illness. He was 56 years old.

title: Nixon Document Defends Surveillance and Denies It Was an Impeachable Offense
description: WASHINGTON, July 18 President Nixon cited new paper leaks, secret negotiatior with foreign powers and Seen tary of State Kissinger's cot cern about United States cret ihility with its allies in effort to persuade the Hous Judiciary Committee tha White House surveillance tivities did not add up to impeachable offense.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: 20c Coin Phone Fee Asked in Jersey

title: New Group Holds Rally to Preserve Tweed Courthouse
description: The Tweed Courthouse, symbol of 19thcentury elegance to some and of 19thcentury corruption to others, was praised for both its aspects yesterday at a rally to urge the building's preservation.

title: Jumbo Jet Wing Section Falls on Sydney Homes
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Friday, July 19 (Reuters)A twelvefoot wing section of a Pan American World Airways jumbo jet broke off over Sydney this morning, smashing into homes in two suburbs.

title: New Riddle in China: The Golden Monkey
description: HONG KONG, July 18 More than usually, China is speaking in riddles these days. Among the most intriguing are, Who Silenced Golden Monkey? and Will He Stay Silenced? Golden Notes Monkey was the on pen name (or rather brtish name, China since he did not use a pen) of an author of some of the most vitriolic of thei wall posters that started appearing in Peking a month ago.

title: STRIP MINE BILL PASSES KEY TEST Bid to Substitute;a Weaker Plan Fails House Vote
description: WASHINGTON, July 18 Supporters of strong regulation of stripmining beat back today a major effort , by the friends of the energy industry in the House of representatives to substitute a weaker, industrybacked measure for the first Federal surface mine control law.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Profits Climb 35.3%
SAMPSON DEFENDS THE CYPRUS COUP
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, July 18Nikos Giorgiades Sampson, the new President of Cyprus, charged in his first press conlerence today that the ousted government of Archbishop Makarios had systematically tortured its political opponents and flagrantly violated the human rights of all Cypriotes.

title: DrugInformer System Brings Only 1 Reward
description: Ten months ago, the State Division of Criminal Justice Services set up a tollfree telephone number and offered a $1,000 reward to anyone who turned in a drug pusher.

title: Panel Says 17 Phone Taps Found No Security Leaks
description: WASHINGTON, July 18None of the telephone taps placed by the Nixon Administration on 13 Government officials and four newsmen ever disclosed any leaks of classified information to the press, according to evidence made public today by the House Judiciary Committee.

title: THE FRANCE TO MAKE 7 MORE ROUND TRIPS
description: PARIS, July 18The liner France will be withdrawn from service Oct. 25 after the last of seven scheduled summer North Atlantic runs, the French Line said today.

title: Young Memo on Plumbers Data
description: WASHINGTON, July 18Following the text of a personal memo prepared by David R. Young, an aide to John D. Ehrlichman, for himself after a meeting with his superior. The memo, reflecting both Mr. Young's and Mr. Ehrlichman's concern that they not be pressed on whether information about the plumbers operation had been passed to the President.

title: at Stevens Emphasizes RockParody Delivery
description: Cat Stevens ended a long worldwide tour at Madison Square Garden on Wednesday night, and one hardly knows what to say. The trouble is that a real criterion of artistic worth in popular music is whether lots of people like it.

title: SAXBE URGES STEPS TO SAVE MARSHLAND
description: TARPON SPRINGS, Fla., July 18 (UPI) Attorney General William B. Saxbe urged Federal prosecutors today to give top priority to fighting what lie called Twentieth century buccaneering by real estate developers whose projects illegally destroyed coastal marshlands.

title: Books of The Times
description: Do you see Alison Lurie over there, smiling nonchalantly while blowing gunpowder fumes from the tip of her pen? She is doing that because she has written her fifth novel, The War Between the Tates, and the fictional landscape is strewn with bodies. In the foreground lies Brian Tate, a man who had conducted his life with theutmost dignity and solemnity, because he feared that the opinions... of a man barely five feet five, weighing a mere one hundred and thirtyfive pounds, were seldom taken seriously. But his seriousness had failed to lead on to greatness; at the age of 48 he had risen no higher than the position of chairman of the political science department at Corinth College.And so one snowy day, feeling discouraged perhaps, he had descended to the floor of his office with a lovesick graduate student from the psychology department. For this descent, Alison Lurie has not gone lightly on Brian.

title: DOCTOR QUITS WORK ON TESTTUBE BABIES
description: LONDON, July 18 (AP)Prof. Douglas Bevis, the British gynecologist who announced that three babies conceived outside the womb had been born normally, said today he was giving up research into creating testtube babies.

title: BRAZIL RECOGNIZES REPUBLIC OF BISSAU
description: BRASILIA, July 18Brazil gave formal recognition today to the Republic of GuineaBissau proclaimed by insurgents in the territory of Portuguese Guinea.

title: TV: Edwardians Points to B.B.C. Ups and Downs
description: One unintentional effect of The Edwardians, a series of biographical dramas being shown Sundays on the ,Public Broadcasting Service, is to demonstrate that British television can be every bit as dull and uninspired as Its American equivalent.

title: The Irish Race Should Decide to Grow Up
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland  The divided and ferociously quarreling Northern Irish people have now been ordered by the understandably impatient British Government to get together and, subject to certain conditions, essentially involving powersharing between the Protestant majority and Roman Catholic minority, work out a sensible solution to the repellent mess that religious distrust and competing political loyalties have made of the otherwise lovely little sixcounty province.

title: NBC Will Replace McGee by July 31
description: Officials of NBC have assigned themselves a July 31 deadline for the selection of new cohost for the Today program to succeed the late Frank McGee, a corporate source disclosed yesterday.

title: SAMPSON DEPENDS THE CYPRUS COUP
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, July 18Nikos Giorgiades Sampson, the new President of Cyprus, charged in his first press conference today that the ousted government of Archbishop Makarios had systematically tortured its political opponents and flagrantly violated the (human rights of all. Cypriotes.

title: CONGRESS PASSE LEGAL D TO POOR
description: WASHINGTON, July 18Overriding conservative opposition, the Senate gave final Congressional approval today to legislation that would create a permanent system of Federal legal assistance for the poor. The Measure was sent to the White House:

title: Apparel Makers Moving Operations to Caribbean
description: The constant search for readily available, and inexpensive, sources of labor has taken an increasing number of American makers of apparel, electronics and other consumer products to Latin America and the Caribbean, it was reported this week.

title: 2 Children Visiting Grandmother Die as Fire Levels Home on L.I.
description: NORTH BELLPORT, L. I., July 18  Two children who were visiting their grandmother here died today when a fire engulfed her home in the early morning hours.

title: U.S. Yacht Is Victor
description: TORQUAY, England, July IS (Reuters)  An American yacht, Terrorist, skippered by Al Cassells, won the opening race of the international OneTon cup series by a wide margin here today. She finished the 27mile course 4 minutes 40 seconds ahead of another American entrant, Magic Twanger.

title: Peronist Leftist, 22, Is Detained In Death of Argentine Publisher
description: BUENOS AIRES, July 18The police have a suspect in custody, but they have not disclosed whether the kidnappers of an Argentine newspaper executive who died in La Plata last night were members, of an organized political or guerrilla group.

title: Pure Pork
description: A splendid opportunity has now presented itself for President Nixon to demonstrate how determined he really is to check inflation and eliminate wasteful Government programs. The Senate has passed and rushed to the President for signature the House version of a bill providing $2 billion in loan guarantees for producers of beef cattle, dairy cattle, hogs, sheep, goats, chickens and turkeys.

title: SUMMATION MADE IN BRASCO TRIAL
description: Corruption and credibility were the crucial issues in the summations yesterday by the defense and the prosecution at the trial of Representative Frank J. Brasco in Federal District Court here.

title: Contraceptive Pills Linked by Doctors To Benign Tumor,
description: British and American doctor have linked the use of oral con traceptives to an increased risk of developing It benign live tumor. If. not promptly diag nosed and properlyAreated, the tumor can lead to a serious an fatal hemorrhage,, according a report in the current issue of the British Medical Journal.

title: House Banking Unit Puts Off Bill Involving Citicorp Issue
description: WASHINGTON, July 18 (AP) The House Banking Committee put off consideration today of a bill to extend. Federal regulation to finanCial holding companies fund raising issues after the Controller of the Currency, James E. Smith, said could have serious disruptive effects on many nonbank companies.

title: Colson Memo Told Halderman, We Must Be Exceedingly Careful Not to Overreact
description: WASHINGTON, July 18Following the text of a memorandum prepared Charles W. Colson for President Nixon', chief aide, H. R. Haldeman, concernini the prosecution of Dr. Daniel Ellsberg

title: Harbor Route of Staten I. Ferry On Register of Historic Places
description: The route that has been followed for more than a century by Staten Island ferryboats plying the waters of New York harbor between St. George, S. and the Battery has been added to the National Register of Historic Places along with the shorelines where the terminals are situated.

title: Judge in Libel Suit Asks Financial Data On Hughes Concern
description: LOS ANGELES, July 18 (UPI)  Howard R. Hughes's main holding company has been ordered to reveal confidentially to a Federal judge how much it is worth, to help determine how much will be taken away from it in libel damages.

title: Psychiatric Profile of Ellsberg Prepared by C.I.A.
description: WASHINGTON, July 18Following the text of a psychiatric profile of Dr. Daniel Ellsberg prepared by the Central Intelligence Agency at the direction of the White House. The profile, the second of two prepared, was compiled by a man who had never met Dr. Ellsberg. It was released today by the House Judiciary Committee as part of the evidence gathered in the impeachment inquiry.

title: GEORGE SIBLEY DIES; EXSQUIBB OFFICIAL
description: George H. Sibley, formerly a vice president, attorney and director of E. R. Squibb & Sons, Inc., and a trustee of the Greenwhich Savings Bank, died Wednesday in Jamestown, Colo., where he lived. He was 75 years lold and formerly lived here and in Pawling, N.Y.

title: A Diver Is Trapped In Flooded Chamber At Navy Yard Here
description: A commercial scuba diver failed to surface after a fiveminute underwater assignment at the Brooklyn Navy Yard yesterday afternoon, and, more than 10 hours after he had slid into 100 feet of water with only an hour's supply of oxygen, the diver had not been heard from.

title: Turkey's Parliament Is Briefed About Cyprus at Secret Session
description: ANKARA, Turkey, July 18 (Reuters)Turkey's Parliament met in secret session over the Cyprus crisis today and then adjourned until Saturday. The army moved thousands of reinforcements to a coastal plain across from the Mediterranean island.

title: ST. CLAIR QUOTES A WITHHELD TAPE TO SUPPORT NIXON
description: WASHINGTON, July 18 President Nixon's defense lawyer told the House Judiciary Committee today that a 1973 tape recording the President has refused to give to the impeachment inquiry would prove that Mr. Nixon ruled out.a blackmail payment to E. Howard Hunt Jr., a convicted Watergate burglary conspirator.

title: STRIKE ON THE THREATENEDMONDAY
description: A strike against the Long Island Rail Road was threatened yesterday for 12:01 A.IVI. next Monday by a union of 50 civil engineers, architects and draftsmen after coolingoff requirements under the Railway Labor Act ended.

title: Union Carbide Net at Peak
description: The Union Carbide Corporation, the nation's second largest chemical producer after E. I. du Pont de Nemours, achieved the, highest sales and earnings for any quarter or half year in its history in the periods ended June 30. The company also noted that is exceeded the $100million profit mark for the first time for a quarter.

title: E. P. A. Chief Says Nixon Has Relaxed Rule Over Agencies
description: BOSTON, July 18 (AP) The Environmental Protection Agency administrator, Russell E, Train, said today that the White House had unquestionably loosened its tight hold on the executive branch of the Federal Government in recent months.

title: Southmen 168 Victors; Huarte Star
REVISION CLEARED ON CAPITAL GAINS
description: WASHINGTON, July 18 (AP) The House Ways and. Means committee tentatively approved today a proposal to adjust capital gains taxes for inflation.

title: Ogden Reid Bids the U.S. Back Makarios in Crisis
description: WASHINGTON, July 18 (UPI) The United States should not withdraw recognition from the Cypriote Government of Archbishop Makarios without Congressional approval, Representative Ogden R. Reid, New York Democrat, said today.

title: Two Deny Being in Ring That Kidnapped L.I. Boy
description: NEWARK, July 18 Two teenagers charged with being part of a kidnapping ring that abducted 9yearold John Calzadilla on March 6 denied under oath today that they had any advance knowledge of the crime.

title: 24 Arrested as Operators Of Cocaine Smuggling Ring
description: WASHINGTON, July 18 (UPI) The Drug Enforcement Administration announced today the arrests of 24 suspects in the United States and Bogota, Colombia, charged with operating a cocaine smuggling ring centered in a ski resort of Aspen, Colo.

title: Krupp's Chief Elaborates On Steel Accord With lran
description: PARIS, July 18"The idea was very simple, said Berthold Beitz, chairman of the supervisory board of the Krupp industrial empire. The Shah has the wlil to industrialize Iran. We have the technology. So you put the two together.

title: A Stolen Statue At Boston Museum Returning to India
description: The curator of Asian art at the Boston Museum of Fine Arts will fly to Washington today to return a stolen 11thcentury bronze figure of Vishnu to the Indian Embassy.

title: People and Business
description: The directors of the Gillette Company, the razorblade giant based in Boston, have appointed Colman M. Mockkr Jr. as president and chief operating officer. His appointment, announced yesterday, ended several weeks of speculation over the successor to Edward Gelsthorpe, who unexpectedly resigned as president three weeks ago after serving in that post for less than 14 months.

title: 2 TeenAgers Deny Being Part Of Ring That Kidnapped L.1. Boy
description: NEWARK, July 18Two teenagers charged with being part of a kidnapping ring that abducted 9yearold John Calzadilla on March 6 denied under oath today that they had any advance knowledge of the crime.

title: N.F.L, Owners Make Proposals, Are Rejected
description: Rejecting virtually all of the players freedom demands, the owners made their first comprehensive package of proposals in the National Football League labor dispute yesterday.

title: RAND'S CONTRACT WITH CITY CLEARED
description: Over the strong objection of the City Council President, Paul O'Dwyer, the Board of Estimate approved yesterday a $300,000 city contract with the New York CityRand Institute for studies of the Fire

title: FixedIncome Security Prices Gain
People in Sports
description: If you happen to see a 6foot11inch redhaired logger in the woods around Eugene, Ore., in the next few weeks, it won't be Paul Bunyan. It will be none other than Bill Walton, the former University of California, Los Angeles, center and No. 1 draft pick of the Portland Trail Blazers.

title: Grease for the Wheel, a Short Answer and Other Watergate Tidbits
description: WASHINGTON, July 18Until just lately, Room G334 in the New Senate Office Building was kept under such tight security that even cleaning crews were not permitted to enter.

title: POLICE IN BALTIMORE PENALIZED ON STRIKE
description: BALTIMORE, July 18 (AP)ly hours after the city ratified a new pay agreement with it policemen, Police Commissioner Donald D. Pomerleau dilhissed or deMoted 109 policemen involved in a fourday, strike.

title: Yanks Defeat Royals, 106, in Game Spiced With Errors and Arguments
Stocks Soar, Then Ease Slightly
Hearing Is Slated on Plan To Integrate Lane School
description: A public hearing on the !Board of Education's plan to integrate Brooklyn's Franklin K. Lane High School will be held early next month by Federal Judge John F. Dooling Jr.

title: Anthony Hanzlik, Pioneer Pilot And Aerial Photographer, Dies
description: Anthony Hanzlik, a photographer and a pioneer pilot for aerial photography who managed Flushing Airport in Queens since 1936, died Wednesday at his home in Flushing. He was 71 years.old.

title: Jehovah Witnesses Open 4Day Meeting
description: JERSEY CITY, July 18The Roosevelt Stadium here was converted today into a kind of outdoor Kingdom Hall as more than 10,000 people took over the ball park for a fourday Divine Purpose District Assembly of Jehovah's Witnesses.

title: CHICAGO UTILITY LISTS PROFIT DIP
description: The Commonwealth Edison Company reported yesterday a marked decline in firsthalf earnings despite higher operating revenues. The giant Chicago utility placed net income at $66.3million, or $1 a share, for the first six months. This compared with $86.2million, or $1.47 a share, in the like period of 1973. Revenues rose to just under $665million for the first six months against $601.2million a year earlier,

title: Memos Showing Concern Over Leaks
description: WASHINGTON, July 18Following are the texts of four internal White House memorandums released on behalf of the President today to reflect the concern in top levels of government over persistent leaks of sensitive information to the news media.

title: Arts Take Root in Outer Boroughs
description: Let's go to the ballet, a Queens man suggested to his wife last Sunday. And off they went, not to Lincoln Center or City Center in Manhattan, but to Alley Pond Park in Queens, where the Long Island Ballet Theater was packing them in. Across the river and into the Bronx, the River Edge Arts Fest was going strong in Harlem River State Park, and in Brooklyn, a concert of Scott Joplin's music had drawn a throng to TheaterintheBack (of the Brooklyn Museum).

title: Newport, Where Inflation Stings a Little, but It Doesn't Really Hurt
description: NEWPORT, R. I.  Infla. thin? For the 250 or so su perrich American families summering in their enclave here, it is but a distant hap peeing like summer lightning, something to notice, but nol a present reality that much crimps traditional lifestyles, True, there are some complaints about clover in the lawn, of help being hard to get, of women doing their own dusting, but that's about all.

title: Makarios Will Speak to U.N. Security Council Today as Head of State of Cyprus
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y. July 18The Security Counci decided today to hear Arch bishop Makarios as head o state of Cyprus although Government there has beet overthrown. He is to speak to morrow afternoon.

title: Tryon's 71 for 146 Leads State Golf.
A's Put Perry on 2Game Losing Streak
description: Gaylord Perry may have been psyching most of the batters in the American League with his nonexistent spitball or greasehall or whatever it was he was accused of throwing, but the former Cy Young Award winner's psychology hasn't fazed the Oakland A's.

title: BUSINESS LOANS RISE $231MILLION
Documents Hint Politics Played Role in Wiretaps
STATE UNIT FIGHTS PROJECT'S RENT RISE
description: TRENTON, July 18 (AP) The State Department of the Public Advocate said today that a proposed project in West New York could force tenants to chose between paying $40 to $65 more a month or being forced out of their apartments.

title: One of Those Clowns Now on Supreme Court
description: WASHINGTON, July 18 (UP1)Three months before President Nixon appointed William H. Rehnquist to the Supreme Court, Mr. Nixon referred to that group of clowns we had around there. Renchburg and that group.

title: Construction Starts On a PeopleMover At Bradley Airport
description: WINDSOR LOCKS, Conn., July 18 (AP)Sitting at the controls of a giant auger machine, Gov. Thomas J. Meskill today broke ground for the controversial $4.4million peoplemover at Bradley International Airport.

title: CHEMICAL MAKERS UNDERINDEMENT
description: NEWARK, July 18E. I. duPont de Nemours & Co. and eight other chemical manufacturers that together control 60 per cent of the nation's dye sales were indicted here today by a Federal grand jury on charges they fixed prices, pushing the cost of dyes to artificial and noncompetitive levels.

title: Beame Tells of Vain Effort To Reconcile City's Books
description: Abraham D. Beame was aware last year, when he was Controller and running for Mayor, that a multimilliondollar discrepancy existed in the records of city treasury funds, according to a statement issued by Mayor Beanie yesterday He ordered a crash program to try to reconcile the discrepancy, which was in the city's favor, sources close to the Mayor said.

title: Hussein Yields on Palestine Group
description: CAIRO, July 18King Hussein of Jordan, departing from a longheld stand, today recognized the Palestine Liberation Organization as the representative of Palestinians outside his own country and agreed with President Anwar elSadat of Egypt that the Palestinians. should have a separate delegation at the Geneva peace talks.

title: GREECE, PRESSED, PLANS TO REPLACE CYPRUS OFFICER
description: LONDON, July 18 Greece made a concession in the Cyprus crisis today by agreeing to replace the 650 Greek officers in the Cypriote National Guard.

title: Heavy Rises Approved, In Newark Cab Fares
description: NEWARK, July 18 (AP)The Newark City Council has unanimously approved substantial fare increases in city taxi rates.

title: Visconti Version of Manon Lescaut Given in Ohio
description: CINCINNATI, July I8The sensation, as press releases invariably put it, of last summer's Spoleto festival in Italy was Luchino Visconti's stag; ing of Manon Lescaut. With the Spoleto cast largely intact. that production had its, American premiere last night at the Cincinnati Summer Opera, imported through a grant from the Corbett Foundation. It enjoyed a diluted success, in spite of what seemed to be a careful duplication by Alberto Fassini, capable though rather smallscaled singing of the leading roles and richly decorative sets by. Lila de Nobili.

title: Britain Cancels Plans to Build Third London Airport at Maplin

description: Dr, Earl L. Bradsher, professor emeritus of American literature at Louisiana State University, died Wednesday at his home in Baton Rouge. He was 95 years old.

description: Alexander Leftwich, a television and radio director, died Wednesday at his home in Middletown, N. Y. He was 66 years old.

title: Sets Win, 2822, From Flamingos
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., July 18 The New York Sets came up with a new winning men's doubles pairing, Sandy Mayer and Charley Owens, and the playercoach, Manuel Santana, beat Mike Belkin, 60, in the singles as the Sets defeated the Florida Flamingos, 2822, tonight in a World Team Tennis match at the Nassau Coliseum. A crowd of 2,510 was on hand.

title: Mrs. Gandhi Says Indians Had ADevice a Decade Ago

title: Orange County, Calif.: From Pavel to McGee
description: SANTA CRUZ, Calif.Orange County, Calif., a suburban sprawl on the coast near Los Angeles, is best known as stronghold of rightwing politics and the home of Disneyland. The Magic Kingdom flourishes, but the county's reactionary reputationestablished by a noisy minorityhas been gravely exaggerated. The ordinary citizens are not unlike voters in Nassau County, N. Y., or Montgomery Bounty, Md.

title: Documents Hint Politics Played Role in Wiretaps

title: No Provisions for Aid In Herstatt Closure
description: FRANKFURT, West Germany, July 18 (Reuters)Karl Klasen, president of the West German Bundesbank, said today there were no legal provisions for giving special help to foreign banks, which incurred losses in foreignexchange dealings as a result of last month's collapse of one of the country's largest private banks.

title: Dining: A Lusty Bravo for Rigoletto, A Muted Ole for the Mole at Mirador

title: Cox, Back in Professor's Role, Talks of Fair Play and Civility

title: JERSEY BELL ASKS 19.4% RATE RISE
description: NEWARK, July 18The New Jersey Bell Telephone Company today filed a request for a 19.4 per cent rate increase with the State Board of Public Utility Commissioners. The increase, totaling $155million, would include raising the cost of local calls from coinoperated telephones to 20 cents and charging 20 cents for previously free calls for directory assistance.

title: Books of The Times
description: Do you see Alison Lurie over there, smiling nonchalantly while blowing gunpowder fumes from the tip of her pen? She is doing that because she has written her fifth novel, The War Between the Tates, and the fictional landscape is strewn with bodies. In the foreground lies Brian Tate, a man who had conducted his life with the utmost dignity and solemnity, because he feared that the opinions... of a man barely five feet five, weighing a mere one hundred and thirtyfive pounds, were seldom taken seriously. But his seriousness had failed to lead on to greatness; at the age of 48 he had risen no higher than the position of chairman of the political science department at Corinth College. And so one snowy day, feeling discouraged perhaps, he had descended to the floor of his office with a lovesick graduate student from the psychology department. For this descent, Alison Lurie has not gone lightly on Brian.

title: U. S. SCORES GULL ON KUWAIT ACCORD
description: WASHINGTON, July 18The State Department, in a highly unusual move, censured the Gulf Oil Corporation today for having agreed to increase the price it paid to the Government of Kuwait for oil.

Soviet Union. The single exception is fascination in their posthumous literary workrespectively Mernoires d'OutreTombe'and IChrushchey RemembersThe Last Testament.

title: SOFT ROCK N ROLL AT FESTIVAL IN PARK
description: The softer side of rock'n'roll was exposed by the Schaefer Music Festival headliners, the group America, Wednesday in Central Park. The trio, by no means new on the scene, still retains much of its earlier acoustic appeal, still pays the same close attention to harmonies and performs everything with quiet freshness. Switches are made to piano and organ from the frontline guitars and discreet amplification is allowed, but the backup never gets topheavy and it is a homework that allows the clarity of the merging and blending voices to come through.

The first major deal has now been disclosed: the Government of Iran is buying a 25 per cent interest in Fried. Krupp Huettenwerke, the steelworks and engineering division of the Krupp enterprise in West Germany.

A FarReaching Crisis
description: The coup that overthrew Archbishop Makarios and installed a proGreek government in Cyprus differs strikingly in its political repercussions and military hazards from similar takeovers in Chile and Portugal. The most significant difference is that the integrity of Cyprus was doubly guaranteed  a situation that did not exist in Chile last September or in Portugal last Apriland the military coup in Cyprus was therefore more than simply an internal affair.
