description: THE APPRENTICESHIP OF DUDDY KRAVITZ, directed by Ted Kotcheff from a screenplay by Mordecai Richler and starring Richard Dreyfuss, got 12 favorable reviews (Vincent Canby, Times; Archer Winsten, Post; Howard Kissel, Women's Wear; Joseph Gelmis, Newsday; Frances Taylor, Newhouse Newspapers; Bernard Drew, Gannett News Service; Gene Shalit, NBCTV; Paul D. Zimmerman, Newsweek; Judith Crist, New York; William Wolf, Cue; Hollis Alpert, Saturday Review World; Frank Rich, New Times), mixed (Jeffrey Lyons, CBSRadio/ WPIXTV; John Simon, Esquire; Jay Cocks, Time) and 2 negative (Jerry Oster, The Daily News, Penelope Gilliatt, New Yorker).

title: Music
description: IN THE peculiar world of the piano, as in the similarly sur?? world of Little League baseball in New Jersey, being female has been regarded as an affliction about which little can be done. Women pianists have made their mark in history, but the feeling persists that heirs is a condition to be risen above, like congenital squinteye or the petit mal. Something of that latent attitude often pervades reviews of Alicia de Larrocha, to choose the example nearest at hand: at some point during the Mostly Mozart festival that begins tomorrow night at Avery Fisher Hall, she is certain to be mentioned (possibly even by me in an unguarded moment) as the greatest woman pianist of our day.

title: 2 STATE AGENCIES BACK PERILED TREE
description: The massive, 275yearold Balmville Tree near Newburgh, N.Y., endangered because of heavy truck and automotive traffic over its root system, has found support from two stategovernment departments that frequently find themselves on opposite sides on environmental matters.

title: Met Games This Week
description: TodayAt San Diego.

title: Magic Casting a Spell Around Much of U.S., Spurring Trick Sales
description: In Los Angeles, Ouija board sales are booming. Washington, the demand for magic oil and tarot cards has soared. And on New York's West Side musicians have been evoking the supernatural with ghostly trombone tones. Many Americans have become enchanted by the theory and practice of magic, a check around the nation shows. Sales of magic tricks have increased by 50 per cent or more in some cities over the last 18 months, and in recent years interest in magic and witchcraft has been running strong.

title: Hart's Bridge
description: Poor Hart Crane! Once the anesthetic thirties had washed over him and those wild anomalies that were supposed to have drowned his star had been converted into period charm, a new snag appeared. Young readers of the sixties, unshorn lambs of the Vietnam pastoral, who might have been expected to love such poems as Black Tambourine, The Dance, or Indiana, may well have choked on the poet's intemperate zeal for airplanes and ball bearings (not that Crane's zeal was ever as intemperate as it looked at first; he hated the idea of bombers).

title: Mr. Nixon's Supporters Don't Take It Quietly

But these days there is little mention of perhaps the hottest issue of allWatergate.

They are very proud of their community and its past and are The Talk happy that they of can walk down South the main streets Amboy of town and be able to recognize almost every face. However, a crisis in South Amboy's school system caused by a lack of classroom space is threatening the tranquility of what is described as an otherwise stable community.

description: PARAMUS  Bergen Community College has produced a 54program earlymorning CBSTV series entitled The American Presidency: The Men and the Office, which is being broadcast nationally through September.

title: With a Good Reed I'll Move Worlds
description: TWO days before his third New York recital last April, Leonard Hindell, a bassoonist, was feeling out of sorts. Ordinarily a young man of robust appearance, Hindell was described by a friend as seeming pale and washed out. Was it merely a case of preconcert nerves? No. Flindell's anxiety stemmed from a fear suffered universally by bassoon and oboe players. He was worried that he would not have a good reed with which to play his instrument. For, as the 31yearold New York Philharmonic musician himself says, What makes a,,,,bassoonist old before his time is the problem he has with reeds.

title: Nell Blaine's Cheerful Palette at the Parrish Museum
description: SOUTHAMPTON  Feeling crestfallen? Woebegone? Looking for a sunny uplift? An antidote for one's doldrums can be found at the Parrish Museum, where there is an exhibition of Nell. Blaine's painting and drawings. Her leafy landscapes and exuberant still fifes provide the kind of summer serenity that makes one feel all's right with the world.

description: Three important new kinds of architecture were invented by modern man: the factory, the skyscraper and the railroad station. The factory and the skyscraper remain icons of our time, but with the advent of the air and automobile age, the railroad station has seemed slated for extinction.

title: Apparent Conflict in Dates Disquiets Panel Members
S.L.A. rhetoric, middleclass platitudeswhat the hell is the difference? Angel sure didn't know; Cheerleader for a revolution
description: I am looking at two photographs. The first is blotched and disfigured face in a newspaper story. If the picture had been found among old clippings, might have thought it was of a DepressionEra criminal, Pretty Boy Floyd's moll, a woman scrambling through Dust Bowl hideouts. There are three other faces under the headlinesmiling, California faces: Camilla Hall, Patricia Soltysik, Nancy Ling Perry. They are infamous media heroines, soldiers in the Symbionese Liberation Army. Yet this fourth face, identified in the caption as Angela Atwood, do not recall from the national news; although it a new face for the press, I have a premonition is a much older face for me.

title: Continued job Declines Threaten City Economy
description: New York City is losing at an accelerating rate the jobs that sustain its economy and its government,, and the de. Idines are causing growing concern among city officials, private ecOnomists, businessmen and labor leaders.

description: MOSCOW, Sunday, July 21  The Soviet Union denied today that its military forces had been placed on alert as a result of the Cyprus invasion.

title: U.S. Mediator Sets Talks Today In Bid to Avert L.I.R.R. Strike
description: A Federal mediator will meet with both sides at 4 P.M. today in an effort to avert a strike that could halt service for 170,000 daily riders on the Long Island Rail Road. The strike has been threatened for midnight by the American Railway and Airline supervisors.

title: The Stronghold; By Mollie Hunter. 259 pp. New York: Harper & Row. $5.95. (Ages 12 to 16)
description: Mollie Hunter, a Scottish writer. has won a deserved reputation in this country for such memorable folkloric fantasies as The Kelpie's Pearls and The Haunted Mountain, among others, as well as A Sound of Chariots, a realistic novel taking place immediately after World War I. In The Stronghold she now takes us back to a turning point in the lives of those Iron Age peoples who once inhabited the Orkney Islands off the northern tip of Scotland.

title: Seoul Reports Sinking Of North Korean Vessel
description: SEOUL, South Korea, July 20 (Reuters)The South Korean Defense Ministry said today that the navy had destroyed a North Korean reconaissanee vessel and killed at least five of its crew in the fourth sea clash with Communist North Korea this year.

title: G.O.P. IN HARTFORD HAS ONE CONTEST
description: HARTFORD, July 20 (AP)Republican delegates of the First District met at Whiting Lane School in West Hartford today to select a Congressional candidate in the only district where the nomination was being contested by more than one individual.

title: Impeachment Broadcast
description: The Rules Committee has wisely recommended to the House of Representatives that the Judiciary Committee's final debate on impeachment be broadcast by radio and television. We strongly endorse that view, and hope that that decision will be followed by opening the House debate, and the Senate trial if it occurs, to full coverage by the electronic media.

title: 3 Hijack Macy's Truck
description: Three men hijacked a Macy's delivery truck containing $5,000 in merchandise yesterday after handcuffing the driver and his helper inside a Harlem building. The police said the driver and a helper were on the seventh floor of the building, at 15948 Harlem River Drive, making a delivery, when the robbers, armed with guns, accosted them. Tenants notified the police.

title: To Halt the Bloodshed
description: The United Nations Security Council moved tardily but forcefully last night to stop the bloodshed on Cyprus and to head off a threatened wider war between Greece and Turkey that could blow up the eastern Mediterranean and rekindle the Middle East. Strict observance of the ceasefire by all parties is obviously the first imperative.

title: 30 BANKS REFUSE MORTGAGE STUDY
description: More than 30 banks  including some of the more important residential mortgagelending institutions in the city have refused to cooperate with a major city attempt to trace the relationship between mortgage practices and housing decay, the head of the city's Rent Guidelines Board charges.

title: Burrowing out Shakespeare's SubText in hi The Shrew
description: LONDON DURING a recent discussion of London's latest hit show (a revival of Shaw's Pygmalion with Alec McCowen and Diana Rigg), I suddenly realized how much the British theater has changed since the critic and director Charles Marowitz joined it. It may not be the best Pygmalion we'll ever see, said someone, but it's certainly the best production of the subtext. Now, if you had used the word subtext here fifteen years ago, when Marowitz arrived on the London scene from New York, people would have assumed you meant the second of two verses of Scripture used by a minister as texts for his sermon. At best, someone might have said warily, Stanislavsky and all that, d'you mpan? In Marowitz's years here, and to a considerable extent because of his efforts a..q a director and critic, we have learned a little moreenough, at least, for conversation about such matters. After Marowitz's first London productions in the 1960's, the theater hummed with actors stories of his unorthodox methods  improvisalions, making up scenes between the lines of the play, sensitivity exercises and the like. Today all these are standard practice in much of the British theater, and the concept of subtext  the unspoken moods and motives at work behind a playwright's written words  is so respectable that The Royal Shakespeare Company has invited Marowitz's The Shrew, an hourandahalf tour between the lines of Shakespeare's Taming, to be the first guest production ever in its studio theater at Strat fordonAvon in the fall. The Shrew has been playing at the Open Space Theater and will return there in September.

title: Grandma's Golf Shop Is Humming
description: The sign outside the proshop at Douglaston Park, one of New York City's 13 municipal golf courses, reads: Helen Gilligan Finn, Professional, L.P.G.A. She is one of about 100 Ladies Professional Golf Association teaching pros and the only one ever under contract with the city of New York. She teaches men, women and children, some with money, some without, from early morning until darksometimes to music. She also owns and operates the proshop.

title: Experts See Grave Nuclea'r Dangers.
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., July 21 A group of leading American and Canadian disarmament expertssaying that even they, had been lulled into false complacency over the last decadewarned today that the threat of world nuclear destruction had taken on frightening new dimensions.

title: Red Smith
description: The New York Times announced it was cutting the price of its Sunday edition from a nickel to three cents. and discontinuing the Illustrated Magazine Supplement. It intended, the announcement explained, that henceforth the Times on Sundays as on weekdays shall be strictly newspaper. The decision had been made in spite of the fact that the 16page magazine with its columns of notes and comment upon the scenes and events that go to make up the life of a great city, its reviews of art, music and the drama, and its many illustrations printed photographic halftone, had found great favour with the public and helped increase the Sunday circulation. But, the announcement concluded, a picture supplement not a newspaper; it is not within the field which the newspaper press may hold exclusively for its own.

title: A Vote of Conscience
description: As the members of the House Judiciary Committee prepare to vote on the critical issue of impeachment, they have a responsibility to lay aside all other considerations except the claims of conscience. description: PORTLAND, Ore., July 21 (AP)  Former United States Senator Wayne Morse, who is 73 years old and has been hospitalized since Wednesday for a urinarytract infection, was listed in critical condition today with kidney failure. The Senator's condition worsened conisiderably overnight, according Ito a spokesman for the Good Samaritan Hospital. Mr. Morse has been attempting a political comeback this year. Two months ago he won the Democratic Senatorial primary election.

title: A Fatally Doctor's Reactions to Dying
Robber Here Slain With His O wn Gunby Sons of Holdup Victim!
description: A holdup man was shot and killed with his own gun here Saturday night when he and a knifewielding accomplice were jumped by the twin sons of one of the robbery victims in an East Harlem housing project.

title: Karl's Playoff Birdie Beats Crampton
description: ENDICOTT, N. Y., July 21 (AP)Richie Karl, a pro at the host En Joie Golf Club, sank a 35foot birdie putt on the first extra hole today and won the $150,000 B.C. open golf tournament in a playoff with Bruce Crampton of Australia.

title: Williams Revises His Tat for Stratford

New twofamily brick homesthey will probably house three familiessprout everywhere. Abandoned stores and buildings become glistening shops, restaurants, night clubs, repair shops, jewelry stores, real estate offices. The Greek Orthodox Church of St. Demitrios has more political power than any clubhouse.

title: MARIJUANA. ARRESTS UP TO 420,700 IN 73
description: WASHINGTON, July 21 (UPI)  Previously unpublished figures, compiled for the Federal Bureau of Investigation Uniform Crime Report for 1973 showed that 420,700 persons were arrested on marijuana charges  66.9 per cent of all. drug arrests in that year.

title: Adolfo Munoz Alonso Dies; Philosopher Backed Franco
description: SANTANDER, Spain, July 21 (Reuters)Prof. Adolfo Munoz Alonzo, one of Spain's leading philosophers and a stanch supporter of Generalissimo Francisco Franco, died here today after a heart attack. He was 59 yea'rs old.

title: Bob Unser, Foyt Take USAC Races
description: CAMBRIDGE JUNCTION, Mich:, July 2(AP)Bobby Unser won a 200Milerace for Indianapolis Cari today and lost by an eirelash to A. J. Foyt In a stockcar event before 46,180 fans at Michigan International Speedway.

title: The Opera: Werner Egk's Domingo
description: ST. PAUL, July 21Werner Egk is not a man you hear much about any more. The German composer, now in his 60's, had a flurry of recognition in this country after World War II although hp had been a favorite of the Nazis. There were so few composers of standing left in Germany that he was hastily purged of Hitlerian taint by Allied authorities and put to work. Now, however, his works have pretty well dropped out of our sight, although they still turn out regularly in Germany.

title: Changing Face of Sports: Bubble May Be Bursting
description: Is the professional sports bubble ready to burst  or is it just inflating along with everything else in the economy?

title: Israelis Affirm Ban on Any Talks With Palestinians
description: TEL AVIV, July 21Premier Yitzhak Rabin and his Cabinet reappraised today their policy on negotiations with the Palestinians and after six hours of discussion, reaffirmed the traditional hardline stand opposing such talks.

title: Miss Jane Gerdts Wed to John Myers
description: Jane Ellen Gerdts, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Ernest L. Gerdts of West Islip, L. I., was married yesterday afternoon to John Robert Myers, son of John E. Myers, presiding judge of Burlington, N J., and Mrs. Myers.

title: Security Council to Meet On Atrocity Issue Today
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., July 21  Greece's United delegate, alleging Turkish milltary atrocities and expressing his country's acceptance of yesterday's Security Council resolution, called today for another emergency Security Council meeting on Cyprus. It is scheduled for 10 A.M. tomorrow.

title: A GREEKTURKISH TRUCE ACCORD ON CYPRUS IS ANNOUNCED BY U. S.; CEASEFIRE IS SCHEDULED TODAY
description: WASHINGTON, July 21The United States Government announced tonight that Greece and Turkey had agreed to a ceasefire between their forces on Cyprus starting at 2 P.M. G.M.T. tomorrow (10 A.M. tomorrow, New York Time).The fighting would thus be halted approximately 70 hours after a Turkish assault force landed on the northern coast of the eastern Mediterranean island in reaction to the July 15 coup in which the Cypriote National Guard led by Greek officers ousted President Makarios.

title: Boatmen Lay Shipworm Growth to Nuclear Plant
description: An infestation of shipworms termites of the seais chewing up cedar piling on parts of the New Jersey shore and has become a source of controversy between marina operators and the Jersey Central Power & Light Company.

description: INCHON, South. Korea, July 21 (UPI)South Korean Navy vessels towed a battledamaged North Korean vessel into port here today with the bodies of five dead crewmen aboard.

Turks Say They repulsed Attempted Greek Landing
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Monday, July 22The Turkish Generai Staff announced last night that here had been a sharp battle off the coast of western Cyprus oetween a Greek naval unit and Rakish naval and air forces.

title: 7,000 Stolen at Supermarket
description: WEST BABYLON, L. I., July 21 (UPI)A gunman last night robbed a Waldbaum's supermarket in West Babylon of $7,000, the Suffolk County police reported. No shots were fired and no one was injured. The police said the incident occurred at about 9:30 P.M. when a man entered Waldbaum's on Route 27 and Hubbards Path to announce the holdup.

New York, was married here yesterday afternoon to Robin Anthony Lister Elliott, Information and education director of the Planned Parenthood Pederation of America. Khoren sian, a leader of the Ethical Culture Society, performed the ceremony in the bride's apartment.

description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., July 21President Nixon. today named.a New York economist, Alan, Greenspan to be the new chairman of. the White House Council of Economic Advisers. Mr. Greenspan will succeed Herbert Stein, who has resigned effective Aug. 31.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: CLEVELAND, July 21 (UPI)Sal Bando, third baseman for the Oakland A's, said today he would not play Tuesday night's AllStar game between the National and American Leagues because of a severely bruised left ankle. Don Money of the Milwaukee Brewers was named to replace him.

title: INTRUDER IS OUSTED FROM ST. PATRICK'S
description: A woman in a hooded robe leaped into the pulpit of St. Patrick's Cathedral during a late morning mass yesterday and began to deliver what she said was a sermon on behalf of homeless women.

title: Greening of Arnold Constable
description: On a threeyear search for elusive profits, Arnold Constable, the forther carriagetrade store founded almost 150 years ago, has been conducting a twopronged program with directly contrary directions. This has involved the closing of all its Arnold Constable branch stores while opening others of an entirely different type and nameNoName, in fact.

description: PARIS, July 21Inmates destroyed Nimes Prison in southwestern France in a riot that began last night and was not brought under control until this morning.

description: FLORIDA, N, Y.A hot sun beats down on seemingly endless fields of lettuce, celery and onions growing out of the black soil of Orange County, 45 miles from Times Square.

description: Job mobility, the fast pace of inflation and some littleknown tax gimmicks have made the desirability of deferredcompensation plans wane recently to some sophisticated executives.

title: Ground for Impeachment
description: ST. JOSEPH, Mo., July 21 (AP)Representative Jerry Litton, Democrat of Missouri, said today that if the Supreme Court ruled that President Nixon must, surrender some White House; tapes and the President refused to comply, the refusal would be an impeachable offense. Mr. Litton said that many of his colleagues shared this reasoning. Once the Supreme Court has ruled, that becomes the law, and failure to comply would be open breaking of the !law, he said.

description: KUWAIT, July 21This leading oilproducing nation is planning to go into nuclear energy in partnership with some of the developing countries it was announced today by Shiek Ali Khalifa Al Sabah, Kuwait's Under Secretary for Petroleum Economics.

description: Major league baseball's foremost thief since Maury Wills was at work again yesterday.

description: PARIS, July 21 (UPI)Eddy Merckx, Belgium's superstar of bicycling, won the 61st Tour de France today and also took first in the 22d and final stage.

description: RIO DE JANEIRO, July 21 (AP)Adauto Lucio.Cardoso, a lawyer and politician noted for his defense of free institutions and the Brazilian constitution, died here yesterday of a heart attack. He ,was 69 years old.

description: MOSCOW, July 21East Germany will bar passage through its territory of officials or belongings of the environmental protection office West Germany plans to establish in Berlin, the Soviet press agency Tass reported today.

title: The Bar Exam: A Dissent
description: It lasts eight weeks. Your task is to master every detail of a vast body of arbitrary rules and procedures. Your hopes of success lie not in superior ability, but in your capacity to endure tedium and perhaps in your sense of humor.

title: The Dance
description: That unnamed but festive Galician town with its dancing peasants and eccentric inventor returned to the New York State Theater on Saturday intwo sweet performances by American Ballet Theater of Coppelia in the version by Enrique Martinez. Eleanor D'Antuono and Ivan Nagy were Swanilda and Franz in the afternoon, and Zhandra Rodriguez was joined by an exhuberant Ted Kivitt in the evening's performance.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A cruise ship line has agreed to give credit to thousands of passengers who had a fuel surcharge added to the cost of their tickets, Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz announced yesterday. Home Lines Inc.. which operates the foreignflagregistered ships Oceanic and Doric, charged passengers up to $56 extra for recent cruises to Nassau, according to Mr. Lefkowitz. He said passengers had not been informed of the surcharge when they paid deposits on their tickets.

title: Miss Haynie Wins Open By Stroke on Last Hole

description: WASHINGTON, July 21In summarizing the evidence before the House Judiciary Committee in its impeachment inquiry, John M. Doar, the committee's special counsel, abandoned the impartial role he had been playing for week's and bluntly laid out the case against President Nixon.

title: COMMERCE UNIT SETS OIL PARLEY
description: WASHINGTON, July 21The United States Chamber of Commerce and its counterparts in Europe and Japan have begun quiet contracts with the Middle Eastern oilproducing countries in hope of establishing a foursided dialogue among busi, nesses,

title: GOING OUT wide

The sculptures are unceremoniously termed junk metal, but you'll have to decide on your own whether junk transformed into art Is still junk.

title: Delegates Assail British King Again In New Brunswick
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, July 21No one knows how many townspeople heard delegates from the Colony of New Jersey denounce actions of the Crown in 1774, but today, when the event was reenacted in its original setting, the pews in the tiny Christ Episcopal Church were filled.

description: With a lowkey lecture on municipal finance, Mayor Beame tried yesterday to dampen the political damage done to his image of fiscal expertise by three audits depicting sloppy bookkeeping and multimilliondollar discrepancies in the books when he was running the Controller's office.

title: The Continuation of Doar
Talks Off
description: PITTSBURGH, July 22 While pickets still paraded in front of the football training camps around the country, baseball prepared today for its midsummer extravaganza the 45th AllStar gamewith Andy Messersmith and Gaylord Perry cast as the starting pitchers.

description: LOS ANGELES, July 22 (UPI)  Three Trans World Airlines jets made emergency landings within minutes of one another at Los Angeles International Airport yesterday when an engine caught fire on one airIcraft and warning lights indicated mwhanical problems on the two others. Airline officials said that 176 passengers aboard a 747 jumbo jet had to be evacuated by escape chutes.

description: SAILING TODAY

title: Bardin Urges Reversal Of Utility Rate Schedule
description: NEWARK, July 22 (AP) New Jersey's Commissioner of Environmental Protection urged the State Board of Public Utility Commissioners today to put a stop to the practice of selling electriety cheapest to the customers who use the most of it.

description: David L Yunich, chairman of the Metropolitan Transpor[ration Authority, said yesterday that he had a promise of $5million in Federal funds for a new program of noise reduction and station improvement in the subway system.

title: India Bank Raises Rates
description: NEW DELHI, July 22 (UPI)India's Exchequer Bank, the country's reserve bank, raised its lending rate today to commercial banks to 9 per cent from 7 per cent. At the same time, the reserve bank raised the minimum lending rates of commercial banks to 12.5 per cent from 11 per cent. It also increased the rate on deposits with the commercial banks to 10 per cent from 8 per cent.

title: Corrupt and Backward Bihar State Mirrors All the Problems of India

title: Top Italian Party Rejects Move To Let Reds Join in Coalition
description: ROME, July 22The Christian Democratic party, despite recent political setbacks and Italy's deep economic problems, rejected pleas from many of its members today and refused to bring the Communists into the coalition Government.

title: Report Cites Message To Athens From Rebels
description: Newsweek magazine says that an hour after the uprising on Cyprus that ousted Archbishop Makarios, United States intelligence agents intercepted a message from the rebels to the Greek Government in Athens saying: Operation President is under way and on schedule.

title: PLEA FILED TO GIVE SHERWIN NEW TRIAL
description: NEWARK, July 22 (AP)  A new trial was sought today for former Secretary of State Paul J. Sherwin on the basis of new evidence.

title: Calls to Crisis Area Curbed
description: The American Telephone and Telegraph Company reported yesterday that longdistance calls to Greece, Cyprus and Turkey could not be accepted or would be subject to long delays because of the Cyprus conflict.

title: Contract Awards
description: The Westinghouse Electric Corporation said yesterday it had won a $100million order to furnish two more nuclear power.systems and fuel to the Georgia Power Company; The units, each rated at 1.12million kilowatts, would become the third and fourth units of the Alvin W. Vogtle nuclear power plant being built at a site in Burke County, 25 miles from Augusta, Ga., on the Savannah River.

title: Blasts Rip Michigan Plant
description: INNESEC, Mich., July 22 (UPI)A series of explosions, apparently sparked by a fire, tore apart a Gulf Oil Company plant near this northern Michigan hamlet today, killing a teenage volunteer fireman and forcing the evacuation of nearby residens. At least seven persons were hospitalized and the police said that quite a few more had been injured by flying debris.

title: G.O.P. Counsel Wary on Impeachment
description: WASHINGTON, July 22 The House Judiciary Committee's newly designated Republican special counsel contended today that the House should not impeach President Nixon unless it appeared probable that he would be convicted in a Senate trial and removed from office.

title: Intrepid Beats Courageous in Tacking Duel
description: NEWPORT, R.I., July 22Intrepid achieved her most significant victory of the summer today and Courageous suffered her most damaging defeat in their America's Cup trial race.

title: Nassau Democrat Is Absolved In VoteSiphoning Plot Inquiry
description: MINEOLA, L.I., July 22The Nassau County District Attorney's office today closed its investigation into charges that a former Democratic Assemblyman had conducted a votesiphoning scheme and said that no crime had been committed.

description: WASHINGTON, July 22A young Virginia lawyer, Samuel A. Garrison 3d, added his voice today to that of James D. St. Clair, President Nixon's Watergate defense attorney, in pre senting the argument for the President against impeachment:

title: ACCORD REACHED ON DIX WITNESSES
description: Federal officials and the lawyers for the mother of William Wheeler, the civilian who died July 11 after a confrontation with Army trainees on Fort Dix, yesterday agreed in Trenton on a Federal judge's plan to insure that witnesses to the incident would be made available to testify in any criminal or civil litigation arising from current investigations.

title: Americans in Cyprus Find an Asylum
description: DHEKELIA, Cyprus, July 22Sheila Ryan stood in the courtyard of the officers club waiting for a bus to take her to breakfast. I feel like going home to mother, she moaned. So did a lot of other people here.

title: DEBT PAYMENT PLAN IS SET FOR ANCORP
description: A plan for repayment of about $40million of debt incurred by Ancorp National Services. Inc., has been approved by the creditors committee, the company announced yesterday. Ancorp, the former American News Company, is operating under Chapter XI of the Federal Bankruptcy Act.

title: Quality Issues Pace Sharp Rises in Bond Prices
description: The bond market's short positions, caught off base during last week's sudden rebound in prices of fixedincome securities, were still struggling to buy their way out yesterday. As a result, bond prices again shot upward in the thin market, with the quality issues leading the way. One of the best examples given by dealers was the stunning runup in Pacific Telephone 9 of 2011. That issue jumped from $960 for a $1,000 face bond to $1,025 during last week.

title: Lunch at La Caravelle: Noonish, Cool Upstairs, Dawnish and Hot Below
description: It is 7:30 A.M. and while most people haven't even stumbled into their kitchens for breakfast, Roger Fessaguet is already thinking about lunch.

title: Indispensable Laotian
description: Of the three wars under way in Indochina eighteen months ago, that in Cambodia continues as before; in Vietnam, little progress has been made toward a political settlement, while the ceasefire is honored mostly in the breach.

title: Britain Obtains Loan From Iran; Revamps Taxes to Aid Economy
description: LONDON, July 22The Government announced a series of measures today to prop the sagging British economy, curtail inflation and bolster public con fidence in the business outlook.

title: Britain Obtains Loan From Iran; Revamps Taxes to Aid Economy
description: LONDON, July 22The Government announced a series of measures today to prop the sagging British economy, curtail inflation and bolster public confidence in the business outlook.

title: The Senate's Loss
description: Senator Wayne Morse of Oregon was too much the maverick to be a reliable party man, too much the gadfly to be a hero of the Senate Establishment, too much the independent to be predictable even in his proved liberalism. He was a superb public servantnot in spite of those attributes but because of them.

title: Army to Permit Hunt For Fabled Treasure
description: SANTA FE, N. M., July 22 (UPI)  The Army told Gov, Bruce King today that it would allow access to the White Sands Missile Range for a search for the fabled Victorio Peak gold treasure.

title: MISSILE HITS COPTEI IN A LUZON ACCIDEN1
description: MANILA, July 22 (AP)A heatseeking missile from a United States Navy F4 Phan tom jet accidentally hit a Navy helicopter today and the six men aboard the helicopter are missing, the Navy reported.

title: Britain Announces She Will Meet With Turkey and Greece on the Cyprus Crisis
description: LONDON, July 22Foreign Secretary James Callaghan announced today that Britain, Turkey and Greece would begin talks on the Cyprus situation later this week in Geneva.

title: Punches Are Thrown, Not Pulled In 2d GiantsJet sCombined Drill
description: FAIRFIELD, Conn., July 22 It was like old times between the Giants and Jets during their 90minute combined workout today, even with rookies and free agents in the lineup.

title: Wayne Morse Dies; A Senator 24 Years
description: Former Senator Wayne Morse of Oregon, a strong early critic of the Vietnam war and a longtime Congressional liberal. died yesterday of kidney failure in Good Samaritan Hospital, Portland, Ore. He was 73 years old.

title: CITY ENJOINS TIMES ON SOUTH AFRICA ADS
description: The New York Times was barred yesterday by the New York City Commission on Human Rights from running classified advertisements for employment in racially segregated South Africa.

description: Peck & Peck, Inc., one of. New York's oldest and bestknown specialty apparel chains, and its parent concern, Brooks Industries, Inc., filed petitions, yesterday for reorganization under the Chapter XI provisions of the Federal Bankruptcy Act.

description: After 1,3 years of battling largescale redevelopment plans and sponsoring its own humanscale alternative, a Greenwich Village group yesterday formally opened the fruits of its labor: a cluster of fivestory cooperative apartment buildings spread over six blocks at the Village's western fringe,

title: News Summary and Index
description: Turkish invasion forces and Greek Cypriote troops continued fighting past a ceasefire deadline in Cyprus, but by nightfall the United Nations command reported that the gunfire had halted. in Washington, Secretary of State Kissinger said the danger of war between Greece and Turkey had been overcome. [1:8.]

title: U.S. Agents Linked to Vesco in Bugging Search
description: WASHINGTON, July 22 (AP) Robert L. Vesco, the fugitive financier, paid $3,000 to have Federal drug agents search his home and offices for hidden electronic bugging devices, a Senate subcommittee was told today.

title: Suit on I.R.S. Records. Filed
description: WASHINGTON, July 22 (AP) An organization affiliated with Ralph Nader sued today for the right to inspect Internal Revenue Service records on activist organizations and individuals. The suit, filed in United States District Court by the Public Citizen's Tax Research Group, asks for all memorandums and documents relating to an I.R.S. special compliance staff That operated from March, 1969, until August, 1973.

description: To the Editor:

title: ANKARA CLAIMING PERMANENT BASE
description: ANKARA, Turkey, July 22Premier Bulent Ecevit asserted today that Turkey accepted the ceasefire on Cyprus, but that the Turkish presence on, the island is now irrevocably. established.

title: Woman Charged in Slayings
description: FAYETTEVILLE, Ark., July 22 (UPI)  The police filed murder charges today against Mrs. Shirley Marie Curry, 37 years old, who is accused of a weekend shooting rampage that left five persons dead, including her former husband and her three children. he police said that Mrs. Curry had acted after losing custody of her 14yearold son in a court hearing Friday.

title: Nonpartisan Mr. Jenner
description: The grounds cited by Republican members of the House Judiciary Committee for easing out Albert E. Jenner Jr. as their chief counsel and replacing him with Sam Garrison, a former member of Spiro T. Agnew's VicePresidential staff, display a dangerous misunderstanding on their part of the nature of the impeachment process. Representative McClory of Illinois, second ranking Republican on the committee, explains that it was necessary to replace Mr. Jenner because he has taken a strong position proimpeachment entirely in line with the Democratic leadership.... Consequently, in order that the Republicans can be served, weneed the action of, the partisan service of Mr. Garrison.

title: Wood, Field &
description: Much has been written about the selectivity of fish their sometimes maddening preference for a certain type of food, whether insect or fish, that happens to be in great supply at the momentbut seldom mentioned is a trait that for lack of a better phrase I shall describe as the feasting effect.

title: BYRNE TO PUT OFF INCOMETAX VOTE
description: TRENTON, July 22  The Byrne administration acknowledged this evening that it. did not have the necessary support for its income tax propoSal in the State Senate and asked that the measure be withdrawn and not put to a vote at the Senate session on Wednesday. The action appeared to have killed the tax proposal at least until the fall.

title: BAYLOR GIVEN GRANT FOR HEART PROJECTS
description: HOUSTON, July 22The Federal Government granted Baylor College of Medicine$13.3million today to establish the nation's first center aimed at integrating heart disease research with the prevention and treatment of heart disease.

title: Advertising: Bad Mouthwash
description: If you haven't heard about Dr. Tichenor's Anteseptic (Badder than Listerine), then you either don't ride the subways or don't read the ads on them,

title: Brazil Seeks Trade With Red Lands
description: BRASILIA, July 22  Open house at the new Soviet Embassy, talk of establishing diplomatic relations with China and toneddown rhetoric against Cuba are signs of the times in the Brazilian capital.

title: Toll Is 4 in Illinois Blast
description: DECATUR, Ill., July 22 (UPI)  The death toll from a tank car explosion Friday in this central Illinois city was four today. Three persons are in critical condition. Two persons died yesterday. An engineer, Bobby W. Olinger, 33 years old of Mexico, Ind., and a switchman, Clyde Rucker, 26, Mount Zion, Ill., had suffered burns. Two persons died Friday when they were trapped in a bunkhouse and diner when the explosion occurred, and 140 were injured.

title: Policewoman Dismissed From Force Over Charges Involving Male Partner
description: A Queens policewoman has been dismissed from the force after a tangled series of departmental trials on charges that she arrested and harassed a woman who was a witness against her at a disciplinary hearing and that she and her male partner attempted to gain revenge on a commanding officer by accusing him of sexual abuse.

title: Treasury Bills Fell At the Weekly Sale
DOCTORS WARNED ON MEDICAID USE
description: Declaring that he was fed up with fraud and other abuses in the treatment of Medicaid patients, Health Commissioner Lowell E. Bellin announced yesterday that any practitioner found guilty of such abuses would be banned permanently from operating under Medicaid.

title: EARNINGS CLIMB AT THE BOEING CO.
description: The Boeing Company, builder of jet aircraft, said yesterday that while its operations were being impacted by inflationary pressures, a substantial reduction in its interest expense and continued favorable performance on major programs had enabled it to report increased second quarter and first half earnings.

title: Nixon Backers Begin Fast and Prayer Vigil at Capitol
description: WASHINGTON, July 22 (AP)About 350 supporters of President Nixon gathered on the steps of the Capitol today to begin what they said would be a 72hour fast and prayer session.

title: Stock Index Up by 2.42; Volume at a 3Week Low
description: The stock market managed to po'st a slight gain yesterday althOugh volume fell to its lowest level in almost three weeks.

title: One of 2 Perjury Counts Against ReineckeVoided
description: WASHINGTON, July 22One of the two counts in the per jury trial of Lieut. Gov. Ed Reinecke of California was dmissed today by Federal District Judge Barrington D. Parker.

title: Lottery Numbers
description: The winning New York daily lottery number yesterday was: 221995

title: 20% Rise in Taxi Fares To Be Weighed by City
description: The Taxi and Limousine ,Commission will hold its next meeting Aug. I and will then consider again a request by the owners of the city's 6,000 fleet taxicabs for permission to raise their rates by 20.5 per cent.

title: INQUIRY IS OPENED BY CAMDEN JURY
description: CAMDEN, July 22 (UPI)A Camden County grand jury began hearing testimony today in an investigation of a City Councilman's charges of mismanagement and sabotage within the city's Police Department.

title: New York Team Achieves Bridge: Upset in QuarterFinal Play
GEORGE SMITH, 77, OF SURGICAL FIRM
description: George F. Smith, president of Johnson & Johnson, manufacturers of surgical dressings, from 1943 to his retirement in 1960, died yesterday at the University of Pennsylvania Hospital in Philadelphia. He was 77 years old and lived at 110 Clive Street Edison, N.J.

title: BEAN RESPONDS TO GOLDIN AUDITS AS 3D IS RELEASED
description: With a lowkey lecture on municipal finance, Mayor Beame tried yesterday to dampen the political damage done to his image of fiscal.expertise by three audits depicting sloppy bookkeeping and multimilliondollar discrepancies in the books when he was running the Controller's office.

title: New Yonkers Meeting Features Win, Place and Show Business
description: YONKERS, July 22Before the marshal called the trotters for the first time at Yonkers Raceway tonight, Murray the K, the disk jockey, called the faithful.

title: Closing? No, It's S.R.O. At Circle in the Square
description: The Circle in the Square has replaced its Going Out of Business sign with Standing Room Only.

title: Republicans Continue to Delay Debate on Strip Mining
description: WASHINGTON, July 22Republicans in the House of Representatives continued today to impede debate on a. measure to impose the first Federal environmental controls on the strip mining of coal.

title: General Foods Up 6 %
description: The country's two largest food processors reported their earnings yesterday with divergent results. The Kraftco Corporation, the No. 1 food processor, reported a 61.6 per cent, decline in earnings for the secand quarter, while the General Foods Corporation showed a modest gain of 6.7 per cent for its first fiscal quarter ended June 29.

title: 62 of 265 Commercial Plasma Centers Suspended by F.D.A. Within a Year
description: WASHINGTON, July 22 Within the last year the Food and Drug Administration orI tiered the closing of nearly a quarter of all commercial blood plasma collection and fractionation facilities in the country for endangering donors and users of the blood products.

title: Canadian Bank Prime Up
description: TORONTO, July 22 (Reuters)  The Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce said today its prime rate would be increased to 11 per cent from 11 per cent effective immediately.

title: Women on the Move
description: Under pressure, companies are offering more jobs involving relocation to women. These promotions requiring transfers are resulting in a rise in family relocations in the increasingly common, twocareer marriage. Page 60.

title: NATO URGES PARLEY ON FUTURE OF CYPRUS
description: BRUSSELS, July 22 (UPI)The Western allies of Greece and Turkey urged them today to follow up the Cyprus ceasefire with prompt and successful discussions on the island's future.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE GREATEST OF ALL. The 1927 New York Yankees, By John Mosedale. 220 pages. Illustrated. Dial. $7.95.

title: BYRNE TO PUT OFF INCOMETAX VOTE
description: TRENTON, July 22.  The Byrne administration acknowledged this evening that it did not have the necessary support for its income tax proposal in the State Senate and asked that the measure be withdrawn and not put to a vote at the Senate session on Wednesday. The action appeared to have killed the tax proposal at least until the fall.

title: Market Place: Con Ed's Board Meets on Payout
description: The focus is on Consolidated Edison today, The utility's directors meet to discuss the common stock dividend for the quarter amid apprehension that once again the quarterly payout will be passed.

title: The Baltic Is Cold but East Germans Find Consolations in a Luxury Hotel
description: WARNEMUNDE, East GermanyThe water is frigid and the wind is fresh out of the north, sending storm clouds scudding over the Baltic, but it is vacation time again, and East Germansnot allowed to travel to sunnier capitalist climesare making the most of it.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: New York City's women amateur golfers started their week of. competition yesterday toward a metropolitan championship final, teeing off for 18hole rounds at the 13 municipal coutses, It was the first time that simultaneous play for women has been held in a citywide event.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: Books in Peril, an extensive exhibition designed to alert the public to the causes of deterioration of books and other printed material has been mounted at the New York. Public Library, Fifth Avertue and 42d Street. The exhibition illustrates the dam4ging effect of air pollution, temperature extremes, humidity and acids in the paper and emphasizes techniques for conserving or restoring printed matter.

title: 6 in Soviet Ask Waldheim To Aid Jailed Crimean Tatar
description: MOSCOW, July 22 (Reuters) Six Soviet dissidents, including Andrei D. Sakharov, the physicist, have appealed to Secretary General Waldheim and the International Red Cross to intervene for a Crimean Tatar reported to be on a hunger strike in prison.

title: Broadcast Funds Approved
description: WASHINGTON, July 22 (AP)  The Senate passed today a bill authorizing $49.8million for Radio Free Europe and Radio Liberty in the fiscal year that began July 1. The bill goes to a SenateHouse conference.

title: Bitex in Bankruptcy Petition
description: The Bitex Corporation, a textile manufacturer in Farmingdale, filed yesterday a petition under Chapter XI of the Federal Bankruptcy Act in the United States District Court for the Eastern District of New York. The company listed total assets of $2.57million and liabilities of $2.09million.

title: Unchallenged City Vault Entry Brought About Tighter Security
description: An official of the Controller's office, newly hired and not known by sight, walked unchallenged into a city vault in the Municipal Building containing a billion dollars in securities. He was not questioned until he was standing in the vault.

title: U.S. Aides Voice Concern To Seoul on Political Trials
description: SEOUL, South Korea, July 20 American officials here are privately indicating their concern to South Koreans over the possible effect that the current wave of political trials may have on continued United States support for this country.

title: Chavez Seeks a Halt to Nation's Worst Influx of Illegal Aliens
description: FRESNO, Calif., July 22Cesar Chavez, president of.the United Farm Workers of America demanded here. last week that the Border Patrol crack down on illegal alien workers.

title: Socal's Forced Retirees Wary of Investing Windfall
description: LOS ANGELES, July 22If the windfall Van E. Beck recently received in the mail had come a year earlier, he Would have had no doubts about what to do with it, he says.

title: To Our Readers
description: The text of the second and final installment of the Summary of Information presented to the House Judiciary Committee ,Friday by John M. Doar, the committee's special counsel, appears on Pages 20 to 27.

title: Intrepid Beats
116,689 Doctors Licensed in 1973, Biggest Gain Ever
description: More than 16,000 new doctors received licenses to practice medicine in the United States during 1973, registering the largest oneyear gain in medical manpower ever, according to statistics compiled by the American Medical Association and reported in the A.M.A.'s current Journal.

title: BirthControl Drive Focuses on TeenAgers
description: Planned Parenthood of New York City announced yesterday that it had started an ambitious birth control campaign focusing for the first time on teenagers.

title: GreekTurkish OilField Dispute In Aegean Remains Unresolved
description: PARIS, July 22  A dispute between Greece and Turkey over oil rights in the Aegear Sea continues to simmer al though it has been overshad owed by the fighting in Cyprus

title: Bookstore Chains Say Bargain Price Tops the List of BestSelling Ideas
description: We're not book collectors, we're not running a library, and we don't stock books because we like them, Russell Hoyt said the other day. We try to keep ourselves disciplined.

title: ST. CLAIR SILENT ON OBEYING COURT
description: LAGUNA BEACH, Calif., July 22President Nixon's chief defense attorney, James D. St. Clair, refused under repeated questioning this evening to say whether the President would obey a Supreme Court order to turn subpoenaed evidence over to the special Watergate prosecutor.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, July 22 (Reuters)The House Ways and Means Committee tentatively decided today to give tax breaks to bankholding companies required to divest their nonbanking businesses.

title: People in Sports
description: Archie Manning is in the mid le of a tugofwar. The Memphis Southmen of the World Football League are tugging at his pursestrings with a threeyear contract reportedly worth $1million., But the New Orleans Saints of the National Football League are fighting back by tugging at their star quarterback's heartstrings.

title: Moscow Bombarded By GrapeSized Hail
description: MOSCOW, July 22Downtown Moscow, which roasted most of the day in temperatures exceeding 100 degrees, was bombarded this afternoon by a storm of hailstones the size of grapes.

title: Egypt in Oil Search Pacts With 3 U.S. Companies
description: CAIRO, July 22 (Reuters)Egypt has signed oil prospecting agreements with three United States companiesthe Mobil Oil Corporation; the Amoco International Oil Company, a subsidiary of the Standard Oil Company (Indiana), and the Union Oil Companyunder her new open door economic policy.

title: Changing Face of U. S. Sports: TV Saturation and Its Effects
description: Professional football games will he available six days a week on television next month, but Leonard Kessler has had it as an armchair quarterback.

title: 2 Groups of U.S. Students Caught in Cyprus by War
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., July 22 (UPI)No word has been received as to the whereabouts of about 60 Harvard University students in Cyprus.

title: J. H. Farnham Jr. Weds Miss Dunlap
description: Christine Meta Dunlap, executive secretary of the Colonial Dames of America, was married in the Quogue (LI.) Chapel yesterday after noon to Joseph Hollister Farnham Jr., an account executive with Johnson & Higgins, insurance brokers. The Rev. Thomas C. Truscott rerformed the Presbyterian ceremony.

title: AMEX PRICES RISE IN SLOW TRADING
Velasquez, Back From Coast Triumph, Wins 1 of 2 Big A Races
description: Jorge Velasquez admitted that he was tired yesterday, but he wasn't too tired to win one of the two races in which he rode at Aqueduct. The Panamanian jockey confessed to fatigue from At the his tight traveling schedule after having won the $350,000 match race at Hollywood Park last Saturday. In that event he guided Carl Rosen's Chris Evert to a 50length triumph over Aaron Jones's Miss Musket.

title: Citibank Says Thai Economy Is in a Pervasive Recession
Notes on People
description: A former paratrooper whO was wounded in both the Korean and Vietnam wars assumed command yesterday as superintendent of the United States Military Academy at West Point. He is Maj. Gen. Sidney Berry, the 48yearold former commandant of the 101st Airborne Division, at Fort Campbell, Ky. He and Mrs. Berry took up residence in the superintendent's quarters after official ceremonies, during which he formally assumed command of the Point. A native of Hattiesburg, Miss., General Berry is the 50th superintendent of the academy.

title: Jordan Urges Arab Parley To Coordinate Peace View
description: AMMAN, Jordan, July 22 (UPI)Jordan called today for a meeting of the Foreign Ministers of Jordan, Egypt and Syria, and a representative of the Palestine Liberation Organization to coordinate the Arab stand toward Middle East peace negotiations.

title: MURDER SUSPECT HAS U.S. LOAN AID
description: LeRoy Barnes, accused of murder and listed by the police as a top narcotics dealer, emerged in a court hearing yesterday as principal owner of a Michigan housing project under construction with a $4.6million Federal loan guarantee.

title: NEW ORDERS DIP IN DURABLE GOODS
description: WASHINGTON, July 22New orders flowing tc manufacturers of durable goods declined slightly in June after two months of strong increases, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Paris for Fall: Listless Start and Why Revive the 40's?
description: PARIS, July 22The biggest inspiration at today's first of the fall couture showings was in the audience. As if by signal, everybody decided to leave their pants suits at home and turn up in skirts.

title: New Jersey Sports Polo for the People
description: PLUCKEMIN, July 22Almost 40 years ago Dr. George Carden played polo against Pete Bostwick in a national polo tournament on the fields of the Burnt Mills Club.

title: For a Grain Reserve
description: WASHINGTON Advocates of a grain reserve have been around for a long time. Joseph had the first published proPosalin the Old Testament  and since then many people have talked of the importance of establishing an evernormal granary. A reserve of essential feed grains to protect people and nations against crop failure and famine always has been a sound idea, but the case for one is especially strong today.

title: The Kissinger Affair
description: WASHINGTON  Once again, the Senate Foreign Relations Committee has marched up the hill and down the hill and accomplished nothing.

title: Bandit Uses Blunderbuss
description: LANSING, Mich., July 22 (UPI)  A lone bandit who robbed an ice cream parlor last night used an unusual weapon  a blunderbuss. The police said that the gunman, who got away with $254, used a muzzleloading flintlock handgun similar to ones used in Revolutionary War times. The police did not know whether the weapon worked. The bandit did not fire it.

title: Mre Ford ideris His Lead
description: Dr. Gallup reports that Vice President Ford has moved into a big lead, for the Republican Presidential nomination, which is the most surprising news since Ron Ziegler last declared Richard Nixon not guilty.

title: Families Adapting as More Women Take Job Transfers
description: When Marina von Neumann Whitman was named to President Nixon's Council of Economic Advisers in the fall of 1972, her husband took a leave of absence from the University of Pittsburgh, where he was chairman of the English department, to join her and their two children in Washington.

title: Moves to Liberalize Politics in Spain Get Under Way
description: MADRID, July 22  While Generalissimo Francisco Franco lay seriously ill in a Madrid hospital, a few moves got under way to liberalize the authoritarian political system he imposed on Spain after his Civil War victory in 1939.

title: Republican Right Preparing for Comeback
description: SAN FRANCISCO, July 22The Republican right is preparing for a comeback.Administration policies in foreign affairs, on deficit spending, on wageandprice controts, on the energy crisis, on almost everything.detente to the Soviet, Union and practicing deficit spending.

title: Lagging Turkish Drive
description: Despite initial advantages of surprise, command of the air and numerical superiority, the Turkish forces invading Cyprus have won only one of four primary objectives in three days of fighting.

title: Republicans Pick Binghamton Judge To Run for Court of Appeals Bench
description: The Republican state organization yesterday chose Appellate Division Justice Louis M. Greenblott of Binghamton as the party's second nominee for the Court of Appeals, filling the vacancy left on the ticket when Judge Samuel Rabin declined the Republican nomination last month.

title: Unchallenged City Vault Entry Brought About Tighter Security
description: An official of the Controller's office, newly hired and not known by sight, walked unchallenged into a city vault in the Municipal Building containing billion dollars in securities. He was not questioned until he was standing in the vault.

title: 2 Hold Up Bank in Brooklyn
description: A young man and a young woman who entered the East New York Savings Bank at 2644 Atlantic Avenue at Pennsylvania Avenue in Brooklyn and presented a note to a teller demanding your small bills escaped with $2,300 yesterday afternoon. The couple entered the bank 10 minutes before closing time, received the cash and walked out of the bank before other bank personnel realized what had happened. Brooklyn detectives and the Federal Bureau of Investigation are Investigating.

title: Amtrak Will Buy 7 Turbine Trains For Run to Boston
description: WASHINGTON, July 22 (AP)  The Department of Transportation agreed today to let Amtrak buy seven new highspeed turbinepowered trains to improve passenger service between Boston and New York City.

title: Sunoco Ads Ruled Deceptive, But Correction Is Denied
description: WASHINGTON, July 22 (AP) A Federal Trade Commission official ruled today that Sun Oil Company's 260 Action advertisements for its Sunoco gasoline were deceptive but rejected proposals by the commission staff to make the company run corrective ads.

title: ANKARA CLAIMING PERMANENT BASI
description: ANKARA, Turkey, July 22Premier Bulent Ecevit assertei today that Turkey accepted the ceasefire on Cyprus, but tha the Turkish presence on th island is now irrevocably estab lished.

title: Amin Offers Support For Mahanos's Return
description: KAMPALA, Uganda, July 22 (Agence FrancePresge)President Idi Amin of Uganda has offered President Makarios the use of his good offices to obtain the removal of foreign forces from Cyprus, it was announced here today.

title: I.R.A. TAPS PHONES OF BRITISH ARMY
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, July 22 (Reuters)  The Irish Republican Army today claimed to have breached British Army security by tapping telephone lines to military headquarters for several weeks and uncovering a network of informers.

title: Newsmen Held Captive In a Crazyguile War
description: KARAVAS, Cyprus, July 22Soldiers boots made a crunching sound as they strode across the glassstrewn floor of the hotel lobby.

title: Baryshnikov Cites Soviet Curb on Art
description: Mikhail Baryshnikov, the 26yearold Soviet ballet sti who defected last month Toronto, said he would nevi have done so if Soviet authorities had allowed him to spend periods abroad as a guest artist with foreig companies to develop creatively.

title: City Beaches Less Than Safe, Lifeguards Say
description: Representatives of the city's 452 lifeguards contended yesterday that the city's five public beaches were less than safe because there were too few lifeguards and much of their lifesaving equipment is obsolete.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: At least a dozen alterations will have to be made the new $33million Westchester County Courthouse here before it can be certified as a court facility by the state, according to a spokesman for the State Commission Correction.

title: Both Sides Agreed on a Truce After U.S. Spurred Efforts in Fear of Greek Coup
description: WASHINGTON, July 22Secretary of State Kissinger said today that the ceasefire agreement between Greece and Turkey last night was the result of an American proposal, offered when negotiations to stop the fighting on Cyprus seemed bogged down and when reports began reaching Washington that a coup was brewing in Greece.

title: Inco Sues to Curb ESB's Comments on Stock Bid
description: The International Nickel Company of Canada, Ltd., said yesterday that it had filed suit to restrain the management of ESB, Inc., of Philadelphia from making alleged false statements in opposing Inco's tender of fer for all of ESB's common, stock. The suit, filed Saturday in the United States Court for the Southern District of New York, charged that Frederick J. Port, president and chief executive officer, and other ESB officials issued untrue statements and engaged in fraudulent, deceptive and manipulative acts after Inco said it planned to offer $28 a share for and all shares of ESB.

title: Crime and Rehabilitation
description: Controller Arthur Levitt has released a disturbing audit showing that the recidivism rate among former state prison inmates is rising. Corrections Commissioner Peter Preiser's response to this report and to the criticisms it contains is inadequate and disappointing.

title: Judge Gesell Voids One of Four Counts Against Ehrlichman
description: WASHINGTON, July 22 John D. Ehrlichman, former chief domestic counselor to President Nixon, was acquitted today of one of the four felony counts on which he had been convicted in connection with the burglary of a Los Angeles psychiatrist's office.

title: Judge Gesell Voids Dne of Four Counts Against Ehrlichman
description: WASHINGTON July 22John D. Ehrlichman, former chief domestic counselor to President Nixon, was acquitted today of one of the four felony counts on which he had been convicted in connection with the burglary of a Los Angeles psychiatrist's office.

title: Davis Cup Results EUROPEAN ZONE'A SEMIFINALS
description: RUMANIA 3, FRANCE 2

title: Court Upholds Contempt Ruling On Radio Official in Hearst Case
description: SAN FRANCISCO, July 22 (AP)The United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit has affirmed the contempt conviction of a Los Angeles radio station, manager for refusing to surrender an original tape recording from the selfstyled Symblonese Liberation Army.

title: People in Sports
description: Archie Manning is in the middle of a tugofwar. The Memphis Southmen of the World Football League are tugging at his pursestrings with a threeyear contract reportedly worth $1million. But the New Orleans Saints if the National Football League are fighting back by tugging at their star quarterback's heartstrings.

title: STEEL PRODUCTION ROSE FROM ITS LOW
PAY RAISES GIVEN AT VILLAGE VOICE
description: Pay raises described as substantial have been awarded to staff writers and other editorial personnel at The Village Voice, which merged last month with New York magazine.

title: BRENNAN DEFENDS JOB SAFETY AIDE
description: WASHINGTON, July 22Labor Secretary Peter J. Brannan defended the Labor Departmeat today against allegations that political fundraising had underminded a Federal program to protect the health and safety of American workers.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Alan Sagner, New Jersey's Transportation Commissioner, said yesterday that he did not think the plan for a South Jersey public transportation authority was a good idea.

title: 60 Attend a Conference To Aid Black Concerns
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, July 22 Sixty business people from minority groups convened here today for a twoday Conference on Education and Training for Minority Business Enterprises designed to exchange ideas and receive suggestions for success in a competitive market place.

title: Hunters Snare Alligators for Conservation
description: MARSH ISLAND, La,, July 19"Listen, one of the men said. Across the darkening marsh came an unbroken hum, neither high nor low in pitch, It might have been the A string of a violin, flat and unvarying, first far away then steadily closer as the night grew darker.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: URBANITY It looks like a real New York bar, with a low ceiling and a smoky atmosphere, but O'Lunney's, at 915 Second Avenue, near 45th Street, is one of the most popular places in town for Country and Western music. It was a regular Irish bar until a year or so ago, when it was converted to meet the growing popular taste for twanging guitars.

title: City Parks Chief Opposes Route Of Rail Spur. to Kennedy Airport
description: Edwin L. Weis Jr., the city's Parks Administrator, last night) assailed the planned routing of the passenger railroad link across Forest Park, Queens, to Kennedy International Airport and said that he was opposed at this stage to granting the construction permit.

title: Greeks Upset by Rumors Of Changes in Leadership
description: ATHENS, July 22Greeks reacted to the agreement on a ceasefire in Cyprus today with relief, humiliation and mild panic over widespread rumors of impending changes in the Greek Government.

title: CITICORP REDUCES SIZE OF OFFERING
description: Citicorp's controversial offering of floatingrate notes has run into customer resistance, and as a result it has been reduced to $650million. The company had planned to sell $850million of the novel securities.

title: Results Highest for Any Three or Six Months
Drop for Talcott Reported In Commercial Paper Sale
description: James Talcott, Inc., the commercial finance subsidiary of the Talcott National Corporation, was reported yesterday as having experienced sharply decreased sales of its commercial paper since early May, when its commercial paper rating was withdrawn by Moody's Investors Service.

title: 2 Young Bike Thieves Kill Youth Who Chased Them
description: A high school student, who was so bright, his friends called him the professor, was stabbed to death yesterday as he tried to detain two youths Who had stolen another boy's 10speed bicycle near a Bronx playground, the police said.

title: Lower, Head of ABC News, Getting a Corporate Post
description: Elmer W. Lower, who was credited within the industry with helping to build ABC network news programs into healthy competitors with CBS and NBC, is scheduled to move from president of ABC News to vice president of corporate affairs for the American Broadcasting Companies.

title: Bank of England Profits Up
description: LONDON, July 22 (Reuters)The Bank of England announced today record profits of $69.3million for the year ended last February. Profits were $11.7million higher than in 1972.

title: To Our Readers
description: The text of the second and final installment of the Summary of Information presented to the House Judiciary Committee Friday by John M. Doer, the committee's special; counsel, appears on Pages 20 to 27.

title: G.O.P. Counsel Wary on Impeachment
description: WASHINGTON, July 22The House Judiciary Committee's newly designated Republican special counsel contended today that the House should not impeach President Nixon unless it appeared probable that he would be convicted in a Senate trial and removed from office.

title: RATING ON ECONOMY AT NEW LOW IN POLL
description: Louis Harris says a new poll shows that the American public's opinion of the Nixon Administration's economic policy has hit an alltime low.

title: Tennis Results
description: Arthur Ashe, Miami, defeated Chico Hager, La Jolla, Calif., 4.6, 6.2, 6.4; Rayno Seegers, South Africa, defeated Charlie Pasarell, Puerto Rico, 7.6, 6.2; Harold Solomon, Silver Spring, Md., defeated Joa quirt LoneMayo, Mexico, 6.1, 6.7; John Alexander, Australia, defeated Alvaro Bettancourt, Colombia, 6.3, 7.6; Vic Amara, Holland, Mich., defeated George Hardie, Dallas, 6.3, 6.2; Paul Kronlc, Australia, deleafed Colin Dibley, Australia, 6.3 4.6, 7.6; Jaime Fillol, Chile, defeated Syd Ball, Australia, 7S, 6.7; Pat Cornelo, Chile, defeated Steve Krulevitz, Baltimore, 6.4, 6.2; Prom Lail, India, defeated Ton Edlefsen, Los Angeles, 64. 64; John Lloyd, Britain, defeated Roy Barth, San Diego, 6.3, 62.

title: Doar Argument Cites Ehrlichman Notes
description: WASHINGTON, July 22John D. Ehrlichman's personal White House notes sluiw that President Nixon discussed setting tip a nonlegal White House investigations unit three weeks after the Pentagon papers were published in The New York Times in June, 1971.

title: Ridgefield Park Suit Asks End to Dumping by County
description: The village of Ridgefield Park, which 22 years ago gave more than 50 acres of its meadowland along Overpeck Creek for park development to Bergen County, has filed suit to force the county to stop dumping garbage there and immediately begin development of the park, or give the land back.

title: U.S Seeks Access to Seaman in Soviet
description: MOSCOW, July 22  The United States Embassy, having determined that a Soviet seaman who tried to defect to the United States four years ago is in fact an American citizen, is now seeking access to him in a Soviet prison.

title: U.S. Is Stepping Up Disease Defenses After Its First Plague Death in 5 Years
description: SANTE FE, N.M., July 22The nation's first death from plague in five years, coupled with increasing spread of the bacterial infection among animals, has led Federal health officials to step up protective measures against the ancient disease, which is endemic throughout the Western United States.

title: Live TV to Cover Inquiry doted by House and Panel
description: WASHINGTON, July 22The House of Representatives and its Judiciary Committee voted today to permit live television and radio coverage of the committee's final impeachment inquiry sessions starting Wednesday.

title: Lilt Darvas, Actress of Stage and Film, Dies at 72
description: Lili Darvas, whose career as a leading Continental and American actress spanned more than 50 years, died yesterday afternoon at her New York home. She was 72 years old and lived at 240 East 79th Street.

title: No Rest for the Weary Bettor As Sports Proliferate, Overlap
description: Sports expansion and its accompanying flood of television exposure are changing the betting habits of America's fans. Instead of resting between seasons, as they used to do, sports fans now find themselves betting on football in July, baseball in October, basketball and hockey in May

title: Goldin Campaign Vow And the Results to Date
description: When he was campaigning as the Democratic nominee for Controller last year, Harrison J. Goldin promised that outside auditors would be brought in to scrutinize the office.

Greeks Upset by Rumors Of Changes in Leadership

title: U.N. REPORTS CYPRUS CEASEFIRE; TURKS ASSERT THEY WILL REMAIN; INTERNAL UNEASE NOTED IN GREECE
description: Turkish invasion forces and Greek Cypriote troops continued fighting past a ceasefire deadline on Cyprus yesterday, but by nightfall the United Nations command on the island reported that the gunfire had halted and the truce had begun.

title: People and Business
description: George L. Staff, formerly vice chairman and most recently an executive vice president of Burlington Industries, Inc., announced his resignation yesterday after 19 years with the country's largest textiles producer. Last Friday, asked about reports that he was resigning, Mr. Staff vigorously denied them. I have absolutely no intention of resigning, he said.

title: Onondaga Chiefs Move to Evict 15 Whites Living on Reservation
description: SYRACUSE, July 22  The Onondaga Indian Council of Chiefs was preparing tonight to evict 15 white people living on the Onondaga Reservation near here. The chiefs voted on March 16 to evict them because of overcrowding on the reservation and fears that growing conflicts between whites and Indians might lead to violence.The original eviction notices were served on more than 30 white families, some of which represented mixed marriages between whites and Indians. The deadline of June 30 was extended for 22 days last month to maintain the peace and friendship that has existed between our people, the Six Nation Confederacy and the people of the United States of America,

title: Punches Are Thrown, Not Pulled In 2d GiantsJet sCombined Drill
description: FAIRFIELD, Conn., July 22 It was like old times between the Giants and Jets during their 90minute combined workout today, even with rookies and free agents in the lineup.

title: Impeachment: Constitutional Phase
description: Resolved, that the House of Representatives does impeach Richard M. Nixon, of high crimes and misdemeanors in the conduct of his office, as set forth in the following articles, in violation of the sacred obligation of his constitutional oath, faithfully to execute the office of President of the United States...

description: American League

title: ST. CLAIR SILENT ON OBEYING COURT
description: LAGUNA BEACH, Calif., July 22President Nixon's chief defense attorney, James D. St. Clair, refused under repeated questioning this evening to say whether the President would obey a Supreme Court order to turn subpoenaed evidence over to the special Watergate prosecutor.

description: Film

title: Bonn Protests East German Plan to Cut Traffic
description: BONN, July 22West Germany's representative in East Berlin, Gnter Gaus, delivered, a protest to the East German Foreign Ministry today against the Communist Government's, threat to prevent officials of the new West German environmental agency from using the highways to get to their offices in Berlin.

title: Alexander Kartveli, P47 Designer, Dead at 77

title: Arnett Cites Thurmond Role In Ouster as O.E.O. Chief
description: ATLANTA, July 22 (AP) Alvin J. Arnett says that three weeks before he was dismissed as director of the Office of Economic Opportunity he was told that Senator Strom Thurmond was putting pressure on the White House for his dismissal.

title: Cambodian General Unhurt As Rebels Ambush a Convoy
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, July 22 (UPI)  A jeep caravan carrying Brig. Gen. Chantarangsei, a highranking political and military official, was ambushed by rebel forces today. One soldier was killed and another wounded, but the general escaped without injury when insurgents opened fire, near Talat, 47 miles southwest of Phnom Penh on Route 4.

title: There's Big Noise in Chicago Chess: Despite Notable Absences
description: Although several of the topranked players are missing from the 1974 United States Championship, which began July 13 at the La Salle Hotel in Chicago the tournament is expected to produce many exciting games.

description: WASHINGTON, July 22In Moscow, he was listed among those American officials who participated in highlevel discussions on detente. In Amman, Jordan, he was addressed as His Excellency. At home and abroad, Ronald L. Ziegler is a constant and trusted confidant of the President.

title: Refunds For Fans
description: WASHINGTON, July 22 (AP)  Negotiations in the National Football League labor dispute collapsed today, further threatening the start of the preseason game schedule.

Ditoi'enzo, who said he had presided over a couple of thousand trials in his own courtroom a few blocks away, took the stand in his own defense in Brooklyn Supreme Court yesterday as the final witness in his trial.for perjury. Both: sides rested after he: had stepped down, and summations will begin today.

title: Dean Among Witnesses Sammoned for Strachan
description: WASHINGTON, July 22 (AP)John W. Dean 3d and Jeb Stuart Magruder are among those summoned to testify at a pretrial hearing for Gordon Strachan in the Watergate coverup case July 29, according to papers filed today in United States District Court.

title: U.N. Chief Acts to Assure Effective Force on Cyprus
