title: Dave Anderson
description: PITTSBURGH, July 22At today's assembly of dugout intellects for tomorrow night's AllStar game, the National League genius, Yogi Berra, named Henry Aaron as the third hitter in his batting order but declined to specify which outfield position the man with 725 home runs would play.

title: Ethiopian Premier Quits and Diplomat Succeeds to Post
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, July 22 (Reuters)Michael Imru, a diplomat and a relative of Emperor Haile Selassie, was appointed Premier tonight to replace Endalkachew Kakonnen, who resigned after five months in office.

title: EnglishSpeaking Whites in South Africa Seem to Be Drifting Into Political Apathy and Impotence
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, July 16  Englishspeaking white South Africans, a minority within a minority, have drifted into increasing political apathy and impotence and are even in danger of losing their dominance of economic affairs in this ethnically complex nation.

title: Silver Futures Up Daily Price Limit
description: Some aggressive buying, reportedly by a large Italian group, forced silver futures prices up the daily limit yesterday on the Commodity Exchange for all contracts except the current July delivery.

title: EARNINGS RISE 17% AT TIMES COMPANY
description: The New York Times Cornpany yesterday reported record revenues and profits for the second quarter and the first six months of 1974.

title: GreekAmericans Demonstrate At the U. N. in Support of Athens
description: More than 1,200 GreekAmericans demonstrated at the gates of: the Secretariat building of the United Nations last night, hoping to win public support for Greece in her dispute with Turkey over Cyprus.

title: L.I. ASSEMBLYMAN UNDER SCRUTINY
description: MINEOLA, L. I., July 22A Nassau County grand jury will investigate charges that Assemblyman Arthur J. Kremer had promised the Long Beach city police a pay raise in return for their support of Democratic candidates in last year's elections, Wililam Cahn, the District Attorney, said today.

title: FARM, CONSUMER AID APPROVED BY SENATE
description: WASHINGTON, July 22 (UPI) The Senate passed a bill today appropriating $13.5billion to fund agriculture, environment and consumer protection programs for the fiscal year which began July 1.

title: Jackson Office Guarded
description: WASHINGTON, July 22 (UPI) An armed guard is stationed outside the offices of Senator Henry M. Jackson's Senate Permanent Investigation Subcommittee, according to Senate sources. They said a secretary caught a welldressed man trying to pick the lock on the office door last week. The subcommittee is looking into charges that the Justice Department dropped an investigation of a multimillion dollar heroin operation when Robert L. Vescoe, the fugitive financier, was implicated.

title: Ceasefire in Cyprus
description: The fragile ceasefire on Cyprus and the projected tripartite negotiations in Geneva are a result of concerted peacekeeping efforts of the whole international community, rather than any one mediator, a fact of capital importance for the future.

title: Wayne Morse Dies; A Senator 24 Years
description: Former Senator Wayne Morse of Oregon, a strong early critic of the Vietnam war and a longtime Congressional liberal, died yesterday of kidney failure in Good Samaritan Hospital, Portland, Ore. He was 73 years old.

title: Connecticut Nominations Go to Cotter, Santaguida
description: HARTFORD, Tuesday, July 23Two days after having met in harmonious convention to nominate United States Representative Ella T. Grasso for Governor, Connecticut's Democrats joined in battle last night to pick their candidates for Congress.

title: New Faces Striving to Be Well Known In 16Man Race for Tennessee Governor
description: NASHVILLE, July 20  One formula for Democratic recovery in the New South is clear by now: Find a new face candidate, with access t6 new money, who can tip over the oldmachine Democrat with a television blitz or some other media gimmick in the party primary; then ease to election especially if the Republicans oblige by nominating a militant conservativewith a campaign of friendly, usually pale, progressivism.

title: Rod Carew Bitter Over Limited Play
description: PITTSBURGH, July 23 The American League's win atallcost game plan col lapsed early tonight and the deterioration was so bad that the league's leading hitter, Rod Carew, said never wanted to play in an other AllStar game.

title: Rejoicing Athenians Chant Demokratia!

A great chorus automobile horns began blow. ing at 7:12 P.M. as driver; heard on car radios the announcement that the military junta, had promised to turn the Government of Greece back to civilian hands.

title: 3 Held in Extortion
description: NEW ORLEANS, July 23 (UPI)Federal agents arrested Carlos J. Marcello, a rackets figure, and two other men today on a threecount indictment involving extortion and threats in an alleged attempt to muscle in on a Louisiana nightclub. Arrested along with Mr. Marcello, 64 years old, were Samuel A. Labruzzo, 34, and Peter G. Brown, 44, all of Metairie. At a hearing before united States Magistrate Ingard 0. Johannesen, Mr. Marcello's bond was set at $25.000: Mr. Labruno's at $10.000 and Mr. Brown's at $15,000.

title: Foreigners Were Held in Hotel As Hostages to Deter Gunfire

These include the severe limitation on what a person is allowed to earn by working without sacrificing his benefits; sex discrimination in the distribution of payments; and the unfair treatment of working wives in comparison with married women who may never have Worked outside the home.

Had the city taken advantage of the offers, the officers said, the discrepancies disclosed this month might have been uncovered, earlier and corrected before they became so large.

That line puts heaviest emphasis on reducing the borrowing pressures of the Federal Government th'e national economy.

William Simon said today he hoped that oil prices may soon be reduced because of the deflationary pressure exerted by a world surplus of about two million barrels of oil. But I don't see it diminishing significantly to reach: the level where it was, say, two years ago, said Mr. Simon during a stopover in the Italian capital after a tour of four Arab countries and Israel.

description: A 7yearold girl was struck and killed last night by a hitandrun driver as she crossed a Queens thoroughfare not far from where she lived at 15020 123d. Avenue in Jrmaica.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: NEWARK, July 23Henry P. Krumwiede will celebrate his 69th birthday on Aug. 8 by taking a 69mile bicycle trip from Lawrence Harbor to Asbury Park and back. Krumwiede, a lifelong resident of this city, is not a showoff. He is merely continuing a tradition he began on his 49th birthday, one mile for each year of his life.

description: Five young men, four of them members of a Brooklyn street gang called the Homicides, were arrested yesterday and charged with murdering 10yearold Bronx youth.

title: DiLorenzo Perjury Trial Goes to the Jury Tdday
description: Civil Court Judge Ross J. Lorenzo was portrayed yesterday at his perjury trial an upstanding public servant by his lawyer and as a skillful fabricator of a cheap up story for what really happened by the prosecutor.

title: Issue and Debate
description: WASHINGTON, July 23Representative Peter W. Rodino Jr. will walk into the hearing room of the House Judiciary Committee tomorrow evening and pound his gavel for order. The chatter will stop, the television cameras will switch on. The debate on the impeachability of Richard M. Nixon will begin.

title: Spanish Parliament Adopts,, Curbs on University Entry
description: MADRID, July 23The Spanish Parliament gave final approval today to a controversial bill setting up,examinations to limit entries into universities So strong was the opposition among students, parents associations and teachers that the Ministry of Education, which sought to institute the examinations for the fall term, was obliged to put them off until,, next year. The final vote was 384 to 51, With. 10 abstentions.

title: Fred F. Lininger, Official At Penn State, Led F.A.O.

Totality

title: Under New Law, City Grants Fewer Reduced Assessments
description: The City Tax Commission reported yesterday that it granted a total of $153.7million in reduced realestate assessments this year, $94million less than the $248million in reduced assessments allowed last year by Mayor John V. Lindsay's tax commissioners.

title: Nigeria to Check Results Of Controversial Census
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, July 23 (Agence France Presse)  The Nigerian leader, Gen. Yakubu Gowon, tonight announced that a nationwide check was to be made next Aug. 2 and 3 on Nigeria's controversial census results.

title: A Cradle of Democracy Often Rocked by Crises
description: Greece, the cradle of democracy, was often rocked by political turbulence in antiquity and againafter 2,000 years of foreign domination in her short modern history as a political entity. Nor did she gain stability after World War II.

title: Son and Milt Hinton. Join Teddy Wilson For Lively Rhythm
description: For 25 years or more, Teddy Wilson has been moving from job to job as a single, a solo pianist who plays by himself or picks up a rhythm section wherever he happens to be. In New York, with its wealth of musicians, many of whom relate to Mr. Wilson's style, he normally has a reasonable chance of good support.

title: Producer's Sales Rise
description: Mean Aluminum, Ltd., the world's second largest primary aluminum producer, more than doubled secondquarter and halfyear earnings with revenues exceeding the billiondollar mark for the first time in a ,halfyear period, the company's report disclosed yesterday. All figures set records.

title: FOOD PRICES DOWN IN MARKET BASKET
description: WASHINGTON, July 23 (AP) Retail prices of United States farmproduced food dropped onetenth of 1 per cent from May to June, the Agriculture Department said today in its monthly market report.

title: Sadat Warns Arabs to Coordinate Stand on Israel or Risk Civil War
description: CAIRO, July 23, (Reuters)President Anwar elSadat Of Egypt asserted today that civil war among the Arabs Was the only alternative to coordinating their attitudes toward a Middle Fast settlement.

description: WASHINGTON, July 23 (UPI)  The Senate passed legislation today to speed Federal court procedures by requiring that persons be tried within 90 days of arrest.

title: Watergate Kremlin, Zionism

Some months ago, in Peking, Premier Chou En lai told me Watergate was not called a scandal in China; it simply represented the kind of phenomenon expected of American society.

title: Durable Cypriote Leader Glafkos John Clerides
description: In a part of the world known for volcanic orators and fiery politicians, Glafkos John Clerides, the durable Greek Cypriote political leader, is notable for his calm; somuch so, in fact, that suspicious Turkish critics have been known to refer to him as kuzu kiligindakurt  a wolf camouflaged as a sheep.

title: Attorneys Vary Their Defenses For 5 in Kidnapping of L.I. Boy,
description: NEWARK, July 23 (UPI)Attorneys for five defendants charged with the kidnapping of 8yearold John Calzadilla on Long Island presented summations today, and tried either to fix the blame on each other's clients, dispute prosecution evidence or suggest insanity as a reason for the crime.

title: U. S. LISTS IDEAS
description: By EDWIN L. DALE Jr.

title: Reinecke Denies He Protected Mitchell in Controversy on Dates
description: WASHINGTON, July 23An assistant special prosecutor sought today to establish not only that Lieut. Gov. Ed Reinecke of California lied to the Senate Judiciary Committee in April, 1972, but also that he did so to protect former Attorney General John M. Mitchell.

title: L.I. Town Passes Replacement For Voided NudeDancing Ban
description: MANHASSET, L.I., July 23 The North Hempstead Towr Board today unanimously adopted an amended ordinance banning. topless and bottomless dancing in certain types of establishments to replace one that was ruled unconstitutional by Federal courts.

title: Dedication Postponed
description: BALTIMORE, July 23 (AP) The formal dedication of the Babe Ruth Birthplace Shrine and Museum Mk been postponed because Hank Aaron, baseball's new home run king, wouldn't be able to attend ceremonies next Monday. No new date has been set.

title: National League Continues Domination, Wins for the 11th Time in 12 Years, 72
description: PITTSBURGH, July 23The American League paid the price of aggression tonight when it tested its new policy of win at any, cost and still lost baseball's 45th AllStar game to the National League, 72.

title: People in Sports
description: Johnny Unitas, who was the only experienced player on the San Diego Chargers to cross the players association picket line, may soon take another important step  into retirement. Unitas hinted at his decision yesterday when he refused to discuss his future career plans. I have no statement to make, he told reporters. I'll let you known in a couple of days.

title: ANDREW TAYLOR
description: Andrew Taylor, a retired assistant machine foreman in the composing room of The New York Times, died Saturday. He was 79 years old and lived at 3162 29th Street, Astoria, Queens.

title: Intrepid 6, Courageous 4 After Two Sets of Trials
description: NEWPORT, R. L, July 23 Intrepid, the people's yacht from the West Coast, beat Courageous, the New York Yacht Club's yracht, for the second straight time today in the America's Cup trials. The margin was a healthy 1 minute 52 seconds in a moderate, steady southerly breeze on the.24.3mile America's Cup course.

title: The Philharmonic Marks Decade of Free Concerts
description: The New York Philharmonic celebrated the opening last night. of its 10th season of free concerts in the city's parks by breaking its own attendance records. The largest previous audience for such an event had been estimated at 110,000. Carlos Moseley, president of the Philharmonic, was reluctant to give an estimated figure for last night'scrowd in Sheep Meadow in Central Park, but said that it was conpiderably greater than any other.

title: Tenants Coalition Asks For Dismissal of Starr
description: A clamor of indignation has arisen from tenant groups and some officeholders over a recent announcement by Roger Starr, the city's Housing and Development Administrator, that a citysponsored group was exploring the possibility of reducing services to tenants as a way of cutting housing costs.

title: Assurance on Unleaded Gas
description: WASHINGTON, July 23 (AP) The Environmental Protectinn Agency said today that it had been informed by the Canadian and Mexican Governmehts that unleaded gasoline would be available at service stations in those countries for 1975model automobiles requiring it Most 1975 American automobiles will be equipped with antipollution catalytic converters; which are damaged, by leaded, gasoline.

title: EDNA S. ROBINSON
description: Edna Stitt Robinson, long active in civic and cultural affairs here, died Saturday at the home of her sister, Marguerite Stitt Church, a former Representative from Illinois, in Evanston, Ill. She lived at 880 Fifth Avenue.

title: 2 Garbage Girls Find Summer Tun
description: LONG BEACH TOWNSHIP, July 23 (AP)All morning two young women hurl trash onto a garbage truck because they're motivated, but their boss doesn't think they'll make it through the summer.

title: Oregon to Honor Wayne Morse With a State Funeral on Friday
description: SALEM, Ore., July 23Former Senator Wayne Morse, who died yesterday, will receive a state funeral Friday in the chamber of the Muse of Representatives here, followed by a funeral in his home town of Eugene.

title: A Voice for Women: Neither a Shout Nor a Whisper
description: PARIS, July 23As the first woman Secretary for the Condition of Women in the first country in the world to create such a post, Francoise Giroud says, I will certainly upset some people. If you want to do things, you upset people.

title: The Changing Face of U.S. Sports: Interlocking Interests Are Problem
description: offstage problemsplayers striking, teams moving, leagues expanding, costs sdaring, telpvision mushroomins,. lawsnits proliferating and: Congress inquiring have inundated;the professional sports scene in recent years.

title: TAPE DESTRUCTION REPORTED REJECTED
description: WASHINGTON, July 23 (AP)  President Nixon rejected suggestions from his staff that he destroy any White House tapes that might prove politically and historically embarrassing, the Washington bureau of the Cox newspapers reported today.

title: White House Stand Dismays jaworski
description: BALTIMORE, July 23 (AP)The special Watergate prosecutor, Leon Jaworski, says he is appalled at the continuing refusal of the White House to say whether President Nixon would obey a Supreme Court

title: GOING OUT Guide
Holdover Chief of Child Agency Finally Learns of Her Dismissal
description: On Friday, seven months after Georgia L. McMurray submitted a pro forma letter of resignation as the city's Commissioner of Child Development, she got a polite letter from Deputy Mayor James A. Cavanagh notifying her that it was accepted.

title: CONFEREES LIMIT COURTS ON BUSING
description: WASHINGTON, July 23SenateHouse conferees, after month long struggle, have agreed to a compromise measure limiting the power of the Federal courts to order busing for school desegregation.

title: STATE IS HELD LAX IN ITS MENTAL CARE
description: Howard J. Samuels, one the two candidates for the Democratic gubernatorial nomination, accused Governor Wilson and the State Department of Mental Hygiene yesterday of failing to implement recommentions tht Mr. Samuels said would have overhauled the state's system for treating the mentally ill and saved the taxpayers $200million a year.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Social Workers in Tentative Accord

title: FreeMarket Prices For: Sugar Hit, Peaks
description: LONDON, July 23 (AP), The ,freemarket price. of sugar on the London terminal market hit a record high for the second day in a row today and sold at $659.64 a to under the pressure of a persisting world shortage.

title: Glamour of OWIthig Franchise: Red Ink, Headaches, Pressure
LINDSAY SPENDS FIRST DAY ON SET
description: PARIS, July 23The scenario for the movie scene being filmed by Otto Preminger focuses on five fathers who have just received the news that their daughters have been kidnapped by Palestinian guerrillas.

title: OFFICES OF FRENCH IN CAPITAL BLASTED
description: WASHINGTON, July 23 (AP) An explosion tonight damaged an office building housing part of the French military mission to the United States, the District of Columbia fire department reported.

title: CONFEREES LIMIT COURTS ON BUSING
Recovery by Western Nations Is Seen by 0.E.C.D.
description: PARIS, July 23The industrialized nations of the West have just gone through the most exceptional deceleration of growth ever experienced, but there should be a modest recovery over the next 12 months and a gradual decline i in the rate of inflation, the organization for Economic Cooperation and Development said today.

title: D. A. Lindsay Weds Mrs. Burbidge
description: Ellen Hurwitch Burbidge and David A. Lindsay, both of Brooklyn, were married here yesterday afternoon. The bridegroom is the twin of former Mayor John V. Lindsay. The Rev. Carlton Lee performed the ceremony in the St. James Chapel of the Episcopal Cathedral Church of St. John the Divine.

title: Amex and 0TC Prices Climb In Somewhat Heavier Trading
PRESIDENT HOLDS ECONOMIC TALKS
Hogan Gives Reasons for His Decision
description: WASHINGTON, July 23 Representative Lawrence J. Hogan of Maryland became today the first Republican on the House Judiciary Committee to announce that he would vote to recommend President Nixon's impeachment.

title: Mediterranean Overturn
description: The political upheavals in Athens and Nicosia that have followed the collapse of the Cyprus coup ,organized by Greece's military junta now give unexpected promise of return toward internal peace and democratic rule both countries.

title: JUNTA'S RULE ENDS
description: ATHENS, Wednesday, July24 The military rulers of Greece announced yesterday that they had decided to turn the nation back to civilian political leaders.

title: Sports Today
description: HARNESS RACING Yonkers Raceway, Central and Yonkers Avenues, 8 P.M. Monticello (N.Y.) Raceway, 8 P.M. THOROUGHBRED RACING Aqueduct (Queens) race track, 1:30 P.M. Monmouth Park, Oceanport, N.J., 2 P.M.

title: Bridge: Mathe and Goldberg Clash In Final of Spingold Tourney
description: Teams led by Lew Mathe of Los Angeles and Steve Goldberg of Marietta, Ga., clashed in the final of the Spingold knockout team championship here yesterday at the New York Hilton Hotel, but only after the Mathe team had the narrowest possible escape from defeat in its semifinal match.

title: Boston Busing, Suburban Balance
description: BOSTONIt is a sad truth of American politics that the job of drafting socialreform programs inevitably winds up in the hands of professionals. Generally members of an intellectual and socioeconomic elite, these people are estranged from the majority of Americans and usually are themselves unaffected by the problems they tackle and the solutions they propose.

title: AMEX SEEKS TO LIST FOREIGN SECURITIES
description: The American Stock Exchange reported yesterday that it had appealed formally to the Securities. and Exchange Commission to modify securities. regulations in order to attract listings on the exchange of more foreign securities.

title: 400 Americans Are Evacuated And Brought by Navy to Beirut
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, July 23 (AP)  Nearly 400 Americans, tired, still shaky, immensely relieved to be safe and for the most part more frightened than hurt, were brought to Beirut today from Cyprus aboard the Coronado, an amphibioustrans, port of the Sixth Fleet.

title: 1975 Ford Line Certified On Cutting of Pollutants
description: DETROIT, July 23 (UPI)The Ford Motor Company said today that the Government had approved its 1975 model cars and trucks that will produce less than half the pollutants of this year's models.

title: Amaritraj And Dibbs. Are Upset
intrepid 6, Courageous 4 After Two Sets of Trials
PENTAGON SCORED ON HEALTH FUNDS
description: WASHINGTON, July 23The Defense Department paid $92million last year for private psychiatric care for military dependents but has no formal accounting of how that money was spent, the staff of the Senate Permanent Subcommittee on Investigations reported today.

title: Beame's Image Built On Successes in Past
description: Hard work, unrelenting tention to niggling details and a quiet passion for getting the city more for less built the superaccountant's image that won the mayoralty for Abraham D. Beame.

title: Goldin TroubleShooter Moves at a Rapid Pace
description: When Jerome Hervey Turk special assistant to Controlle Harrison J. Goldin, left ht home last Sunday to go to hi: office in the Municipal Building his wife, Carole said:

title: Work Blocks Expressway
description: Repairs on an eastbound section of the Long Island Expressway in Queens caused traffic to back up for two miles yesterday. Two lanes near 108th Street in Rego Park were affected before the ,work was completed. Repairs on Northern. Boulevard have reduced traffic; to, one lane in each directiOn from 249th Street to the Nassau County line. That work is expected to take three weeks.

title: DOUGLAS M. VAN RIPER
description: Douglas Mackenzie Van Riper, president of the Douglas Van Riper Real Estate Corporation of Manhasset, L. 1., died, apparently of a heart attack, in Eastern Long Island Hospital, Greenpoint, on Monday. He was 42 years old and lived at 3 Old Pine Drive in Manhasset:

title: South Korean Bishop Held After Trial Is Postponed
description: SEOUL, South Korea, July 23 (AP)The South Korean Government today postponed the trial of a Roman Catholic Bishop who opposes President Park Chung Hee, then took him into custody again.

title: Tracks Normal After Blast
description: DECATUR, III., July 23 (UPI) All tracks were cleared and trains were moving today at the Norfolk and Western Railroad. yards here, four days after lea)ting gas from a tank car exploded, leaving four persons dead and 140 injured.

title: TV: Star of Dropped Toma Tells What Happened
description: Tome, the series about a policeman partial to disguises, will not be returning next season. One major reaSon, what an ABC network spokesman refers to as a contributing factor, is that Tony Musante is refusing to return to weekly duty in the title role. At a time when prominent TV starsRedd Foxx, Carroll O'Connor, Peter Falkseem increasingly willing to wage contractual battles, Mr. Musante's stance sheds some provocative light on the economic pressures and questionable structures of the industry.

title: U.S. and Canadian Prisoners End Hunger Strike in Mexico
description: MEXICO CITY, July 23 (UPI)After 13 days of nothing more than oranges and tea, 75 American and Canadian prisoners at Lecumberri Prison here have given up their hunger strike in apparent frustration, friends said today. There apparently was no sign of a response to denands for more help from United States officials.

title: Republican on Panel Says He Will Vote to Impeach; The Debate Starts  Tonight
description: WASHINGTON, July 23 Senior Democrats on the House Judiciary Committee met privately today to redraft proposed articles of impeachment in an attempt to elicit broad, bipartisan support for formal charges against President Nixon.

title: New Restaurants Transform Columbus, Amsterdam Ayes.
description: There are people who live on the Upper West Side who would say, a bit chauvinistically perhaps, that their

title: General Phone Raises Three and SixMonth Earnings to Peaks
CONJUGAL VISITS DENIED ATRAHWAY
description: NEWARK, July. 23 (UPI)A Federal judge refused to grant an inmate request yesterday to set up a program permitting conjugal visits bewteen prisoners and their wives or fiances at Rahway State Prison.

title: Royal Dutch Sees Loss Of $220.Million Likely
description: LONDON, July 23 (AP)The Royal Dutch/Shell Group said today its cumulative losses on nuclear development might have reached $220million as of the end of the second quarter. The group said it was setting aside about $124million in its secondquarter accounts. On March 31, the setaside was about $10million.

title: Onondagas Smash Doors Of Whites on Reservation
description: SYRACUSE, July 23Groups of Indian raiders broke down doors, slashed telephone cables and menaced several families as they attempted today to evict seven white families from the Onondaga Reservation near here.

title: Advertising: Dillon on Creativity
description: Probably because he was newspaper reporter before he was a copywriter and a copywriter before he became chief executive, Tom Dillon, president of Batten, Barton, Durstine & Osborn, has a wonderful way with words. Yesterday, before an audience of fellow practitioners, he turned his talents loose on the subject of creativity in advertising.

title: Franco Fully Recovered, Head of Hospital Reports
description: MADRID, July 23The director of the hospital where Generalissimo Francisco Franco has been under treatment since July 9 for phlebitis and thrombosis said today that the 81yearold Spanish leader had recovered completely and could return home this week to resume normal life as chief of state.

title: Soviet Launches a Molnia
description: MOSCOW, July 23 (UPI)The Soviet Union launched another in its series of Molnia2 communications satellites toI day, the Tass press agency said., The satellites relay to outlying; regions of the country telephone, television and radio broadcasts as well as newspaper matrices and weather, icharts.

title: INQUIRY PLEDGED IN BORDER CASES
description: WASHINGTON, July 23Both the attorney general and his deputy have assured the ranking minority member of the House Government Operations Committee that the Justice Department is preparing to investigate vigorously allegations of corruption in the Immigration and Naturalization Service, a branch of the de

title: Aaron Peeved by Snub as Pilot
Contract Awards
description: ARO, Inc., a subsidiary of Sverdrup & Parcel and Associates, Inc., received a,$210.9million Air Force contract for operating the Arnold Air Force Station in Tennessee, site of the Arnold Engineer Development Center.

title: PRESIDENCY HELD THE REAL TARGET
description: WASHINGTON, July 23 The 151page White House defense brief presented to the House Judiciary Committee last (Saturday asserts the complete absence of any solid evidence that would justify the impeach ment of President Nixon.

title: FRANK E. KEYES
description: HARTFORD, Conn., July 23 (AP)Frank E. Keyes, a sports writer for The Hartford Courant who had covered Connecticut sports for more than 40 years, died yesterday. He was 60 years old. He started his newspaper career at The New Haven JournalCourier in 1932 and joined The Courant in 1941.

title: Ballet: Makarova Excels
description: Coppelia is one of the few 19thcentury classics that can succeed without being a star vehicle. But Natalia Makarova was very much the focus of attention in her first Swanilda of the season Monday night at the New York State Theater in American Ballet Theater's lively production.

title: Rites for Lili Darvas
description: A funeral service for Lili Darvas, the actress, has been scheduled for this morning at 10 in the chapel of the Frank E. Campbell funeral home, Madison Avenue at 81st Street. Miss Darvas, who was last seen here in the Hungarian film Love and the recent television production of Hans Werner Henze's Rachel, la Cubana, died Monday at her New York home.

title: Jersey Utility to Halt Nuclear. Power Plant
description: The Jersey Central Power and Light Company announced yesterday that it was halting construction on a $600million nuclear power plant and also indefinitely postponing plans for a $364million conventional power plant as part of its effort to cut expenses. The utility, which is an operating subsidiary of the General Public Utilities Corporation, said it would lay off about 200 employes and reduce maintenance and construction of lines and substations.

title: Israel Reports Her Jets Raided Guerrilla Targets in Lebanon
description: TEL AVIV, July. 23 (AP)Israeli war planes bombed and rocketed Palestinian guerrilla targets in southern Lebanon today, the military command announced.

title: India's Inflation Hurts the WelltoDo
description: PATNA, India, July 21Years ago, when the summer heat enveloped Bihar, Rekha Jha and her parents traveled to the hill station of Darjeeling. There were horseback rides every morning for Rekha and tea and pastries after her afternoon nap and new silk saris for. weekend parties when aunts and uncles gathered at the summer home.

title: NATO Studying Vulnerable Sea Lanes
description: LONDON, July 17The assured supply by sea of oil and other essential minerals in the event of war with the Soviet Union has become the primary problem facing the Atlantic Alliance.

title: Joys and Sorrows of Concerts in Park
description: When the idea of taking the New York Philharmonic into the city's parks was conceived, few people were really confident that the new baby,would liveor even if it was wanted. But last night the freeconcert project, now a sturdy youngster with millions of friends, opened its 10th season in the Sheep Meadow in Central Park.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE GOOD OLD BOYS, By Paul. Hemphill, 255 pp. Simon & Schuster. $7.95.,

title: 2 Held in Stripping of Cars
description: The police raided a garage at 2611 Second Street, in Astoria, Queens, yesterday and arrested two men believed to be involved in stripping latemodel stolen cars. The police said they found seven stolen cars ready for dismantling and three partially stripped vehicles. Wayne Johnstone, 25 years old, of 5169 72d Place, and Vincent DeLia, 45, of 7107 52d Avenue, both in Maspeth, Queens, were charged with possession of stolen property, grand larceny and possession of burglary tools.

title: Red Smith
description: The Atlanta. Braves are expected to hire a new manager today, and Eddie Robinson, a reformed first baseman who rejoices. in the title of vice president, baseball operations, has said it would be someone already in the organization but not Henry Aaron or his brother Tommie, manager of the club's farm in Savannah. It probably won't be Luman Harris or Fred Haney, either, although if the Atlanta brass wants a man to lead the Braves to a championship, those two are the only men alive whose ability to accomplish this is certifiable. The only Sports other managers to win. with the Braves this century, Billy. Southworth and George of Stallings, have moved on to the great ball The Times park in the sky, and even if Billy or George were available they would not be considered seriously because Billy would be 81 years old and George 103.

title: Witness in Brasco's Trial Pleads Guilty to Contempt
description: John A. Masiello, a reputed member, of the Mafia, pleaded guilty yesterday to criminal contempt of court for having refused to testify in the second trial of Representative Frank J. Brasco of Brooklyn.

title: HOSPITALS CHIEF LETS 5 AIDES QUIT
description: Dr. John L. S. Holloman Jr., president of the city's Health and Hospitals Corporation, disclosed yesterday that he had accepted the proforma resignations of five of the corporation's top officials because a need strengthen the staff.

title: A Cyprus Beach Invaded By Turks Is Calm Again
description: KARAVAS, Cyprus, July 23 Peace returned to the Turkishoccupied north coast of Cyprus this morning after an augmented landing force yesterday widened its beachhead and captured parts of the Greek Cypriote port of Kyrenia.

title: Hilton Joins Giants
description: The New York Giants picked up one defector from the players strike and one castoff from the World Football League's New York Stars vesterday, while Charley inner, the New York Jets coach, was lamenting the fact that no more of his seasoned players have shown up for camp.

title: People and Business
description: Senator William Proxmire urged yesterday that Congress reject a proposal by the Navy to increase advance payments to the Grumman Aerospace Corporation for production of F14 fighter planes.

title: Stations to Display Gasoline Price in LARGE Numbers, a Foot Square
description: The city's answer to outofsight gasoline prices was unveiled yesterday: jumbo price signs, a foot square, that a new regulation requires to be displayed on gasoline pumps at service stations.

title: Stage Stars Thank Police For Efforts in Times Sq.
description: A bevy of Broadway theater people who seem convinced that police efforts have made a decided improvement in conditions in the Times Square area turned out yesterday to offer their personal thanks to the police officers assigned to the area.

title: Hazel Park Strike Ends
description: HAZEL PARK, Mich., July 23 (UPI)Striking personnel at the Hazel Park Raceway ratified a new contract today, ending a walkout that postponed the start of the track's 12(1day thoroughbred racing season. Racing will start tomorrow.

title: FOUNDATION TO AID DETECTIVE WIDOWS
description: The formation of a foundation to provide financial assistance to widows of retired city detectives was announced yesterday,

title: CON EDISON PLANS 20CENT ME
description: The Consolidated Edison Company made some 308,000 stockholders and countless utility analysts happy yesterday by declaring a dividend of 20 cents a share on its common stock, payable Sept. 15 to holders of record on Aug. 7.

title: PRELATE OPPOSES ORDAINING WOMEN
description: The Right Rev. John M. Allin, Presiding Bishop of the Episcopal Church in the United States, has appealed to three Episcopal bishops to reconsider their plans to ordain 11 women in Philadelphia on Monday.

title: G.M. LAYING OFF 750 AT TONAWANDA UNIT
description: DETROIT, July 23 (UPI) The strikeplagued General Motors corporation has idled 750 workers at its Tonawanda, N.Y., plant, bringing the number of employes off the job at G.M. plants this week to 15,650.

title: Police Are Searching for Second Suspect in Slaying in Norwood Section
description: Following a night of questioning witnesses and informants, detectives yesterday arrested a 16yearold boy who had never been in trouble with the police in the slaying of a boy during the theft of a bicycle in the Norwood section of the Bronx.

title: Republican on Panel Says He Will Vote to Impeach; The Debate Starts Tonight; Rep. Hogan, a Conservative, Speaks Out as Democrats Redraft the Articles in Bid for Bipartisan Support
Petersen Reportedly Blocked US. Attorney Ouster
description: SAN DIEGO, July 23Assistant Attorney General Henry E. Petersen is reported to have blocked a recommendation by a Department of Justice review team that the United States Attorney here, Harry D. Stewart, be removed from office for questionable conduct.

title: Bush Disputes Ziegler.
description: DALLAS, July 23 (UPI)The Republican National Chairman, George Bush, today disputed the charge made by the White House press secretary, Ronald L. Ziegler, that the House Judiciary Committee's impeach.. ment hearings resembled kangaroo court. I know [committee] members on both sides, and I just don't believe that's the way those hearings are conducted, Mr. Bush said at a news conference.

title: Gap in Income Between Blacks and Whites Widens
description: WASHINGTON, July 23The gap that separates the media income of black and white fan ilies continued to widen la; year, the Bureau of the Censt reported today.

title: Southern Income Up
description: The Union Pacific Corporation, whose railroad of the same name is the biggest moneymaker in the railroad industry, and the Southern Railway, the second most profitable carrier, both reported yesterday sharply higher revenues and earnings for the second quarter.

title: Younger Brother Asserts Victim Died as Hero Trying to Aid Another
description: The top bunk of the doubledecker bed that Henry Schwartz shared with his younger brother, Eric, is empty now, and custody of a hifi record player, a gold ring that had been their, grandfather's and parakeet named Cleo have all changed hands.

title: POTATO FUTURES JUMP DAILY LIMIT Cash Prices in the Producing Areas,. However, Decline
description: Potato futures jumped the daily halfcent limit for all months yesterday on the New York Mercantile Exchange, even though cash prices were sharply lower in large current producing areas. In Virginia potatoes were selling for 4 1/2 cents a pound, off a quarter cent from the previous day, while in Alabama they dropped to 4 1/2 from 5 cents. %

title: JUNTA'S RULE ENDS
description: ATHENS, Wednesday, July 24 The military rulers of Greece announced yesterday that they had decided to turn the nation back to civilian political leaders.

title: Curbs on Beach Nudity Challenged in Lawsuit
description: A former vice president of the Gay Activist Alliance who received a summons for sunbathing in the nude at a Queens beach recently, filed suit yesterday contesting the constitutionality of the nudity restrictions.

title: Senator Gurney Quits Campaign In Florida to Prepare for Trial
description: WASHINGTON, July 23Senator Edward J. Gurney Florida withdrew as a candidate for reelection today prepare a defense against charges of bribery, conspiracy and making false statements a Federal grand jury.

title: Triple Pays $8,114 But Double Sags
description: Payoffs at Aqueduct went from the ridiculoushess of a $10.60 daily double to the sublimity of an $8,114 triple yesterday. The triple combination that turned $2 into a small fortune was given most of its punch by Yo Marc, a $78.40 winner ridden by James Long, a triplebug apprentice. Yo Marc took the onemile ninth race by a head over So Much More. (71), with Lover Boy Billy (5.1) third. Long also rode the $5.60 winner of the third Rose of Tiara.

title: About New York
description: The bicycle is more than what it seems, and as much as anything else it is the flowering of a lifestyle. William Buckley rides a bike, and when he ran for Mayor, he proposed that a bike path be built along Second Avenue from First Street to 125th Street. This nearly unhinged the other Conservatives, who saw it as an affront to the existing order, and in a way it was. The city is not really built for bicycles, and on the adults who now ride them there is kind of chic.

title: Justices Meet Today
description: The Supreme Court announced that it would meet this morning, raising speculation that it would rule on President Nixon's challenge of an order to yield White House tapes. Page 30.

title: CON EDISON PLANS 20CENT DIVIDEND
description: The Consolidated Edison Company made some 308,00C stockholders and countless utility analysts happy yesterday by declaring a dividend of 20 cents a share on its common stock, payable Sept. 15 to holders of record on Aug. 7.

title: Favorites Advance On Links in Oregon
description: EUGENE, Ore., July 23 (AP)The medalist, Elaine Hand, and the cofavorites, Mary Budke and Carol Semple, scored openinground victories otday as match play began in the TransNational women's golf tournament.

title: Issue and Debate Search for a Definition Of Impeachable Offense
Dance: The Australian Ballet at Home
description: CANBERRA, Australia, July 21Canberra is a quiet and planned city, whose quietness is only disturbed by the reticent whirring of the wheels of Australia's national Government. Yet like most major Australian cities it has a theater center, offering plays, opera, ballet and concert* throughout the year. It was here that I caught up with the Australian Ballet, offering a comparatively new work by Sir Robert Helpmann, the revival of Sir Frederick Ashton's The Dream and the world premiere of a work by the Engglishbased Australian choreographer Barry Moreland.

title: CYPRUS UNITY BID
description: FAMAGUSTA, Cyprus, July 23  Nikos Giorgiades Sampson, selfproclaimed President of Cyprus for a week, resigned today and turned over the presidency to Glafkos Clerides, President of the House of Representatives and a widely respected figure here.

title: East German Port City Enjoys a Btulding Boom
description: ROSTOCK, East GermanyThis Baltic port of 220,000 people is enjoying a building boom that has been going on since 1953 when the Government decided to make Rostock the country's principal port.

title: Bankers Cite City Refusal Of Aid in Balancing Books
description: Officers of some of the city's leading banks said yesterday that the city had repeatedly turned down over the last several years offers to help reconcile its bank accounts. Had the city taken advantage of the offers, the officers said, the discrepancies disclosed this Month might have been uncovered earlier and corrected before they became so large.

title: Arena Plan Is Pressed By Brooklyn
description: Sebastian Leone, Brooklyn Borough President, made a pitch yesterday for an indoor sports stadium in his borough before the New York State Sports Authority. In reply, Edwin M. Schwenk, the authority chairman, asked that Leone get the New York City Board iof Estimate to approve a feasibility study of the stadium.

title: MANSFIELD BACKS 6DAY TRIAL WEEk
description: WASHINGTON, July 23Senator Mike Mansfield said today that he would advocate sixdayaweek sessions in the event of a Senate trial of President Nixon, with no time off for campaigning by Senators up for reelection this fall.

title: Carnegie Hill Areas at 5th Ave. Designated a Historic District
description: The war here is over, John Boogaerts Jr. said yesterday in front of his town house at 70 East 91st Street.

title: Crash Kills Navy Pilot
description: WARMESTER, Pa., July 23 (UPI)A Navy pilot was killed today when his A4 Skyhawk light attack iet crashed shortly after takeoff from the Naval Air Base in Bucks County. The autherities identified the pilot as Lieut. Kenneth D. Wetzel, 30 year old of Landsale, Pa.

title: Conferees Agree to Cut Billion In White House Arms Budget
description: WASHINGTON, July 23 (UPI) House and Senate conferees agreed today to cut nearly $1billion from the Administration's military weapons budget for this year and to ban tests of Minuteman missiles over the Northwestern United States.

title: Charles W. Brown, Geologist Began Department at Brown
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., July, 23 (AP)Charles Wilson Brown, founder of the geology department at Brown University, died yesterday in Rhode Island Hospital, He was 99 years old.

title: FIGHT ESCALATES FOR ESB'S STOCK
description: The fight to acquire ESB, Inc., the world's largest producer of batteries, was intensi, fied yesterday with International Nickel Company of Canada, Ltd., the original bidder, attnouncing,it would pay $36 a Merger share for all outNews standing common shares. A few hours later, the United Aircraft Corporation, the competing bidder, said it, too, would pay $36 a share.

title: Theater: Betti's Burnt Flowerbed Comes to the Roundabout
Fire Caused by Cigarette Studied in Test to Find Out How to Cut Death Toll
description: NORWOOD, Mass., July 24Seven minutes after an automatic device simulating a dropped cigarette was ignited in a heavily instrumented, motellike bedroom here, flames were consuming the bed and sweeping all around the walls and yellow nylon tweed carpeting.

title: Text of Supreme Court Ruling Ordering Nixon to Turn Over Data
Market Place. Customers Aid Utilities Abroad
description: Is it possible that capitalstarved utilities will turn to their customers for money to finance expansionas they have in a few foreign nations?

title: Greece's Way Out
description: The weight of seven years of army dictatorship has been lifted from the people of Greece. The satisfaction and rejoicing at the rapid developments in Athens stretch far beyond the exuberant throngs that poured into the streets within minutes of the succinct radio announcement that civilian rule had been restored to Greece.

title: GUNS ASSERTS CRISIS EXPOSED NATO FLANK
description: BRUSSELS, July 2  Secretary General Joseph M. A. H. Luns said today that the Cyprus crisis had temporarily weakened the North Atlantic Treaty Organization's defenses on its southern flank. But he added that he thought the new Greek Premier, Constantine Caramanlis, could heal his country's rift with Turkey.

title: Byrne Yields on Income Tax; Moratorium on Plan Reported
Notes on People
description: Federal Judge Otto Kerner, who begins serving a threeyear prison term next Monday, resigned yesterday from the United States Court of Appeals for the Seventh Circuit. He apparently did so in the face of warnings from members of the Congress that he would face impeachment unless he resigned his $42,500ayear judicial seat.

title: Beame Will Let Goldin Hire 45 to Correct Accounts
description: Mayor Beame  pale and tiredlooking, but back at work after a week's illnesspromised yesterday to let his successor as Controller, Harrison J. Goldin, hire 45 staff accountants to help straighten out records that have been depicted as sloppy and inaccurate.

title: Sir James Chadwick Dies; Nobel Winner for Neutron
description: LONDON, July 24Sir Jamc Chadwick, who won the Nobel Prize for Physics in 1935 fc his discovery three years earlie of the neutron, has died at the age of 82, it was learned the night.

title: Excerpts From Transcript of House Judiciary Panel's Impeachment Proceedings
PARIS BUDGET RISING TO COVER INFLATION
description: PARIS, July 24 (Reuters)The French Government approved today a budget of $51.6billion for 1975, almost 14 per cent higher than estimated spending this year. The increase was expected to be entirely swallowed up by inflation.

title: Ruling Leaves Jaworski With'Righi Good Feeling
description: WASHINGTON, July 24 (UPI)The special Watergate prosecutor, Leon Jaworski, said today after the Supreme Court decision ordering President Nixon to turn over 64 Watergate conversations that it looked now as if the American people could put Watergate behind them.

title: Not by Claw Alone
description: We live In an age that is skilled at packaging, and when a product becomes oldfashioned or disreputable the tendency is to repackage it and pre tend that it is brand new.

title: CHESS BODY WARNS ON CZECH BOYCOTT
description: SOLINGEN, West Germany, July 24 (UPI)The International Chess Federation said that it would not tolerate future boycotts by the Soviet Union or other East European countries against the exiled Czechoslovak grandmaster, Ludek Pachman.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: MigrantWorker Buses Ruled Unsafe

title: ExAide Depicts Nixon As Attentive to Details
description: WASHINGTON, July (President Nixon was depicted by a former aide in testimony released today as being almost obsessive about trivial administrative matters and very, very much in charge of what went on in the White House.

title: AllStar Review: HoHum Affair
description: PITTSBURGH, July 24 The AllStar game that the National League won, 7.2, from the American League last night was No. 45 in a series that began in 1933, and it was every bit as easy to forget as game No. 45 of any baseball season.

title: U.S. Auto Sales Declined By 25.6% During MidJuly
PRICES OF BEEF HERE RISE 2D WEEK IN ROW
description: Reversing a general decline since early April, the price of beef in the city's Market Basket survey went up again last week, leading a rise of fivetenths of 1 per cent in the cost lof feeding a family of four.

title: U.S. Seeks to Delay I.B.M;'s Trust Trial
description: The Department of Justice has proposed that the trial of Its antitrust suit against the International Business Machines Corporation be postponed until after Dec. 2.

title: The Imperatives of Law
description: The Supreme Court, without ever mentioning the word impeachment, has changed the atmosphere, and maybe even the balance of power, in the impeachment debate in the Congress of the United States.

title: Dutch Plant Blast Kills One
description: DEVENTER, the Netherlands, July 24 (Reuters)  One man, was killed and six injured MI an explosion last night at the Akzo chemical plant here., Damage was estimated at $2.9 million.

title: Melina Mercouri Plans to Go Home; Hundreds of Exiles Head for Greece
description: PARIS, July 24  It is the end of a tyranny and the start of a road, Melina Mercouri intoned into the telephone in her strong, gritty voice. It is very difficult.

title: ExMental Patient Denied Records by Brooklyn Judge
description: A Federal district judge in (Brooklyn ruled yesterday that mental hosiptals are not obligated to give their former patients access to their own medi cal records.

title: 2 Say Hirschfeld Was Preparing Gift for Lowenstein Before He Began Race
description: Abraham Hirschfeld, a can didate for the Democratic nomination for the United States Senate, had $50,000 ready to donate to a Lowensteinfor Congress committee shortly after Allard K. Lowenstein dorpped out of the Senate race and five days before he announced for Congress, two bighranking Democrats said yesterday.

title: Subsidy for Middle Class Draws Fire of a City Aide
description: A representative of the city's housing and planning offices testified yesterday against parts of a proposal to provide bargain housing for middleincome white families as part of a plan to revitalize the Coney Island area and to integrate Mark Twain Junior High School there.

title: JOHN FOGARTY
description: John Fogarty, president of Automated Management, information concepts specialists here, died Tuesday at Lenox Hill Hospital. He was 62 years old and lived at 1235 Park Avenue.

title: STRONG NAVY URGED BY SOVIET ADMIRAL
description: MOSCOW, July 24Adm. Nikolei D. Sergeyev, the navy. chief of staff, said today that since the arms race unleashed by the imperialists continued, the Soviet navy persistently improves combat readiness.

title: Cairo Paper Says Moscow Promised Aid to Industries
description: CAIRO, Thursday, July 25 (Reuters)  The authoritative Cairo daily Al Ahram reported today that the Soviet Union, had agreed to carry out industrial projects in Egypt at cost of about $160million.

title: Radio Station Manager May Drop Tape Battle
description: LOS ANGELES July 24 (UPI)A radio station manager who went to prison for refusing to give the Federal Bureau of Investigation a Patricia Hearst tape and other materials said today that he would give in if he could not raise enough money to pay for appeal to the Supreme Court.

title: Chess:
City Offers 2,000 DayCare Backers $10Million if State and U.S. Match It
description: About 2,000 demonstrators chanted in the rain outside City Hall yesterday and won a promise from the city that it would provide $10million for day care if the state and Federal governments provided matching funds.

title: Defying Indians, Family Burns House Rather Than Leave It to the Chiefs
description: NEDROW, N.Y., July 24A white woman and her Indian husband last night burned the house in which they reared their 11 children, rather than turn it over to chiefs of the Onondaga tribe.

title: Fernando Bujones Wins a Gold Medal In Ballet Contest
description: Fernando Bujones, a 19yearold soloist with the American I Ballet Theater, has been awarded the Gold Medal at the Seventh International Ballet competition, which closed yesterday in Varna, Bulgaria.

title: Advertising: New Panasonic Try
description: Coming off a lessthanwonderful year, Panasonic is going to try a new tack in the fall. It is going to concentrate its inventory and to some extent its advertising.

title: Kissinger Defends U.S. Aid to Seoul
description: WASHINGTON, July 24 Secretary of State Kissinger said today that although the Nixon Administration did not approve of South Korea's repressive policies, it had decided to continue economic and military aid for Asian security reasons.

title: VW Adding Cattle to Beetles in Brazil
description: RIO DE JANEIROVolks wagen is diversifying in Brazil for the first timeinto Cattle.

title: Finally, Monumental Cookbook Is Translated
description: An event that is to our minds almost as important as the publication of the English language version of Larousse Gastronomique in 1961 will occur this fall. It is the English translation of Gastronomie Pratique, a volume we have treasured in our home library for more years than we can count. It is a 67yearold, sevenpound 1,281page tome on clasSic and regional French cookery, and it is remarkable in many respects.

title: Wilson Is Chided by Samuels on His Law Practice
description: Howard J. Satimels said yesterday that he would not allow Governor Wilson to get through this election without answering every question about his 15 years of private law practice while he served as Lieutenant Governor.

title: Dr. C. E. Forkner Jr. Weds Miss Shirley
description: The marriage of Joanne Shirley, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Carl Shirley of Bernardsville, N. J., to Dr. Claude E. Forkner Jr., son of Dr. and Mrs. Forkner of Darien, Conn., and De Land, Fla., took place here yesterday afternoon. The Rev. Kenneth Owen Jones performed the ceremony in the Chapel of the Fifth Avenue Presbyterian Church.

title: New Jersey Sports
Seoul Court Dooms Five More Civilians On Plotting Charge
description: SEOUL, South Korea, July 24 (AP)The Seoul district criminal court sentenced five civilians to death today on charges of espionage on behalf of North Korea and of plotting an uprising against President Park Chung Hee.

title: Now or 1980
description: At long last the House Administration Committee has reported out a campaign finance reform bill which has been considering for four months. While neither so broad nor so strong as its Senate counterpartit would, for example, allow public funds for Presidential elections but not Congressionalit is a reasonably good bill and could probably be reconciled with the Senate measure. But to stand any chance It has tt7 reach the floor within the next few days. That is now the grave responsibility of the House leadership.

title: Union and Hospitals Group Reach Pact in Long Strike
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., July 25 (AP)The United Steelworkers of America and Appalachian !Regional Hospitals announced an agreement tonight ending a 115day strike against nine hospitals in three states.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: HIT THE ROAD, JACK That most endearing of Shakespeare's ruffians, Sir John Falstaff, arrives tonight at the Delacorte Theater in Central Park for a onemonth visit in Joseph Papp's production of The Merry Wives of Windsor. It's said that the character of Falstaff was so popular in Part One and Two of Henry IV that Queen Elizabeth ordered the playwright to bring forth a new play especially for him. And yet, in its 18 years of free Shakespeare in the park, the New York Shakespeare Festival has never before produced The Merry Wives.

title: P. BOICE ESSER
description: P. Boice Esser, who represented the Second Assembly District of Westchester County in the New York State Assembly from 1958 to 1964, died Tuesday. He was 58 years old and lived at 256 Old Colony Road, Hartsdale, N.Y.

title: Soviet Central Committee Hears a Brezhnev Report
description: MOSCOW, July 24 The Central Committee of the Soviet Communist party held plenary meeting today, apparently endorsing existing policies with little if any change.

title: A Wrenching Ordeal
description: On the eve of the House Judiciary Committee's historic debate on whether to recommend to the full House that President Nixon be impeached, Ronald L. Ziegler issued a call from out in the West that the House not pass the buck by sending the case to the Senate, thereby sparing the nation a wrenching ordeal.

title: Citicorp Find, Good Market for Offering
description: Citicorp's controversial and highly publicized issue of $650million in floatingrate notes virtually sold out yesterday and the notes traded on the New York Stock Exchange at their face value. For the First Boston Corporation, the lead underwriter, it was a long day of tension and activity. Here is a bird'seye view:

title: Hearst Surrender Call A Hoax, Police Report
description: LOS ANGELES, July 24 (AP)The police said tonight that a woman who identified herself as newspaper heiress Patricia Hearst and said she wanted to surrender was perpetrating a hoax.

title: SILVER UP IN U.S., STEADY IN LONDON
Americans Reported Migrating To South and Out of Northeast
description: WASHINGTON, July 24Americans have been moving into the South and out of the Northeast during the nineteenseventies, altering the historic patterns of migration north and westward, new Census Bureau figures show.

title: Personal Finance
description: A recent decision by the New Jersey Supreme Court, the state's top court, has changed the rules concerning the distribution of properly at the time of divorce. At the same time it has reshaped planning for gifts by parents to, their children.

title: AnacondaChile Pact
description: The Anaconda Company announced it had reached a $253million settlement with the new Government of Chile for the takeover of its Chilean mining subsidiaries in 1971. Details on Page 42.

title: Nixon Supporters Sing At Vigil in Capitol
description: WASHINGTON, July 24 (AP)  About 250 praying, fasting supporters of President Nixon sang and handed out leaflets today in their vigil on the Capitol steps.

title: Turks Admit They Sank Own Vessel Off Cyprus
description: ANKARA, Turkey, July 24A tragic military blunder during the brief conflict on Cyprus, in which a Turkish plane or planes bombed and sank Turkish destroyer mistaken for part of an invading force from Greece, is causing consternation in Government circles here.

title: India Plans Launching Of Space Vehicle in 78
description: NEW DELHI, July 24 (UPI) India will launch her first space vehicle in 1978, Prime Minister Indira Gandhi said today.

title: People in Sports
description: With a diamond gleaming in his solid gold tooth, Jesse Dark dazzled the press yesterday when he signed multiyear contract with the Knicks. The 6foot5inch guard from Virginia Commonwealth was New York's secondround draft choice. Explaining the tooth, Dark said, It was something I promised myself two or three years ago. Asked how much it had cost, he smiled and said, A lot.

title: Vizzini and 2 Union Officials Sentenced To 3Year Probation for Firemen's Strike
description: Richard J. Vizzini and two other firemen's union officials who led the first strike by the city's 10,900 firemen last Nov. 6 were placed on probation yes terday for three years with a warning by the court against, strikes by city employes.

title: The Agents
description: The lawyeradviseragent for 300 of the world's hest athletes puts it this way: There is a fantastic explosion of sports which may very well envelop everybody and he the demise of sport. The average fan now is getting fed up. He's getting fed up with the number of franchises and the dilution of play.

title: NIXON'S SUPPORT APPEARS TO WANE
description: WASHINGTON, July 24President Nixon's support on the impeachment issue appeared today to have markedly deteriorated in the House in the wake of two dramatic developments.

title: Funds for Official's Home
description: WASHINGTON, July 24 (AP) The Senate Appropriations Committee approved $815,000 today to fix up and operate the official residence being provided for the Vice President. Under legislation passed earlier, the Vice President is to be housed in what was the residence of the chief of Naval operations.

title: Yanks Talk of a Drive To the Top
description: Like everybody else in the major leagues the Yankees, except for Thurman Munson and Bobby Murcer, their AllStar players, had the last three days off, during which they took stock of their fortunes in the American League's Eastern Division. Unlike nearly everybody else, however, the Yankees came up feeling satisfied.

title: Music: Mostly Mozart
description: One of the increasingly valuable policies of the Mostly Mozart Festival in recent summers has been the inclusion of chamber works that flesh out the listener's understanding of the composers represented. Not merely the few famous pieces that everyone knows and respects, but also a sampling of the relatively ordinary pieces that need to be kept in mind if we are fully to grasp the miracle of, say, Mozart's last symphonies and piano concertos.

title: Sports News Briefs
All About. Missoula
description: MISSOULA, Mont.This womblike valley town of 55,000 tucked away in the green Rocky Mountains of northwestern Montana looks, on the surface anyway, like a handy escape back to the early nineteensixties. There is pollution, of course, and crime though vigilante posses are around to protect youeven devil worship on occasion; but, overall, it's ideal for Chamber of Commerce types and HaightAshbury refugees alike.

title: Driving School Held Up
description: Three holdup men interrupted a lecture at an East Side driving school last night and escaped with $914 in cash and an assortment of jewelry taken from the 19 students and the school manager at the Model Driving School, 161 East 86th Street.

title: Purge Ends and Stars Come Out Again
description: Not many people recognized the New York Stars original defensive secondary, but even those fanatic few who did won't recognize the reshuffled secondary the Stars will use in Philadelphia against the Bell tonight,

title: GRUMMAN PROFITS ON U.S. PAYMENTS
description: WASHINGTON, July 24 The Grumman Corporation has made a profit of almost $3million by investing the funds obtained through what are, in effect, Government loans for its controversial F14 fighter plane, Navy officials disclosed today.

title: Constantine Declines to Predict When He Will Return to Greece
description: LONDON, July 24Constantine of Greece, deposed King by the military Government while in exile last year, declined to predict today when he would return to his country.

title: JIM HARTZ IS NAMED A COHOST OF TODAY
description: Jim Hartz, anchorman of WNBCTV's earlyevening and lateevening news broadcasts, has been selected by NBC officials as the new cohost of the earlymorning Today show. He will begin Monday.

title: MENINGITIS VACCINE SUCCEEDS IN TRIALS
description: GENEVA, July 24  Largescale field trials in Egypt and the Sudan have confirmed the ability of a vaccine to immunize against cerebrospinal meningitis caused by type A germs, the World Health Organization said today.

title: AUDITOR ACCUSES A FLORIDA SCHOOL
description: WASHINGTON, July 24A Government auditor reported today that the Green Valley School in Florida had overcharged a Defense Department health insurance program by $185,000.

title: Soviet Editor Cautions Egypt About Growing Ties to West
description: MOSCOW, July 24  The Government newspaper Izvestia sharply criticized tonight the Egyptian Government, warning Cairo that its new Western friends were not to he trusted.

title: FARM OWNER IS SUED BY THE STARLEDGER
description: NEWARK, July 24 (AP)Charging that its freedem to report the news had been violated. The Newark StarLedger filed a $250,000 Federal damage suit today against a New Jersey farm owner whose employes allegedly roughed up one of its reporters and a State Assemblyman investigating alleged abuses against migrant farmworkers.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Federal District Judge Mark A. Constantino ruled yesterday against five firemen who had challenged the constitutionality of the Fire Department's new regulations on beards, mustaches and the length of hair. The court holds that the regulation is a valid exercise of state power and is not an unreasonable interference with the firemen's constitutional rights, the Brooklyn judge said.

title: 61,319 See Americans Win, 5833,
Foolish Pleasure Wins Tremont
description: Foolish Pleasure outlasted What. a Sketch in the $28,800 Tremont at Aqueduct yesterday and then withstood a clakth of foul to win the stakes by a neck

title: Spain Imposes Long Terms On 2 in Liberation Group,
description: BARCELONA, Spain, July 24 (AP)A military court sentenced two men today to long prison terms on charges of robbery, resisting arrest and illegal possession of arms. The Government said they were members of the Iberian Liberation Movement, an underground organization.

title: 6 Seized Here on Charges Of Fraud on Relief Checks
description: Five women and a man were arrested in the Bronx yesterday in connection With what the police said was the fraudulent cashing of welfare checks totaling $120,000.

title: Rockland Weekly Sold
description: HAVERSTRAW, N.Y., July 24 (AP)The sale of The Rockland County Times by the estate of William J. McCabe to R.C.T. Publishing Company, a new corporation, was announced today. Sylvan Davis of Old Tappan, N. J., president of R.C.T. was named publisher. His wife, Evelyn, an R.C.T. vice president, will be associate publisher. The weekly, with a circulation of 4.500, was established in 1889 and had been owned by the McCabe family, since 1893.

title: The Superstars
NIXON'S SUPPORT APPEARS TO WANE
description: WASHINGTON, July 24 President Nixon's support on the impeachment issue appeared today to have markedly deteriorated in the House in the wake of two dramatic developments.

title: Decline of a Building Mirrors Flatbush Ills
description: The onceproud apartment house called Nottingham Court at 575 Ocean Avenue, Brooklyn, looks from the outside much like any other substantial, prewar building in the treelined, middleincome Flatbush section.

title: Byrne Yields on Tax Plan
description: TRENTON, July 24  The Democratic majority in the State Senate agreed in a part caucus today not to force who promised to be a final defeat of Governor Byrne's taxreforr program on the Senate floo after the party's leadership re ported that the Democratic Governor had agreed not to in date another incometax pros iposal for at least two years.

title: Martin Topples Ramirez, 63, 61
Cox Says Ruling Affirms Cornerstones of LibertY
description: SOUTH BROOKSVIELE,Me. July 24 (AP)Archibald Cox, former special Watergate prosecutor, said today: the Supreme Court decision, on the White House tapes, reaffirmed two cornerstones of libertythat the law ap plies to all men equally and, that the President is under. the law.

title: Earth Tremor in Italy
description: ANCONA, Italy, July 24 (Reuters)  A fivesecond earth tremor shook this hilly city on the Adriatic coast late last night. There were no reports of damage in the tremor, which registered 5 points on the 12point Mercalli scale.

title: ETHELBERT WARFIELD
description: Ethelbert Warfield, a retired partner in the law firm of Satterlee, Warfield & Stephens, died Tuesday at the Community Hospital in Glen Cove, L.I. He was 76 years old and lived at Sunset Drive in Oyster Bay; L.I.

title: Panel's Pro and Con, Amid 2 Bomb Threats
description: WASHINGTON, July 24 And so it finally began, the public phase of the impeachment proceedings against Richard Milhous Nixon, with praise for the President as an apostle of peace and denunciation of the same man as the source of rampant corruption, with articles of impeachment laid upon the table. There were also two bomb threats.

title: TRANSITAID BILL REVIVED IN HOUSE
description: WASHINGTON, July 24 The MinishWilliams Bill, calling for a countrywide transit subsidy that could funnel $200million to the rail, subway and bus systems of the New York metropolitan area, was resurrected today when the House Rules Committee voted to send it to the House floor.

title: LEGISLATORS GIVE CAMPAIGN SKETCH
description: ALBANY, July 24A preview of the state election campaign was presented here today as Republican and Democratic legislative leaders agreed that inflation, not Watergate, would be the major issue in November's election.

title: France Balks at Sharing
description: BRUSSELS, July 24Hopes that France will begin cooperation with the 12nation Oil Consuiner Coordination Group in the next few months were dashed this week during energy talks in Brussels among the foreign ministers of the nine Common Market nations.

title: Pennsylvania Pact Reached
description: ALLENTOWN, Pa., July 24 AP) Pennsylvania Power & Light Company reached a tentative agreement today with the striking Employes Independent Association, which said that copies of the proposal would be mailed to its 5,000 members. The company services 29 counties in eastern and central Pennsylvania.

title: NEW SIKKIM RULERS SWORN BY THE KING
description: NEW DELHI (UPI)Sikkim's Chogyal, or King, administered the oath of office to five Cabinet ministers today, ending 332 years of monarchical rule in the Himalayan country, the PreSs Trust of India reported.

title: Citicorp Offering Lifts Some Gloom From Markets
description: The good reception accorded Citicorp's huge offering of $650million of floatingrate notes yesterday lifted some more of the gloom from the markets for corporate and tax exempt bonds. Sentiment was also improved by the quick sellout of the day's biggest offering  $200 million of the S. S. Kresge Company convertible debentures. The issue, managed by Morgan Stanley & Co,, was oversubscribed, and the books closed before noon.

title: Austrian Train Derailed
description: VIENNA, July 24 (Reuters)An express train jumped the tracks just south of Vienna today, injuring more than 30 passengers. Twelve persons were hospitalized, two in serious condition, The train was traveling from Belgrade to Vienna when the accident happened near the spa town of Baden.

title: Dave Anderson
description: PITTSBURGH, July 24Until he approached Babe Ruth's home run record, Henry Aaron moved through the National League for two decades as if he were a man cellophane. People looked through him and saw Willie Mays or Mickey Mantle or somebody else. Eventually the cellophane turned into velvet. But to some people he was more than a threat to Babe Ruth's record, he was a black man who was about to break a white man's most revered record. To them, Henry Aaron represented only black velvet. In the hate mail that angered him, Sports.he seemed to rediscover his blackness as he enjoyed the dignity of the black velvet of that they had created. After he hit his 715th The Times home run, he dwelled In the glory of his blackness, quietly but firmly. His new wife, BiIlye, is whispered to have made him more conscious his blackness. Now, quietly but firmly, he has assumed a new role involving his blackness, the willingness to be the major league's first black managerif the Atlanta Braves management affords him the opportunity.

title: Purge Ends and Stars Come Out Again
description: Not many people recognized the New York Stars original defensive secondary, but even those fanatic few who did won't recognize the reshuffled secondary the Stars will use in Philadelphia against the Bell tonight,

title: Coach Takes Over for Lockman, Who Is Stepping Down
description: CHICAGO, July 24 (AP)Jim Marshall, the third base coach, was named manager of the Chicago Cubs today, replacing Whitey Lockman, who retired. Lockman said he would devote fulltime to being director of player development.

title: Reinecke Loses in Effort To Call Expert Witnesses
description: WASHINGTON, July 24A United States District Court judge refused today the requests by counsel for Lieut. Gov. Ed Reinecke of California to call a specialist in internal medicine and a semanticist as expert witnesses.

title: Bolivian President Promises Retuim to Civilian Rule in 75
description: LA PAZ, Bolivia, July 24 (Reuters)  President Hugo Banzer Suarez has promised to hand over power to a constttutional government after general elections in October, 1975.

title: AnacondaChile Pact
description: The Anaconda Company announced it had reached a $253million settlement with the new Government of Chile for the takeover of its Chilean mining subsidiaries in 1971. Details on Page 42.

title: Delay of Makarios Return Suggested by Cyprus Chief
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, July 24Glafkos Clerides, the President of Cyprus, said today that it would be a very unwise move under present circumstances for the deposed President, Archbishop Makarios, to attempt to return to the island. The question whether the Archbishop would ever resume the presidency, he said, will have to be decided by the Cypriote people in general elections in the next few months.

title: Tanker Blast Off France
description: LONDON, July 24 (UPI)The 150,000ton Liberian supertanker Asiatic was ripped open and set on fire today by an interior explosion off the northwest coast of France, the British Navy said. The ship was reported to. be moving through 20foot waves in an effort to reach Brest. A navy spokesman said that one child was killed in the blast and that eight other persons, ineluding five passengers, were injured.

title: John Warhol Jr. Is Dead; ExJersey Aide Was 65
description: John Warhol Jr., who for seven years was Deputy Attorney General of New Jersey under Gov. Alfred E. Driscoll, died Tuesday at St. Mary's Hospital, Passaic, N.J. He was 65 years old and lived at 70 Island Road, Mahwah, N.J.

title: Tanaka Refuses to Give Speech As Japanese Parliament Meets
description: TOKYO, July 24The Japanese Parliament began a special session today and, in an unusual move seen as a sign of his weakened leadership, Premier Kakuei Tanaka refused to give the customary opening address.

title: DiLorenzo Case Goes to Jury
description: A jury of nine men and three women began deliberating the fate of Civil Court Judge Ross J. DiLorenzo yesterday afternoon after hearing a twohour charge from Supreme Court Justice John M. Murtagh.

title: Deaths
Delay of Makarios Return Suggested by Cyprus Chief
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, July 24Glafkos Clerides, the President of Cyprus, said today that it would be a very unwise move under present circumstances for the deposed President, Archbishop Makarios, to attempt to return to the island.

title: Black. Passer Impressing jets
description: When John Jones walked into the New York Jets freeagent tryout camp a couple of weeks ago, he didn't seem to have a lot going for him. Jones is black and rarely has a black player won a regular starting quarterback job in the National Football League.

title: Bridg:
Turks Promise U.N. Not to Use Force to Take Nicosia Airport
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Thursday, July 25  Turkey pledged today not to use force or the threat of force to take over the international airport in Nicosia, which is held by the United Nations peacekeeping force in Cyprus.

title: Byrne's Defeat Followed an Old Script
description: TRENTON, July 24The path to tax reform in New Jersey is strewn with the bleached bones of incometax proposals that failed, and Governor Byrne's plan has now joined others that could not make it.

title: Atlanta's Manager On Interim Status For Rest of Year
description: ATLANTA, July 24 (UPI) Clyde King became a major league manager for the second time today when the Atlanta Braves gave him the job Henry Aaron said he would have taken if it were offered to him.

title: SOBELL EXHIBITS ARE FOUND BY U.S.
description: Ten exhibits sought from the Federal Government by Morton Sobel! in his effort to compile evidence to overturn his conviction in the 1951 case of Julius and Ethel Rosenberg have been found, a lawyer working on the case reported yesterday.

title: 4 ARRESTED HERE IN EXTORTION PLOT
description: Four men were arrested yes terday on an indictment accusing them of extorting $5,1751 from an East Side discotheque owner in exchange for protecH tion against death.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Shooting School Is on Target
description: MANCHESTER, Vt.  A middleaged dog can be taught new tricks, although habit, slowed reflexes and sheer stubborness have to be overcome.

title: Curb on Newsmen
description: WASHINGTON, July 24 (AP) Supreme Court Justice Lewis F. Powell Jr, set aside today an order by a New Orleans judge that restricted reporting of murder trial.

title: PRESIDENT BOWS
Richardson, in Moscow, Briefs Russians on :Watergate Impact
description: MOSCOW, July 24Elliot L. Richardson, who resigned from the post of Attorney General in October in a dispute related to the Watergate scandal, is telling the Soviet leaders, that, in his view, even if President Nixon is removed from office his policy of dtente will be continued by the United States.

title: 2 OFFICERS CALLED IN MADAMS CASE
description: Investigators from the office of the special.state prOsecutor,1 Maurice H. Nadjari, questioned two undercover agents of the Police Department's publicmorals division yesterday in an inquiry into alleged payoffs to police officers by Manhattan prostitution rings.

title: EVANGELISTS VETO WORLDISSUES UNIT
description: LAUSANNE, Switzerland, July 24  Churchmen of 150 countries represented at the World Evangelization Congress here decided today not to form a permanent organization in opposition to the World Council of Churches.

title: Nixon Gets Bill Authorizing Death Penalty in Hijacking
description: WASHINGTON, July 24 (AP) A bill has been sent to President Nixon authorizing the death penalty when an aircraft hijacking results in the death of an innocent person.

title: STATE GIVEN STATUS OF A DISASTER AREA
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., July 24 (AP)  President Nixon declared the state of New York a major disaster area today as the result of fierce storms and flooding since early July.

title: Greece Is Releasing Political Prisoners
