description: ATHENS, July 24The new civilian Government in Greece moved quickly today toward restoring democratic rights, announcing the release of all political prisoners and amnesty for political crimes.

title: Greeks Said to Warn That Turkish Advances in Cyprus Threaten Civilian Rule
description: ATHENS, July 24Greek officials have privately warned the United States, Britain and Turkey that reported Turkish violations of the ceasefire in Cyprus were threatening peace and a restoration of a civilian government in Greece, diplomats and Greeks said today.

title: Meningitis Cases Rise In 2 Brazilian Cities
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, July 24 (UPI)  Medical authorities in Rio de Janeiro said today that the number of children ill with meningitis was increasing dramatically. In So Paulo, the opening of the school year was postponed to prevent the spread of a meningitis epidemic that has killed 187 people there.

title: Senate Passes Realty Bill
description: WASHINGTON, July 24 (Reuters)The Senate passed today and sent to the House legislation to prohibit kickbacks and require disclosure of settlement terms when people buy real estate.

title: Voice Reacts Quickly
description: WASHINGTON, July 24 (UPI) Twelve minutes before Chief Justice of the United States Warren E. Burger finished reading the Supreme Court's ruling today, the Voice of America, the Government broadcasting system, was telling the world that President Nixon had been ordered to surrender more tapes related to the Watergate affair.

title: Screen: Death Wish Hunts Muggers
Meskill Appoints 4 Judges To Common Pleas Courts
description: HARTFORD, July 24 (UPDGoy Thomas J. Meskill has appointed four more Circuit Court judges,to Common Pleas courts. The judges are leonard W. Dorsey of New Britain, WUliam D. Graham of Hartford, Davis H. Jacobs of Meriden and Edward F. Stodolink of Stratford.

title: Truck flips, Stalling Trafftc
description: An overturned tractortrailfir truck on the Long Island Expressway at Little Neck Ilrliway in Little Neck, Queens blocked eastbound traffic for several hours during the evening rush hour yesterday.

title: Lincoln Center Gives Out ReducedSize Programs
description: The programs being handed out at Mostly Mozart Festival concerts and National Ballet of Canada performances at Lincoln Center this week have shrunk in size, but at least they are still free.

title: Canadian Bank Rate Lifted
description: OTTAWA, July 24 (UPI) The Bank of Canada increased its basic interest rate from 8% per cent to a record 9 per cent today. The rise in the bank rate was the third since last January. The last increase was on May 13, when it rose from 81 to 83/4 per cent.

title: Hazard of Salmonella Poisoning Cited in G.A.O. Survey of Meat
description: WASHINGTON,. July 24 (UPI)A Congressional study said today that the problem of salmonella poisoning in meat, particularly in chicken and pork, was as bad as ever.

title: Bonn Foreign Chief Begins Series of Talks in the U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, July 24HansDietrich Genscher, the new Foreign Minister of Weil: Germany, began a series of meetings with leading United States officials today, with emphasis on economic and defense issues.

title: AllStar Review: HoHum Affair
description: PITTSBURGH, July 24 The AllStar game that the National League won, 7.2, from the American League ast night was No. 45 in a series that began in 1933, and it was every bit as easy forget as game No. 45 of my baseball season.

title: Nixon Warmly Congratulates New Greek Premier and Voices Full U.S Support
description: WASHINGTON, July 24President Nixon sent a cablegram of congratulation to Premier Constantine Caramanlis early today about eight hours after the Greek leader returned to Athens from exile and took over the new Government.

title: 2 Republicans Indicate They'll Vote to Impeach
NIELS F. JOHNSEN
description: Niels Frithof Johnsen, the founder and chairman emeritus of Central Gulf Lines, Inc., which began operations with a, single former Liberty ship in 1947, died Tuesday in New, Orleans. He was 79 years old.

title: U.S. Investments Expected
description: PARIS July 24Treasury Secretary William E. Simon has returned from the Middle East convinced there could be a drop in the basic level of oil prices next month and satisfied that oil potentates are responsible investors who recognize a self interest in preserving stable financial conditions.

title: Heap Good Medicine
description: HONG KONG (UPI)  Tests conducted by the Institute of Botany of the Chinese Academy on a traditional chinese herb called dragon blood showed I that it stopped internal and external bleeding in 50 seconds. The best western medicine for this purpose takes 90 seconds, according to an academy report.

title: Saigon Reports Its Bombing Heaviest in Day Since Truce
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Thursday, July 25 (AP)The Saigon command said today that South Vietnamese planes flew the heaviest raids of the 18monthold ceasefire yesterday against North Vietnamese forces.

title: Officials Explain Timing Of Impeachment Debate
description: WASHINGTON, July 24House Judiciary Committee officials said today that there were two principal reasons for beginning the final impeachment debate in the evening today rather than in the day time or tomorrow.

title: KATHARINE HARDWICK
description: Katharine D. Hardwick, dean emeritus of the School of Social Work of Simmons College in Boston, died Tuesday at Cape Cod Hospital in Hyannis, Mass. She was 88 years old and lived in Marstons Mills, Mass.

title: Last American Group Flown Out of Cyprus
description: STUTTGART, West Germany, July 24 (Reuters)The last known group of Americans in Cyprus was being evacuated from the island today by British aircraft, the headquarters of the United States armed forces European command said here.

title: The Court Speaks
description: In a unanimous and firmlyworded opinion, the Supreme Court has reaffirmed the supremacy of law over Presidential pretensions and restated its own authority as the ultimate arbiter of the law. The opinion written by Chief Justice Warren Burger left Mr. Nixon no lawful alternative except to surrender the tapes and documents to United States District Judge John Sirica for his inspection and for possible use in the forthcoming Watergate trial.

title: Lisbon Names New Head Of Government in Angola
description: LISBON, July 24 (AP)Rear Adm. Antonio Wrosa Coutinho has been named head of the new military Government in Angola. He replaces Gen, Jaime Silverio Marques, who was recalled to Lisbon after a week of turmoil in the African colony in which at least 54 persons were killed.

title: The Agents
Consumer Notes
description: When Congress amended the TaftHartley Act last year to allow labor unions to bargain collectively for prepaid legalservice plans as fringe benefits, it sparked new interest and hope among consumerinterest groups.

title: 2 CHARGES LISTED
description: WASHINGTON, July 24 The House Judiciary Committee began historic final deliberations tonight on the possible impeachment of President Nixon without waiting to determine whether new evidence might emerge as a result of Supreme Court judgment earlier today.

title: United States v. Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, July 24  There is the drama of externals, and there is the drama that arises from the situation. It was the latter that gripped the chamber of the Supreme Court as the Chief Justice announced the decision in, United States v. Nixon.

title: Times Declares Dividend
description: The New York Times Company yesterday declared a quarterly dividend of 15 cents share on its Class A and Class B common stock, payable Sept. 26 to stockholders of record Sept. 11. A regular quarterly dividend of $1.375 a share on the 5 per cent cumulative prior preference stock was also declared, payable Oct. 1 to holders of record Sept. 11.

title: 2 Large East Coast Utilities Set BuildingPlan Cutbacks
description: Two major East Coast utility systems announced yesterday that they were cutting back their construction programs by more than $100million each.

title: Concerto in F
description: WASHINGTON, July 24When recently released F.B.I. documents showed Gen. Alexander (Only You) Haig to be the man who requested the wiretap on my telephone in 1969, called the President's chief aide in California to wonder why he had chosen me.

title: Standard Time Urged
description: WASHINGTON, July 24 (UPI) Senator John C. Stennis, Democrat of Mississippi, proposed yesterday that the COUPtry return to standard time for six months each year. He said that the, benefits of yearround daylight saving time as an energysaving device were speculative at best.

title: Newark Now Focusing on Columbus Homes
description: NEWARK, July 24  With the fouryearold rent strike at the Stella Wright Public Housing Project settled, housing officials hefe are turning their attention to another thorny issue  the almostaslong rent strike at Christopher Columbus Homes, a 1,556unit lowincome project in the North Ward.

title: Navajo and Hopi Crowd Hearing On Bills to Settle Land Dispute
description: WASHINGTON, July 24Representatives of two feuding Arizona Indian tribes attempted today to influence the outcome of legislation that could solve a 92yearold land dispute.

title: Individualistic Premier
description: When Constantine Caramanlis was Greece's Minister of Public Works, the story goes, he ordered the trolley tracks torn up in Athens to make way for roadways and buses. But the @Man@ trolley company @in the@ stalled, so one day at dawn Mr. @News@ Caramanlis appeared with a gang of workmen and ripped out the tracks.

title: Montclair Appeals Ruling Of HiringPractice Bias
description: Montclair yesterday appealed a state civil rights ruling that found that the town's Police and Fire Departments discriminated against members of minority groups.

title: The imperatives of Law
description: The Supreme Court, without ever mentioning the word impeachment, has changed the atmosphere, and maybe even the balance of power, in the impeachment de bate in the Congress of the United States.

title: Books of The Times
description: The novelty of reading Paul E. Erdman's first novel, The Billion Dollar Sure Thing, was that you learned something and got entertained at the same time. You learned something about international monetary exchange rates, about the gold standard and about the function of worldwide confidence in the dollar (unless of course you were one of the film who had understood these things already). And you got entertained by seeing the lessons immediately woven into a story whose outcome you cared about (and whose outcome you could only follow if you had learned the lessons properly). In short, The Billion Dollar Sure Thing was a clever piece of programed education.

title: OMBUDSMAN TELLS OF A PRISON PAST
description: SALEM, Ore., July 20Marc (Ted) Winters, the new Oregon ombudsman, remembers a boyhood. friend, Wayne Long, who taught him to harness horses.

title: Screen: Tough Opens
The Superstars
Prosecution Rests In Trial of 2 Indians Over Wounded Knee
description: ST. PAUL, July 24 (UPI)The prosecution rested Its case today in the 6month trial of two leaders of the American Indian Movement, Dennis Banks and Russell Means, who are charged with 10 felonies in last year's 71day Indian, takeover at Wounded Knee, S.D.

title: Connecticut Republican Faces Up to Watergate
description: In the opinion of one ambitious young Republican politiclan, the way to begin to make tile best of Watergate in an election year is to admit that it is there.

title: 2d Youth Gives Up in Killing of Boy Who Fought Bike Thieves
description: A youth wanted for the slaying of a 16yearold high school student in a bicycle robbery earlier this week surrendered yesterday afternoon to a television news reporter.

title: Jury Begins Deliberating In Calzadilla Kidnapping
description: NEWARK, July 24  A jury of nine women and three men went into deliberation at 2:10 P.M. today to determine the fate of five persons charged with the kidnapping last March 6 of 9yearold John Calzadilla for $50,000 ransom.

title: What Pension Reform Bill Means. A Little More Security for Widows
Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: A COUNCIL SERVES AFTER TERM DIM
description: NEW ORLEANS, July 24Because a Federal court has declared that racial discrimination exists in this city's voting districts, the seven members of the City Council, elected to fouryear terms, are now serving a fifth year without having had to undergo an election.

title: IndianPakistani Rancor Halts Bolstering of Links
description: NEW DELHI, July 23Three months after India and Pakistan resolved to open the way for diplomatic and economic relations, the atmosphere has turned bitter and uneasy.

title: Intrepid Sails to 2 Victories
Turkish Chief Hails Athens Shift As Step to New Era of Freedom
description: ANKARA, Turkey, July 24Premier Bulent Ecevit of Turkey hailed today the installation of a new civilian leadership in Greece as a step toward a new era for democracy and freedom in our region.

title: 3 Allies Warn Soviet on Berlin Access
description: BONN, July 24  The embassies of the United States, France and Britain said today they expected the Soviet Union to prevent East Germany from carrying out a threat to block officials of a new Bonn agency from using the highways to get to their office in West Berlin.

title: Belfast Bomb Injures 3
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, July 24 (Reuters)A bomb seriously damaged a bar today on the fringe of Belfasts New Lodge area, a Roman Catholic section. Three persons were sent to hospitals for treatment.

title: Priest Sees Horrors If Nixon Is Impeached
description: WASHINGTON, July 24 (AP)A White House aide, the Rev. John McLaughlin, said today that the nation would face a yearlong parade of horrors if the House voted to impeach President Nixon.

title: OPINION BY BURGER
description: WASHINGTON, July 24 The Supreme Court ruled today, 8 to 0, that President Nixon must provide potential evidence for the criminal trial of his formers subordinates, rejecting flatly the President's contention that he had absolute authority to withhold such material.

title: CALZADILLA CASE GOES TO THE JURY
description: NEWARK, July 24  A jury of nine women and three men went into deliberation at 2:10 P.M. today to determine the fate of five persons charged with the kidnapping last March 6 of 9yearold John Caizadilla for $50,000 ransom.

title: Basic Principles of Legal System Restated
description: WASHINGTON, July 24Five years ago Warren E. Burger was personally chosen by President Nixon for the job of Chief Justice of the United States, Today, Mr, Burger was the author of the Supreme Court's decision ordering Mr. Nixon to turn over White House tapes and records to the United States District Court.

title: People and Business
description: Harry Freeman, vice president of the Overseas Private Investment Corporation, said yesterday in Cairo he was hopeful of Egypt's acceptance of American investors but cautioned that it may take some time. Mr. Freeman is in Cairo to discuss 0.P.I.C.'s role in establishing new privatelyowned American business ventures in Egypt following the visit earlier this month of Treasury Secretary William IE. Simon. That visit led to the signing of the Investment Guarantee Agreement, which permits more freedom and flexibility for private investors who want to operate in Egypt. Interested companies must have permission from the Egyptian Government and plan to manufacture products that will be beneficial to Egypt.

title: LISBON RECOGNIZES RIGHTS OF COLONIES
description: LISBON, July 24 (UPOPortugal formally acknowledged today the right of her overseas colonies to selfdetermination and independence.

title: Footwear Products Prices Raised by Goodyear Tire
description: The Goodyear Tire and Rubber Company announced yesterday price increases for footwear products, which it attributed to higher raw Materials costs and a recent wage increase.

title: Mobil Gains by 99% Caution Voiced
description: Earnings gains ranging up to 100 per cent and more were !announced yesterday for the !second quarter of 1974 by several of the nation's largest oil companies.

title: CLOYD LAPORTE, 81, LAWYER, IS DEAD
description: Cloyd Laporte, senior partner in the law firm of Dewey, Ballantine, Bushby, Palmer & Wood, died yesterday at his country home on Twin Elm Lane in Carmel, N.Y., after long illness. He would have been 82 years old today and lived also at 430 East 86th Street.

title: Colombian Police Kill Hijacker After Passengers Leave Plane
description: CALI, Colombia,July 24 (Reuters)  The police today shot and killed the hijacker of a Colombian airliner and arrested his alleged accomplice, his wife, when the plane landed in this southwestern Colombian city.

title: FISCAL 74 DEFICIT
description: WASHINGTON, July 24The Federal budget would up the fiscal year 1974 with a deficit of $3.5billion, the smallest redink Jigure since the.fiscal year 1970, the Treasury and the Office of Management and Budget reported today.

title: Ballet: Nureyev's Sleeping Beauty
description: The National Ballet of Canada, with Rudolf Nureyev as guest artist, has returned to the Metropolitan Opera House for a threeweek season. The two last weeks will include a repertory that was not presented during the company's visit this spring.

title: Movie Palace Regains Lost Splendor
description: The Beacon Theater at Broadway and 74th Street, one of the last of the movie palaces built before the Depression, with frescoes, monumental golden statues and dazzling chandeliers, is being restored to its former opulence and turned into a firstrun movie house after years of obscurity as a shabby auditorium for $1 movies.

title: 2 CHARGES LISTED
description: WASHINGTON, July 24The House Judiciary Committee began historic final deliberations tonight on the possible impeachment of President Nixon without waiting to determine whether new evidence might emerge as a result of Supreme Court judgment earlier today.

title: Senate Passes Education Aid Measure, 8115 With
description: WASHINGTON, July 24The Senate approved today a $25billion education bill containing a compromise provision to limit the busing of children for school desegregation.

title: F.T.C. AIDE TO LET LITTON KEEP UNIT
description: WASHINGTON, July 24 (AP) A Federal Trade Commis aion official recommended to day that Litton Industries he permitted to retain the Ger man typewriter manufacturer TriumphAdler.

title: LEGAL CONFLICT SPANNED 3 MONTHS
description: WASHINGTON, July 24The legal battle whose outcome was decided today by the Supreme Court was joined three months ago in United States District Court here, when a lawyer from Texas filed a fairly routine type of motion asking that certain material be subpoenaed for possible use in a forthcoming criminal trial.

title: Anaconda Reaches Accord With Chile
description: The Anaconda Company bounced yesterday that it reached a settlement with the new Government of Chile over the expropriation in 1971 of two of its subsidiaries, the Chile Exploration Company and the Andes Copper Mining Com

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Debt Issue to Be First by Any Thrift Group
description: The New York Bank for Savings, the fourth largest mutual savings institution in the nation, said yesterday that it plabned to sell the public $50million of floatingrate notes in two weeks.

title: Dr. Samuel I. Kooperstein, Export Authority Aide, 72
description: Dr. Samuel I. Kooperstein, retired medical director of the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey, died Tuesday at his home, 380 Mountain, Road, Union City, N.J. He was 72 years old.

title: Broadcasts of Debate Resume This Morning
description: CBSTV and the Public Broadcasting Service will televise today's session of the House Judiciary Committee's debate on impeachment starting at 9:30 A.M.

title: Greece Is Releasing Political Prisoners
description: ATHENS, July 24The new civilian Government in Greece moved quickly today toward restoring democratic rights, anflouncing the release of all,poMica] prisoners and amnesty for political crimes.

title: Council Bill Would Bar Sunbathing in the Nude
description: A bill to ban nude sunbathing on public beaches was introduced yesterday in the City Council. This would be in addition to rules under the administrative code, that make it illegal to swim in the nude or change clothes on a public beach.

title: Business Briefs
description: BRUSSELS, July 24 (UP1)The dollar dropped to its lowest level of the year in Paris today and its lowest for at least six weeks on most other European exchanges. Gold rose 25 cents an ounce to close in Zurich and London $144.75.

title: For Beltlessness, Saint Laurent
description: PARIS, July 24The gypsy band at the entrance played gaily as the guests entered the mirrored salon, which was decorated in red velvet, mirrors and wallpaper painted to look like marble. Everybody was there: Paloma Picasso, Yul Brynner, Oscar dela Renta, Olympia de Rothschild, Catherine Deneuve and Earl Blackwellso many, in fact, there weren't nearly enough seats and many stood against the walls.

title: Gov. Sargent's Veto Upheld
description: BOSTON, July 24 (AP)The Senate has sustained a veto by Gov. Francis W. Sargent of a bill that would have required police officers to carry firearms when quelling prison disorders. Opponents of the measure argued that it would have stripped commanding officers of their right to make a decision.

title: CITY IS CRITICIZED BY BOND SERVICE
description: Fitch Investors Service, the thirdlargest municipal creditratihg service in the country, criticized the city of New York yesterday for the way it borrowed money; saying that it would ate the city's bonds at BBBlower, it said, than New York City has ever been rated.

title: Franco Termed Eager To Set Off for Vacation
description: MADRID, July 24 (AP)  Generalissimo Francisco Franco, reported fully recovered from a blood clot and internal bleeding, is eager to go on vacation, doctors reported today.

title: Lottery Numbers
PRESIDENT BOWS
description: LAGUNA BEACH, Calif., July 24President Nixon, abandoning his challenge to the Supreme Court's jurisdiction over him, said today that he would comply with this morning's Court decision on subpoenaed data in all respects.

title: Air Pollution Is Said to Kill 108,000 People Prematurely
description: DENVER (UPI)  Air pollution has killed 108,000 people prematurely in New York during the last 10 years, says a prominent researcher.

title: OPINION BY BURGER
description: WASHINGTON, July 24 The Supreme Court ruled today, 8 to 0, that President Nixon must provide potential evidence for the criminal trial of his former subordinates, rejecting flatly the President's contention that he had absolute authority to withhold such material.

title: Mrs. Gandhi Links Her Critics at Home With McCarthyism
description: NEW DELHI, July 25Prime Minister Indira Gandhi accused her critics today of spreading McCarthyism in India by making wild allegations of corruption against her and her Government leaders.

title: No Reason to Delay
description: If any one of three circumstances obtained, the House Judiciary Committee might possibly be justified In delaying its impeachment decisions pending scrutiny of the additional tape recordings which the Supreme Court has now,ordered President Nixon to submit:

title: Asarco Net Climbs 200%
description: Leading metal companies reported yesterday substantial gains in earnings for the second quarter of 1974, The reports included companies in the copper and steel industries.

title: JOSEPH S. ROSENTHAL
description: NEW LONDON, Conn., July 25 (AP)Joseph S. Rosenthal,. who, as a Coast Guard captain, was the commander of the for mer Groton Coast Guard Institute, died today at the Coast Guard Academy Hospital, He was 77 years old.

title: TV: Networks and the White House
description: In this week's coverage of major developments surrounding the possibility of Presidential impeachment, the most significant television moments stemmed not from content but, in two key instances, from behindthescenes network policy decisions. Tuesday evening, NBC did not  repeat, did notgive live coverage to the 7:30 news conference of James D. St. Clair, Presidential counsel. Wednesday evening, the CBS Evenings News With Walter Cronkite did not give live coverage to Mr, St. Clair's delivery of President Nixon's response to the tapes decision of the Supreme

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: QuickDivorce Firm Called Violator

title: DECISION BY 5 TO 4
description: WASHINGTON, July 25The Supreme Court raised major hurdles to merging city and suburban schools for racial integration today by all but banning the busing of children across school district lines for desegregation.

title: Wilson Denies He's a Millionaire And Promises Full Disclosure
description: Governor Wilson denied yesterday that he was a millionaire and promised to make public in due course his and his wife's net worth.

title: JOHN K. CARROLL
description: John K. Carroll, law partner in Davies, Hardy, Ives & Lawther, died yesterday in New Rochelle (N.Y.) Hospital. He was 65 years old and lived at 18 Woodbine Avenue in Larchtnont, N. Y.

title: Contract Awards
description: The General Dynamics Corporation received yesterday $306million in Navy contract, including $285.4million to begin construction of the first submarine in the Trident strategic missile system.

title: 10c Coffee, Nostalgia At Yonkers
description: YONKERS July 25 s It cost only a buck and a quarter to get into the grandstand at Yonkers Raceway tonight, Coffee was a dime, hot dogs were 15 cents, soda was 10 cents and beer was 20 cents.

title: A SUSPECT GIVES UP IN KENNEDY ROBBERY
description: A young unemployed man was arrested last night and charged with stealing a bicycle and tennis racket from John F. Kennedy Jr., the 13yearold son of the late President, in Central Park two months ago.

title: State to Make Tracks More Appealing
description: Bertram D. Sarafan, the new chairman of the State Racing and Wagering Board, said yesterday New York would do whatever it takes to meet closerange racing competition from New Jersey.

title: Bronx Man's Report of a Slaying Leads to His Arrest as Suspect
description: A bizarre tale related by a 22yearold Bronx man on a television news program about his having witnessed the strangling of an elderly woman in her apartment led to his arraignment yesterday as a suspect in the slaying.

title: CHAPIN'S FOLK MUSIC HAS INNOCENT MOOD
description: Harry Chapin can be secure about his following. In a rainstorm, the Wollman Rink was packed with devotees of the New Yorkbased folkie when he appeared Wednesday night in the openair Schaefer Music Festival"Call it a picnic gone awry, said Mr. Chapin.

title: O.E.C.D. Warns Nixon on Slump in U.S.
description: PARIS, July 25  The Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development cautioned President Nixon today that his Administration's policies might be leading the United States into a deeper slump than he realized.

title: Harry O. Locher, Engineer, Helped Build IND System
description: Harry O. Locher, a civil engineer, died yesterday of emphysema at St. Francis Hospital, Roslyn, L. 1. He was 91 years old and lived at 37.42 86th Street, Jackson Heights, Queens.

title: Berlinger Says Study Confirms City Laxity in Handling Welfare
description: A scientific sample of 114 cases at a typical welfare center in Queens showed that 33 of the cases were ineligible for payment and 20 others were receiving overpayments, the State Welfare Inspector General reported yesterday.

title: Saigon Reporting 1,100 Enemy Killed In a Fierce Battle
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Friday, July 26 (Reuters)The Saigon command said today that about 1,100 Communist troops had been killed in a fierce battle near a besieged town in the northern part of South Vietnam.

title: Rotating TV Coverage Continues on Hearings
description: The House Judiciary Committee's impeachment debate will be telecast today by NBCTV and the Public Broadcasting Service, starting at 10 A.M. The three networks are rotating in covering the proceedings.

title: I.R.A. Admits Planting Bomb on British Plane
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, July 25 (UPI)  The Provisional wing of the Irish Republican Army said today it planted an unprimed bomb aboard a British Airways jet to prove it could breach airport security. It warned that in the future bombs would be set to explode.

title: ANTHONY FAVOR
description: Anthony Favor, former president of the New York Shoe Travelers Association, died of a coronary attack while playling golf at the Westchester Country Club, Harrison, N. Y., on July 13. He was 76 years old and lived at 5 Buena Vista Drive, Greenwich, Conn.

title: Jobriath Displays A New Rock Voice But Familiar Face
description: Jobriath, who made his New York debut on Wednesday, is, believe it or not, a familiar face. The singer stared down for several months from a billboard, 40 feet or so square, in midtown, the start of a campaign designed to establish him as major rock star and distinguished by excessive managerial hyperdrive in a business not noted for reticence in these matters.

title: NIXON AT LOW POINT IN THE GALLUP POLL
description: President Nixon's popularity rating has declined to its lowest point recorded to date;, with only 24 per cent approving his performance, the Gallup., Poll reported yesterday.

title: Profit Taking Snaps Rally And Prices of Stocks Drop
CECELIA RIBMAN
description: Cecelia Lowe Ribman, a former insurance broker here, died of cancer yesterday in Memorial Hospital. She was 80 years old and lived at 400 East 57th Street.

title: Economic Council
description: What ought the President's Council of Economic Advisers to be?

title: E.P.A. Chief Is Confident About NoLead Gas Rules
description: WASHINGTON, July 25 (UPI) Russell E. Train, head of the Environmental Protection Agency, said today that he did not believe that the 1975 model cars, which must run on nolead gas, would give consumers trouble.

title: Blyth Eastman Shows Losses Of $8.8Million in Fiscal Year
description: Monthly management reports circulated among senior officers of Blyth Eastman Dillon & Co., Inc., show that the firm has been running up some of deficitstrewn Wall Street's highest losses.

title: Nearby Fishing Outlook for Weekend
description: AREA AFluke have been running well. Catches of up to 10 pounds have been made off Spring Lake and Seagirt with squid and smelt as bait. On the surf at Long Beach Island, fluke of a slightly smaller variety have also been in abundance. On the Ridge off Surf City, blues in the 8.10 pound range have been caught by fishermen chumming with butterfish. Striped bass and blues are plentiful (but small) at Island Beach and Sea Side Park. Many crabs are in Barnegat Bay.

title: Assessing the StrategicArms Negotiations in Moscow
description: WASHINGTON  For those who have seriously hoped for longterm, balanced and effective limits on offensive strategic nuclear arms, the Moscow summit talks may turn out to have been a decisive, negative turning point.

title: Inco Increases Bid for Stock of ESB
description: In still another move to el. iminate its competitive bidder, International Nickel Company of Canada, Ltd., late yesterday raised its bid for all the shares of ESB, Inc., the world's largest maker of batteries. to $41 a share. The $41 bid was the second by Inca during the day. In the morning, Inca announced it would pay $38 share for ESB. Within a few hours the United Aircraft Con poration, its competitor for the hand of ESB, announced that it would meet the price of $38. Shortly thereafter, an Inco spokesman said it was probable that the Canadian company would make another announcement before the end of the day.

title: Giscard Now Sees Need for More Reform Than He Did at Election
description: PARIS, July 25Valery Giscard d'Estaing said at his first presidential press conference here today that two months in office had convinced him change in France must go much further and deeper than seemed needed when he was elected.

title: Musicals Thrive in Australia, but Accent Is Broadway
description: ADELAIDE, Australia, July 24  Perhaps Australia has only its publicity to blame if so many people think of it as a land of Koala bears, kangaroos, beer cans and limitless bush. In fact, it is the most urbanized of all Englishspeaking societies  the vast majority of Australians live in large citiesand its two largest towns, Sydney and Melbourne, are both larger than Rome. In such circumstances it is little wonder that the theater flourishes.

title: RULING EXPECTED ON TWAIN TODAY
U.S. ENVOY BACKS MORE SAIGON AID
description: WASHINGTON, July 25Graham A. Martin, United States Ambassador to South Vietnam, asked today for Congressional approval of the Nixon Administration's request for $750million in economic aid for the Saigon Government so that in a very few years we will be able to regard our Vietnam involvement as closed.

title: Release Tied to Negotiations
description: LIMASSOL, Cyprus, July 25On the sunbaked dirt playing field of the municipal soccer stadium here, about 1,750 men from Limassol's ethnic Turkish enclave and surrounding Turkish villages are Penned in behind coils of barbed wire.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: In Midwest, Drought Worsens
description: CHICAGO, July 25A Midwestern drought has begun to reduce this year's corn and soybean crops and many farmers are hoping, some desperately, for rain this week to save them.

title: Ankara Reports Holding 783
description: ANKARA, Turkey, July 25The Turkish Government announced tonight that it had taken 783 Greek and Greek Cypriote prisoners during the fighting on Cyprus last weekend.

title: British Armor and Troops Bolster U.N. Peace Force at the Nicosia Airport
Leslie Carpenter Dead at 52; Long a Newsman in the Capital
description: WASHINGTON, July 25 (AP) Leslie Carpenter, a Washington newspaper correspondent for nearly three decades and husband of a former White House press aide Elizabeth Carpenter, died yesterday at the age of 52.

title: 16 Camden Police Face Departmental Hearings
description: CAMDEN, July 25 (AP)Two alleged incidents of police brutality have led to departmental charges against 16 city policemen, including the deputy police chief, Mario Ferrari, and a patrolman twice charged with atrocious assault and battery.

title: HOUSE UNIT BACKS TAX RISE FOR RICH
description: WASHINGTON, July 25 (UPI)  The House Ways and Means Committee tentatively decided today to increase the minimum tax on wealthy individuals who receive large amounts of taxfree preference income.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: To many runners, summer used to be the season between track and crosscountry competition. But now, rapidly increasing number of allcorners track and field meets in the state is giving athletes more opportunities compete through most of the summer.

title: Impact of the Ruling
description: Yesterday's Supreme Court ruling all but barring the busing of school children across school iistrict lines to achieve desegregation adds a major new legal barrier to the already potent political and social forces working against the integration of bigcity schools. The immediate impact will be to impose a freeze on very much further desegregation in heavily black cities, North and South. But the longrange impact, may be to solidify and possibly accelcrate the demographic forces that in recent years have divided many of America's large metropolitan areas into dual cities, one largely black and poor, the other mostly

title: Turkish Reservations About a Geneva Hotel
description: GENEVA, July 25 (Reuters) One sure sign that a peace conference is about to begin here is the lastminute switching of hotel bookings when one side learns that the other has rooms in the same place.

title: Experts. Ask Action to Avoid Millions of Deaths in Food Crisis
description: From droughtbesieged Africa to the jittery Chicago grain market, from worried Government offices in Washington to the partlyfilled granaries of teeming India, the longpredicted world food crisis is beginning to take shape as one of the greatest peacetime problems the world has had to face in modern times.

title: Police Hold a Fete for Russians
description: When Officer Murray Trelford planned a Frisbee match between his colleagues in the 20th Precinct and 30 members of the Moiseyev Dance Company, it was not so much to teach the dancers how to play the gamewhich is unknown in Russia but to prove to them that Central Park is safe.

title: Greek Cypriotes Detaining 1,750 Turks in a Stadium
PRESIDENT CALLS FOR LESS SPENDING
description: LOS ANGELES, July 25President Nixon offered tonight a steadyasyougo policy of fiscal and monetary restraint, along with an appeal to the American people to spend less money,.as his program to curb inflation.

title: GOVERNMENT HEADS QUIT IN MOZAMBIQUE
description: LOURENCO MARQUES, Mozambique, July 25 (Agence FrancePresse)  The governor general of Mozambique, Dr. Henrique Soares de Melo, and all members of his provisional administration have resigned, a communiqu said here today.

title: U.S. AIDE REPORTS DISMISSAL THREAT
description: WASHINGTON, July 25A Government lawyer told Senate subcommittee today he was threatened with dismissal if he continued to give legal help to a member of the Federal Renegotiation Board who was challenging the profits of one of the country's biggest space and defense contractors.

title: PARKER TYLER, 70, A WRITER ON FILMS
description: Parker Tyler, who wrote sevleral books on the motion pictures, died here Wednesday. He was 70 years old and lived at 15 Charles Street.

title: A Sense of Duty
description: When it was first proposed that the impeachment proceedings be televised, widespread concern was expressed that the members of Congress might disgrace themselves by prattling inanities before the cameras or by grandstanding for living room consumption back home. The House Judiciary Committee, which began its televised hearings on the impeachment debate night before last, has knocked those fears squarely in the head.

title: About New York
description: One thing that delights a New Yorker's soul is to be alone in a crowd, which is one reason, among several, why a great many people gathered in the Sheep Meadow the other night to hear the New York Philharmonic. Actually, no one knows how many people did gather, and the police will not guess.

title: Mrs. Klein to Proceed With Plan For Inmate Residence at Hospital
description: BLUE ANCOR, July 25The State Institutions and Agencies Commissioner, Ann Klein, indicated today that she would proceed with a plan to house state prisoners at nearby Ancora Psychiatric Hospital despite the protests of Mayors from six Camden County communities and other local officials.

title: Rail Freight Traffic Up
description: WASHINGTON, July 25The Associations of American Railroads reported today that freight traffic on United States railroads in the latest week was an estimated 16.3 billion tonmiles, 1.1 per cent above the corresponding week last year Carloadings in the same period totaled 520,877 cars, 2.0 per cent beloW last year. The American Trucking Associtti tions, Inc., reported intercity truck tonnage was 4.6 per MC below last year.

title: Tough Strip Mine Curbs Passed by House, 29181
description: WASHINGTON, July 25A bill that would Impose strict Federal environmental controls on the widespread desolation of land and water caused by strip mining for coal cleared the House tonight after one of the chamber's longest and most heated debates in years.

title: Losers Win $75,000
description: OCEAN CITY, N. J., July 25 (AP)  The State Lottery Commission inaugurated its new $75,000 Grand Drawing lottery here today, a contest for holders of losing tickets. George Chambers and Dorothy Barrett of Sussex were selected as cowinners from among 36 finalists. The Grand Drawing will be held every four or five weeks, depending on ticket sales.

title: A.B.A. Panel Seeks ,Repeal Of Laws on Prostitution
description: CHICAGO, July 25 (UPI)State laws covering prostitution represent one of the most direct forms of discrimination against women and should be repealed, committee of the American Bar Association said today.

title: John B. Orr Jr., 54, Dead; Dade County Mayor Since  72
description: MIAMI, July 25John B. Orr Jr., Mayor of Dade County, died here today of cancer. He was 54 years old.

title: ISRAELI UNITS RING WOULDBE SETTLERS
description: TEL AVIV, July 25Israeli forces tonight surrounded an encampment in occupied Jot.= danian territory where Israeli squatters proclaimed their in

title: SENATE UNIT CLEARS PORTLICENSING BILL
description: WASHINGTON, July 25 (AP) A bill that would allow Federal licensing of deepwater ports for supertankers off the United States coast was approved yesterday by a Senate subcommittee.

title: Excerpts From Nixon's Address on the Economy
description: LOS ANGELES, July [AP]  Following are excerpts front the prepared text of President Nixon's economic address, here to. day to a gathering of businessmen and manufacturers:

title: SUIT BIDS N. A. M. FILE AS LOBBYIST
description: The National Association of Manufacturers was charged yesterday in United States District Court in Washington with illegally failing to register as a lobbyist.

title: Senators Reject Nixon Criticism of Consumer Bill
description: WASHINGTON, July 25The principal Senate sponsors of legislation to set up a new Consumer Protection agency told President Nixon today they could pass the bill despite his threat of a veto.

title: White House Aides Upset And Concerned by Events
description: WASHINGTON, July 25The events of this week in the Watergate case have left members of the White House staff deeply shaken and concerned, more so than at any time in the past.

title: Stars Defeat Bell, 1715, As 64,719 Fans Watch
GOING OUT Guide
description: GOT NO STRINGS Summergarden, in which the Museum of Modern Art throws open the heavy gates to its sculpture courtyard for public entertainment, continues to delight people with informal music and dance. This evening, however, the program take a new turn with a performance by Steven Hansen, who calls himself Puppetman, and who is a walking Punch and Judy Show unto himself.

title: FAIRCAMPAIGN UNIT HOLDS HEARING HERE
description: The vice chairman of the Fair Campaign Practices Committee cautioned the State Board of Elections yesterday against promulgating a faircampaign code with many specific terms.

title: SENTENCING LAW RULED IMPROPER
description: State Supreme Court Justice Burton B, Roberts yesterday overruled as unconstitutional new state law requiring mandatory prison term for any secondfelony offender whose previous crime was committed in another state even though the first offense was not felony in New York.

title: Advertising: Credit Unions Bid
description: The nation's 23,000 credit unions consider themselves in a battle with the banks, savings and loan associations and finance comptinies. They also consider themselves the least known.

title: Books of The Times
description: While it is probably not an item for the front page, it most certainly is news that a new Horatio Alger Jr, novel has been found. Alger, who died in 1899 al the age of 07, might reasonably enough be assumed to be quite through as an author by now, threequarters of a century later. Yet, after his death no fewer than 11 books appeared under the name of Horatio Alger Jr., written by Edward Stratemeyer, who called himself Alger's literary executor. Still later, F. Scott Fitzgerald wrote an Algertype story in The Saturday Evening Post in 1929 and even borrowed an Alger title,."Forging Ahead.

title: COMMON MARKET WILL STUDY I.B.M.
description: BRUSSELS, July 25 (UPI)The European Economic Community announced today that it would open an investigation into possible antitrust violation by the International Business Machines Corporation.

title: P.S.C. Aide Backs Con Ed Rate Raise
Philippine DC10 Held on Coast For Flight Called Unauthorized
description: SAN FRANCISCO, July 25 (AP)The United States Government has seized a Philippine Air Lines DC10 airliner on the premise that the carrier was unauthorized to fly the wide plane to this country.

title: HOUSE UNIT PULLS BIG TV AUDIENCE
description: The opening session Wednesday night of the House Judiciary Committee's debate on the articles of impeachment substantially increased television viewing from the normal summertime levels, according to the overnight Nielsen ratings for New York and Los Angeles.

title: F.D.A. TO APPROVE A NEW SWEETENER
description: WASHINGTON, July 25The Food and Drug Administration will announce tomorrow its approval of a highintensity sweetener that is expected to be the first real competitor to saccharine since cyclamates were banned about three years ago.

title: Union Wage Rises In 74 Top Gains Achieved LastYearl
description: WASHINGTON, July 25 Firstyear wage rate increases negotiated by unions averaged 8.7 per cent in the first half of 1974, well above the 5.8 per cent average of 1973, the Labor Department reported today.

title: HIGH COURT RULING BLOCKS CITYSUBURB SCHOOL LINKS TO ACHIEVE INTEGRATION
Two Injured as Glass Falls From John Hancock Tower
description: BOSTON, July 25 (AP)Two pedestrians were treated yesterday for eye injuries suffered apparently as a result of a shattered pane of glass that fell from the John Hancock Tower.

title: Dean Raises New Issue On Dates of Nixon Talks
description: WASHINGTON, July 25John W. Dean 3d said in testimony released today that he may have discussed the raising of $1million for the Watergate burglars with President Nixon at least once before March 21, 1973, the date on which Mr. Nixon says he first learned of proposals to make such payments.

title: Excerpts From Supreme Court Decision Barring DetroitSuburban School Merger
description: WASHINGTON, July 25Following are excerpts P.m. the decision of the Suprem Court reversing lower court on a desegregation plan fo Detroit and suburban school and from three dissentin, opinions:

title: ExNazi Jailed in Hamburg
description: HAMBURG, West Germany, July 25 (Reuters)A Hamburg court has sentenced a former Nazi officer, Otto Hantke, 67, to life imprisonment for killing four jews between 1942 and 11943, The Hamburg Justice Ministry said today.

title: Piano Played Without Shoes
description: LONDON (AP)Stephen Bishops, a pianist, found at the beginning of a concert in Staffordshire that his new shoes squeaked when he worked the pedals. He took them off and finished the twohour recital in his socks.

title: A Plea on Energy Office.
description: WASHINGTON, July 25 (UPI) The Federal Energy Administrator, John C. Sawhill, argued today that his Federal Energy Office should be kept alive beyond its scheduled expiration date next Feb. 28. In testimony before a Senate Agriculture subcommittee, Mr. Sawhill said a bill extending the agency's life should be tailored to make'it more workable in a period when supply and demand are in better balance.

title: World Court Backs British Fishing Off Iceland
description: THE HAGUE, July 25 (Reuters)The World Court ruled here today that Iceland's decision to extend exclusive fishing rights to 50 nautical miles from the coast could not apply to Britain.

title: House Panel's Debate on Impeachment Focuses on Issues of Proof and Doubt
description: WASHINGTON, July 25 Presumption of innocence. Proof beyond a reasonable doubt, They are words from the criminal law; and they peppered the debate today over the impeachability of Richard M. Nixon.

title: Smith Gains In Tennis at Washington
description: WASHINGTON July 25 (UPI)Stan Smith survived a stiff challenge from 19"yearold John Lloyd of Britain today in the $100,000 Washington StarNews tennis tournament. The topseeded star won his second round match, 68, 63, 64.

title: NIXON SIGNS A BILL ON LEGAL AID TO POOR
description: WASHINGTON, July 25 (AP) The White House announced today that President Nixon had signed into law a bill creating an independent corporation providing legal aid to the poor.

title: Yastrzemski'
Limousines Whisk Soviet Elite to New Parliament
description: MOSCOW,July 25A fleet of black Chaika limousines whisked the elite of the Soviet Union today to the ceremonial public display of Leninist democracy presented once every four yearsthe convocation of a new Supreme Soviet.

title: Riot Policemen Break Up Protests at 3 French Jails
description: PARIS, July 25  Protests erupted in three more prisons today, bringing to five the number of French prison disturbances in the last week.

title: The Pop Life
description: The Jackson 5 (or six, with the addition of 11yearold Randy), who are performing at Madison Square Garden tomorrow night, are hardly the only young group before the public these dayh. The record racks and the airwaves are full of piping prepubescence.

title: Reinecke Witness Reports Errors In Key SenateHearing Transcript
description: WASHINGTON, July 25A court reporter from California, testified today in the perjury trial of Lieut. Gov. Ed Reinecke script of a Senate Judiciary Committee hearing on which the indictnient of Mr. Reinecke is based. of California that he had found substantial errors in the tran

title: City Urged to Make Pharmacies Keep Drug Profile of Customers
description: Dr. Lowell E. Bellin, the city's Health Commissioner, submitted to the Board of Health yesterday a proposed resolution that would require all pharmacies in the city to maintain a medication history, or drug profile, for every customer.

title: Kerner Denied a Review.
description: WASHINGTON, July 25 (AP) The Supreme Court refused today to reconsider its denial of a request from Otto Kerner Jr., former Governor of Illinois, for review of his conviction on bribery and related charges. The appeal hinged in part on whether constitutional provisions on the indictability of incumbent officials apply equally to Presidents and Federal judges.

title: Many Stores Offer. Tomatoes at PreInflation Price
description: Tomatoes are selling in many stores in New York, New Jersey and Connecticut at prices that have not been seen here since the country began suffering galloping inflation in 1971.

title: Arcata National Awarded
description: MENLO PARK, Calif., July 25 (UPI)  The Arcata National Corporation said today that Federal Judge Thomas J. Lydon has ruled Arcata was entitled to recover $38.8million more plus interest from the Federal Government for 11,000 acres of timberland taken into Redwood National Park in 1968. Judge Lydon, the company said, found the lands to he worth $96.63million but the Government already has paid the company $57.75million.

title: CLAIRE POTTER
description: Claire Potter of Claire & Walson, interior decorators at 37 West 57th Street, died.here Wednesday. She was 82 years old and lived at 7 West 77th Street.

title: Experts Ask Action to Avoid Millions of Deaths in Food Crisis
description: From droughtbesieged Africa to the jittery Chicago grain market, from worried Government offices in Washington to the partlyfilled granaries of teeming India, the longpredicted world food crisis is beginning to take shape as one of the greatest peacetime problems the world has had to face in modern times.

title: CONVICTION VOIDED IN DISRUPTION CASE
description: TRENTON, July 25 (AP) An appeals court today reversed a Municipal Court con. viction of a man charged with disrupting a public meeting. The only think the man did, the court noted, was call a, Hudson County Freeholder a crook.

title: P.S.C. Aide Backs Con Ed Rate Raise
description: An increase of $130.56million a year in Consolidated Edison's electricrate revenues was recommended yesterday to the State Public Service Commission.

title: Hartford G.O.P. to Run Housewife for Sheriff
description: HARTFORD, July 25  A Plainville housewife was named by Republicans in a county convention last night to be their champion again in a bid to unseat the high sheriff of Hartford.

title: L.I. Supervisor Proposes Fund Disclosure by Aides
description: EAST HAMPTON, L,I., July 25Judith Hope, the Democratic Supervisor of this traditionally Republican town, formalty proposed today that key administration members, their spouses and relatives disclose fully their income, financial holdings and any transactions

title: Pesticide Maker Fined
description: BOSTON, July 25 (AP)A Holbrook chemical company, Baird & McGuire, Inc., has been fined $20,000 and placed on two years probation in what the Environmental Protection Agency termed the highest penalty ever levied for criminal violation of the pesticide act. A total of $18,000 of the fine was suspended.

title: An Explanation:Articles of Impeachment Provide Framework for Panel Decision
description: WASHINGTON, July 25The two articles of impeachment that were submitted to the House Judiciary Committee last night will undoubtedly be amended, rewritten and refined by the committee.

title: Chairman and Skilled Politician Peter Wallace Rodino Jr.
description: WASHINGTON, July 25 Representative Thomas P. O'Neill of Massachusetts, the majority leader, reflected recently on the pressures that had been placed on the House leadership to appoint a select committee to explore possible impeachment proceedings against President Nixon, rather than place the responsibility on the untested new chairman of the House Judiciary Committee. Man in the News

title: $41MILLION GIVEN FOR NEWARK PLANS
description: NEWARK, July 25  The Federal Department of Housing and Urban Development has given a $41million urbanrenewal grant to Newark's Housing and Redevelopment Agency to be used in six major rebuilding projects in the central part of the city.

title: Four Guilty in Kidnapping Of Calzadilla Boy on L.I.
description: NEWARK, July 25 Four nen were found guilty in Fedral Court here today of kidtapping 8yearold John Calzadilla from his Dix Hills, L. I., leighborhood last March 6 for 50,000 ransom.

title: Still Ahead by Stroke With a 65 in Canadian Open
American Motors And U.A.W. Start Talks on Contract
description: DETROIT, July 25 (UPI)The United Automobile Workers began contract negotiations for 15,000 United States and Canadian American Motors Corporation workers today with a pledge not to bargain away their right, to refuse overtime.

title: FORD CAMPAIGNS FOR REP. DENNIS
description: MUNCIE, Ind., July 25As the nation's attention focused today on the impeachment hearings in Washington, Vice President Ford flew here to campaign for a conservative Republican member of the House Judiciary Committee who is reported to be in some difficulty in his bid for reelection.

title: Voices Of New South Emerge at Hearing
description: WASHINGTON, July 25Representative James R. Mann, an imperturbable Democrat from Greenville, S. C., surveyed his colleagues on the House Judiciary Committee.

title: HOUSE UNIT BACKS MASS TRANSIT BILL
description: WASHINGTON, July 25The House Public Works Committee defied the Nixon Administration today by voting out a $20bil. lion mass transit bill that would provide operating and capital funds for six years.

title: Who Will Speak for America?
description: In the agonizing crisis at the beginning of the last World War, when Neville Chamberlain was departing as Prime Minister and Winston Churchill was coming forward to take command, a loud cry went out across the House Speak England!

title: Ballet: Debut in Apollo
description: Cast changes at the top for American Ballet Theater's newest ballet, Le Baiser de la Fee, and a debut in Apollo provided the interest at the company's performance Wednesday night at the New York State Theater.

title: Oil Curb Effective
description: The Arab oil embargo against the United States last winter was almost 100 per cent effective in cutting back American oil imports, and hit the United States twice as hard as the rest of the world, a Senate study concluded. Details on Page 45.

title: HIGH COURT REFUSES TO TAKE SIRWA CASE
description: WASHINGTON, July 25 (UPI)  The Supreme Court turned down today a bid by former Attorney General John N. Mitchell and a Watergate codefendant to disqualify United States District Judge John J. Sirica from. presiding at the Watergate coverup trial in September.

title: Ankara Reports Holding 783
O Peck &
description: For a certain kind of woman who has reached the irrevocable point of maturity, there was a terrible poignancy to the news earlier this week that Peck & Peck has gone into bankruptcy.

title: Gratifying Mr. Nixon
description: The Supreme Court may well have sealed Richard Nixon's personal fate with the psychological impact of its decision against him on surrender of tapes and other records of 64 White House conversations to the special prosecutor. Even so, the Court's opinion seems to give Mr. Nixon substantial basis for responding as he did.

title: Stars Defeat Bell, 1715, As 64,719 Fans Watch
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 25With a feat that was as unlikely as the atmosphere in which the game was played, Moses Lajterman, a 21yearold Argentine who had been cut previously by both New York and Philadelphia, kicked a fourthquarter, 40yard field goal that gave the Stars a 1715 victory over the Bell tonight.

title: Recently Published Books
description: GENERAL

title: Alton Corning to Washington For Talk With Cabinet Aides
description: TEL AVIV, July 25Foreign Minister Yigal Alton flew to Washington today to keep appointments with American Cabinet ministers early next week.

title: Virginia Paper to Be Sold
description: WAYNESBORO, Va., July 25 (AP)The Evening Post Publishing Company of Charleston, S. C., has agreed to purchase controlling interest in the daily Waynesboro NewsVirginian. Terms were not disclosed.

title: $41 Million Allotied On. Newark Renewal
description: NEWARK, July 25  The Federal Department of Housing and Urban Development has given a $41million urbanrenewal grant to Newark's Housing and Redevelopment Agency to be used in six major rebuilding projects in the central part of the city.

title: A.&P. HELD GUILTY ON MEAT PRICING
description: SAN FRANCISCO, July 25 (AP)A Federal jury found the A. & P. supermarket chain guilty today of fixing prices in buying fresh meat and assessed the giant company a total of $32,712,081 in damages. The Great Atlantic and Pacific Tea Company was found guilty of conspiring to fix prices at both the wholesale and retail levels.

title: FISHMARKET MOVE TO BRONX IMPEDE
description: The plan to move the Fulton Fish Market into a new $20 million plant at the Hunts Point food center in the Bronx has run into a serious snag.

title: Weather Underground Reappears With a Book
description: The Weather Underground, an amalgam of mostly young revolutionaries who moved off the nation's campuses in the late nineteensixties, has reappeared with the publication of a 158page political statement entitled Prairie Fire.

title: Takeout Cut Is Planned For Belmont
description: A request by the New York Racing Association to use Belmont Park's fall meeting for an experimental reduction in parimutuel takeout was approved yesterday by the State Racing and Wagering Board.

title: EGYPTLIBYA TIES STRAINED FURTHER
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, July 25 (UPI)Libya assailed Egypt today for serving American and Zionist interests and tightened customs checks on Egyptians arriving in Libya. In retaliation, Egypt suspended all ship ments to Libya.

title: Judge Denies Nixon Bid to Keep Stans Letters From Prosecutor
description: WASHINGTON, July 25 Citing yesterday's Supreme Court decision, a Federal judge has ordered that the Watergate special prosecutor be given correspondence between President Nixon and former Commerce Secretary Maurice H. Stans relating to charges that some contributions to the 1972 reelection campaign were tied to the promise or hope of Federal jobs.

title: Commodity Price Index, Off 2.6 From Week..Ago Level
Courreges's Fun Belies Uncertainty of Couture
description: PARIS, July 25 Andr Courreges dropped his hemlines only to midknee today, making them the shortest in Paris.

title: Canadian Unit in U.N. Force On Cyprus to Be Increased
description: OTTAWA, July 25 (AP)The Canadian contingent with the United Nations peacekeeping force in Cyprus is to be almost doubled, from 486 to about 950 men, the Secretary of State for External Affairs, Mitchell W. Sharp, announced today,

title: Four Guilty in Kidnapping Of Calzadilla Boy on L.I.
description: NEWARK, July 25 Four men were found guilty in Fedetal Court here today of kidnapping 8yearold John Calzadilla form his Dix Hills, L. I., neighborhood last March 6 for $50,000 ransom,

title: MELLON NATIONAL PLANS NOTE SALE
description: The Mellon National Bank of Pittsburgh joined the move toward indexing debt offerings to the inflation level yesterday when it said it would sell $100million of floatingrate notes in midAugust. Citicorp successfully sold on Wednesday $650million of such notes carrying an interest rate linked to the Treasury bill rate. The Chase Manhattan Corporation will follow next week with $200million of similar notes, just ahead of the Crocker National Bank of San Francisco, which plans to sell $75million.

title: DELTA AIR EARNINGS SURGED IN.QUARTER
description: Delta Air Lines the fifth largest of the nation's 10 trunklines, reported yesterday a $29.1million profit, equal to $1.46 a share, for the quarter ended June 30, its fourth fiscal period. For the fiscal year ended June 30, the company's earnings reached $90.6million, or $4.56 a share.

title: A COMMITTEE IMPEACHMENT VOTE BY SIZABLE BIPARTISAN MAJORITY IS INDICATED AS DEBATE GOES ON
description: WASHINGTON, July 25A large, bipartisan majority of the House Judiciary Committee signaled its readiness today to adopt a reolution formally proposing the impeachment of President Nixon,

title: Pentagon Aides Say Soviet Is Developing Strategic Missiles for the 1980's
description: WASHINGTON, July 25Defense Department officials said today that the Soviet Union was developing several new longrange missiles in addition to four missiles that it had been testing with multiple warheads.

title: Convicts Held 10 a Second Day In Texas and Demand Weapons
description: HUNTSVILLE, Tex., July 25 (AP)Armed convicts held 10 persons hostage for the second day in a state penitentiary library today, but a prison official said tonight that the negotiation picture had brightened.

title: Pepsico Dividend Up Again
description: Directors of Pepsico, Inc.; voted yesterday for the third time in 18 months to raise the company's quarterly dividend. The dividend of 35 cents share, up from 30 cents, is payable Sept. 30 to sharehotders of record Sept. 9.

title: U.S. Aides Say Cyprus Crisis Strengthened NATO
description: WASHINGTON, July 25United States officials said today that, while the confrontation between Greece and Turkey had temporarily weakened the southeastern flank of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization, the Cyprus crisis itself actually served to strengthen the alliance.

title: Rooney Expansion Chief
description: Dan Rooney, general manager of the Pitsburgh Steelers, is chairman of the National Football League expansion committee.

title: Catholics in South Korea Attend a Mass of Protest
description: SEOUL, South Korea, July 25 The conflict between the Korean Roman Catholic Church and President Park Chung Hee's Government intensified today when over 2,000 Catholics gathered at a mass to protest the jailing of a prominent Bishop.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: DrunkenDriving Appeal Is Lost

title: SYRIA SAID TO BAR RAIDSINTO ISRAEL
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, July 25Syria is reported to he disarming Palestinian guerrillas, arresting radicals among them and cooperating with United Nations forces in the Golan Heights area to prevent guerrillas from crossing the ceasefire lines into Israel.

title: Joy Is Expressed in the Suburbs; Reactions in Detroit Divided
description: DETROIT, July 25In the suburbs of Detroit there were expressions of joy today, excited calling of friends to tell them that the Supreme Court had ruled that their schoolchildren would not be bused into Detroit schools and a sense of relief among leaders who had spent several years battling a courtordered busing proposal.

title: Release Tied to Negotiations
description: LIMASSOL, Cyprus, July 25On the sunbaked dirt playing field of the municipal soccer stadium here, about 1,750 men from Limassol's ethnic Turkish enclave and surrounding Turkish villages are penned in behind coils of barbed wire.

title: Locust Valley Budget
description: LOCUST VALLEY, L. I., July 25  Residents of the local school district, who defeated two previous school budgets, tonight approved a third proposal for a $7,745,916 budget. The budget carries a tax rate of $9.78 per $100 of assessed valuation. The vote was 923 to 831.

title: Prices of Farm Commodities Rise Following a U.S. Report
description: Following a Government report that stocks of grain were lower than expected, plus extended drought conditions in the growing areas, prices of number of farm commodities closed up the limit yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade.

title: Caramanlis Asks Patience On Return to Democracy
description: ATHENS, July 25Constantine Caramanlis, Premier of the new civilian Government, called tonight for national unity to enable him to meet the crisis over Cyprus and to move toward democracy.

title: Sun Lists 163% Gain
description: Large profit increases continued to be reported by oil companies for the second quarter this year. Texaco, Inc., ranking second in the industry after the Exxon Corporation, reported yesterday a 72.1 per cent rise in the Junequarter profit, while Sun Oil Company's earnings climbed 163 per cent.

title: TAX CUT IS VOTED IN WEST GERMANY
description: BONN, July. 25 Respond. ing to increasing worries about the possibility of a recession in the West German economy, the lower house of Parliament approved today a $5.2billion tax cut, to go into effect Jan. 1.

title: Voices of New South Emerge at Hearing
description: WASHINGTON, July 25Representative James R. Mann, an imperturbable Democrat from Greenville, S. C., surveyed his colleagues on the House Judiciary Committee.

title: 4 Killed as 2 Planes Collide in Air
description: TOMS RIVER, July 25 (UPI) Four persons were killed today when two singleengine airplanes collided in the air. One of the planes plunged into a sandpit, and the other crashed and burned in a wooded area a mile and a half away.

title: PRESIDENT CALLS FOR LESS SPENDING
Stein's 144 Wins Met Medal by 2 Shots
Franklin National Loses $86Million More of Deposits
description: The financial condition of the beleaguered Franklin National Bank continued to deteriorate during the week ended Wednesday, as the bank lost an additional $86million in deposits.

title: WAGE, SETTLEMENTS ROSE IN 2D QUARTER
description: WASHINGTON, July 25, (Reuters)  Wage settlements in the second quarter of this year were substantially higher than in the first quarter, the Labor Department reported today.

title: INMATE TESTIFIES ON JUSTICE HERE
description: A man who has waited 15 months in the Brooklyn House of Detention without going to trial on a murder charge was the first witness yesterday at the civil trial of a prisoners suit against major figures running the Brooklyn criminaljustice system.

title: Defection By Van Pelt Spurs Anger
description: FAIRFIELD, Conn., July 25 Brad Van Pelt, who was moving in the wrong direction last season, took what he considered another step forward today, to the dismay and anger of striking player representatives of the New York Giants.

title: City Reaffirms Policy Against Dual Pricing
description: A city law, designed to protect against deceptive trade practices, may end up costing consumers more at local supermarkets.

title: White House Aides Upset And Concerned by Events
description: WASHINGTON, July 25The events of this week in the Watergate case have left members of the White House staff deeply shaken and concerned, more so than at any time in the past.

title: Ballet on Aug. 9: Bruhn, Nureyev, Baryshnikov
description: Three of the top performers in balletErik Bruhn, Rudolf Nureyev and Mikhail Baryshnikovwill take to the stage here on the same night.

title: Profits Scoreboard
Bridge: Spingold Winners Display Steadiness Despite Youth.
description: The Spingold knockout team championship, which lasted a full week and ended here Tuesday night, was never lacking in drama. From the first round favored teams suffered defeats at the hands of unknowns; and the closing stages were marked by lastditch efforts that just failed.

title: Freed Greek Captives Reunited With Families at Aegean Jetty
description: ATHENS, July 25Fortyfive men, released today from an Aegean island where they had been political prisoners, surged through lines of cars with boat trailers on an automobile ferry as it docked near here.

title: Theodorakis Expresses Joy on Return to Athens
description: ATHENS, July 25 (AP)The composer Mikis Theodorakis returned home last night after four years in exile and said, My joy now is the same that I felt waiting in a cell to be tortured.

title: Arab Oil Embargo Against U.S. Found Almost 100% Effective as Import Curb
description: WASHINGTON, July 25The Arab oil embargo last winter was almost 100 per cent effective in cutting back petroleum imports to the United States and, on balance, Arab production slowdowns hit the United States twice as hard as the rest of the world, a Senate study concluded today.

title: Ford and Coy. Milliken Praise Ruling on Busing
description: WASHINGTON July 25 (AP)Vice President Ford and Michigan Gov. William Milliken hailed today's Supreme Court Detroit busing decision as a victory for reason. Mr. Ford, who represented Grand Rapids, Mich., in Congress for 25 years before becoming Vice President last fall, said: I think it is a great step forward to finding another answer to quality education.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Widow Seized in Lincoln Towers October Slaying
description: The widow of George Howard Hodge, a music arranger who was slain in his apartment near Lincoln Center last October, was arrested yesterday and charged with homicide in her husband's death.

title: Velma Royton, 81, Actress, Appeared in Little Women
description: Velma Royton, a stage actress who had appeared in this city and elsewhere, died yesterday at Midtown Hospital. She was 81 years old and lived at 815 Park Avenue.

title: A.B.A. Panel Seeks Repeal Of Laws on Prostitution
description: CHICAGO, July 25 (UPI)State laws covering prostitution represent one of the most direct forms of discrimination against women and should be repealed, committee of the American Bar Association said today.

title: Notes on People
description: A theftofservices charge, involving an unpaid cab fare, against Stephen Smith, husband of the former Jean Kennedy, was dismissed in Manhattan Criminal Court yesterday after the taxi company inolved declined to press the case.

title: Youth Arraigned in Death Of 16YearOld Bronx Boy
description: The 18yearold suspect who surrendered to authorities Wednesday in connection with the stabbing deat hof a Bronx teenager was arraigned in Bronx Crirninal Court yesterday.

title: State to Make Tracks More Appealing
description: Bertram D. Sarafan, the new chairman of the State Racing and Wagering Board, said yesterday New York would do whatever it takes to meet closerange racing competition from New Jersey.

title: Freed Greek Captives Reunited With Families at Aegean Jetty
description: ATHENS, July 25Fortyfive men, released today from an Aegean island where they had been political prisoners, surged through lines of cars with boat trailers on an automobile ferry as it docked near here.

title: DiLorenzo Verdict
description: A Supreme Court jury here acquitted Civil Court Judge Ross J. DiLorenzo of two counts of perjury, but he faces a new trial in October on the six remaining perjury counts on which the jury said it could not agree. Page 37.

title: MEETINGS SLATED ON NEW TAX PLAN
description: TRENTON, July 25Democratic legislative leaders said today that they would begin preliminary meeting as soon possible next month to evaluate revenueraising alternatives to the Byrne administration's incometax program that died in the state Senate yesterday.

title: Corporate Profile
description: ESB, Inc., may not be the sexiest of corporate names and neither was its predecessor name, the Electric Storage Battery Company. But in the last week, ESB has become one of the most talkedabout names on Wall Street as two of the world's giant corporations have become locked in a tenderoffer battle for control of it.

title: Yastrzemski's 300th Clout Adds to Woes of Tigers
Bronx Hops Onto Culture Bus Loop
description: A third culture bus loopthe other two now operate In Manhattan and Brooklyn will be put in operation Aug. 3 in the Bronx, it was announced yesterday by Mayor Beame and David L. Yonich, the Metropolitan Transportation Authority's chairman and chief executive officer.

title: STOCKS ON AMEX AND COUNRTER DIP
Bomb Hurts 6 in Salisbury
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, July 25 (Reuters)  A bomb tossed through the window of a night club here last night exploded on the dance floor and wounded six persons. There was no indication who was responsible for the attack.

title: Losers Win $75,000
description: OCEAN CITY, N. J., July 25 (AP)  The State Lottery Commission inaugurated its new $75,000 Grand Drawing lottery here today, a contest for holders of losing tickets. George Chambers and Dorothy Barrett of Sussex were selected as cowinners from among 36 finalists. The Grand Drawing will be held every four or five weeks, depending on ticket sales.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: Picketing Packers and Bears Arrested

title: NEGOTIATIONS OPEN ON E.E.C. MEMBERSHIP
description: KINGSTON, Jamaica, July 25 (UPI)  Negotiations for associate membership in the European Economic Community fa 44 Caribbean, African and Pacific nations opened here today with E.E.C. in open disagreement on two of the major issues  sugar and energy.

title: In Midwest, Drought Worsens
description: CHICAGO, July 25A Midwestern drought has begun to reduce this year's corn and soybean crops and many farmers are hoping, some desperately, for rain this week to save them.

title: 3Nation Talks on Cyprus Open in Geneva
description: GENEVA, July 25Greek, Turkish and British Foreign Ministers opened their conference on Cyprus here tonight with a brief, declaration endorsing the United Nations ceasefire agreement.

title: Boiling Exuberance Marks Jazz Band With Condon Style
description: For followers of the free and easy traditional style of jazz, associated with Eddie Condon, almost the only consistent source of supply in Manhattan recently has been the Grove Street Stompers, who meet on Mondays at Arthur's Tavern on Grove Street in Greenwich Village. Most of the bands in the metropolitan area that play in this vein have followed their audiences to the suburbs.

title: Stage: Play's the Thing
description: If any play in modern repertory could rightly be called a bright bubble, it's Ferenc Molnar's The Play's the Thing. This popular, 1920 antique is an airy, timeless masterpiece of neat construction and gleaming dialoguethe real baitthat perfectly evokes those uppercrust, cakefrosting charades from the Continent in the period up to the midnineteenthirties.

title: Red Smith
description: When Branch Rickey and Jackie Robinson broke baseball's color line in 1946, it was already badly bent. Not many people are aware that four years before Rickey signed Robinson and farmed him out to Montreal, Bill Veeck had hired more than a dozen blacks to play for the Philadelphia Phillies. Even fewer know that Veeck also hired the major league's first black manager. Elston Howard knows about that. He was the manager.

title: Maryland Quintet Seeks Soviet Trip
Cyprus Minefield
description: The opening in Geneva of the BritishGreekTurkish peace talks on Cyprus offers hope that the tenuous ceasefire on the island can be quickly consolidated, but resolution of the political and ethnic controversies that stand in the way of permanent settlement will be a slow process.

title: F. T. C. AIDE SEES WIDE PR10EFIXING
description: WASHINGTON, July 25 A member of the Federal Trade Commission has charged that Americans are being cheated out of at least $10billion a year by businessmen who fix prices.

title: MINORITY JOB PLAN FOR CITY PROJECTS UPHELD BY COURT
description: A controversial plan designed to provide black workers with thousands of jobs on city construction projects was approved here yesterday by Judge Morris E. Lasker in Federal District Court.

title: Jaworski Asks Court to Set a 10Day Deadline for White House to Yield Tapes
description: WASHINGTON, July 25Leon Jaworski, the special Watergate prosecutor, asked Federal District Judge John J. Sirica today to order that President.Nixon turn over the tapes of the 64 Watergaterelated conversations, in installments within 10 days.

title: The Screen
description: Man Who Had His Hair Cut Short was shown at the fourth New York Film Festival under the title The Man With the Shaven Head. The following excerpt is from A. H. Weiler's review, which appeared Sept. 21, 1966, in The New York Times. The film opened Sunday and will he shown again today and tomorrow at noon and midnight at the First Avenue Screening Room, at 61st Street.

title: GEORGE D. FORD
description: LOS ANGELES, July 25 (AP) George D. Ford, whose father operated the Washington theater where Abraham Lincoln was assassinated, died Wednesday in a hospital here. He was 94 years old.

title: Notre Dame Suspends 6 Players
description: Six Notre Dame football players, including four starters on last year's topranked team, were suspended yesterday for a year for violating the school's dormitory code, which forbids afterhour visits by women.

title: Soviet Prosecutor Retired
description: MOSCOW, July 25 (AP)Roman A. Rudenko, the Soviet Union's prosecutor general since 1953, will he retired from his post by the current session of the Supreme Soviet, the press agency Tass reported. Mr. Rudenko, 67, has been reported in poor health.

title: DiLorenzo Freed on 2 Perjury Counts But Faces a New Trial on 6 Others
description: Civil Court Judge Ross J. Dilorenzo was acquitted of two counts of an eightcount indictment accusing him of perjury by a jury of nine men and three women late last night after they had deliberated 151A hours over two days.

title: People and Business
description: One of Wall Street's veteran overthecounter securities traders, Oliver J. Troster, a partner of Troster, Singer & Co., who started in 1919 as a $15aweek clerk for Holt & Co., was trying yesterday to remember a time when Wall Street was worse off than it is today.

title: Weekly Retail Sales Up
description: WASHINGTON, July 25The Department of Commerce reported today that the department store sales last week were an estimated $984million, up 7 per cent from the yearearlier $918million. Total retail store sales were about $10,577billion, up 10 per cent from last year's $9.6billion.

title: Goodyear Sales and Profits at Peaks; Other Companies Issue Their Reports
DECISION BY 5 TO 4
