description: VERNON, N. Y. July 28A Swedishowned colt, who was ordered out of the Dexter Cup at Roosevelt Raceway on June 15, today ranks as a top contender in the Hambletonian to be raced Aug. 28 in DuQuoin,

description: RALEIGH, N.C., July 28 (AP)Rufus L. Edmisten, former special counsel to the Senate Watergate committee and aide to Senator Sam J. Erwin Jr., the committee chairman, has won the Democratic nomination for Attorney General of North Carolina.

title: Vienna: Tributes on Birthdays of Three Famous Sons
description: VIENNAIn a reversal of the usual form, Austria is paying extravagant birthday tribute this year to one of its still living famous sons and giving only halfhearteed honors to two who are dead. Karl Boehm, the con ductor, who turns 80 in August, has been made tIn honorary member of the Vienna Society of Friends of Music and has received a special medal from the Mozart Society and a silver platter and birthday cake from the Vienna State Opera. In turn, there have been only brief observances of the 100th birthdays of Arnold Schoenberg and karl Kraus.

title: DATA REVISIONS DISMAY EXPERTS
description: WASHINGTON, July 28 Economists in and out of the Government are expressing concern, even dismay, at the huge size of the revisions in the nation's basic accounts published by the Commerce, Department earlier this month.

title: Czechoslovakia Gain's
description: MOSCOW, July 28 (UPI)Czechoslovakia drew ahead of the Soviet Union, 21, today when the doubles team of Jan Kodes and Vladimir Zednik beat Alexander Metreveli and Vladimir Korot kov, 6.4, 61, 63, in the European Zone B Davis Cup final. The remaining two games of the singles will be played tomorrow.

title: More Turkish Troops Are Landed on Cyprus
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, July 28 (AP)  Turkish helicopters, merchant ships and naval landing craft landed more troops and armor on Cyprus today for the ninth day.

title: Personal Finance

description: The credit markets, after weeks of confusion, finally found a signpost last Friday. It pointed to continued inflation and tight money.

title: 24 Missing as Liberian Ship Sinks in Collision Off Japan

title: Ford to Talk Today to Urban League
description: SAN FRANCISCO, July 28The armslength relationship between the Nixon Administration and civil rights organizations is expected to be somewhat relaxed after tomorrow when Vice President Ford is scheduled to address the 64th annual convention of the Naitional Urban League.

title: President Is More Yielding In Clashes With Congress
description: WASHINGTON, July 28While the impeachment drive against President Nixon has been attracting widespread attention, a related development has gone virtually unnoticed: That Mr. Nixon has made important concessions of authority to the Congress that must, decide whether he remains in office.

title: Rape Study Details the How, the Why and the Who
description: A 30yearold. unmarried woman was returning to her firstfloor apartment on the Upper East Side after spend ing an evening with friends a few blocks away. As she put her key into the lock, she was suddenly seized by the neck.

title: IND Rider Slain in Holdup; Wife's Cries Go Unheeded
description: A 53yearold man riding home with his wife on a subway train in Brooklyn was shot and ,killed late Saturday night by one of four young thugs who accosted the couple in a nearly deserted car in an apparent robbery attempt and fled emptyhanded.

description: WASHINGTON, July 28 (UPI) Senate investigators charged today that the United States grain sale to the Soviet Union in 1972 was ineptly managed from start to finish.

title: About New York
description: A Mrs. Mitchell from East 37th Street went wandering in Greenwich Village the other day and came upon a vegetarian restaurant on Charles Street. Being incorrigibly curious about these things, Mrs. Mitchell went in, sat down at a big oak table, and ordered a piece of apple pie from a harassed, lanky young woman.

title: A COMMON EASTER URGED BY PRELATE
description: The centuriesold search for a common date for the celebration of Easter by all Christians Protestant, Roman Catholic and Eastern Orthodoxmay be ended in the near future, according to. Metropolitan Chrysostomos, a leading Orthodox theologian of the Holy Synod of th eEcunnenical Patriarchate of Constantinople.

title: Reinecke's Hold on Office In California Is Uncertain
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., July 28 (UPI)Lieut. Gov. Ed Reinecke's prospects for remaining in office after his perjury conviction remained uncertain today.

title: Consumers Batten Down For Fuel Cost Increases
description: We already have two humidifiers in our house, plus storm windows, plus good insulation; I can't do anything more to use less fuel, says Robert Guy of Weston, Conn. Re vows not to lower his thermostat next winter below 68 degrees, I'm not going to live in a cave.

title: ETHEL R. CHILDRESS

She was 77 years old and resided at 2 Passaic Avenue in Spring Lake: N. J., and in Palm Beach.

title: City Papers on Threshold of Future As Result of 11Year Automation Pacl

title: Anthrax Epidemic Is Contained in One Texas County
description: MARLIN, Tex., July 28An extraordinary series of veterinary and military measures have contained within one Texas county an anthrax epidemic that health officials said threatened to devastate the livestock industry in the nation's largest cattleproducing state.

title: BEANIE DENOUNCES GOLDIN'S TACTICS AS DISTORTIONS
description: Bristling with anger, Mayor Beame struck out yesterday at Harrison J. Goldin, accusing his successor as Controller of distortions and shabby tactics in the continuing controversy over multimilliondollar discrepancies in the city's bank balances.

title: U.N. HOLDS PARLEY AT SOVIET BEHEST
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., July 28The Soviet Union called tonight at a Security Council meeting for an urgent end to any foreign intervenition in Cyprus and for the withdrawal of all foreign Itroops"an apparent reference to Turkish as well as Greek military personnel. The Council session had been called by the Soviet Union.

title: Aussie Skipper Chosen
description: NEWPORT, R.I., July 28 (AP)  Jim Hardy, a former world champion in the 5.5Meter Class, has been chosen to skipper the Australian 12Meter yacht, Southern Cross, in her bid this year for the America's Cup.

title: James Sharp, Who Led Drug And Steamship Firms, Dead
description: James H. Sharp, a former president of Merck (North America), Inc., international division of Merck, and of the AmericanHawaiian Steamship Company, died Friday of cancer in Roosevelt Hospital. He was 80 years old and lived in Wilton, Conn.

title: After the Cheering, Greeks Assess Dangers Ahead
description: ATHENS, July 28  When its drove up to his downtown betel this afternoon, the streets were deserted in the Sunday sunshine. There was no political significance in the absence of the usual throngit was just a sleepy afternoon  but his quit arrival seemed to suggest that the cheering over the fall of the military junta and the installing of civilian government had subsided.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N.Y., July 28 (AP)Thoroughbred horse racing returns tomorrow to this upstate New York resort city for a 24day meeting. Saratoga Race Course, one of three run by the New York Racing Association, is the oldest continually operating race track in the United States.

title: Solomon and 91 Heat Beat Martin in 3Set Semifinal
description: WASHINGTON, July 28 (UPI)Harold Solomon and a case of heat exhaustion stopped Billy Martin, the teenaged amateur, 75, 1.6, 06 today in a semifinal match of the $100,000 Washington StarNews tennis tournament.

title: News Summary and Index
description: The foreign ministers of the threenation conference on Cyprus were informed in Geneva that the Soviet Union had decided to send an observer to the meeting, but this had no visible effect on the deadlock between Greece and Turkey. The foreign ministers of Greece, Turkey and Britain were continually meeting an impasse each time progress on a new ceasefire was reported. [1:5.]

title: Talks on Mideast Due
description: The Israeli Foreign Minister, Yigal Allon, arrived in Washington yesterday to discuss ways of reaching a Mideast settlement. In coming weeks,. officials from Jordan, Egypt and Syria will visit the United States for separate consultations. It'll be a real month of the Middle East, an Ameriaan official said. Details, Page 7.

title: Europe's BeefBerg
description: The decision of the European Economic Community to cut beet imports in half this year by banning all purchases abroad until November is a shortsighted response to a meat glut that is troubling farmers around the world.

title: ROBERT NORTON
description: Robert Norton, a retired lawyer who had been editor in chief of the periodical China Today in the nineteenforties, (died Saturday at his home, Charlton Street. He was 77 years old.

title: Allis Wins Title In Bicycle Racing
description: PONTIAC, Mich., July 28John Allis, a 32yearold Harvard Business School student, became the national men's bicycle road champion today when he won the 115mile title race one length.

title: Red Smith
description: In a recent interview Howard K. Smith, the newscaster President Nixon used to like, told about getting fired by CBS. After some strong broadcaits about Ku Klux Klan brutality I had personally witnessed, William Paley called me in and said, You obviously don't agree with our policy, which is against that kind of controversy. You'd better look somewhere else. Paley didn't really object to my views. He simply reversed Voltaire. He said, I agree with everything you say, but damned, if I'm going to let you it!'.

title: Miss McCall Bride Of Craig Z. Foster
description: Catherine Anne McCall and Craig Zimmerman Foster, recent graduates of the University of New Mexico in Albuquerque, were married there yesterday in the Alumni Chapel, where the Rev. David Poling performed the Protestant ceremony.

title: Watergate Reforms
description: Under the leadership of Senator Ervin of North Carolina, the Senate Watergate committee has concluded year and a half of admirable work by agreeing upon a set of bipartisan recommendations for strengthening Federal law and creating new institutions of the Federal Government to lessen the risk of future scandals. In the present agony of impeachment the need for reform obvious, and the means are now at hand.

title: AIDES TERM NIXON SELFCONTROLLE
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., July 28Disappointed by reverses in the Supreme Court and House Judiciary Committee, hurt by the incessant attacks on him and his associates, President Nixon is depicted, as able to go stoically about the business of the Presidency through the exercise of enormous selfcontrol.

title: AndrettiOutlasts Redman To Win at Road America
All Thy Victories
description: WASHINGTON President Nixon won three farreaching and historic victories last week.

title: Allison Katz Bride Of Alan Schned
description: Allison J. Katz, a student at the Columbia University School of Nursing, and Alan Schned, Who attends the Columbia College of Physicians and Surgeons, were married at noon yesterday in Greenfield Hill, Fairfield, Conn. Rabbi Stephen Pierce performed the ceremony at the home of Mr. and Mrs._ Julius Gold.

title: Sobbing Guard Pleads for Concession to Convicts
description: HUNTSVILLE, Tex., July 28 Bobby Heard was crying.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The New Jersey Food Council, representing supermarkets and food stores, called on Congress to pass legislation making the National Labor Relations Act applicable to migrant farm workers. Member companies believe farm workers should have the right to determine whether to join a labor union, and if so, which union, a resolution said. The United Farm Workers Union has recently stepped up its campaign to organize farm workers.

title: Burlington Northern Plans An Increase in Dividend
description: Burlington Northern, Inc., announced yesterday an increase in the quarterly dividend to 42 cents a share from 37 cents a share, payable to common stockholders on Sept. 3 to record Aug. 9.

title: The People Do Govern
description: WASHINGTON, July 28When Representative James R. Mann spoke, the room quieted to catch his low voice. Slowly, reflectively, he said he was troubled by attacks on the Judiciary Committee.

title: Dole Suggests Increasing Guard on Vice President
description: POMONA, Kan., July 28 (UPI) Senator Robert Dole, Republican of Kansas, while refusing to comment on the House Judiciary Committee's vote recommending the impeachment of President Nixon, says that security surrounding Vice President Ford should be increased.

title: Da Nang Area and Base Are Attacked With Rockets
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Monday, July 29 (AP) Communistled forces today carried out their second rocket attack in 10 days against the Da Nang air base, reports said. Their rockets also hit several nearby district towns.

title: President Is More Yielding In Clashes With Congress
description: WASHINGTON, July 28While the impeachment drive against President Nixon has been attracting widespread attention, a related development has gone virtually unnoticed: That Mr. Nixon has made important concessions of authority to the Congress that must decide whether he, remains in office.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: TOE FOR THE ROAD. The idea of moving culture into the city's neighborhoods is new something of a firmly rooted tradition in New York, and one of its most successful manifestations  the Dancemobile  begins its eighth season tonight. The Dancemobile unit is a huge truck equipped with dressing rooms, a stage, taped music and portable lighting equipment, so that it can take dance into neighborhoods for residents who might otherwise never get to see it

title: WEST SIDERS SEEK TO SAVE THEATERS
description: Something of a record may be set early this fall when the wrecker's ball will smash four New York theaters in a single operation, unless neighborhood opposition wins a reprieve.

title: Boom in Machine Tools Going Strong
description: The machine tool industry, considered an important leading indicator of economic conditions, is continuing its steady advance in shipments and new orders.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A flight instructor and a student were killed when their singleengine aircraft nosedived 300 feet into a wooded area near MacArthur Airport in Holbrook, L. authorities said.

title: Greece May Bid U.S. Press Turkey
description: ATHENS, July 28  Greece may have to ask the United States to exert more drastic pressure on Turkey to solve the crisis on Cyprus, a high Greek official said tonight.

title: New JerseySports
description: BERGENFIELD, July 28  Danny Lopez has a realistic approach to training thoroughbred racehorses.

title: Seoul Agents Interrogate Catholic Nun for 17 Hours
description: SEOUL, South Korea, July 28The men who took Sister Sye Raymonde from her convent in a black sedan never identified themselves.

title: Otto Kerner Goes to Jail Today, His OnceShining Career at End
description: CHICAGO, July 28 His final appeal to the United States Supreme Court was denied. Thursday and Otto Kerner, the first sitting Federal judge to be convicted of a serious crime, goes to jail tomorrow.

title: KUH AND RIVAL WARN ON PLEA BARGAINING
description: District Attorney Richard H. Huh of Manhattan and his opponent in the November election, Robert Morgenthau, agreed yesterday that plea bargaining would at times be disadvantage to society and to those charged with crimes.

title: That New Appliance: Consumer May Soon Know Its Energy Cost.
description: The clothes dryers, both with the same capacity and features, and both made by reputable manufacturers, have a $50 price differential. Which is the best buy?

title: Printers Approve New Contract, 1,00941
description: Members of Typographical Union No. 6 gave overwhelming approval yesterday to a landmark contract opening the way for automation of typesetting at The New York Times and The Daily News.

title: MAME DENOUNCES GOLDIN'S TACTICS AS DISTORTIONS
description: Bristling with anger, Mayor Beame struck out yesterday at Harrison J. Goldin, accusing his successor as Controller of distortions and shabby tactics in the continuing controversy over multimilliondollar discrepancies in the city's bank balances.

title: WATERFRONT FAIR IN HOBOKEN ENDS
description: HOBOKEN, July 28Singers, guitarists, drummers and other musicians strummed, beat and bowed a nonstop stream of tunes from a stage that was not always the center of attention at the River City Fair that ended here this evening.

title: 80 Notables Gather in the Hamptons For a Rebel Party Without Cause
description: BRIDGEHAMPTON, L. I., July 28Summer after summer, it has been possible to measure the social concerns of the worlds of the arts, commerce and society that mingle in the vacation villages that are collectively called the Hamptons by the benefit parties they attend.

title: Through the Dark, Glassily
description: A stock language has evolved in government over many years, a language that makes it impossible to discuss, let alone fix or evaluate, questions of official and public political or moral responsibility.

title: N.F.L. Peace Talks to Resume As Sides Huddle in Washington
description: CANTON, Ohio, July 28Will peace with honor finally emerge from the bitter National Football League player strike this week?

title: Don McCafferty Dies
description: Don McCafferty, head coach of the Detroit Lions of the National Football League, died yesterday after suffering an apparent heart attack while working in his yard at his home in Pontiac, Mich. He was 53 years old. Obituary on Page 26.

title: Family Wins Mayor As Prize in Raffle For Midget League
description: RIDGEFIELD PARK, July 28 If Gilbert A. Gibbs had ever considered a career as a homemaker, his inept performance yesterday in the home of Barbara Moore should permanently allay such thoughts.

title: G.O.P. Choice in Connecticut
description: HARTFORD, July 28  In the national stir over Representative Ella T. Grasso for winning the Democratic gubernatorial nomination a week before, many people seemed to forget that the Connecticut Republicans, too, were going to nominate a candidate for Governor.Man in the News

title: Eggs Still a Good Buy Despite Price Rise Here
description: Egg prices have started moving up, and City Consumer Affairs Commissioner Elinor C. Guenheimer, remembering that last August ii, large Grade A's hit $1.05 a dozen, is hoping they will not go too far.

title: Bridge: 204 Players Gather to Honor An Unsung Hero of the Game
description: Those who work hardest for bridge do not as a rule get much thanks. But there are exceptional ,cases, and one of them occurred a week ago when 204 players gathered in Rochdale, Queens, to honor Bob Haulsey and to present him with a free trip to the American Bridge Association's forthcoming Summer Nationals in Detroit.

title: Statements by Beame and Goldin in Clash Following Audits of Controller's Office
description: Following are the state ments issued yesterday by Mayor Beame and City Controller Harrison J. Goldin concerning audits of the Controller's office.

title: Man at Ford Speech Queried on Food Bag
description: CANTON, Ohio, July 28 (UPI)A man with a brown paper. bag in his arms drew Secret Service agents attention during Vice President Ford's speech yesterday at the Pro Football Hall of Fame.

title: Major Bills in Congress
description: Fuel  Gives the President broad powers to curtail energy consumption and manage fuel supplies. Veto sustained by. Senate.

title: MILWARD W. MARTIN, PEPSICOLA OFFICIAL
description: Milward Wyatt Martin, former senior vice president, director, secretary and head of the law department of the PepsiCola Company, now Pepsico, died yesterday at his home in Locust Valley, L. I. He was 79 years old and also lived in Manasota Key, Fla.

title: REVISED TERMS SET FOR FERTILIZER PLAN
description: Earth Sciences, Inc., the National Steel Corporation and the Southwire Company announced over the weekend a tentative agreement to revise their joint alunitealumina fertilizer project in Utah.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: TV: Verdict on Impeachment Coverage? Justified
description: After four full days of coverage, the verdict is clear. The decision to televise the House Judiciary Committee debates on Presidential impeachment is fully justified: While the presence of TV cameras has undoubtedly had some effect on the participants, that effect has often been positive, keeping blatant or excessive posturing to a bearable minimum. Mean. time, the public is afforded invaluable access to, and understanding of, a historical event.

title: Franconia Notch: Highway Battle Site
Nichols Wins Golf In Canada
Kissinger and the Taps
description: WASHINGTONThe initial reaction to Henry A. Kissinger's demand for vindication of his honor convincingly demonstrates to me, as one of Mr. Kissinger's wiretapping victims, that many liberal Senators are willing to apply a different standard when judging the conduct of the President and his muchadmired Secretary of State.

title: Major Concerns Reduce Output Of Gasoline Despite Oil in Plenty
description: Despite plentiful Supplies of crude oil, the nation's major oil companies in recent weeks have reduced their production of gasoline and have operated their refineries 6 to 7 per cent below the capacity they were utilizing a year ago.

title: Good Partners in Law and Marriage
James Willmeth Marries Ardis Kauer
description: Ardis Kauer, an elementaryschool teacher in East Harlem, was married yesterday afternoon to James Kent Willwerth, of New York, a writer with the TimeLife News Service. The Rev. William F. Baughan, a Unitarian minister, performed the ceremony at the bridegroom's other home in Becket, Mass.

title: McKown Wins Bois Net
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., July 28 (AP)Ben McKown of Lakeland, Fla., seeded fifth, won the boys 18 singles title in the National junior clay courts tennis championships today by beating the No. 2 seeded player, Bruce Manson of North Hollywood, Calif., 63, 36, 76.

title: Scott Advances In 35's Tennis
description: MANHASSET, L.I., July 28 Gene Scott of New York started defense of his United States Men's 35Year Division clay court tennis championship today by defeating Richard Scheer of New York, 6.3, 61 at the Shelter Rock Tennis Club.

title: CYPRUS MEETING IS STILL SNAGGED; MOSCOW AIDE DUE
description: GENEVA, July 28The Foreign Ministers of Greece, Turkey and Britain, who negotiated most of the day and into the night without reaching a new agreement on a ceasefire in Cyprus, were informed tonight that the Soviet Union had decided to send an observer to the conference.

title: CHARLES H. ALSPACH, A SOCIAL AIDE AT U.N.
description: Charles H. Alspach, a former chief of community develop. ment in the department of social and economic affairs of the United Nations, died Saturday in Phelps Memorial Hospital in Tarrytown, N. Y. He was 78 years sold and lived at 110 North Highland Place in CrotononHudson, N. Y.

title: Brooks Robinson Hurt
description: BALTIMORE, July 28 (AP) Brooks Robinson, the AllStar third baseman of the Baltimore Orioles, pulled a muscle in his right rib cage today and had to be removed from the lineup. Robinson was examined after the Orioles lost, 4.0, to the Milwaukee Brewers, and a club spokesman said Robinson was expected to be out for four of five days.

title: Elkhound Is Best in Coast Show
description: SANTA BARBARA Calif., July 28Mrs. Patricia Craige of Monterey, Calif., who four years ago gaited her Norwegian elkhound, Ch. Via Melca's Vagabond,to best in show at Santa Barbara, was back today to lead a field of 4,288 with her homebred elkhound, Ch. VinMelca's Homesteader, which she co owns with Diann Schiller.

title: Javits Vote on Nixon To Await Evidence
description: Senator Jacob K. Javits refused to be pinned down yesterday on how he would vote in a Senate trial of President Nixon.

title: GEORGE H. ENGEMAN
description: George H. Engeman, retired publisher of The North Virginia Free Press, a weekly paper that he founded with his wife in the nineteenforties, died Saturday at the Hunterdon Medical Center in Flemington, N. J. He was 69 years old and lived in Lake George, N. Y.

title: Mayor Is Feeling Bitter Now That He Is Better
description: Because he had been taken ill with a bad bronchial virus two weeks ago at the outset of criticism over the way he had run the Controller's office, Mayor Beanie had been forced to violate one of the prime rules of political conduct: If they're doing something to you, be there.

title: Advertisin Ethan Allen on TV
description: Following an eightmarket test last year, Ethan Allen, Inc., and a majority of its independently owned Ethan Allen Galleries, furniture retailers, will launch their first national television effort in the fall.

title: Talks on Mideast Due
description: The Israeli Foreign Minister, Yigal Allon, arrived in Washington yesterday to discuss ways of reaching a Mideast settlement. In coming weeks, officials from Jordan, Egypt and Syria will visit the United States for separate consultations. It'll be a real month of the Middle East, an American official said. Details, Page 7.

title: E and F Service Disrupted By 2 IND Station Incidents
description: Subway service on the IND's E and F lines was disrupted for several hours early yesterday by a series of mishaps. The first delay occurred about 12:30 A.M. in the Queens Plaza station, after a trash fire broke out on the Manhattanbound tracks.

title: Mansfield Seeks to Close Debate on Consumer Bill
description: WASHINGTON, July 28 (UPI) As many as four votes may be taken in an effort to end debate on the Consumer Protection Agency bill before the Senate, Mike Mansfield, the Democratic leader, said today.

title: State's PrisonChief Cites Significant 2Year Gain
description: Responding to recent criticism, the State Commissioner of Correctional Services issued a report yesterday maintaining that significant progress had been made in improving New York's prison system in the last two years.

title: Extortion Jury Sought
description: ATLANTA, July 28 (AP)Jury selection will begin tomorrow in the trial of William A. H. Williams, charged with extortion in connection with the kidnapping in February of Reg Murphy, an editor for The Atlanta Constitution.

title: Newark Parade Marks State Puerto Rican Day
description: NEWARK, July 8Latin rhythms and joyous shouts in Spanish brightened Broad Street, Newark's main thoroughfare, early this afternoon, as more than 1,000 marched in the 12th annual New Jersey Puerto Rican Day parade.

title: FRED W. PITZER
description: Fred W. Pitzer, vice president and sales manager of the Bronham Company, newspaper publishers representatives, died Friday in Mount Sinai Hospital. He was 60 years old Und lived in Eastchester, N.Y.

title: CYPRUS MEETING IS STILL SNAGGED; MOSCOW AIDE DUE
description: GENEVA, July 28The Foreign Ministers of Greece, Turkey and Britain, who negotiated most of the day and into the night without reaching a new agreement on a ceasefire in Cyprus, were informed tonight that the Soviet Union had decided to send an observer to the conference.

title: A Mass Killing in Cyprus: Two Versions of Its Cause
description: ALAMINOS, Cyprus, July 28 Fourteen Turkish Cypriotes are buried in an unmarked common grave in an open field at the edge of the Turkish sector of this divided village in southern Cyprus.

title: G.O.P. Choice in Connecticut
description: HARTFORD, July 28  In the national stir over Representative Ella T. Grasso for winning the Democratic gubernatorial nomination a week before, many people seemed to forget that the Connecticut Republi cans, too, were going to nominate a candidate for Governor.

title: Net Deposits Fell At Thrift Concerns In First Half of 74
description: WASHINGTON, July 28 (UPI) The Federal Home Loan Bank Board said today that net deposits in Federally Insured thrift institutions had fallen in the first half of this year to $5.9billion compared with $9.9billion for the first six months of 1973.

title: AIDES TERM NIXON SELFCONTROLLED
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., July 28Disappointed by reverses in the Supreme Court and House Judiciary Committee, hurt by the incessant attacks on him and his associates, President Nixon is depicted as able to go stoically about the business of the Presidency through the exercise of enor mous selfcontrol.

title: Don McCafferty, N.F.L. Coach Of Colts and Lions, Is Dead
description: PONTIAC, Mich., July 28 (AP)  Don McCafferty, head coach of the Detroit Lions football team, died today, apparently of a heart attack. at his home. He was 53 years old.

title: Ankara Insists on Security For All Turkish Cypriotes
description: ANKARA, Turkey, July 28Premier Bulent Ecevit said today that Turkey would not sign a ceasefire agreement in Geneva unless real security was established for ethnic Turks on Cyprus.

title: Harlem Five Wins
description: The Harlem Professional Basketball AllStars trounced the Washington, D.C., Open Coalition AllStars, 152127, last night before a capacity crowd at City College's Mahoney Gymnaslum in the first of this summer's intercity games.The New Yorkers were led by Larry Kehon of the New York Nets who tallied 34 points and was named the game's most valu able Player.

title: Doctors Are Giving Franco Additional Routine Checks
description: MADRID, July 28 (UPI)Doctors treating Generalissimo Francisco Franco said today that they were giving him routine additional checks while he recovered from a circulatory ailment.

title: Phnom Penh Streets Home for Thousands
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, July 28 At night, after the 9 o'clock curfew, when the restaurants where the foreigners and the Cambodian elite dine have emptied and there is no one on the streets to beg from, squads of ragged semiwild children count up their meager take and straggle off to the foul pieces of sidewalk where they live and sleep.

title: Weekly List of Mutual Funds
British Phone Operators Walk Out, Fearing Bomb
description: LONDON, July 28 (Reuters) International telephone operators in London walked out today because of a rumored threat by the Irish Republican Army to blow up their building.

title: Klecatsky Rows to 5 Victories
description: ST. CATHARINES, Ontario, July 28Dr. Larry Kletatsky of the New York Athletic Club became the top sculler of the 92d annual Royal Canadian Henley Regatta as he scored five victories today.

title: Cowboys Morton Checks Into Camp
description: THOUSAND OAKS, Calif., July 28 (UPI)Craig Morton of the Dallas Cowboys today joined a growing list of quarterbacks who have reported to their National Football League, training camps. Morton checked into the Cowboys camp while the man he usually battles for the quarterback job, Roger Staubach, was back in Dallas observing the players strike.

title: A Listing of Recently Published Books
description: A Season in Heaven: Being the Log of an Expedition After That Legendary Beast, Cosmic Consciousness by William Gibson (Atheneum, $6.95).

title: Alice Edwards Wed To Arthut Jacobson
description: Alice Marie Edwards, a supervisor of psychiatric social work at the Child Guidance Institute of the Jewish Board of Guardians, was married yesterday afternoon to Arthur Jacobson, general manager of Danbar Press, computerized typography and bookpublishing company.

title: Inmate Is Killed as Riots continue in French Prisons
description: PARIS, July 28 (AP)Fresh riots erupted at more than dozen prisons in France's troubled prison system during the weekend, and one prisoner was killed.

title: Susan Sheinman Wed to Reporter
description: Susan Sheinman, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Nathan Sheinman of New York and Westhampton Beach, L,I., was married here last night to David A. Andelman, son of Mr. and Mrs. Saul Andelman of Newton Centre, Mass.

title: Sonny Carson's Conflicts Simmer on and off Screen
description: It was an unlikely allianc to begin with Sonny Carson the street, thug turned militant political activist, and the Paramount Pictures Corporation, which has made it share of the kind of blax ploitation films deplored by such activists.

title: SYDNEY P. BRADSHAW
description: NYACK, N.Y., July 28Sydney Parker Bradshaw, a retired Wall Street broker, died yesterday at a Manahawkin, N.J., hospital. He was 71 years old and lived here.

title: Mrs. Skala's 212 Wins by 4 Shots
Pesce Adds Eerie Touch To Fiber Glass Designs
description: Gaetano Pesce, that Venetian master of visual tricks, is at it again. But this time Mr. Pesce has injected an unnerving social commentary into his furnishings designs.

title: Farm Exports at Peak
description: WASHINGTON, July 28 (UPI) United States agricultural exports leaped to a record $21.3billion in the 197374 fiscal year that ended June 30, the Agriculture Department announced. The total, buoyed by increases in both farm prices and the volume of shipments, was 65 per cent over the record $12.9billion figure for the preceding year, officials said.

title: New Premier Is Sworn In On Dominica in West Indies; ROSEAU, Dominica, July 28 (AP)Deputy Premier Patrick Roland John has been sworn in as Premier of Dominica after yesterday's resignation of the Caribbean island's first Premier, Edward O. LeBlanc.
description: Mr. John succeeded Mr. LeBlanc two weeks ago as head of the Labor party, defeating) former Deputy Premier Ronald Armour at a party convention. Mr. John was sworn in as Premier today.

title: Paterson Cuts Crime Rate By Adding Street Patrols
description: PATERSONViolent crimemuggings, purse snatchings, larceny and burglary  declined dramatically here after the Police Department added 70 men to street duty, Police Chief James T. Hannan said in an interview.

title: DEMOCRATS DRAFT A SECOND ARTICLE OF IMPEACHMENT
description: WASHINGTON, July 28Democrats on the House Judiciary Committee caucdsed today to refine the wording of a second article of impeachnient of President Nixon.

title: Moscow Says 'Circles in NATO Are Plotting Against Cypriotes
description: MOSCOW, July 28The Soviet Union charged today that certain circles of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization were making behindthescenes efforts to deprive Cyprus other independence and turn the island into a strategic NATO base.

title: Rangel Asks Further Effort To Improve Black Education
description: WASHINGTON, July 28 (UPI) The leader of the Congressional Black Caucus said today that, although the Supreme Court might have banned most citysuburban busing to achieve, racial balance in public schools, the fight for a quality education for blacks was not over.

title: Ahumada Fights Oquendo Tonight
description: Jorge Ahumada of Argentina renews his bid for another shot at the world light heavyweight boxing title tonight in a 12rounder with Angel Oquendo in the main arena of Madison Square Garden. Ahumada battled Bob Foster, the champion, to a draw in a title bid June 17.

title: Exploratory Drilling for Oil And Gas Climbing Sharply
description: WASHINGTON, July 28 (UPI) Oil and gas drilling increased sharply in the United. States in the second quarter of this year, the American Petroleum Institute reported over the weekend.

title: Sports Today
description: Mets vs. Montreal Expos, at Shea Stadium, Roosevelt Ave. nue and 126th Street, Flushing Meadow, Queens, 2:05 P.M.

title: Printers Settlement
description: Union ratification of the agreement to automate the composing rooms of The New York Times and The Daily News, with its startling list of innovations in traditional labormanagement practices, reflects a welcome new maturity in relationships on the newspaper labor front.

title: Dodgers Get Sinking Feeling Again With 32 Loss
description: The Los Angeles Dodgers may be reliving their downfall of last season.

title: Baryshnikov s Tantalizing U.S. Debut
description: Mikhail Baryshnikov is one of the great dancers of our time, and his United States debut Saturday night at the New York State Theater in American Ballet Theater's production of Giselle gave only a tantalizing hint of the rare and magnificent talent he is sure to display here in the future.

title: MRS. IVY LEE
description: Cornelia Bigelow Lee, widow of Ivy Lee, who had been public relations counsel to the Rockefellers and to large corporations and foreign governments, died yesterday in the Eden Park Nursing Home in Rutland, Vt. She was 97 years old and lived in Dorset, Vt.

title: Growth Plans Gather Momentum at Korvette Chain
description: Korvette, involved in one of the most extensive expansion moves by a New York retailer in decades, expects to complete negotiations for the acquisition of six S. Klein stores in the near future and to have them in operation as Korvette stores in 1975.

title: IND Rider Slain in Holdup; Wife's Cries Go Unheeded
description: A, 53yearold man riding home with his wife on a subway train in Brooklyn was shot and killed late Saturday night by one of four young thugs who accosted the couple in a nearly deserted car in an apparent robbery attempt and fled emptyhanded.

title: Carey Urges Screening To Free Bench of Politics
description: Charging that the judiciary has become a happy hunting ground for people whose only qualification is loyalty to a political leader, Representative Hugh L. Carey of Brooklyn, a contender for the Democratic nomination for Gover nor, yesterday pledged to keep) politics out of the judicial system.

title: Rhodesia Will Vote Today; Smith Urges White Unity
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, July 29 (Reuters)  Prime Minister Ian D. Smith made an 11thhour call tonight for white unity in tomorrow's Rhodesian general election, and, by implication, appealed for voters to give his Rhodesian Front party a sweeping victory in the poll.

title: Soviet Wants a U.N Group to Verify Cyprus Truce
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y. July 29The Soviet Union proposed today that the Security Council send a mission to Cyprus to verify the ceasefire and withdrawal of all foreign forces from the island.

title: Wilson Campaign: He'll Dolt His Way
description: Previewing his contest for full fouryear term, Governor Wilson indicated yesterday that his campaign would be less ex pensive, less colorful and shorter than what many politicians consider to be the classic campaigns of his predecessor, Nelson A. Rockefeller.

title: Banks Linked to Pressure on Bohack
description: Banks and not food suppliers were the creditors who put pressure on the Bohack Corporation and forced the decision to file for reorganization under Chapter XI of the Federal Bankruptcy Act, according to

title: Brazilians Report Meningitis Spread as Been Checked
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, July 29The Brazilian Ministry of Health said today that deaths from meningitis in the city of So Paulo numbered 267 for the first 17 days of this month, But, the.ministry said, the situation is now under control.

title: National Policy Debate Spurred by Cities Efforts to Limit Growth
description: On June 11, the House of Representatives scuttled a major bill to encourage state land use planning because, it was felt, the mere granting of Federal subsidies would be an unwarranted intrusion on state and local autonomy.

title: The Dance
description: NEW LONDON, Conn., July 29Pilobolus was originally a clutch of muscular young men who descended from Dartmouth several seasons ago to astonish us with their powerful gymnastic grace. Last year the group added two women and seemed slightly baffled about what to do with them artistically. Last evening Alison Chase and Martha Clarke took a giant creative step forward with the company in the premiere of Monkshood's Delight at Connecticut College's American Dance Festival.

title: Oil Nationalization Planned In Venezuela Within a Year
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, July 29 (AP)Venezuela's petroleum industry will be nationalized within one year, President Carlos Andrez Perez said today.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: Security Tightened For Bolshoi Tour

title: 69 Killed as a Bus Collides With Truck in North Brazil
description: BELEM, Brazil, July 29 (UPI) At least 69 persons died yesterday in a headon collision between a bus and a truck about 250 miles south of here, the police reported today.

Bjorklund And Adamle Join jets
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., July 29 Mike Adamle, the thirdleading rusher with the New York Jets last season, reported to camp today and became the eighth established player on the club to cross the Player's Association picket line.

title: 2 West Side Rail Yards Are Sought for Housing
description: A major New York builder announced yesterday intentions to construct thousands of apartments on two large Hudson River waterfront parcels in Manhattan that the builder has agreed to purchase from the bankrupt Penn Central Transportation Company for more than, $100million.

title: Laughing Bridge Snaps Stake Mark at Saratoga
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N.Y., July 29A stakes record performance by Neil Hellman's Laughing Bridge and a nose triumph by the ElceeH Stable's Our Dancing Girl thrilled the fans in the running of the two divisions of the Schuylerville for 2yearolds at the opening of Sara,toga today.

title: KIDNAPPING CHIEF HELD COMPETENT Jury Rejects Insanity Plea by Convicted Organizer in the Calzadilla Case
description: NEWARK, July 29 (AP)A Federal Court jury sitting in a special sanity trial found today that Jorge Martinez, the convicted organizer of the kidnapping of John Calzadilla, whs mentally competent to be responsible for the crime.

title: Legal Ruling Blocks
description: The deputy White Plains corporation counsel issued a legal opinion yesterday that effectively prevented the Common Council from electing a successor to Mayor Carl J. Delfino, who resigned four days before his death on July 21.

title: 18,000 in Trenton Rally for More Jobs
Court Bids Navy Keep Promise to a Recruit
description: NORFOLK, Va., July 29 (AP)A Federal judge ruled today that the Navy must release a sailor from activereserve drills because a recruiter's promiie of tech nical training was not fulfilled.

title: CHEMICAL MAKERS AGREE TO CURB ADS
Bike Mishap Hurts Astronaut
description: HOUSTON, July 29 (AP)Don Lind, a scientist and astronaut, was injured on his way to work today when his bicycle was hit by a car. Mr. Lind, 44 years old, a native of Midvale, Utah, was taken to a ,hospital for examination. A spokesman at the Johnson Space Center said his injuries were not believed to be serious.

title: Shift Set at Wellington
description: The relationship between the Wellington Management Company and a group of funds which includes the Wellington Fund and 10 others has been restructured, directors for the two organizations said yesterday. They said the fund group would assume responsibility for fund administrative functions presently performed by the company, while the management company would continue to serve as investment advisor and distributor for the funds.

title: Grand Jury Exonerates L.I. Legislator 2d Time
description: MINEOLA, L. I., July For the second time in five days, Assemblyman Arthur Kremer has been cleared by a Nassau County grand jury of allegations of wrongdoing.

title: Chess: Browne Tightens His Grip On First Place in Title Play
People in Sports
description: Staling he wants no. congratulations, because this is a very sad time in my life, Rick Forzano took over yes terday as interim coach of the Detroit Lions of the Na tional Football League, He replaced Don McCafferty, who died Sunday of a heart attack The 45yearold Forzano had been McCafferty's offensive backfield coach, and betore that the head coach at the University of Connecticut and the United States Naval Academy. He also was an assistant coach with the St. Louis Cardinals and the Cincinnati Berigals,

title: GEORGE T. NEWELL
description: George Theron Newell, a retired vice president of the Manufacturers Hanover Trust Com11 pany and a past president of the American Institute of Banking, died Sunday at his home at Saw Mill Road, Danbury, Conn. He was 78 years old.

title: Wilson Campaign: He 11 Dolt His Way
description: Previewing his contest for full fouryear term, Governor Wilson indicated yesterday that his campaign would be less expensive, less colorful and shortor than what many politicians consider to be the classic campaigns of his predecessor, Nelson A. Rockefeller.

title: Greek Premier Says He, Not Army, Wields Power
description: ATHENS, July 29Premier Constantine Caramanlis sought tonight to reassure his nation that he, and not the armed fortes, was in full control of Greece.

title: NBCTV Paying $10Million to Show Godfather Once
description: NBC TV has licensed the rights to The Godfather from Paramount Pictures for a single showing next November at a reported price of $10million, the highest ever paid by television for a motion picture. The 1972 release, which won three Academy Awards, has thus far earned more than $85million in domestic theater rentals, making, it the leading boxoffice film in history.

title: BERNARD F. AGNELLI
description: Bernard F. Agnelli, senior vice president and manager of the New York office of Dialog, the, publicrelations arm of the J. Walter Thompson Company, died Saturday of a heart attack near Kingston, N. Y., while jogging. He was 43 years old and lived at 4512 244th Street, Douglaston, Queens.

title: ERICH KAESTNER, 75, GERMANAUTHOR,DIES
description: MUNICH, West Germany, July 29, (Reuters)Erich Kaestner, one of Germany'S bestknown authors, died in hospital here today. He was 75 years old.

title: The Issues Behind BeameGoldin Feud
description: During his campaign to become Controller of New York City, Harrison J. Goldin promised to hire outside auditors to look into the office. On July 14, he made the first of these audits public.

title: State Contends Rao Case
description: A robbery case manufactured by the office of the special state prosecutor, Maurice H. Nadjari, served to uncover a virtual cesspool of corruption in the Brooklyn criminal justice system, one of Mr. Nadjari's associates said in court papers filed recently.

title: Reinecke Won't Quit Post Unless Required by Law
description: WASHINGTON, July 29(UPI) Lieut. Gov. Ed Reinecke of California, convicted last Saturday on Federal perjury charges, said today that he would not resign unless legally required to do so.

title: Mediation
M.T.A. to Use Dogs in Its Battle on Graffiti
description: The Metropolitan Transportation Authority is having attack dogs trained to chase vandals who paint graffiti on subway cars in the outdoor st,orage yards of the subway system.

title: Makarios Praises U.S. Efforts After Meeting With Kissinger
description: WASHINGTON, July 29 Archbishop Makarios conferred with Secretary of State Kissinger for more than an hour today and concluded that the role of the United States is really very constructive in efforts to obtain a settlement of the Cyprus issue.

title: Boy Drowns in Puerto Rico
description: SAN JUAN, Puerto Rico, July 29 (UPI)A 9yearold Queens boy who was visiting relatives in Puerto Rico drowned yesterday in a swimming pool at a Navy installation near the island's south coast, the police reported today. The boy was identified as Andre William Hawkins of Hollis.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: Mary McElroy of Bayside, a 22yearold tennis instructor, set the pace among the qualifiers in the women's citywide amateur golf tournament conducted by the New York City Recreation Department at all of the city's municipal courses.

title: The Dance
description: NEW LONDON, (Ann., July 29Pilobolus was originally a clutch of muscular young men who descended from Dartmouth several seasons ago to astonish us with their powerful gymnastic grace. Last year the group added two women and seemed slightly baffled about what to do with them artistically. Last evening Alison Chase and Martha, Clarke took a giant creative step forward with the company in the premiere of Monkshood's Delight at Connecticut College's AmeriDance Festival.

title: Treasury Bills Rise At the Weekly Sale
New Yorkers See Rich Double at Monmouth
description: OCEANPORT, N. J., July 29 With Aqueduct idle, Monmouth Park rolled out a green carpet of welcome for New York horseplayers today in the form of its biggest daily double in 22 years. The payoff was $3,417.60 for $2.,,

title: Pacemaker Is Implanted In a Baby 18 Hours Old
description: NEW ORLEANS, July 29 (AP)Doctors announced today that they had successfully implanted a pacemaker to increase the heartbeat of an infant, possibly the youngest ever given the notice.

title: The Proposed Impeachment Article II
description: WASHINGTON, July 29Following is the text the proposed Article II of impeachment adopted by the House Judiciary Committee tonight:

title: A COMING OF AGE
description: BERLIN  The East German press is preparing the way for the 25th anniversary of the German Democratic Republic on Oct. 7.

title: There's More Than One Way
description: One side effect of the current inflation is a modest pennypinching among members of the middle class who are too affluent to cry, yet vulnerable enough to feel some pain.

title: Quake Study of Balkans Is Completed by Soviet
description: MOSCOW, July 29Soviet scientists report they have prepared a seismic map of the Balkans With which it will be possible to estimate the relative degree of earthquake risk anywhere in the area.

title: Turks Widen Cyprus Hold, Order U.N. Force to Move
description: KYRENIA, Cyprus, July 29Turkish troops continued to expand their area of control eastward from their beachhead here today and ordered the United Nations peacekeeping force to leave the Kyrenia area, where it has been protecting Greek Cypriotes cut off behind Turkish lines.

title: Ribicoff's Charmed Life: From Poverty to Power
description: WASHINGTONFrom the very beginning, he was something special.

title: Rhodes Will Hold Forums To Combat Impeachment
description: WASHINGTON, July 29 Hoping to head off what could become a stampede for impeachment, the House minority leader, Representative John J., RhOdes of, Arizona; Is to announce later this week a plan to hold informal rap sessions for Republicans to debate the issue.

title: A BasesFull Sacrifice Fly Beats Lyle
18,000 in BuildingTrades Rally at Trenton for Jobs
description: TRENTON, July 29 Eighteen thousand shouting construction workers gathered in front of the State House today and angrily demanded that Govefrtor Byrne act to provide more jobs for their severely depressed industry.

title: Pay for Signatures on Petitions Alleged
description: Workers who jointly circulated Democratic nominating petitions for District Attorney Richard H. Kuh and Jacob D. Fuchsberg, a candidate for the Court of Appeals, were paid by the Fuchsberg campaign on the basis of the number of Fuchsberg signatures collected, according to political sources. Such payments are illegal.

title: Cass Elliot, Pop Singer, Dies; Star of the Mamas and Papas
description: LONDON, July 29Mama Cass. Elliot, the American pop singer, died here tonight at the age, of 33.

title: BEAME DEMANDS; SAFER SUBWAYS; ??
description: A day and a half after a 53yearold man was killed by four youths on an IND subway, train, Mayor Beame held a series of hastily called meetings yesterday to ask Police Commissioner Michael J. Codd and Transit Authority executives what steps could be taken to take the subways safer.

title: Books of The Times
description: In American writing now, the romance of death seems to be challenging the romance of love. The sexual revolution has so redefined love that many of us are no longer sure what it is, while a growing existential awareness has brought death out of the funeral parlor. Serious fiction feeds on significance, and if love abdicates, death is its natural successor. For some time, the sense of threat has displaced the sense of promise in the novel, and what is the ultimate threat but death? That is what has always lurked behind our writers long flirtation with absurdity, which might be defined as the death of belief. When our beliefs go, there is nothing between us and death except empty time. Life is telescoped. We skip to the end of our story because the plot fails to thicken.

title: Rhodes Will Hold Forums To Combat Impeachment
description: WASHINGTON, July 29Hoping to head off what could become a stampede for impeachment, the House minority leader, Representative John J. Rhodes of Arizona, is to announce later this week a plan to hold informal rap sessions for Republicans to debate the issue.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Columbia University's College of Physicians and Surgeons announced that it was setting up a $2.6million clinicalresearch center for muscular dystrophy and related diseases. The center will be financed in part by a $1.5million construction and research grant from the Muscular Dystrophy Association of America, which is establising clinicalresearch centers in four universities in the country.

title: New Freedom Is Changing Greek Life
description: ATHENS, July 29The lively music of Mikis Theodorakis is playing again on the radio and in the nightclubs of Greece.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: DISCREET CHARMS L'Age d'Or, released in 1930, was Luis Builuel's second film, and yet its sardonic tone and surreal hijinks offer an amazing demonstration of the continuity that has marked Mr. Butbel's long, productive career. It's considered a classic film, one of Mr. Bunuel's most important, but it is also seldom seen here because the producer, Viscount Charles de Noailles, has been reluctant to have prints sent out here and there.

title: Coated Abrasives Increase in Price At Norton Company
description: The Norton Company announced yesterday a price increase of close to 8 per cent on its coated abrasive products sold domestically effective Sept, 9. The company blamed continued escalation in the cost of raw materials plus other manufacturing and distribution expenses for the advance.

title: Zurn Sloop Wins Race On Cruise
Giants Punt Concern: To Avoid Long Returns
description: FAIRFIELD, Conn., July 29  Don't be surprised if the New York Giants punt the ball toward the sideline instead of high, deep and down the middle in their exhibition opener Saturday night at the Astrodome against the Houston Oilers.

title: Nixon Termed Confident Fairness Will Prevail
description: WASHINGTON, July 29 All last week, Ronald L. Ziegler and other Presidential assistants issued caustic remarks about the members and staff of the House Judiciary Committee, accusing them of being unfair to President Nixon in the face of evidence of his innocence.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: L.I. Assemblyman Cleared 2d Time

title: Layer Returns to Tennis Action Next Week
description: Rod Laver is returning to competition. After an 11week layoff, the Aussie lefthander will celebrate his 36th birthday by playing in the $50,000 Volvo international tournament beginning. Aug. 5 at Bretton Woods, N.H.

title: FARR GETS SENTENCE OF 5 DAYS AND $500
description: LOS ANGELES, July 28 (UPI) Superior Court Judge Charles H. Older today sentenced William Farr, a reporter, to a maximum five days in jail and a fine of $500 for his threeyear long refusal to identify news sources.

title: Peru's Reign of Silence
description: The men in uniform who rule Peru by fiat have finally acted to silence the country's only surviving voices independence and criticism. Gen. Juan Velasco Alvarado and his ruling junta sent police with submachine guns to seize the offices of all of Lima's newspapers and protect the new editors who have been appointed by the regime. The Government is obviously fearful that the claimed accomplishments of the revolution cannot stand the test of independent scrutiny.

title: Accountability and Impeachment
description: WASHINGTON, July 29Like dozens of public officials and leaders before him, Richard Nixon was being asked today, to answer for the acts of subordinates. The House diciary Committee News had before it proposed article Analysis impeachment condemning the President for alleged misconduct carried out personally and through his subordinates and agents. The issue, as the debate wore on, was not whether Mr. Nixon could ever be held accountable for his aides, but, instead, the circumstances which he could be held accountable.

title: Army Sergeant Leads Pistol Shoot
description: CAMP PERRY, Ohio, July 29 (UPI)Hershel Anderson of Tracy City, Tenn., won the centerfire pistol competition today with a score of 874 of 900 to take the twoday lead in the 1974 National pistol shooting championships.

title: JURY IS SELECTED
description: A jury of 11 men and one woman was selected in Brooklyn yesterday in the trial of State Supreme Court Justice Dominic S. Rinaldi, who is charged with perjury and obstruction of justice.

title: Bailey Reelected Chairman Of Connecticut Democrats
description: HARTFOORD, July 29John M. Bailey of Hartford, who served as Democratic national chairman in the administrations of President John F. Kennedy and President Lyndon B. Johnson, was reelected by acclamation tonight to a 15th twoyear term as Connecticut Democratic chairman.

title: 500 Children Spend Day in the Outdoors, Courtesy of a Friend
description: ENGLEWOOD CLIFFS, July 29Because I was a city kid myself, a local restaurateur today brought more than 500 children from custodial institutions, broken homes and daycare centers in the metropolitan area to a park here for a day of fun in the outdoors.

title: Merger Approved With 2 Subsidiaries At Missouri Pacific
description: The Missouri Pacific Railroad said yesterday its directors had approved a plan to merge with two of the carrier's subsidiaries, the Texas & Pacific Railway and the Chicago & Eastern Illinois Railroad.

title: 2 Channels to Televise Panel's Debate Today
description: NBCTV and the Public Broadcasting Service will televise today's session of the House Judiciary Committee's impeachment debate.

title: $200Million Park Bonds
description: TRENTON, July 29  The State Assembly today approved by a 75to1 vote a $200million Green Acres bond issue, the largest in the state's history, for acquisition and development of parks and, recreation lands.

title: New Standards on Quality Proposed for State Waters
description: TRENTON, July 29 (AP)David J. Bardin, the State Environmental Protection Commissioner, proposed today new quality standards for New Jersey waterways.

title: Seizure of Papers Prompts A Demonstration in Peru
description: LIMA, Peru, July 29 (UPI)Policemen used high pressure water hoses early today to break up a noisy demonstration by 300 students protesting against the expropriation of Lima's independent newspapers by President Juan Velasco Alvarado's military. Government.

title: Australians Sell Chinese Wheat Worth $177Million
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, July 29 (Reuters)  Australia has sold China another one million metric tons of wheat worth more than $177million, the chairman of the Australian Wheat Board announced today.

title: SPACE LOAN TO AID
description: Overcrowding in District 10 in the Bronx is expected to be lessened next fall under a plan of the City University to lend about 70,000 square feet of Bronx Community College space to the district for classroom use.

title: Ankara Remaining Firm
description: ANKARA, Turkey, July 29The Turkish Government continued tonight to take a tough stand on withdrawal or reduction of its troops on Cyprus, now estimated at 20,000 men.

title: Pony Express Race in Fete
description: LINCOLN, N.M., July 29A 30mile Pony Expreses race over trails in the Sacramento Mountains will be part of the 25th annual Billy the Kid festivities scheduled for this Friday, Saturday and Sunday in this historic frontier community. The race will start at 8:30 A.M. Saturday at the ghost goldmining town of White Oaks and will end here with the delivery of letters bearing a Pony Express marking.

title: South Vietnam Says Foe Captures Posts In Northern District
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, July 29 (AP) Communist forces kept up their attack along the northern coast of South Vietnam today, capturing a series of Government outposts south of Da Nang around the district capital of Thuong Due.

title: AMEX IS CONSIDERING TRADING OF OPTIONSI
description: A detailed proposal that could form the basis for co ordinated trading of options on both the American Stock Exchange and the Chicago Board Options Exchange Was uted to American Exchange members, the Amex's chairman, Paul Kollon, announced terday.

title: Communists Take Heavy Toll of Saigon's Forces Near Capital
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, July 27After suffering several re.verses in the southern part of the country in recent months, Communist troops have dug in and inflicted extensive casualties in some of the hardest fighting since the ceasefire went into effect in January, 1973.

title: Nassau Will Not Sell Land In Lawrence for Hospital
description: MINEOLA, L. I., July 29Nassau County Executive Ralph G. Caso said today that because of community opposition, the county would not sell 10 acres of land it owns in. Lawrence, L, L, for a proposed new hospital site. The site was intended to be used for the new Long Island JewishHillside Medical Center's South Shore division.

title: NEW ACCUSATION
description: WASHINGTON, July 29 The House Judiciary Committee voted overwhelmingly tonight to adopt a second article of impeachment charging that President Nixon failed repeatedly to carry out his constitutional oath and duty to uphold the nation's laws.

title: 2 West Side Rail Yards Are Sought for Housing
description: A major New York builder announced yesterday intentions to construct thousands of apartments on two large Hudson River waterfront parcels in Manhattan that the builder has agreed to purchase from the bankrupt Penn Central Transportation Company for more than $100million.The purchase agreement is subject to approval of the Federal , District Court in Philadelphia because the railroad is being reorganized under Federal bankruptcy laws, Trustees of the Penn Central are reported to have petitioned the court for approval of the sale,City approval would be neededfor any housing on the sites because zoning changes would be.required, Whether such approvel would he forthcoming would depend on the details of the proposals, which are still being drawn up. Financing arrangements, too, are far from set.

title: PRICES CUT AGAIN IN BOND MARKETS
Senate Committee Unit Alters Trade Bill
description: WASHINGTON, July 29 (Reu ters)  The Senate Finance Committee made substantia changes during a closeddooi session today on the contro versial Housepassed trade bill the Administration wants ap proved this year.

title: FIGURE SHIFT TO LIFT DETROIT EDISON NET
description: LANSING, Mich, July 29 (UPI) The Michigan Public Service Commission approved today an accounting change for the Detroit Edison Company that will increase 1974 earnings of the financially ailing company by 15 cents a share.

title: Senate Leaders Prepare
description: WASHINGTON, July 29 Democratic and Republican leaders of the Senate took the first formal steps today to prepare for a possible impeachment trial on whether President Nixon should be removed from office.

title: Advertising: Rumor Mongering
description: Advertising is the most visible facet of American business. That frequently makes it the easiest target.

title: Rush Testifies but Only Repeats Views
ESB Backs Inco Bid In Merger Contest
description: ESB, Inc., the prize in merger contest between the International Nickel Company of Canada, Ltd., and the United Aircraft Corporation, said yesterday that it now supported the Inco tender offer of $41 a share and would recommend that shareholders accept it. ESB also said that it was with drawing an antitrust suit filed last Thursday in Federal District Court in Philadelphia seeking to enjoin Inca from purchasing any ESB shares.

title: GASOLINE CUTBACKS STIR STATE INQUIRY
description: ALBANY, July 29 (AP)State Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz said today he had ordered an antitrust investigation into reports the major oil companies had cut back gasoline production.

title: Jury Refuses to Vote Indictment That Omits Hughes
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., July 29A Federal grand jury refused today to vote an indictment that was specially drawn by Department of Justice officials in Washington with the intention of excluding Howard R. Hughes, the reclusive industrialist, from a list of defendants.

title: Agony and Pride
description: Members of the House Judiciary Committee have been eloquent in conveying their sense of agony and awe the decisions which chance has called upon them make this summer of 1974. Less evident, but equally justified, is the sense of confidence among legislators and the observing public alike over the way this solemn and fateful political process is operating within the democratic structure.

title: Physicians Honor Holloman
description: Dr. John L. S. Hollman Jr., president of the Health and Hospitals Corporation will be awarded a certificate of recognition today at the 79th annual convention and scientific assembly of the National Medical Association in New Orleans. Dr. Holloman, a former president of the predominantly black organization of physidistinguished service field of health care.

title: Kuh Shows Tombs to His Aides on Eve of Hearing
description: District Attorney Richard H. Kuh of Manhattan and Correction Commissioner Benjamin J. Malcolm accompanied a group of assistant district attorneys on a visit to the Manhattan Men's House of Detention yesterday to show them the improvements being made under court pressure.

title: French to Study Jail Strife As the Death Toll Rises to
description: PARIS, July 29, (Reuters)The Government today ordered special emergency panels to investigate prison strife as the death toll rose to four in 10! days of rioting in 43 of 170! French prisons.

title: 6 Children Die, 2 Missing In Austrian Bridge Collapse
description: SALZBURG, Austria, July 29 (UPI)A bridge across an alpine ravine collapsed today, plunging 24 West German children and three guards into a river, the police said. Six children were found dead, 19 other persons, including the guards, were injured and two children were reported missing.

title: Westchester Names Doctor
description: The Westchester County Board of Legislators yesterday approved by a unanimous vote, 10 to 0, the appointment of Dr. Joseph A. Cimino as Commissioner of Hospitals. Dr. Cimino, who is 40 years old, was Commissioner of Health in New York City during the John V. Lindsay administration. The appointment was made by County Executive Alfred B. DelBello.

title: People and Business
description: Vice President Gerald R. Ford says in an interview in Dun's Review: I am worried about interest rates. I hope that the Federal Reserve, once it sees that there is an honesttogoodness effort being made in fiscal policy, will not be too tough too long.

title: Government Control Deal
description: LONDON, July 29 (UPIThe Tanzanian Government is taking full control of the operations in its country of the British American Tobacco Company, the concern said today.

title: Horton on Mend
description: DETROIT, July 29 (UPI)The Detroit Tigers said today that Willie Horton, their slugging left fielder, might be abe to return to action in week or 10 days. Horton had his right knee placed in cast July 12 because of a cartilage problem.

title: CYPRUS MEETING STRIKES IMPASSE ON 2 VITAL ISSUES
description: GENEVA, July 29The Foreign Ministers of Britain, Greece and Turkey recessed tonight after 31 hours of almost continuous negotiations without rettehing agreement on Cyprus ceasefire..

title: New French Nuclear Test in Pacific Is Reported
description: WELLINGTON, New Zealand, July 29 (UPI)Prime Minister Norman Kirk said today he had reason to believe France had exploded another nuclear bomb in the atmosphere at her Mururoa atoll test site in the South Pacific.

title: Jerseyan Slain in Geneva
description: GENEVA, July 29 (AP)  A 36yearold Egyptian student his been arrested and charged with the murder of Jean Stewart, 29, of Plainfield, N. J., the police said today. They said they had received a call yes, terday from a man who said he had just killed his girlfriend. At the address given by the caller, they found Miss. Stewart dead from knife wounds

title: Bridge: Other Groups, Seek Players Of the Former Aces Team
description: For the last five years, North America has been worthily represented in world championship play by the Aces, who won two world titles and finished second on three occasions to the Italian Blue Team.

title: StrikeRelated Work Loss In U.S. Put at 3Year High
description: WASHINGTON, July 29 (Reuters)The number of days lost because of strikes in the United States during June was greater than at any time since July, 1971, the Labor Department reported today.

title: PHYSICIAN INDICTED ON MEDICARE FEES
description: Dr. Albert J. Brinz, a 50yearold physician from Scarsdale, N.Y., was indicted in Federal District Court here yesterday on charges that he had submitted 15 false Medicare claims for a total of almost $6,000.

title: U.S., Urging Rate Rises, Calls Parley of States Utility Agencies
description: WASHINGTON, July 29 The Nixon Administration, with the stated purpose of winning bigger and faster rate increases for utility companies, has called a national conference of the state agencies that regulate the utilities.

title: ExPennsy Head Consents To Restrictions by S.E.C.
description: WASHINGTON, July 29Stuart T. Saunders former chiel executive officer of the Penn Central Company, has consent ed to an injunction against vio la ting the antifraud and report ing provisions of Federal securities laws, the Securities and Exchange Commission said to day.

title: $158 Level Reached
description: LONDON, July 29  The price of gold climbed sharply on the European bullion markets today amid reports that investors were acting in response to the decision of theHouse Judiciary Committee to recommend the impeachment of President Nixon.

title: TRUMAN BRADLEY
description: LOS ANGELES, July 29 (AP) Truman Bradley, Chicago broadcast announcer who also appeared in films and was host of a television series, died yesterday at the age of 69.

title: Fairchild Republic Said to Win Orders
description: FARMINGDALE, L.I., July 29  The Department of Defense is scheduled to give the Fairchild Republic Company final approval to start production on 30 A10 close air support planes for the Air Force, informed sources disclosed today.

title: Waterfront City
description: Sometimes it seems accessible only to the gulls, or those native explorers who know how to find their way to itbut New York's waterfront is the city's lost resource. There are 578 miles of it, and a wide variety of conditions from parks and wetlands and luxury housing to residual industry and rotting piers, and in their own way New Yorkers love and useand misuseit.

title: Do It Rightor Else
description: Former Representative Wayne Aspinall of Colorado has been quoted as saying of the stripmine control bill passed by the House of Representatives last week that it would never even have got to the floor if he had still been chairman of the Interior Committee. Coming from one who ran that committee with an iron handand rarely in the best interests of the environmentMr. Aspinall's statement testifies both to the improvement the committee system and the historic merits of the bill.

title: NATO's Cyprus Score
description: The State Department's claim that the North Atlantic Treaty Organization emerged from its trial by fire in the Cyprus conflict with increased strength undoubtedly is an exaggeration. But close consultation and some good luck did save the alliance from the kind of breakdown and recrimination that occurred during and after the October Middle East war. That in itself was no mean feat, given an armed clash between two NATO members, Greece and Turkey, and the significant divergencies once again between the United States and its European allies.

title: GUERRILLAS BATTLE LEBANESE RIGHTISTS
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, July 29 (AP)Machinegun fire and explosions were heard in many parts of Beirut tonight as supporters of a rightwing Lebanese political party and Palestinian guerrillas engaged in fierce 90minute battle northeast of the city.

title: Kuh Shows Tombs to His Aides on Eve of Hearing
description: District Attorney Richard H. Kuh of Manhattan and Correction Commissioner Benjamin J. Malcolm accompanied a group of assistant district attorneys on a visit to the Manhattan Men's House of Detention yesterday to show them the improvements being made under court pressure.

title: HAROLD LETT 78, RIGHTS AIDE, DIES
description: Harold A. Lett, a leader in race relations in New Jersey since 1934, died Thursday in the Theresa Grotta Center for Restorative Services in West Caldwell, N. J. He was 78 years old and a former resident of Newark.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: 11 Women Ordained Episcopal Priests; Church Law Defied
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 29In a controversial ceremony that defied their church's laws, and tradition, 11 women were ordained as Episcopal priests today at the Church of the Advocate in North Philadelphia.

title: Convicts Demands Ruled Out as a Hostage Escapes
description: HUNTSVILLE, Tex., July 29  Texas prison officials hardened their negotiating position today, ruling out meeting the demands of three armed inmates for guns after one of their 15 hostages escaped from the Huntsville prison library this morning. The officials said that negotiations were at standstill.

title: Turkish Withdrawal
description: The fundamental difficulty that brought the Cyprus peace conference in Geneva to a near breakdown is one that undoubtedly will bedevil all negotiations henceforth until it is resolved. In response to the abortive coup Nicosia organized by the Greek military junta, substantial Turkish military forces were transported to Cyprus, where they are now dug inand they will have to be negotiated out.

title: A Delay in Construction Of Medical School Urged
description: NEWARK, July 29 (AP)A state agency called today for postponement of construction of all healthcare facilities in the Newark area, including the proposed New Jersey College of Medicine and Dentistry, because the absence of proper planning could skyrocket hospital costs.

title: Hunter of Packers Traded to Bills
description: BUFFALO, July 29 (AP)The Buffalo Bills of the National Football League announced today they had acquired the former Alabama,, quarterback, Scott Hunter, from the Green Bay Packers.

title: Antiques and Portobello Fair for a Day
description: An innovative, citysponsored experiment is expected to transform the grimly silent and empty canyons of Vanderbilt Avenue on Sept. 8 into a colorful bazaar of antiques shops and cafes.

title: Reshaping the Presidency
description: WASHINGTON  Once Richard Nixon is impeached, the Office of the Presidency will have to be restructured and somehow brought more effectively under democratic control. Thoughtful persons are already pondering as to how this can be done in ways that accord with America's constitutional and political experience.

title: Armstrong Cutting Back
description: NEW HAVEN, July 29 (AP)The Armstrong Rubber Company, complaining of lagging tire sales, has begun a 5 per cent reduction of its 6,600employe payroll, the company announced today. The move will affect employment at Armstrong's headquarters here and at plants in West Haven; Hanford, Calif.; Des Moines, Iowa, and Natchez, Tenn.

title: A bortion Rights Bill Voted
description: TRENTON, July 29  The Assembly gave final legislative approval tonight, after a long and often emotional debate, to a bill that would give hospitals and individuals the right to refuse to perform or assist in abortions without fear of legal or disciplinary action.

title: Kidnapping Trial Begins
description: ATLANTA, July 29 (UPI)William A. H. Williams, a 33 yearold subcontractor, went on trial today for the $700,000 kidnapping last February of Reg Murphy, an editor of The Atlanta Constitution. By the end of the day, 26 potential jurors had been selected from a list of 137 in Federal District Court and eight had been rejected. Judge William C. O'Kelley told the group that he hoped that a jury could be chosen by noon tomorrow and it would be sequestered when the testimony began.

title: Legal Ruling Blocks Council Plan to Pick White Plains Mayor
description: The deputy White Plains corporation counsel issued a legal opinion yesterday that effectively prevented the Common Council from electing a successor to Mayor Carl J. Delfino, who resigned four days before his death on July 21.

title: Dance and Stage Blended At Festival in Connecticut
description: NEW LONDON, Conn., July 28The American Dance Festival, in its 27th season, has also been the scene of an experimental theater festival. During the last month, seven prominent New York experimental companies have been in rotating residence with plays, workshops and special events for children.

title: BROKERAGE FIRMS RESCIND FEE RISES
description: Several leading brokerage firms that broke industry ranks early this month and raised commission rates that they charge banks, mutual funds, insurance companies and other big institutional customers are now rolling back the increases., The rates affected applied to, transactions of $2,000 to $300, 000 and covered the bulk of institutional trading.

title: Dance and Stage Blended At Festival in Connecticut
description: NEW LONDON, Conn., July 28The American Dance Festival, in its 27th season, has also been the scene of an experimental theater festival. During the last month, seven prominent New York experimental companies have been in rotating residence with plays, workshops and special events for children.

Fred Zoilner, who had threatened to sell the Detroit Pistons for the last nine years, but raised the price to scare off potential buyers, finally has left the pro basketball scene after 33 years,

description: SAN FRANCISCO, July 29 (UPI)Vice President Ford said today that John B. Connally's political future would depend on what happened at his trial.

title: Powell Explains His Ruling Staying Court's Press Gag
description: WASHINGTON, July 29 (AP) Supreme Court Justice Lewis F. Powell Jr. said today that he had stayed a New Orleans court's ban on reporting certain parts of a pretrial hearing in a rapemurder case there because he believed the order was an unconstitutional prior restraint of publication.

title: ARABS TO REVIEW BOYCOTT OF ISRAEL
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, July 29 An Arab League conference, which opened today at the Lebanese summer resort of Aleih, is reappraising the effectiveness of the Arab economic boycott against Israel.
